       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          At Paladin, Business Development Managers are focused on
          <b>
           developing new clients and growing relationships
          </b>
          for temporary and direct hire positions. BDMs work closely with recuriters and the management team to
          <b>
           identify and pursue top new business prospects in marketing and advertising
          </b>
          . BDMs take a consultative approach with clients to maximize the value Paladin provides at all phases of the hiring process.
         </p>
         <p>
          As a BDM you will be
          <b>
           highly visible within the marketing, creative, communications and digital marketing communities
          </b>
          cultivating and maintaining executive level contacts within the industry. You will network within professional associations and
          <b>
           establish connections with leaders in the corporate marketing community as well as the agency world
          </b>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          BDMs must also have had previous professional experience within at least one of the marketing, creative or communications disciplines. This is an important factor that enables Paladin to provide true peer-to-peer partnerships and counsel to clients and candidates.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Desired Skills &amp; Experience:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Knowledge and understanding of marketing, creative and/or communications industry
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong sales and business development skills
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Consultative approach to client management
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Adept at qualifying opportunities and negotiation
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Team building and goal orientation
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Sense of urgency and time management skills
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Fearless cold caller and adept at database/passive marketing
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong communications, writing and presentation skills
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Focus and goal orientation
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           To learn more about Paladin, please visit www.paladinstaff.com.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          EOE M/F/D/V
         </p>
         <p>

         </p>

          <li>

          </li>

          </b>

We are looking for a WAREHOUSE ASSISTANT, who can work alone, or with others with a stable, long term work history to help run our San Jose warehouse. This is a very unique position in that this person will also occasionally travel, to work in our San Leandro Warehouse. Must have a clean driving record!

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

          </b>

          <br/>

Please list these with the name of the company and the amount of your total compensation package. Please start with your most recent job and go backwards chronologically.

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Direct Support Professional (DSP)
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Serra Center
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Fremont, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Looking for something different in the field of medical and social work?
          </b>
          <br/>
          *Are you interested in making a difference?
          <br/>
          *Enjoy being a teacher and an advocate?
          <br/>
          *Want to enjoy going to work?
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Join Our Team!
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Serra Center, a non-profit corporation, has been committed to providing dignity, respect and choice to persons with intellectual disabilities since 1975. We are currently seeking Direct Support Professionals for our licensed residential care homes in Fremont.
         </p>
         <p>
          Direct Support Professionals are needed to provide support and training in activities of daily living to adults with intellectual disabilities. Job duties are performed in our team-oriented 6 bed residential care homes in Fremont, at a 1:3 staff-to-client ratio. Duties include support with cooking, cleaning, bathing, personal hygiene, community integration, socialization, dispensing medication, assistance with transferring to/from wheelchair. Monthly mandatory in-service trainings meet on-going educational requirements for CNA's and LVN's.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications/Requirements:
          </b>
          Flexible and patient personality, high school diploma, higher education in related field or personal experience regarding persons with intellectual disabilities. Department of Justice fingerprint clearance, valid CDL and clean driving record a must.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           CURRENT OPENINGS:
          </b>
          Work days/hours offered based on agency need to comprise full and part-time schedules.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Monday- Friday:
          </b>
          <br/>
          6:00-9:00am
          <br/>
          2:00-8:00pm
          <br/>
          2:00-10:00pm
          <br/>
          2:00-9:00pm
          <br/>
          A one hour split-shift differential is paid when am and pm shifts are worked in the same day.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Saturday and Sunday:
          </b>
          <br/>
          6:00am-12:00pm
          <br/>
          8:00am-8:00pm
          <br/>
          12:00pm-6:00pm
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           On-Call Staff:
          </b>
          <br/>
          No set scheduled, shifts are offered based on applicant availability to cover openings daily and weekly as they become available. An additional cash incentive is provided when shifts are accepted.
         </p>
         <p>
          Applicants: Please state the position you are interested in when applying.
          <br/>
          Full-time Benefits: PPO or HMO Medical, Dental (employer funded), Vision, Pension Plan (employer/employee funded), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), paid vacation, sick and 11 holidays.
         </p>
         <p>
          Serra Center2610 Central Avenue, Suite 120
          <br/>
          Union City, CA 94587
         </p>
         <p>
          For more information, please visit our website: www.serracenter.org
         </p>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Accountant / Book Keeper / Operations Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Finezi
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Union City, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Finance / Accounting Manager and/or Operations manager Location: Union City, CA
          <br/>
          Duration: Full time - Direct Hire or Contract to hire
          <br/>
          We are currently looking for a dynamic individual to join our Union City office as Accountant / Operations Manager cum Book Keeper. The successful candidate will be a key member of the operations team for the Staffing division. Working closely with the senior leadership team, the incumbent will be responsible for all accounting functions using quickbooks, administering payroll and benefits for the employees , performing book keeping and accounting duties to support the end to end finance operations of the firm.
          <br/>
          Candidate should be an expert on Quickbooks.
          <br/>
          Responsibilities:
          <br/>
          Assume complete responsibility for the accurate and timely preparation and processing of bi-weekly payroll.
          <br/>
          Manage processing of end to end payroll and benefits activity using QUICKBOOKS including payment of state and federal taxes.
          <br/>
          Develops system to account for financial transactions by establishing a chart of accounts; defining bookkeeping policies and procedures using QUICKBOOKS.
          <br/>
          Conduct monthly client wise account reconciliation, monthly Bank reconciliation.
          <br/>
          Maintains subsidiary/vendor accounts by verifying, allocating, and posting transactions.
          <br/>
          Balances subsidiary accounts by reconciling entries.
          <br/>
          Maintains general ledger by transferring subsidiary account summaries.
          <br/>
          Balances general ledger by preparing a trial balance; reconciling entries.
          <br/>
          Maintains historical records by filing documents.
          <br/>
          Prepares financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends.
          <br/>
          Complies with federal, state, and local legal requirements by studying requirements; enforcing adherence to requirements; filing reports; advising management on needed actions.
          <br/>
          Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
          <br/>
          Perform general ledger entries, payroll accounting duties using QUICKBOOKS.
          <br/>
          Ensure group benefits invoices are reconciled and processed in a timely manner.
          <br/>
          Ensure HR employee files contain all historical and current payroll and benefits information.
          <br/>
          Perform accounts payable duties including: Receiving and entering vendor invoices, ensuring proper job and cost allocation of invoices, confirming approval for processing of vendor invoices.
          <br/>
          Timely payment of vendor invoices, filing of accounts payable documents.
          <br/>
          Perform all and any other office/accounting/ book keeping related duties as needed.
          <br/>
          Act as the office cum Operations/Account Manager and handle key responsibilities and calendar of the executive Management.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Accounting, Book Keeping, Quick Books: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </b>

          </b>
          <br/>

This job is performed in an office or field environment with a moderate to loud noise level.

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Senior Associate
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Essex Lake Group
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       New York, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Roles and Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <p>
          Senior Associates* are the owners of one or more work streams and deliverables within a project; in many cases they would have high responsibility and entire visibility across all work streams within an engagement. They will be leading a team of Analysts and Associates and are expected to show leadership skills in content delivery as well as team management. SAs will be interacting with clients, synthesizing analysis with team, formulating recommendations, preparing and managing implementation efforts. They will closely work with Engagement Manager and Client Initiative Leader in managing all client expectations from an engagement. They are expected to contribute to firm development by leading training, logistics functions within the firm and helping develop areas of expertise within the firm. They should be an expert at performing complex quantitative analysis on large amounts of granular client data using data manipulation and statistical tools like SAS, WPS, R, CART. They will also apply proprietary Essex techniques on business problems and establish best practices to be used across the firm e.g. Portfolio Evaluations, Forecasting Risk etc.
         </p>
         <p>
          Skillset/Requirement:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Total Professional experience of 3-5 years with excellent analytical capabilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Should be an expert of working on statistical tools like SAS, WPS, R, CART
          </li>
          <li>
           M.Tech /MBA/Masters from Premier Academic Institutes, with excellent academic records
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent track record of handling very complex and challenging analytical/ scientific assignments
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven track record of communication, interpersonal and leadership skills and team management skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Should be able to take ownership
          </li>
          <li>
           Should have analytical bent of mind and should be interested in travelling and exploring the world
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Professional competencies:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Willing to work in an international environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Team player
          </li>
          <li>
           Good interpersonal skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Well organized
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines on time
          </li>
          <li>
           Good communication skills
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          *Please note that Essex uses internal job titles separate from those mentioned on job boards. The Senior Associate position is referred to internally as Profit Enhancement Specialist
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_1d5a4f4140aed955">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>

       </td>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">

      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Lafayette, CA
      </span>
      <br/>

      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Lafayette Physical Therapy has been an established private practice for over 40 years in the community providing rehabilitation, massage and wellness services to a diverse clientele including orthopedics, sports and geriatric rehabilitation. We have a highly productive and efficient team and are looking for a personable and motivated individual that will thrive in our team environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for someone who will help to maintain a high level of customer service and professionalism. The Patient Services Representative works at the front desk assisting patients in person and over the phone as well as assisting the clinic in complete patient records, insurance verification and authorization, payment collection, scheduling and a other front office tasks. If you are detail oriented and looking to be a part of a wonderfully caring and effective team we would love to meet you!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Mission Statement
          </b>
          <br/>
          Lafayette Physical Therapy strives to provide extraordinary physical therapy in a professional, caring, results-oriented and cost-effective way to restore, enhance and preserve function, movement, and health. We will help each patient achieve his or her highest functional level by being dedicated to excellence in our clinical practice. We will treat patients with dignity and respect by truly listening to them to help them meet their goals. Finally, we will provide these services in an environment that fosters the professional and personal growth of each LPT employee.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Core Values
          </b>
          <br/>
          1. To provide an extraordinary customer service experience for all clients, treating them as unique and important individuals.
          <br/>
          2. To produce industry leading clinical outcomes.
          <br/>
          3. To meet and exceed all measures of financial performance through production and fiscal responsibility.
          <br/>
          4. To offer a great employment experience by promoting a working environment that fosters personal and professional growth, team enthusiasm, synergy, and integrity, so that staff meet and exceed their professional goals, and so that good people stay with the company for a long time.
          <br/>
          5. To have the company operate with ease so that each person can focus on their key production area with efficiency and production quotas exceeded regularly.
          <br/>
          6. To have our PTs recognized as autonomous professionals by patients and referral sources.
          <br/>
          7. To continually create new referral relationships and nurture existing ones so that we have a large and growing database of referrals.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Characteristics Needed
          </b>
          : The right candidate is friendly, professional, organized, reliable, accountable and ethical. We have a strong team atmosphere that requires an energetic and positive person with a good work ethic, accountability, and reliability.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills &amp; Abilities Needed
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Quick Learner
          </li>

           Strong Communication Skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong Multitasking abilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent Phone Etiquette
          </li>
          <li>
           Confidence in speaking to patients about money owed
          </li>
          <li>
           Detail-oriented with high accuracy
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to prioritize tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to follow directions and meet deadlines
          </li>
          <li>
           Adaptable to a growing practice
          </li>
          <li>
           Good spoken and written English (strong grammar)
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>

           </b>
           : MS Word and Excel, email, Windows 7 &amp; 8,
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Customer Service
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </b>
          :
         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Scheduling physical therapy, massage and wellness appointments
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Preparing and pulling charts
          </li>
          <li>
           Filing
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively manage daily logs and record keeping
          </li>
          <li>
           Process Patient Referrals, No-Shows/Cancellations, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Data Entry
          </li>
          <li>
           Work as a team with other staff members in order to provide the best possible customer service and workplace efficiency
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

         </p>

         </p>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Accounts Payable Specialist
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       CRISTA Ministries
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Accounting Specialist helps empower CRISTA to meet its mission by supplying great accounting and finance support and excellent customer service to both internal and external customers. The Accounting Specialist will efficiently process high volumes of payables and administer the corporate purchasing card system. They will also conduct ministry research, perform special projects, and prepare other reports as needed. Intrigued? Let us introduce you to the Accounting/Finance Team at CRISTA Ministries. The Accounting/Finance team is a group of highly professional individuals with exceptional accounting skills that aim to provide world class support and financial leadership to an organization that loves God by serving people. Supporting the seven distinct CRISTA Ministries provides a technically challenging, fast paced environment where there are opportunities to grow professionally and spiritually while putting your skills to work for a mission you believe in.
          <br/>
          JOB DUTIES:
          <br/>
          1. Accounts Payable Accounting:  Perform the necessary accounting functions that will accomplish accurate and timely record keeping for all ministries, including, but not limited to the processing of all incoming payables, vendor account reviews and filing. Manage the corporate purchasing card program including activation/deactivation of users, audit of purchasing card statements, maintenance of the sign off infrastructure and facilitation of card limit changes. Prepare monthly Use Tax worksheet. Follow CRISTA policies, procedures, laws and regulations.
          <br/>
          2. Accounts Payable Support:  Provide excellent customer service in both verbal and written communications with internal and external customers. Understand the AP software (Agresso) well enough to be a resource to staff regarding PO requests and AP inquiries. Maintain annual blanket purchase order listings, creating or deactivating as requested. Assist the AP Supervisor with internal control audits of vendors, purchasing card usage and other items as needed. Recommend process and system improvements to the AP Supervisor.
          <br/>
          3. Work collaboratively with supervisor, coworkers and customers.
          <br/>
          4. Perform other related duties as assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS:
          <br/>
          1. Christian Commitment: Godly leader and servant leadership style that is relational and reflective of John 10; personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and spiritual maturity.
          <br/>
          2. Education: Associates degree in Accounting from an accredited college or university recognized by the United States Department of Education or equivalent
          <i>
           .
          </i>
          Relevant work experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis.
          <br/>
          3. Experience: Experience with computerized accounts payable systems, computerized general ledger systems and customer service.
          <br/>
          4. Licensure/Certification: None
          <br/>
          5. Software and Equipment Used: Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.
          <br/>
          6. Other Considerations:
          <br/>
           Must be able to work independently, efficiently and professionally with a wide variety of personality types as well as demonstrate a willingness to learn and grow.
          <br/>
           Ability to work collaboratively with supervisor, coworkers and customers.
         </p>
         <p>
          PREFERED QUALIFICATIONS:
          <br/>
          1. Christian Commitment: Godly leader and servant leadership style that is relational and reflective of John 10; personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and spiritual maturity.
          <br/>
          2. Education: Associates degree in Accounting from an accredited college or university recognized by the United States Department of Education or equivalent. Relevant work experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis.
          <br/>
          3. Experience: Experience with computerized accounts payable systems, computerized general ledger systems and customer service.
          <br/>
          4. Licensure/Certification:
          <br/>
          5. Software and Equipment Used: Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.6. Other Considerations:  Must be able to work independently, efficiently and professionally with a wide variety of personality types as well as demonstrate a willingness to learn and grow. Ability to work collaboratively with supervisor, coworkers and customers.
         </p>

          The most efficient way to be considered is to apply directly to this position using this URL:
          <br/>
          https://chj.tbe.taleo.net/chj05/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=CRISTA&amp;cws=1&amp;rid=1453
         </p>

         </p>

          </li>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Sales Consultant - Unconventional!
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Honda and Toyota of Seattle
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Honda and Toyota of Seattle are recruiting Sales Consultants for our brand new location in SODO!
         </p>
         <p>
          Let's start with the SUCCESS STORIES of a few of our Sales Consultants.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A Sales Consultant was an inspector of fire control systems. He has been with us for 6 months and averages 20 cars sold per month;
          </li>
          <li>
           A Sales Consultant is a former Youth Pastor and High School History Teacher. He is 6 months new and averages 17 cars sold per month;
          </li>
          <li>
           A Sales Consultant was a former fast food employee. She moved to the US to learn English. She now averages 18 cars sold per month!
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We have many more success stories like these to share!
         </p>
         <p>
          What has helped them become successful?
         </p>
         <p>
          Honda and Toyota of Seattle is committed to hiring and developing top talent from all industries. Our teams operate with a non-conventional automotive selling philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone; you must have a genuine passion for providing an exceptional customer experience. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Role
         </p>
         <p>
          The primary goal of the Sales Consultant is to provide a fun educational experience for customers who come into Honda and Toyota of Seattle. The Sales Consultant will accomplish this by handling all walk in store guests, answering questions, presenting our products, and educating the public about what makes our selling process different than the rest. An implicit responsibility of the Sales Consultant is to conduct educational conversations and business dealings in a way that creates a superior customer experience that represents the new way of selling cars.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our business model is simple: ONE person, ONE price, and ONE place.
         </p>
         <p>
          Finally: What we offer:
         </p>
         <p>
          We are committed to YOUR success at Honda and Toyota of Seattle. We offer:
          <br/>
          - 60 days of training for our model of business. Training is paid at a high hourly wage;
          <br/>
          - After 60 days of probationary period, pay is based on a highly competitive commission structure;
          <br/>
          - Medical, dental, vision and life insurance offered after 60 days of employment;
          <br/>
          - Paid time off;
          <br/>
          - Ongoing training and development;
          <br/>
          - Room for advancement within the company;
          <br/>
          - No standing out in the cold and rain! 5 (of 6) levels completely indoors.
         </p>
         <p>
          Honda and Toyota of Seattle are also looking for qualified applicants for service technicians at all levels, parts consultants and service advisors. You may reply here for those job postings as well.
         </p>
         <p>
          Equal Opportunity Employer. Drug-free Environment.
         </p>

         <p>

         </p>
         <p>
          iDESIGN Solutions is a Value Added Reseller focused on selling Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Math (STEAM) education solutions, including; 2D and 3D design software, VEX Robotics Classroom Kits &amp; Parts, 3D Printers and teacher training.
         </p>

         <p>
          Salary: $10.00 /hour
         </p>
        </span>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0rnj1eb02j8u2" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Pest Control Technician
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Whitworth Pest Solutions
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Puyallup, WA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $13 - $18 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Pest Control Technicians Needed-Structural (Puyallup/Tacoma)
         </p>
         <p>
          Compensation $13-$18/hr. DOE
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           We're looking for career-minded individuals who like to work hard and help people.
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          Whitworth Pest Solutions, Inc. is a leader in the pest control industry in Pierce, Thurston and King County. We are a growing company that has been in business for over 30 years. It was founded by Terry Whitworth, Ph.D. Entomologist. The company operates out of a facility owned by Terry, which he custom designed for the business. Whitworth is proud of its excellent reputation and focuses on superior client service, continuing education for all employees, and problem solving through knowledge and hard work. We are different than giant, publicly traded national companies-employees are not numbers here, but rather valued members of a team.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB DESCRIPTION:
          </b>
          Pest Control Technician (pest control performed on structures)
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           ADDITIONAL BENEFITS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          1. 401K with match.
         </p>
         <p>
          2. Very attainable production bonuses above and beyond normal hourly pay.
         </p>
         <p>
          3. Paid holidays, vacation, sick time.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
          </b>
          Experience in structural pest control is desired (licensed by WSDA and/or current occupation is in pest control) but not required.
         </p>
         <p>
          Once a new employee completes paid training, they will be expected to have the following skills:
         </p>
         <p>
          --Ability to identify insects and rodents. Ability to think on their own and solve difficult pest infestations.
         </p>
         <p>
          --Be detail-oriented and able to interpret product labels accurately and apply products accurately and conscientiously.
         </p>
         <p>
          --Communicate with clients and the public in a positive and knowledgeable way.
         </p>
         <p>
          --Be self-motivated and able to work alone with focus.
         </p>
         <p>
          --Ability to pass or already have passed Washington State Department of Agriculture exams.
         </p>
         <p>
          --Feel comfortable driving a variety of vehicles, including at times a spray truck and/or pulling trailers (CDL not required).
         </p>
         <p>
          Before you send your resume, please read the following (numbered paragraphs below). We want to make certain that you have a further idea of what this job involves and what it requires. The following information is meant to provide insight regarding some conditions and environments that some people choose not to work with. We would rather have you know some of the specifics now, rather than later.
         </p>
         <p>
          1. We are very concerned about the health and welfare of all employees and make safety the top priority. Therefore, we are only interested in hiring conscientious, safety minded people who take good care of themselves, including good personal hygiene (persons exhibiting long hair, excessive facial hair, excessive piercings and excessive visible tattoos may not be hired or may be asked to cover up certain areas). Conscientiousness also includes always paying attention to what's going on around you so that pesticide applications are safe to our clients and the general public. Employees must refrain from the use of drugs and excessive use of alcohol. Non-tobacco users are preferred, as tobacco use is not allowed in company vehicles or on client properties.
         </p>
         <p>
          2. Exceeding our clients' expectations is our goal in all the services we provide. Therefore, all technicians must be service minded and feel rewarded by helping people and putting clients first. They're required to establish good working relationships with clients, including reporting important issues to them regarding their homes or businesses and showing care and empathy while performing their service. They must be willing to "go the extra mile" toward exceeding client expectations, all while displaying a professional and positive attitude.
         </p>
         <p>
          3. Employees must have reliable transportation to and from work and must have a good driving record. All potential candidate driving records and background history will be checked. No one should have more than two minor moving infractions in the past three years, especially if they're less than 25 years of age. In addition, there is a lot of driving involved since we have expanded our service areas. Some technicians will drive a company vehicle an average of 50 to 100 miles per day (on some days, even more).
         </p>
         <p>
          4. Pest control technicians regularly deal with ladders, spray equipment, and a wide variety of pesticides. They deal with many different types of insects and animals that infest buildings and landscapes, including but not limited to: bed bugs, fleas, spiders, wasps, yellowjackets, rats and mice. If you have fears about encounters with anything mentioned above or anything that is considered a pest in our industry (including killing them), then this job is not for you.
         </p>
         <p>
          5. A majority of the time, technicians are required to work over 40 hours per week. At certain times, they are also required to work on a Saturday, Sunday, after normal business hours and at night for commercial accounts. Overtime is paid at 1-1/2 times normal hourly pay.
         </p>
         <p>
          6. Pest control technicians must routinely enter spaces within buildings that pests travel through or live in. These areas (such as attics or crawl spaces underneath a building) can be tight, narrow, cramped, hot, cold, wet, dirty, dark, stinky and just plain unpleasant. Although personal protective equipment is provided, some people still find it hard to work in these conditions. For example, if you have fear of heights, claustrophobia, a bad back, or your physical size does not permit entry into a small space, you would not be able to perform this job.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           7. We are a drug-free company (this includes marijuana use and abuse of prescription drugs). No applicant becomes an employee until they undergo a pre-employment drug screen, even if promised a position. Employees are subject to random drug testing throughout their career.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Thank you for expressing an interest in working here. If you feel that you qualify for employment here, please proceed to email a resume.
         </p>
         <p>
          Feel free to check out our website at http://www.whitworthpestsolutions.com.
         </p>
         <p>
          Please DO NOT CALL OUR OFFICE. We will be reviewing all resumes and you will be contacted if we are interested in interviewing you.
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_4dcfa227182eccc1">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>

         </p>

          She is a bright, happy &amp; motivated little girl who was born at 29 weeks. She had a very, very rocky start to life &amp; as a result she is now playing physical 'catch up'. She is delayed with her motor skills &amp; has low vision which means that in order to be able to access much of the content; adaptions or material creation needs to happen &amp; extra time needs to be taken for tasks such as writing.
         </p>

          You will be partnering with the class teacher &amp; facilitating any adaptations within the wider teaching team to ensure that our daughter can be fully integrated into each lesson &amp; that all material is accessible. You will be sat alongside her, assisting where necessary; with the overall objective of developing her independent learning skills.
         </p>
         <p>
          The school is a main stream private school based in Bellevue. It is a wonderful environment &amp; the children experience a fantastic range of lessons throughout the week, which they often transition from class to class to.
         </p>
         <p>
          The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of helping develop a child on a one to one basis, have had some experience of working with additional physical needs, work well within a team, have lots of creative ideas to bring to the table alongside the motivation to implement them!
         </p>
         <p>
          We are only looking for candidates who are happy to put in a hundred per cent effort, genuinely love making a difference and someone who has got the dedication to help develop over the long term.
         </p>

         </p>

          Guide hours are 8.30am  2.30pm Monday to Friday, although there is some flexibility with this.
         </p>
         <p>
          Very good $ package; car available for right candidate if needed.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you would genuinely love to make a difference, &amp; to be part of a team that is helping not let a difficult start affect a future; (and have the following), we'd love to hear from you:
          <br/>
          *English as 1st language or completely fluent.
          <br/>
          *At least 1 year relevant experience.
          <br/>
          *Have check able references &amp; no criminal record.
          <br/>
          *Child Care qualifications / teaching credentials
         </p>
         <p>
          Please include your resume &amp; tell us why you think this role would be great for you. Also confirm your availability &amp; salary expectations.
         </p>
         <p>
          We look forward to hearing from you.
         </p>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u113m2pb9rodjf" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        OCC Fiber Procurement Specialist
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Alsip MiniMill, LLC
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Alsip, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           <b>
            Required:
           </b>
          </i>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Exceptional people, communication, analytical, math/finance, negotiation and organizational skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelors degree.
          </li>
          <li>
           Five years previous work experience in paper mill environment, recycling, sales, customer service, warehousing, purchasing or similar industry.
          </li>
          <li>
           Up to 50% travel, minimal overnight
          </li>
          <li>
           Presence at mill some nights and weekends
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           <b>
            Preferred
           </b>
           :
          </i>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors degree in accounting, finance, environmental science or business and seven years' previous work experience in paper mill environment, recycling, sales, customer service, warehousing, purchasing or similar industry.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           MAJOR AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITIES:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Identify generators of old corrugated containers (OCC) and double-lined kraft (DLK) in the vicinity of the mill  Secondary Fiber.
          </li>
          <li>
           Create and maintain listings and files (electronic and hard copy) of all brokers and generators of OCC/DLK  Supplier Customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate visits to supplier customer offices and generation facilities to inspect OCC/DLK processing, volume, dock/rail facilities, distance from mill and other nuances.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate visits to carrier (trucking) customer offices/locations to become familiar with services provided to Alsip MiniMill.
          </li>
          <li>
           Add/update suppler and carrier customer files, shipping locations, contact information, etc. in the Alsip Fiber Procurement System (AFPS) software.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete weekly bookings of OCC/DLK loads using AFPS.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop a glossary of terms unique to the mill to promote common understanding among mill personnel.
          </li>
          <li>
           Create and maintain Pulp and Paper Industry pricing files, for each month and historical.
          </li>
          <li>
           Review all fiber supply contracts for accuracy; maintain electronic and hard copy files of all.
          </li>
          <li>
           Scan, copy, e-mail and file various documents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Meet with Mill Manager, Team Leads and Warehouse Team Lead and personnel to get feedback on all issues related to fiber quality, transportation, scale, receiving, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete volume and financial projections and budgets for OCC/DLK purchases, transportation, shuttle service, warehousing and more.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) for OCC/DLK usage, transportation costs, cost per finished ton, yield and more.
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in safety and environmental training and team/team building events with mill staff.
          </li>
          <li>
           Create cost and volume tracking of mill waste.
          </li>
          <li>
           Identify areas for improvement  both cost and efficiency.
          </li>
          <li>
           Learn and participate in procurement of non-OCC/DLK parts, supplies and equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as required by supervisor.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           NATURE AND SCOPE:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Support all facets of fiber procurement for Alsip MiniMill LLC: sourcing, transportation, delivery, and warehousing. Collaborate closely with mill leadership and technicians to ensure Safety/Housekeeping, Quality, Cost, and Production of OCC supply operations meet or exceed mill standards.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           THE COMPANY
          </b>
          <br/>
          Alsip MiniMill, LLC is converting from DIP Fine Paper (LWC) to supply our new owners with 100% recycled lightweight, high-test corrugated medium. The mill is located within an hour of downtown Chicago.
         </p>
         <p>
          Ideal candidates will be highly motivated team players, who desire to learn and grow professionally in an organization committed to Safety and Quality. AMM offers competitive pay and comprehensive benefits, including health, dental, 401k and employee assistance program. EEO/AA
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Recycling, sales, purchasing -- minimum: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_08bd8e7347de1fc9">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>

          </b>
         </p>

The Senior Client Consultant is also involved in the client acquisition process (pre-sales) working with prospects, and presenting the BluePlanner software to support Revenue Management initiatives.
         </p>
         <p>

          </b>
         </p>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain client relationships, present new features and/or ideas to improve business results
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in industry events and develop leadership expertise in Revenue Management and Trade Promotion Management
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in the development of UpClear Client Services team, including recruitment, training and management
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in company marketing and business development initiatives, including industry events &amp; publications
          </li>

          </b>
         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

UpClear has clients in more than 18 countries, and operates out of New York City, London, and Hong Kong. BluePlanner has been recognized by Consumer Goods Technology as one of the leading solutions for Sales Optimization. UpClear is growing at a rate of more than 50% per year.

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          A truly game-changing enterprise software company comes along once a decade. The last one was Salesforce.com. WorkFusion is the next.
         </p>
         <p>
          Born of research at MITs Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Lab (CSAIL), WorkFusions software elevates human intelligence by automating the work thats beneath it. One of New York Citys fastest growing software companies, WorkFusion is at the intersection of two megatrends in global business: robotic automation and workforce elasticity. WorkFusions enterprise platform brings these two trends together by pairing machine learning with human knowledge workers to automate repetitive data work. By identifying, learning, and replicating the pattern of human tasks, WorkFusion radically reduces costs and creates capacity for businesses and improves productivity and creativity for human workers.
         </p>
         <p>
          Fueled by a growing number of large customers in financial services, eCommerce, and retailing and funded by top-tier investors from Silicon Valley and New York, WorkFusion is expanding quickly and growing its world-class team. More information can be found at www.workfusion.com.
         </p>
         <p>
          WorkFusion is seeking an Account Manager to work closely with our large enterprise, fortune 500 clients to be the face of WorkFusion to these clients and drive revenue growth within the account.
         </p>
         <p>
          Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Navigate among the key players at large, global, and complex organizations to understand their needs and how our capabilities align and solve problems
          </li>
          <li>
           Oversee all commercial issues, including contracts, and adherence to service level agreements
          </li>
          <li>
           Connect and facilitate training and support resources to clients
          </li>
          <li>
           Handle any new needs, such as custom integration, and custom development requests
          </li>
          <li>
           Introducing WorkFusion to new users within an account and ensure that they receive the necessary orientation, training, and support
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with the client to ensure satisfaction with WorkFusion
          </li>
          <li>
           Collaborate with peers on the enterprise sales and customer success teams to develop and execute strategic growth plans
          </li>
          <li>
           Build strong relationships with the procurement, legal, and business/operations teams at our clients organization to get ahead of new opportunities and make negotiating and closing new deals more efficient
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BS/MS degree in information systems, business, or a related discipline with emphasis on business and computer technology
          </li>

          </b>
         </p>
         <p>

          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Travel arrangements for JRW and or Project Manager.
          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Assist the Bookkeeper with placing orders. Shipping must also be outlined at this point if special services such as white glove or international will be necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           <i>
            Assist Bookkeeper with data entry of accounts payable.
           </i>
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Assist the Bookkeeper with filing and organizing all accounting documents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist Project Managers to communicate with contractors/vendors to follow up on existing orders and estimated timing for completion, or to obtain new samples, photos, quotes, for potential new orders/sales and making sure all conversations are documented or followed up in writing.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist Project Managers with arranging and scheduling elevator times and dates for subcontractors and vendors to make deliveries.
          </li>
          <li>
           Keep weekly up-to-date statuses on pending purchase orders and update Project Managers with purchase order Statuses (CFA/finishes/samples).
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           General office, office technology and kitchen Supply ordering.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate projects for office with IT person such as technology installation, repair or replacements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists JRW with personal assistant tasks.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position requirements:
          </b>
          *
          <b>

          </b>

Maintain good time management skills and the ability to multitask. Knowledge of standard office equipment and computer applications related to the work including but not limited to Internet research, WordPress, MS Office, Adobe, Photoshop, etc. Excellent Customer Service skills.

          </b>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0qef52b9nobqj" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Lead Toddler Teacher
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Multicultural child and family Hope center
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Tacoma, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Early Childhood Education and Assistance Program (ECEAP, pronounced e-cap) helps children and families get ready for kindergarten. ECEAP is funded by Washington State and is free to enrolled families. It serves three- and four-year-olds from low income families, or with developmental or environmental risk factors that could interfere with school success.ECEAP includes preschool education, health services coordination, and family support services. Children who attend learn to manage their feelings, get along with others and follow classroom procedures. They build the beginning skills for reading, math and science. The program works closely with parents to support their childrens health and education and to meet family goals. ECEAP also helps families access medical and dental care and social services.
         </p>
         <p>
          job description
          <br/>
          Interacts with parents, volunteers, and team members to guide the educational activities of children 1 month to 5 years enrolled in the College's early childhood program to provide educational instruction. This position also interacts and responds to each child with respect, courtesy, and understanding their developmental stage of growth. Work is performed following Department of Early Learning (DEL) requirements (WACS), Association for Early Learning Leaders standards (AELL), Child and Adult Care Food Program (CACFP) requirements, and Center Policies and Procedures which include Expectations and Code of Teaching Behavior, Health Care Policy, Emergency Procedures, Safety and College Policies. This position reports to the Early Learning Program Manager.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Guide individual and groups of children ages 1 month to 5 years in developmentally appropriate practices using best practices as a guide to foster creativity, fine and gross motor development , cognitive skills, social and emotional development, language development, and independence and self-help skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Implement guidance techniques that respect the individuality of each child. Respond to children with respect, courtesy and an understanding of their developmental stage of growth.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to assess each child's developmental progress using a valid, reliable, and recognized assessment tool.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete scoring rubrics such as the Early Childhood Environment Rating Scale (ECERS) or the Infant Toddler Environment Rating Scale (ITERS) and conduct ongoing assessment of classroom and program strengths and needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop and implement learning experiences for children based on observations of children's interests and developmental needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide on the job training and mentoring to staff whose skill sets are in an earlier stage of development, such as, student staff, temporary employees, and volunteers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Use computer literacy and knowledge to find teaching resources on the internet, use online time and leave system, maintain attendance record, design curriculum, prepare newsletters in a professional format, and check and respond to emails as it pertains to job functions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate with the Program Manager regarding information and insights that effect the efficient cohesive functioning of the program. This information may relate to the program, children, or parents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate routinely with parents regarding child's development.
          </li>
          <li>
           Function as a member of a team-oriented staff. May lead, instruct, assign and check the work of others. Participate in staff meetings and in-service training.
          </li>
          <li>
           Make use of opportunities to expand knowledge and expertise through professional development and trainings relating to Early Childhood Program Specialist position.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete twenty hours basic STARS training within six months of hire and maintain a minimum of ten hours annually after that.
          </li>
          <li>
           Courteously receive visitors and parents with the ability to articulate the philosophies of the program and early childhood education, and best practices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Understand and implement minimum licensing requirements as determined by the Department of Early Learning (DEL).
          </li>
          <li>
           Have an understanding of Early Achievers, Head Start, and Early Childhood Education and Assistance Program (ECEAP).
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform related duties as assigned to meet the needs of the children and the functions of the Early Learning Center.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Minimum Qualifications
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Associates degree in Early Childhood Education from an accredited college. OR- Associates degree with twenty (20) credit hours in early childhood development, special education or equivalent. OR- a current Child Development Associates Degree (CDA).
          </li>
          <li>
           Two (2) years of FTE experience working with preschool age children as a lead teacher in a group setting, providing program planning, developing and presenting educational activities/lessons plans - or- equivalent combination of education and experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Intermediate experience using word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software programs such as Microsoft Office.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Preferred Qualifications
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors degree in Early Childhood Education from an accredited college or university.
          </li>
          <li>
           Three (3) years of FTE experience working with preschool age children as a lead teacher.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience working under the guidelines of an accredited early learning program.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Conditions Of Employment
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Successfully pass a criminal history background check prior to employment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Successfully pass a portable background check (PBC) prior to employment through Managed Education &amp; Registry Information Tool (MERIT).
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid First Aid and CPR Certification. May obtain within 30 days of hire.
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid Food Handlers Permit. May obtain within 30 days of hire.
          </li>
          <li>
           HIV certificate of training. May obtain within 30 days of hire.
          </li>
          <li>
           Record of current Tuberculin (TB) Test.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift and carry 20-45 pounds, live weight.
          </li>
          <li>
           Obtain State Training &amp; Registry System (STAR) number for MERIT. May obtain upon hiring.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Pay depending on experience
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_0af040ef26274324">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0qq8a4b0elbct" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Human Resources Administrator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Connelly Skis Inc./CWB Board Co.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Lynnwood, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Position: Human Resources Administrator
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Compensation: DOE
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Connelly Skis, Inc. has been in business since 1965 manufacturing watersports products. Our products are sold world-wide. Our work environment is casual and fun. Connelly Skis promotes a healthy workplace for all of our employees. It is our policy to not offer employment to individuals who smoke or use tobacco products and hire only those who successfully pass a drug test. This is a great job for water sports enthusiasts - we offer discounts as part of our benefit package!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB OVERVIEW:
          </b>
          This position is responsible for performing a variety of human resources, accounting and office administrative duties. Assists Managers and Employees with their HR needs. Processes payroll, manages the time records and related reports. Coordinates a variety of employee activities. Responsible for coordinating recruiting, the orientation of new employees, employee benefit enrollments and other related activities. Processes Workers Comp claims, handles OSHA reports and participates in Safety Committee activities. Maintains Human Resource records and files, ensuring confidential information are secure.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB RESPONSIBILITIES (include, but are not limited to):
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Maintains knowledge of employment policies, contributes to employee handbook editing, distributes employee handbook when changes are received and answers employee questions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates recruiting/hiring functions for approved job openings. Screens applicants and conducts phone interviews. May also attend second interviews to provide insight. Coordinates final interviews with the hiring manager. Ensures decisions are documented. Responds to applications/resumes received for positions, including unsolicited applications. As needed, assists managers in preparing/revising job descriptions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for payroll functions and related reports: Registers employees into the time clock system and monitors time clock; sets up the annual payroll calendar and coordinates needs with the payroll processing company; collects data; processes hours/departments, various deductions, payroll changes and enters required information into the automated payroll system; balances and verifies processed payroll and resolves discrepancies; prepares checks and distributes; prepares payroll-related reports, files/secures payroll data; answers employee questions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates the 401 (k) Plan and insurance enrollment processes and requested benefit changes, including the annual enrollment period.
          </li>
          <li>
           Carries out a variety of employee events and activities: employee meetings, luncheons, gifts, celebrations and events like United Way campaigns.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains in-house communications: bulletin board posting (legal and informational), birthdays and employment anniversary announcements, compiles monthly/annual activity calendars, distributes newsletters, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains human resource, benefit and employee files according to the records retention schedule, keeping appropriate data secure and confidential.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           DESIRED SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           At least two years of office experience work requiring computer skills, detail work, working with office equipment (phones, copiers, etc.), independent project coordination and working with people at all levels in an organization.
          </li>
          <li>
           Human Resource work experience desired.
          </li>
          <li>
           Payroll experience desired, preferably using ADP.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be a high school graduate or have equivalent experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess a high degree of integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality.
          </li>
          <li>
           Exceptional oral communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to write clear communications with accurate spelling and punctuation and display data professionally.
          </li>
          <li>
           Self-motivated, able to prioritize and plan work activities, balance multiple tasks and change priorities as needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently and as a team member.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to relate to other people and maintain positive relationships and remain open to others ideas.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent computer skills and quick to learn new systems.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We are a tobacco-free and drug-free company. Must be a non-tobacco user (for the last 6 months) and drug free (required to pass a drug test).
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must be a high school graduate or have equivalent experience. Human Resources experience desired.: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_c5cdaa53597f71fa">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0dm6pqbr1het5" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        After-School Swim Lesson Instructor
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Head-Royce School
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Oakland, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $23 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Head-Royce After-School Swim Program Coordinator
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Responsibilities and Expectations 2015
          </b>
          <br/>
          The ASP Swim Coordinator serves as the administrative head of the after-school swim lesson program and on-site manger during all swim lessons. Given the authority to lead therein, the Swim Program Coordinator is responsible for the effective supervision and administration of that program, including all areas of personnel, program, and participants. While additional responsibilities may surface in the course of this inherently unpredictable work, the following is a list of core duties and expectations:
          <br/>
          Program Schedule: Monday-Thursday, (Fridays 3:30-4:30 pm) September 14th - October 9th,
          <br/>
          Hours: 2:00 - 6:00 daily (depending on lesson schedule)
          <br/>
          Pay Rate: $25 per hour
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Expected to attend and support all staff trainings that are traditional and/or deemed necessary for the most effective functioning of the swim lesson program.
          </li>
          <li>
           The Assistant Supervisor oversees the running of the swim lesson program on a day-to-day basis. The primary responsibility of the coordinator is recruitment/ hiring, scheduling and supervising of all swim instructors and students and oversight of all lessons.
          </li>
          <li>
           The Assistant Supervisor is a primary point of contact for parents while on campus needing assistance or attending lessons. Some communications may occur during or outside of the program itself.
          </li>
          <li>
           The Assistant Supervisor is responsible for maintaining accurate systems of attendance within the swim lesson program in collaboration with the programs office, locating missing students, and contacting parents/ASP if attendance issues arise. Should an instructor miss a lesson, the Coordinator would arrange make-up lessons with families.
          </li>
          <li>
           In a multi-departmental structure, the Assistant Supervisor will need to collaborate closely with the ASP counselors to ensure timely lesson arrivals, changing/transitioning students, safety of the participants, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           The Assistant Supervisors leadership includes oversight of safety-related issues and disaster response within the program in coordination with the Director of Programs. In the event of an emergency situation and/or disaster, all staff are expected to remain present on campus to ensure the complete safety of all participants until no longer needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           The Program Coordinator will manage all assessment of student swim level and ensure that placement in groups/instructors is appropriate and best suited for maximum learning.
          </li>
          <li>
           The Coordinator will manage the flow of students and ensuring that they arrive on time and receive their entire 30 minute lesson.
          </li>
          <li>
           Depending on enrollment and availability, the Coordinator will also be responsible for swim lesson instruction.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          The Swim Program Coordinator would report directly to the Director of Programs. The Swim Program Coordinator is expected to proactively communicate any conflicts, concerns, incidents or issues with the Director of Programs and collaborate to identify and implement solutions.
          <br/>
          ASP Swim Instructors:
          <br/>
          Instructor hours: Mon. - Thurs. 2:00 pm - 6:00 pm
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must hold a current Water Safety Instructor certificate, First Aid certificate, and infant, child and adult CPR certifications.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have experience and the ability to demonstrate each swim stroke with proper breathing technique (front crawl/freestyle, back crawl/backstroke, breastroke, butterfly, elementary backstroke), dives, flip-turns, underwater retrieval, skulling, floating, and treading water.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must demonstrate a positive attitude and a high standard of professionalism, quality instruction and provide a safe, enjoyable learning environment for all children.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Are responsible for the classes that they are assigned to teach and the student evaluation upon completion of the session.
          <br/>
          Must teach lessons according to provided formats. Our program uses the American Red Cross Learn-To-Swim 09 Revised Swim Program, a 6 level program.
          <br/>
          All staff members must participate in scheduled meetings, training, etc. if necessary.
          <br/>
          Must support the mission of the program, the needs of the children, and supervisory staff in all ways reasonable within the parameters of the position.
          <br/>
          Where possible, staff members should help with the transition and changing of students from the After-School Program (ASP) to their swim lessons. Should a student not arrive on time, it is each individual instructors responsibility to communicate and problem solve their attendance.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $23.00 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           WSI and/or Red Cross Cerification: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_24a3ee6f212843c9">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0sicc4b9jq8qu" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
