  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        After School Instructor
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       82nd Street Academics
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Long Island City, NY
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $13 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          82nd Street Academics seeks part time Instructors for our after school program at Hunter's Point Community Middle School (HPCMS) in Long Island City, NY. The program will enter its second year of operation in September 2015. The participants in the program are 100 students in 6th-8th grades. The goal of our program is to provide the academic and social support needed to help students develop the skills required to successfully complete their secondary and collegiate education. We achieve these goals by providing a holistic program that includes homework assistance, physical exercise, and college exploration. This program is funded by the Department of Youth and Community Development (SONYC) and is governed by a strong partnership with the host school.
         </p>
         <p>
          The hours of this position are 2:15pm-5:45pm, Monday to Friday. There are bi-weekly meetings and professional developments that may occur outside of these hours.
         </p>
         <p>
          Rate of Pay: $12-$14 per hour depending on previous experience and related education.
         </p>
         <p>
          Major Duties and Responsibilities include:
          <br/>
          -Provide leadership on a day to day basis for a class of 10- 15 middle school students. Instructors are representatives of our agency in the school and are responsible for maintaining the culture of the school in the afternoon.
         </p>
         <p>
          -Create lesson plans in advance of implementation ensuring that they are age appropriate and coincide with the goals of the program and our stakeholders. Much of our planning is based in college exploration activities. Staff will work as a team to provide activities and experiences that increase students awareness of the college application process and what options are available to them. We will work together to promote a college-attending environment among students.
         </p>
         <p>
          -Ensure student safety and attendance to the program at all times. -Instructors are a role model for our students. Everyone on our team must be outstanding in adherence to policies on attendance and punctuality, dress code, and setting a tone of respect in interactions with students, colleagues, parents, and HPCMS staff members.
         </p>
         <p>
          -Communicate with parents when there is a concern that must be resolved. Provide excellent customer service and a professional, caring demeanor.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Requirements:
         </p>
         <p>
          Education and Experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Study plan towards college graduation with a BA (minimum)
          </li>
          <li>
           At least one year of experience working with the Middle School age group in a professional setting
          </li>
          <li>
           Commitment to the program through the end of June 2016 is a non-negotiable requirement
          </li>
          <li>
           Bilingual fluency in Spanish and English is needed but not required
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Demonstrated Abilities
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Knowledge of best practices in working with children in an extracurricular setting
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong communication abilities in one-on-one meetings and in group settings,
          </li>
          <li>
           Takes personal accountability for the program outcomes, and takes initiative to implement positive change in the face of challenges
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Interested and qualified candidates should respond to this posting with their cover letter and resume by email only. Any attachments should be in PDF or MSWord formatting. Please include the title of this position in the subject line of your email. For more information about our organization please visit our website at www.82ndst.com.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $13.00 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Work with middle school students in a school setting: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required language:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Spanish preferred but not required
          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

         </p>

          </li>

        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          In the 1920's, America fell in love with the automobile. More and more vehicles began traveling the roads, creating a need for an auto parts distribution system that could keep pace with the demand to keep our automobiles running. In 1925, NAPA was founded to meet those needs. Since then, we've sped our way to become a powerhouse in the auto parts industry. Fueled by the popularity of the automobile, our name can now be seen on over 5,800 stores, 58 distribution centers, and 13,000 NAPA AutoCare facilities across the country, and we're not stopping there.Our 80 years of experience has made us an industry leader, but don't let our age lead you to believe we can't keep up with the changing times. We're not your grandfather's NAPA. As our vehicles become more advanced, we've adapted our business in ways that allow us to stay ahead of the curve. We're constantly updating our inventory of over 500,000 parts, opening new stores, reaching out to customers in new ways, and most importantly, we're hiring new talent to join our ranks.It's an exciting time to join our team and we need people like you to help us accelerate our business into the future. Our growth depends on the dedication and enthusiasm of our employees. At NAPA, we want to continue to expand our presence, but at the heart of our business we just love automobiles. That's probably one of the reasons you're visiting this page. You share our passion to help customers, both retail and wholesale, keep their vehicles running. At NAPA, you'll be part a team that's building on an 80-year legacy of NAPA KNOW HOW, backed by the best employees in the world.We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.NAPA Auto Parts is seeking a skilled, enthusiastic and hard working part time Delivery Driver to join our growing team of auto parts professionals. As a Delivery Driver your primary focus is on getting the right parts to the right people at the right time, and engaging with customers as the face of NAPA throughout the day. Other responsibilities for the Delivery Driver will include:
         </p>
         <ul>

           Building long-term relationships with the customers you deliver to
          </li>
          <li>
           Driving throughout the metropolitan area using maps and directions
          </li>
          <li>
           Utilizing both manual and automatic transmission vehicles
          </li>
          <li>
           Handling cash charge transactions correctly and core/part returns appropriately
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintaining a distribution log or tracking system to record all deliveries/pickups made
          </li>
          <li>
           Lifting merchandise up to 60 lbs for deliveries
          </li>
          <li>
           Inspecting, protecting and maintaining company assets, merchandise, vehicles, building and people
          </li>
          <li>
           Starting pay $12.30 per hour
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          The ideal NAPA Delivery Driver will have a passion for delivering customer care on an everyday basis, and must also have excellent driving aptitude for both manual and automatic vehicles.Other requirements for the Delivery Driver include:
         </p>

          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Stamina to stand and walk for entire work shift
          </li>
          <li>
           Strength to lift 60 lbs of merchandise
          </li>
          <li>
           Clear speaking and attentive listening skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Motivated to train and learn
          </li>
          <li>
           Flexibility in schedule including evenings, weekends and holidays
          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum 18 years of age
          </li>
          <li>
           Pre-Employment drug screen and background check
          </li>
         </ul>

          Salary: $12.30 /hour
         </p>

  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Job Coach (part-time)
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Napa Valley PSI
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Napa, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $12.50 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Napa Valley PSI Job Announcement
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Opening Date: July 28, 2015
         </p>
         <p>
          Position Title:
          <b>
           Job Coach (part-time)
          </b>
          <br/>
          Reports to: Lea Ronald, Director of Services
          <br/>
          Normal Work hours: 20 hours per week
          <br/>
          Days: M-F (some evening and weekend work may be required)
          <br/>
          Status: Non-Exempt
          <br/>
          Wages: $12.50/ hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Under direct supervision of the Director of Services, the position of the Job Coach helps to promote and support the mission of Napa Valley PSI by providing supervision and vocational training in a variety of environments including onsite work experience, community assessments, job exploration and community employment. This position is responsible for the delivery of assessments, job training and other support services to service participants who are seeking employment or are competitively employed in local businesses.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           DUTIES:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Provides supervision and training in vocational community related skills to individuals onsite and in community settings.
          <br/>
          Completes documentation including Special Incident Reports (SIRs), daily notes, vocational timesheets and safety meeting notes as required.
         </p>
         <p>
          Contributes to a team approach to solving issues related to persons served.
          <br/>
          Follows safety procedures and teaches safe work practices to persons served.
          <br/>
          Attends mandatory trainings, staff meetings and staff trainings that may occur after your typical scheduled work hours.
         </p>
         <p>
          Maintains communication with home-providers, co-workers, employers, referral agencies and community at large as required. Disseminate appropriate information to site management.
         </p>
         <p>
          Displays professional and respectful attitude towards employees, co-workers supervisors and assignments.
         </p>
         <p>
          Ability to work a flexible schedule which may include evenings, weekends or holidays.
         </p>
         <p>
          Ability to lift/transfer/push/pull/bend/turn/pivot up to 38 lbs. occasionally while assisting employees in wheelchairs as a support in daily program/work activities.
         </p>
         <p>
          Ability to sustain a forward bend occasionally while assisting employees in assembly tasks, table top activities and in a variety of work and community settings.
         </p>
         <p>
          Provides for continuous quality service improvement and promotes teamwork among co-workers and persons served.
          <br/>
          Reports all suspected abuse in accordance with Mandated Reporter regulations and procedures.
          <br/>
          Is knowledgeable and adheres to agency policies and procedures.
          <br/>
          Other related duties as assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Education:
          </b>
          <br/>
          None.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Experience:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Must be 21 years of age or older. 2+ years direct services to individuals with disabilities. 1 year minimum experience working with people with disabilities in an employment setting preferred. Experience in job/task analysis, work assessment, teaching techniques or equivalent experience is desirable.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Special Skills:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Ability to use computer using Microsoft Office programs to complete reports. Ability to take direction from supervisor and respond to requests for assistance from other co-workers in a timely manner. Demonstrate sensitivity to the multi-cultural diversity of the service population. Ability to work and communicate cooperatively and collaboratively with co-workers, supervisors and representatives from the community and community agencies. Excellent organizational skills, ability to function independently and prioritize workload. Willingness to enroll in ongoing, free training to expand develop skills.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Special Training:
          </b>
          <br/>
          First aid &amp; CPR, Pro-Act, defensive driving, Abuse Reporting, universal precautions, safety awareness.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Prerequisite(s):
          </b>
          <br/>
          Must possess a valid CA drivers license, acceptable DMV printout and proof of car insurance for a car that can be used during work time. Pass pre-employment test with a score of 70% or better. Employer paid pre-placement physical which includes a skin T.B. test or chest x-ray (TB test shall be done not more than one year prior to or seven days after employment). Ability to pass a breath alcohol test (BAT), drug screen and pre-work screen (back evaluation). DOJ/FBI fingerprint clearance.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Please send resume via Indeed which will be emailed to Napa Valley PSI.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Closing Date: August 10, 2015
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
          </b>
          <br/>
          NAPA VALLEY PSI IS AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. THE COMPANYS POLICY IS NOT TO DISCRIMINATE AGAINST ANY APPLICANT OR EMPLOYEE BASED ON RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, GENDER, AGE, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY OR EXPRESSION, MARITAL STATUS, MENTAL OR PHYSICAL DISABILITY, AND GENETIC INFORMATION OR ANY OTHER BASIS PROTECTED BY APPLICABLE LAW. THE COMPANY ALSO PROHIBITS HARASSMENT OF APPLICANTS OR EMPLOYEES BASED ON ANY OF THESE PROTECTED CATEGORIES.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Napa Valley PSI reserves the right to close this position prior to or to extend the closing date beyond the specified closing date as business requirements necessitate. Please contact Karen Nunes, Human Resources Director for more information.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           This job description does not promise you or imply that the functions listed are the only duties to be performed or that the position may not change or be eliminated. Employees are always expected to follow their supervisors instructions and to perform the tasks.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $12.50 /hour
         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>

         <p>
          <b>
           Join Our Team!
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Serra Center, a non-profit corporation, has been committed to providing dignity, respect and choice to persons with intellectual disabilities since 1975. We are currently seeking Direct Support Professionals for our licensed residential care homes in Fremont.
         </p>
         <p>
          Direct Support Professionals are needed to provide support and training in activities of daily living to adults with intellectual disabilities. Job duties are performed in our team-oriented 6 bed residential care homes in Fremont, at a 1:3 staff-to-client ratio. Duties include support with cooking, cleaning, bathing, personal hygiene, community integration, socialization, dispensing medication, assistance with transferring to/from wheelchair. Monthly mandatory in-service trainings meet on-going educational requirements for CNA's and LVN's.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications/Requirements:
          </b>
          Flexible and patient personality, high school diploma, higher education in related field or personal experience regarding persons with intellectual disabilities. Department of Justice fingerprint clearance, valid CDL and clean driving record a must.

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          </b>
          <br/>
          6:00am-12:00pm
          <br/>
          8:00am-8:00pm
          <br/>
          12:00pm-6:00pm
         </p>

          </b>

         </p>

         </p>

          We are looking for a self-starting, flexible, and energetic person to join our team in this critical role. Our Sales Assistant provides overall administrative and operational client service support to assist the business activities of several Financial Advisors. You will perform various administrative functions for the Financial Advisors including, creating letters, forms and reports from rough draft, as well as preparing and originating correspondence. Our Sales Assistant is the backbone of the office. You will be a significant contributor to commission and fee generation, through your activities that support and enhance our client relationships and customer service..
         </p>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

           Receives unsolicited orders from clients.
          </li>

           Enters unsolicited trades at the direction of the Financial Advisor.
          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

           Creates and maintains records and files.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures required client paperwork is current with firm and industry requirements, rules and regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains client information and creates reports using portfolio software programs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists Financial Advisors with marketing efforts including seminars, mail outs, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Receives and processes securities.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

           Develops and maintains effective and efficient workflow including managing team tasks/responsibilities and assignments.
          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0rdtkbb9jp9n2" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

    </td>

  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Chemical Dependency Professional (CDP)
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Navos Mental Health Solutions
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Navos Inpatient Services is seeking a full-time licensed Chemical Dependency Professional (CDP).
          <br/>
          Job Summary: The Chemical Dependency Professional will work with involuntarily detained patients hospitalized due to crisis arising from a mental disorder. The Chemical Dependency Professional is responsible for completing Chemical Dependency Evaluations for appropriate patients and participating in the Treatment Team to provide expertise and consultation regarding chemical dependency issues. The Chemical Dependency Professional is responsible for identifying chemical dependency treatment resources in the community, both inpatient and outpatient, and initiating ad completing referrals to access such resources for patients utilization after discharge from the hospital. The Chemical Dependency Professional will provide both individual and group counseling and education for appropriate patients in the inpatient treatment setting.
         </p>
         <p>
          Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Ability to work with individuals with chemical dependency issues and the acutely mentally ill in a professional and ethical manner. The Chemical Dependency Professional must be able to communicate clearly in both a verbal and written manner and be able to work effectively in a collaborative manner. The Chemical Dependency Professional must well organize and have the ability and tenacity to follow through with needed processes from initiation to completion.
         </p>
         <p>
          Possess the knowledge, values, attitude and skills to create a trauma-informed, safe, trusting healing environment that respects the perspectives and experiences of the individuals, families, staff and communities we serve with safety and healing.
         </p>
         <p>
          Education, Experience, and Certification: Masters Degree in behavioral sciences preferred, BA minimal. Current WA CDP License.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           CDP: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_223b66f627b2f9c2">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

           Complete a daily back order report to assure customers are up to date with delivery information.
          </li>
          <li>
           Answers customer service calls, questions and complaints in a prompt manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Initiates internal communications and information flows related to the service of customers and completion of their transactions.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
         </p>

          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Good organizational skills and communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Previous experience working with computer systems, including Microsoft office products.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          </li>

      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Government Contract Representative
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Mallory Safety &amp; Supply
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          At Mallory Safety &amp; Supply we get energized by applying thought and creativity to create best in class solutions. This energy has lead to multi-faceted growth, with the result that we have more than quadrupled in size in the last 7 years. We are the largest independent safety distributor on the West Coast with 8 locations, 200 employees, $10 million in inventory and a $1.5 million rental fleet.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are hiring a Government Contract Representative in Longview, Washington to join our growing team!
         </p>
         <p>
          The Government Contract Representative possesses excellent multitasking skills, has an eye for detail and is a skilled negotiator.
         </p>
         <p>
          Position Overview:
         </p>
         <p>
          The Government Contract Customer Service Representative is internet savvy, able to quickly find vendors and their products online while negotiating with vendors deciding whether to bid.
         </p>
         <p>
          Minimum qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School Diploma * 3-5 years previous customer service experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience working with contracts including government contracts
          </li>
          <li>
           Previous Military experience preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient with Microsoft Office, strong Excel skills required.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently or in a team environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Detail oriented
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong multitasking skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of federal government contracts
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong work ethic with a true sense of urgency
          </li>
          <li>
           Creative problem solving skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong written, oral communication and interpersonal skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Knack for building positive relationships
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Enter orders and complete purchasing into Prophet 21 our distribution software, previous experience with Prophet 21 is preferred but not required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage several quotes, orders and deadlines simultaneously while consistently providing accurate quotes consistently.
          </li>
          <li>
           Capitalize on opportunities that that come through contracts, by providing timely, accurate and competitive quotes.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Benefits:
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a full-time position offering excellent pay, medical, dental and 401(k). Hiring great people is the most important thing we do, so if you are motivated, we have an environment that will allow you to shine. We are very selective, so please only apply if this is a great fit for you.
         </p>
         <p>
          Mallory Safety &amp; Supply is an Equal Opportunity Employer
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Government Contract: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>

      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Academic Tutoring Staff $12-15 per hour
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Newton Center Inc
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Menlo Park, CA
      </span>

      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           What is Newton Center Inc?
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Newton Center Inc. is a nonprofit, after-school academic support program serving elementary age students in schools around the Bay Area. Newton Center is located on school grounds every day school is in session from dismissal until 6pm.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Is Newton the right place for you?
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Position: Academic Support Staff and Director in our Menlo Park and San Mateo locations. Working with children grades K-5.
         </p>
         <p>
          Newton Center Inc. is looking for hardworking, compassionate and creative educators. Newton instructors spend about four hours a day, five days a week, working with elementary school students in both an academic and recreational setting. Consistent school year attendance of both Newton teachers and students creates an environment in which students, teachers and parents can build a trusting, insightful and intimate relationship.
         </p>
         <p>
          Newton is a great place for both educators and other professionals to cultivate their didactical and interpersonal skills in a classroom setting. Furthermore, our collaborative work environment provides an exceptional opportunity for all team members to plan activities, mentor students, and share their opinions on everything from behavior modification to site organization. Working with kids in Newton's progressive and flexible atmosphere is amazingly fun and rewarding!
         </p>
         <p>
          Please feel free to email with questions!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Early Childhood Education units preferred
          <br/>
          Must be available to work all hours listed below
          <br/>
          HS graduate required.
          <br/>
          Must have reliable transportation
          <br/>
          Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.
          <br/>
          Must be able to tutor Kindergarten through 8th grade school subjects.
          <br/>
          Ability to effectively lead children through tasks, maintain class guidelines, encourage positive student morale, and be a positive role model to the children.
          <br/>
          Comfortable with and able to enforce program rules and policies and adhere to student disciplinary policies.
          <br/>
          Energetic, enthusiastic, creative, and take initiative a must.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Compensation &amp; Hours:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          $12-$15/per hour--Depends on experience and education.
         </p>
         <p>
          M, T, W, F: 1:30 - 6:00 p.m (Menlo Park)
          <br/>
          Th: 12:30 - 6:00 p.m. (Menlo Park)
         </p>
         <p>
          M, T, Th, F 2:30 - 6:00 p.m. (San Mateo)
          <br/>
          W 12 - 6:00 p.m. (San Mateo)
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           How to Apply:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          By using the link below.
         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        District Operations Coordinator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       H&amp;R Block
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Please note that this position will require up to a four week furlough. During this time of furlough, you will remain in full-time status and eligible for 100% of your benefits. This position requires local travel between offices within the metro area with business mileage expense reimbursement. Flexible home office H&amp;R Block retail location in the San Francisco, Valejo, Santa Rosa or San Mateo area.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB SUMMARY
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          This position is responsible for all operational and administrative activities for company owned tax offices. This position may support multiple District Managers in a matrix management structure. This role may also manage Messenger and/or Custodian labor. This individual must have a strong ability to deliver executable results that will enable the company to achieve strategic business objectives. Specific areas of support include, but are not limited to, adjusting labor staffing and scheduling, coordination of office set up and shut down, leadership of labor command center to coordinate staffing shortfalls/overflow and ensuring all supplies are available to district offices.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB DUTIES
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Makes adjustments to labor staffing and scheduling of district and provide reporting to District General Managers and Company Support Managers
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintaining the asset management inventory.
          </li>
          <li>
           Make adjustments to office hours to ensure they are consistent with company guidelines.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate the set up and shut down of all offices for the assigned districts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate with landlord, facilities to ensure office standards are consistently being met.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage the centralization of supply ordering and distribution
          </li>
          <li>
           Management of messenger and custodian to support office upgrades, delivery of supplies or other activities to help the operational support of tax office
          </li>
          <li>
           Assign non-returning/moving tax pros clients to other Tax Pros based on expertise (i.e. client matching)
          </li>
          <li>
           Local coordination of a national contract for cleaning of offices, coffee, water or other office amenities. This includes agreement with Iron Mountain for the storage and retrieval of tax documents
          </li>
          <li>
           Attends district meetings to observe and participate in the meeting. Will coordinate Town halls along with planning end of year recognition events and other district wide activities (e.g. OL Conventions)
          </li>
          <li>
           Will provide administrative support to District leadership and District staff as necessary
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB REQUIREMENTS
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           3-5 years of operational experience in retail, service or similar work environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           This individual must have strong ability to deliver executable results that will enable the company to achieve its strategic business objectives
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have a strong leadership background and knowledge of how to handle problems quickly and efficiently
          </li>
          <li>
           This position requires excellent communication and logistical planning skills with a proven ability to coordinate activities within a matrix management structure
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong organizational skills and ability to effectively work under strict deadlines, while organizing multiple priorities
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated ability to research and summarize operational data for use in managerial decisions
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently with little or no direct supervision at various times
          </li>
          <li>
           Good verbal and written communications skills and interpersonal skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Understanding and previous use of a Windows-based computer system and applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook; and PowerPoint.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           operational experience in retail: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_36b86f35446c8a8c">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">

         <p>
          Guest Service/Night Auditor Agents are responsible for encountering, engaging &amp; greeting a guest, providing outstanding guest service during registration and throughout their stay, and settling the guest's account upon completion of their stay. However, the realm of responsibilities will extend beyond that of a typical front desk agent. This allows the Guest Service Agent to expand their skill sets and work in a fast paced environment with new challenges daily. Primary responsibilities include: registering guests, making and modifying reservations, hotel operation, and concierge duties. Guest Service Agents must possess a positive and upbeat personality with a desire to deliver outstanding customer service to our guests. Guest Service Agents must have the ability to multi-task, be detail-oriented, and be able to solve problem in order to effectively deal with internal and external customers.

         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          * Must be able to work night, weekends and holidays
          <br/>
          * Must be flexible
          <br/>

         </p>

          Greet, engage, encounter and register incoming guests, ensuring guests are properly introduced to the hotel and its amenities. Process guest folios and collect payment. Administer and manage cash handling responsibilities Display appropriate phone etiquette to all incoming callers. Maintain efficient and effective flow of information with guests, team members, managers, sales, and maintenance and housekeeping departments. Follow and promote the Guest Rewards program enrollment standards. Handle guest requests and concerns promptly with courtesy. Relay appropriate tourism information to guests about local areas of interest. Prepare for guest arrivals Receive and distribute guest faxes, mail and any deliveries. Control inventory and distribution of hotel's keys. Ensure all shift duties are completed. Handle emergency situations when necessary, i.e. first aid, fire emergencies. Handle additional duties as needed by the guests.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>

         </p>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Store Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Confidential Transportation Company
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Leandro, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Store Manager
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for a motivated and driven Store Manager for one of our convenience store locations.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Summary:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Manages a convenience food store; engaged in selling general lines of merchandise, and prepared foods, by performing the following duties shown below. Is responsible for directing the day-to-day operating activities of the assigned store in accordance with Company image, profitability, guest service, safety, and personnel standards. This position reports to the Area Manager responsible for the location.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Duties and Responsibilities
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Give all guests prompt and courteous service.
          </li>
          <li>
           Promote and support Company image standards.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepares work schedules and assists in directing team members to specific duties.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates sales promotion activities and prepares, or directs workers preparing merchandise displays and signage.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitors compliance of team members with established security, sales, safety and record keeping procedures and practices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Answers guests complaints or inquiries.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains inventory and cash controls to include enforcement of all company policies and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Supervises team members in daily operation of site including performance reviews, discipline, scheduling, training, &amp; recommended promotions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures compliance of team members with established security, sales, safety, and record keeping procedures and practices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proactively recruits, review resumes, and interviews, potential new Team Members.
          </li>
          <li>
           Conducts safety program and enforces observance of safety regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Is knowledgeable of and has the ability to respond to emergency situations as described in Companys IIPP
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for communication of Company Policies to team Members.
          </li>
          <li>
           Verifies bank deposits and ensures they are delivered to the bank daily.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicates with area manager regarding guest requests and vendor-related concerns.
          </li>
          <li>
           Consistently reports to work on time and in accordance with assigned work schedule.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain great relationships and communications with team members, vendors, area managers, and the corporate office when applicable.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned by Supervisor.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           General Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Promote and support Company image standards.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complies with Company meal and rest break policies.
          </li>
          <li>
           Adheres to all city, county, and state regulations including verifying age with a valid I.D. for age restricted sales.
          </li>
          <li>
           Presents a neat, clean appearance in uniform.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work in a safe manner at all times and report all accidents immediately.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Supervisory Responsibilities
          </b>
          :
          <br/>
          Directly supervises team members. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with company policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, training team members; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining team members; scheduling: addressing complaints and resolving problems. Conducts quarterly store meetings for the purpose of resolving problems and corporate issues, safety procedures, updates, and information.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Qualification Requirements:
          </b>
          <br/>
          To perform this job successfully, an individual must be capable of performing each of the above stated essential duties satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must possess a valid and appropriate Drivers License and automobile insurance in accordance with Company Standards.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Education/Experience:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Associates Degree (A.A.) or equivalent from a two-year college or technical school -OR- six months to one year related experience and/or training in the management of retail operations; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Other education and/or experience may be considered as a substitute.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Communication Skills:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to guests and team members.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Mathematical Skills
          </b>
          :
          <br/>
          Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Reasoning Ability
          </b>
          :
          <br/>
          Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Ability to apply common-sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Physical Demands:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to stand and talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to walk. The team member is occasionally required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The team member must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Work Environment:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those a team member encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the team member occasionally works in high, precarious places, extreme cold, and risk of electrical shock. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud. Work schedules may vary at any time, as required by business operations, and be adjusted for definite or indefinite periods of time so as to increase, decrease or otherwise change any non-exempt team members daily, weekly and/or shift hours of work and/or the days a team member will report for work.
         </p>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0dcfikbqik8e3" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Diesel Truck Driver -Local Delivery - Marin County
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Grange Debris Box
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Rafael, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Truck Driver HELP Wanted
          <br/>
          Diesel Truck / Local Marin County Delivery
          <br/>
          IMMEDIATE OPENING! Imagine driving a 2 or 3 axel trucks around beautiful Marin County all day and being paid for it by joining a well established 55 year old Marin County company as a roll off truck driver. A Class A or B license is required.
         </p>
         <p>
          The job consists of delivering, exchanging, and picking up roll-off boxes with a heavy duty 2 axel class 7, or a 3 axel class 8 diesel truck with air brakes, tarping and tying down the loads, and hauling the contents to various local recycling facilities.
         </p>
         <p>
          A preferred candidate will be a stable well established Marin County Resident. Diesel truck driving and mechanical ability and tools are a plus, but not a requirement. Routes often require Drivers to navigate through communities and tight areas in city and suburban locations. Backing skills are essential. Our drivers routinely climb in and out of the truck cab to climb on to the containers to smooth loads or secure tarps for transport. Drivers must have safe driving records and be able to communicate professionally with customers and dispatch at all times, and comply with all local, state, and federal transportation regulations and Company policies.
         </p>
         <p>
          Work hours may be up to full time and may require occasional weekend work. Drivers must be able to complete daily driver logs as well as pre and post trip truck inspections. Extra work maintaining other trucks, containers, and other equipment could also be available.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Requirements:
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Must be at least 21 years of age or older. We prefer a Marin County Resident.
          <br/>
          2. Clean driving record and no major violations or multiple speeding violations, negligent or reckless driving, DUI, or driving on a suspended or revoked license
          <br/>
          3. Legally eligible to work in the United States.
          <br/>
          4. Provide resume listing ALL past employment and education.
          <br/>
          5. High school diploma or GED degree. Advanced education is a plus.
          <br/>
          6. Present a CDL with a 2nd form of ID (birth certificate, social security card, passport etc).
          <br/>
          7. Successfully pass pre-employment (post offer) drug screen, background and motor vehicle records check and Department of Transportation Physical.
          <br/>
          8. Must be able to speak and read English well enough to converse with the general public, understand highway traffic and signals, respond to official questions, and be able to make legible entries on reports and records.
          <br/>
          9. Must have or get a valid California Class A or B drivers license with airbrakes endorsement.
          <br/>
          10. At least 1 year of previous truck driving experience operating a similar vehicle requiring a Class B or Class A CDL
          <br/>
          11. Ability to perform all of the physical requirements of the position with or without reasonable accommodations.
          <br/>
          12. Cleans and maintains truck in top condition.
          <br/>
          13. Operate the truck and equipment in a safe and professional manner.
          <br/>
          14. Maintain Vehicle Log and Driver Pay sheets.
          <br/>
          16. Pass alcohol and drug testing.
          <br/>
          17. Mechanical ability and tools are a real plus, but not required.
          <br/>
          18. Computers, Welding and painting ability another plus.
         </p>
         <p>
          Representative Responsibilities - Driver - Roll Off:
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Performs complete pre-trip inspection including, but not limited to, tire pressure, fluid levels, safety equipment, gauges and controls.
          <br/>
          2. Drives heavy diesel truck to and from customer locations and recycling facility(s).
          <br/>
          3. Climbs into and out of truck at customer locations and recycling facility(s).
          <br/>
          4. Operates loading and discharge cylinder mechanisms.
          <br/>
          5. Operates hydraulic controls to deposit collected material at the recycling facility.
          <br/>
          6. Tarps containers and secures container to rails while wearing required protective equipment.
          <br/>
          7. Courteously interactions with customers, dispatchers and supervisors.
          <br/>
          8. Cleans up the area around accidental waste spills.
          <br/>
          9. Reads route sheets. Services each customer as assigned by the dispatcher and/or supervisor.
          <br/>
          10. Completes route/productivity sheets, Vehicle Condition Reports (VCRs) and other forms.
          <br/>
          11. Performs driver check-in procedures upon returning to the facility at the end of the day.
          <br/>
          12. Operates in a manner that is aimed at creating capacity and ensuring productivity by meeting company specified productivity goals while ensuring safe operations at all times.
          <br/>
          13. Follows all safety policies and procedures.
          <br/>
          14. Provide and operate GPS, iPhone or other similar smart phone.
          <br/>
          15. Performs other job-related duties as assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          Physical Demands:
         </p>
         <p>
          The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 35 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 70 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move more than 100 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. *All candidates are subject to Human Performance Exam, Physical, background checks and drug testing. EOE/AAP/MF. Interested candidates should first submit resumes and salary requirements. Please submit your resume and salary requirements via email to fred at GrangeBox dot Com. Then call Fred at 415-456-2712 to discuss this opportunity.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: Existing drivers earn $40K to $80,000 Per year
         </p>
         <p>
          Directions: 200 Tamal Vista is the address of our office complex. The internal street is Tamal Plaza. Our physical address is 200 Tamal Plaza, Suite 115, Corte Madera, Ca., 94925. We are located along Tamal Vista between Warnum and Fifer on the west side of Hwy 101. We are next door to the Marin Municipal Water District Corporation Yard, directly across Tamal Vista from the former Handi Cup property where 180 residential units are currently under construction, and north of the DMV Motor Vehicles Dept. Of the five buildings in our complex, Building 100, 200, &amp; 300 are in front; Building 400 &amp; 500 are in the back. Drive between the front and back buildings, around the south side of building 200 and you will see a blue colored storefront with the letters 115 above our door, between Bldg 200 and 300.
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           San Rafael, CA
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Commercial Truck Driver: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required license or certification:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Class B
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_7581fedcb52c660e">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">

        </div>

        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Sales Representative - Technology
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           About the Company:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Kelley is the premier provider of office technology products, mailing equipment and software solutions, and IT solutions in the Pacific Northwest. We provide our customers with the personal and exemplary service of a local company and the resources and technological innovation of a large national organization.
         </p>
         <p>
          Start today building a career with a growing company! At Kelley we have the culture, the mindset, the passion and the full product suite in place to help you build a career in sales. Technology sales are where the growth is!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Sales Representatives are in charge of driving the revenue growth of Kelley through acquisitions of all new business. This is a 90% new business acquisition, 10% account management role. You will be expected to
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Quickly learn Kelleys suite of office technology, mailing, software and IT products
          </li>
          <li>
           Prospect for new opportunities independently and manage a pipeline
          </li>
          <li>
           Research leads, pre-qualify prospects, and identify decision makers within a corporate structure
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop relationships by way of phone, email, social media and professional networking
          </li>
          <li>
           Be an product expert: educate prospects on the benefits of Kelley product and make solid recommendations
          </li>
          <li>
           Create urgency and close deals quickly in a sales driven environment
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Some sales experience
           <b>
            required,
           </b>
           technology sales experience in a B2B environment preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have a hunter mentality as this is a new business sales role
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience selling hardware preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelors degree preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong written and verbal persuasion and interpersonal skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of Microsoft Office Products and web products
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits and compensation:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Competitive salary, commission, and bonus structure
          </li>
          <li>
           Car and phone allowance
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Kelley is committed to investing in our people and our passion to help companies succeed is what sets Kelley apart. Our investment in our team members starts with Kelley paying 90% of the employees medical insurance premiums and continues with additional benefits including:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Dental, vision, life, disability and supplemental insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid holidays
          </li>
          <li>
           Flex spending
          </li>
          <li>
           401K with company match up to 4% after 6 months of employment
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </b>

           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Does "culture" really make a difference at Keller Williams? You better believe it does! Organizing the goals of a business around solid, positive, core values and then proceeding to cultivate them on a daily basis inspires and motivates the members of the organization. However you define fulfillment, it is created by our daily surroundings - the culture we experience as we participate in the workplace environment of our choice.
         </p>
         <p>
          Much has been said about the KW culture. The truth is, those of us that have the same values and focus on culture in business are perfect business partners. We are so thankful to have found a business that thinks like we do - where our beliefs are fostered in a positive and powerful way!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>
            Our Team:
           </i>
          </b>
          <br/>
          Over here at The Red Door Team we don't just fill jobs, we build careers. What we do is create a win win for everyone concerned. We have a culture here where we work hard and play harder.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are enthusiastic, high energy, and self motivated. We are a team of loyalty, team work, and growth. It is important to us that each person who joins our team feeds that culture.
          <br/>

         </p>
         <p>
          This position will receive quality seller &amp; buyer leads. Main responsibilities include prospecting, completing CMA's, taking listings, working with buyers and negotiating contracts. Our team operates on a system based fashion with corresponding accountability for lead follow up.

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

       <font size="+1">
        Support Technician
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       First Choice Health
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Who We Are:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          First Choice Health is a Seattle-based, physician and hospital-owned company serving Washington and the Northwest since 1985. We now serve well over one million people with our array of products and services. Our Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) is recognized as the leading independent PPO in Washington State and has a growing regional presence in Oregon, Idaho, Montana and Alaska.
         </p>
         <p>
          We occupy a great downtown location, pay competitive salaries and offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, health savings accounts, flexible spending accounts, life and disability insurance, EAP, 401(k), profit sharing, tuition reimbursement, transportation assistance, credit union and gym
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Who We're Looking For:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Our team is looking for a customer service focused individual who enjoys helping people solve problems and use their technology more effectively. You should have a superior understanding of the Windows 7 operating system and be well versed in a variety of common productivity and business applications. As a service desk technician you'll be responsible for prioritizing technology issues reported from fellow employees and work to resolve issues and fulfill requests. Youll need to clearly communicate the status of our systems and create concise documents that help people make better use of their technology. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are fundamental to this position.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Who You'll Be Working With:
          </b>
          <br/>
          You'll rely on an infrastructure team available for problem escalation and troubleshooting assistance. Our team of skilled support technicians, system administrators, and system engineers are focused on ensuring our users have access to the tools and resources necessary to support our growing business. Since we're a small team, youll be exposed to many different components of the technology infrastructure. The scope of your job may be broader when compared to similar positions at other organizations  this provides you the opportunity to develop and grow your skills with a wide range of technologies.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           What You'll Be Doing:
          </b>
          <br/>
          We've made some big investments to keep our infrastructure robust, reliable, and current. We have a highly virtualized infrastructure and almost half of our users work in a virtual desktop environment. We interact regularly with our in-house development team to support several mission-critical applications. As a service desk technician, youll work directly with our employees in person and over the phone to ensure that not only their problems are resolved but that new technologies are leveraged to make their jobs easier.
         </p>
         <p>
          Here are some of the technologies youll be working with:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           VMWARE View Horizon VDI
          </li>
          <li>
           Veeam Backup and Recovery
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft Exchange 2013
          </li>
          <li>
           Skype for Business
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft Active Directory
          </li>
          <li>
           System Center Configuration Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Windows 7
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft Office 2010/13
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Some of the Skills We're Looking For:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong in person and over-the-phone customer support skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Solid written and verbal communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical people
          </li>
          <li>
           Aptitude to efficiently organize and prioritize tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Advanced working knowledge of Windows 7 and common software applications
          </li>
          <li>
           Fundamental understanding of Active Directory and common administrative tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Innate desire to solve problems
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Why Work Here
          </b>
          <b>
           :
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           You'll be part of a small, effective team that values collaboration and welcomes new ideas
          </li>
          <li>
           We offer some great benefits that go beyond the standard stuff: among a host of other benefits, youll have access to an Orca card, discounts at many local companies, a wellness program, and technical training resources.
          </li>
          <li>
           Great downtown Seattle location and flexible work schedules
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Knowledge of Windows 7 and common software applications: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0d6qtjbqqk9fk" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Accounting Associate AP
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Tharco a PCA company, San Lorenzo, CA
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Lorenzo, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $35,000 a year
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Responsible for financial and cost analysis, administering information systems by providing local controller support and general ledger reporting activities. Works closely with Sales and Production in gathering and analyzing data and oversees accounts payable process. Provides input to resolving accounting problems and monitoring compliance with policies and procedures. The successful candidate would participate considerably in month end closing activities and serve as backup to the plant Controller and other accounting and administrative functions.
         </p>
         <p>
          Responsibilities Include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Performs general accounting activities, including the preparation, maintenance and reconciliation of ledger accounts and financial statements, such as balance sheets, profit-and-loss statements and capital expenditure schedules
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepares, records, analyzes and reports accounting transactions and ensure the integrity of accounting records for completeness, accuracy and compliance with accepted accounting policies and principles
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides financial support to the business including forecasting, budgeting, and analyzing variations from budget
          </li>
          <li>
           Conducts financial, business analyses and modeling using forecasts, financial statements, and other business inputs to assess risk, improvement opportunities and potential costs and/or benefits
          </li>
          <li>
           Performs accounts receivable, accounts payable, credit and collection duties
          </li>
          <li>
           Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Basic Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Associates or Bachelor's degree in accounting with 3-5 years general accounting and SYSTEMS/DATA PROCESSING experience. Requires a demonstrated commitment to total quality principals and tools, excellent communication, planning/organizing, teamwork/collaboration, analysis/problem assessment and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated initiative and tolerance for stress.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Preferred Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           PeopleSoft GL/AP experience preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in a Manufacturing environment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           PCA is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $35,000.00 /year
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Accounting experience of: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Associate
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

The sales team, partnered with its back up sales support, is peerless and top of class in the industry.

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Pre-qualify and assist new leads who contact us via phone or email
          </li>
          <li>
           Create informal and formal sales quotes as required by Sales Specialists and Sales/Showroom Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow up with clients on status of outstanding Sales Quotes as directed my manager/sales staff
          </li>
          <li>
           Assemble and file, in a timely manner, all back up sales paperwork, ensuring that all information is complete
          </li>
          <li>
           Organize and perform mass market mailings and e-blasts in cooperation with Marketing
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate, with Marketing and Showroom Staff, all special events, including invitations, rsvps, solicitation of caterers, etc
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain Servoy and VAM contacts databases and mailing lists
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain all finish sample and literature inventory levels in the showroom
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain and update pricelists updates are posted to the shared drives
          </li>
          <li>
           Handle and track all floor samples and finish samples borrowed from the showroom
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

The Kennel Attendant may also be called upon to administer medication or supplements as directed by Hospital Staff. Additional responsibilities include laundry and cleaning the hospital common areas, treatment suite, exam rooms and grooming suite as well as hospital grounds. Must be willing to work a schedule that includes, mornings, afternoons, weekends and holidays. Prior kennel experience a plus. $9.00 - $9.50 per hour depending upon experience.

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u112pbob9nnffe" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Maintenance Mechanic
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Caraustar
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Position Summary: To maintain equipment and grounds facility to provide an efficient and safe work environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          Role qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School diploma. Mechanical/Electrical Training Certification or equivalent work experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of 5 years working as a Maintenance Mechanic in a manufacturing environment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Position Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Perform all necessary repairs for the facility including mechanical, electrical, support equipment repairs, building and grounds maintenance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Examine machines and mechanical equipment to diagnose source of trouble.
          </li>
          <li>
           Dismantle or partly dismantle machines and perform repairs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Replace broken or defective parts with items obtained from stock.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with the inventory of replacement parts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Preform preventative maintenance on machining.
          </li>
          <li>
           Report any faulty or inefficient equipment and schedule for repair.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide support to production personnel by answering breakdown assistance calls.
          </li>
          <li>
           Troubles shoot machine breakdowns and provide solutions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow proper lockout/tagout procedures when working on equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow department and company policies and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow safety rules and regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reports all food safety and quality problems to the Quality Team.
          </li>
          <li>
           May be required to perform other duties as requested, directed or assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Essential skills and experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in working with low voltage machinery and equipment such as Sheeters (Good Strong), Print Presses (Man Roland), Die Cutters (Bobst) and Gluing equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read schematics and working with PLCs
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of working with several various hand &amp; power tools.
          </li>
          <li>

      </span>
