         <p>
          <b>
           Carma Needs Event Brand Ambassadors!
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Are you an energetic people-person who cares about the environment? Do you want to be part of building an exciting new service with a San Francisco start up?
         </p>
         <p>
          Our Brand Ambassadors are the face and voice of Carma. Our exciting new pilot program  Go Carma  makes commuting to and from work easy by providing cars for people to share. This position requires someone who enjoys interacting with people, can think quickly on their feet, and is extremely reliable and organized. Above all, were looking for someone who is passionate about spreading Carmas mission: to reduce the number of cars on the road.
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a great way to gain valuable marketing experience by working for an exciting start-up in the Bay Area!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Street Team: (75%)
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The position offers two regular shifts: morning shift and afternoon shift (see below).
          </li>
          <li>
           This position requires staff to travel throughout the Bay Area regularly, including driving in our cars to and from San Francisco and San Ramon, CA.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Be articulate and able to communicate details about the Carma service with customers in a friendly and engaging manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform marketing and community engagement tasks including: flyering at local businesses, cleaning and stocking vehicles, and driving Carma branded cars.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide a summary report to the marketing department within 24 hours of the event.
          </li>
          <li>
           Wear branded attire while performing street team duties.
          </li>
          <li>
           Guaranteed 20 hours per week
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Morning shift position: 6 am and 2 pm.
          <br/>
          Afternoon shift position: 1 pm and 7:30 pm.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Event Team: (25%)
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Event responsibilities are staffed as needed. Times and days vary.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Set up tables, banners, displays, and giveaways.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be articulate and able to communicate details about the Carma service with potential customers in a friendly and engaging manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide a summary report to the marketing department within 24 hours of the event.
          </li>
          <li>
           Wear branded attire during events.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           About us:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Founded in 2007, formerly known as Avego, Carma is a world-leader in real-time occupancy technology used by hundreds of application developers, cities, governments, transport operators and tens of thousands of individual consumers. Users in dozens of cities are matched with neighbors and colleagues to reduce congestions using carmacarpool.com, and commuters in San Francisco can commute in style using our ownerless car service at gocarma.com. Carma is headquartered in San Francisco, CA with offices in Cork, Ireland, San Jose, CA, Austin TX, and Bergen, Norway.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Valid U.S. drivers license with three years of driving history.
          </li>
          <li>
           Event tabling, marketing, and/or sales experience strongly preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Natural sales talent a must.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent verbal communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           High-energy, positive, outgoing personality with a sense of humor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be comfortable showing initiative in talking with people and consistently provide stellar customer service.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently and demonstrate strong troubleshooting skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           6-month minimum commitment required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to lift, push, and pull materials between 30 to 50 pounds.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Start date and compensation:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           We are looking to fill this position immediately. The applicant should be able to start upon hire.
          </li>
          <li>
           This is a part-time contractor position.
          </li>
          <li>
           The pay is $20/hour. Branded apparel and training will be provided; no other benefits are available.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           To apply:
          </b>

         </p>
         <p>
          Thanks for your interest in Carma!
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Contract
         </p>

         </p>

          </li>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0u891vbq6k9mg" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Case Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Weston United Community Renewal, Inc
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       New York, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Company Overview:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Weston United Community Renewal, Inc. is a not for profit organization located in Harlem, New York. For over 29 years, Weston United has provided housing and supportive services to participants with histories of chronic homelessness, mental illness, and substance abuse. Weston United employs over 100 employees who contribute to a rich and diverse work environment.
          <br/>
          Weston United is currently seeking a Case Manager that will be responsible for delivering rehabilitative and restorative services to participants currently housed in Supportive Residential Services in Harlem.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements / Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Qualifying candidates must have an Associate's degree
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelor's degree preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           A suitable candidate will also have at least 2 years of Mental Health experience, particularly in the area of case management
          </li>
          <li>
           BSW and CASAC also desirable
          </li>
          <li>
           Good interpersonal and writing skills
          </li>
          <li>
           This position will require extensive walking when visiting consumers in various apartments throughout the city
          </li>
          <li>
           Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Duties and Responsibilities Include the Following:
          </b>
          <br/>
          <i>
           Other duties may be assigned
          </i>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Reports to the Program Coordinator
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide at least 2 face-to-face contacts with consumers in their apartments each week.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that consumers are living in safe, clean and decent environments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Document minimum of 2 progress notes per week.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures consumers have adequate ADL skills by demonstrating, training and coaching.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist consumer with assessing needs and strengths to set goals and objectives.
          </li>
          <li>
           Writes the admission notes in the uniform case record.
          </li>
          <li>
           Documentation of progress notes as they pertain to consumers individualized service plans, and ensures restorative services are clearly illustrated in progress notes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures that consumers are linked to all necessary ancillary services including psychiatric, medical and dental treatment, vocational and educational resources, and legal and financial entitlements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide crisis intervention in acute episodes of emotional and physical distress in order to contain consumers regression and to ensure safety of consumers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Completes follow-ups 30, 60 and 90 days documentation of discharged consumers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Represents the agency at conferences and meetings of referral sources, treatment providers and professional and community groups.
          </li>
          <li>
           Writes the individual service plans, service plan reviews in a timely manner for all consumers of the assigned caseload.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures that consumers have appropriate seasonal clothing.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor and evaluate whether or not consumers needs have been met by the ancillary services and make recommendations to supervisor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist consumers with entitlements, budgeting and managing utilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that furnishings, livings and household items meet agency standards.
          </li>
          <li>
           Escorts consumers to housing, benefits, and psychiatric/medical appointments when required.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>
            Weston United is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer.
           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_5b2012dad5331102">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Accounts Receivable Clerk
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       B-W Memorial Corp.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       SeaTac, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Provide timely and accurate recording of sales/payments to customer accounts and maintain accounts receivable records. May assist Accounting Supervisor with payroll tasks.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Enters all sales contracts into accounts receivable database using appropriate coding.
          </li>
          <li>
           Enters finalized cash receipts and update accounts receivable ledger by customer.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains and processes death benefits claims and keep appropriate records for an adequate audit trail.
          </li>
          <li>
           Processes daily deposits and track merchant receipts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitors customer account details for non-payments, delayed payments, and other irregularities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Generates and mails statements and delinquency notices on all accounts monthly to determine viability.
          </li>
          <li>
           Researches and processes charge backs, returns, bad checks, credit balances and refunds.
          </li>
          <li>
           Investigate and resolve accounts receivable phone inquiries and follow up with appropriate parties; may include follow-up telephone inquiries to collect unpaid balances.
          </li>
          <li>
           Works with off site location staff to collect accounting detail reporting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Distributes monthly reports to locations and/or supervisors; Balance General Ledger and Cash accounts and research unresolved items; Maintain miscellaneous cash sales records.
          </li>
          <li>
           Keeps Accounting Supervisor informed of non-routine situations and complaints.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follows established procedures for processing cash receipts and deposits on daily basis.
          </li>
          <li>
           Processes credit and refund adjustments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Comply with company and GAAP established policies and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Cross trains with Accounts Payable duties. Act as back-up for AP desk and assist with related special projects, as requested or required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides daily assistance with general business incoming calls and inquires.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists the CFO and Accounting Supervisor with day to day processes.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Self-motivated, highly detail oriented and organized.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to maintain accurate filing of invoices and receipts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to create clean, clear, and concise financial reports and statements for customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong problem solving skills and reasoning ability.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a customer service focus.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to act and operate independently with minimal daily direction from manager.
          </li>
          <li>
           Associate's degree (A. A.) or equivalent from two-year College or technical school; or one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook required. Experience with accounting software desired.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Bonney-Watson is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status or marital status. www.bonneywatson.com.
         </p>
         <p>

         </p>

          <li>
           SeaTac, WA
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

         </p>

          <li>

          </li>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">

      </span>

      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Position Summary: To maintain equipment and grounds facility to provide an efficient and safe work environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          Role qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School diploma. Mechanical/Electrical Training Certification or equivalent work experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of 5 years working as a Maintenance Mechanic in a manufacturing environment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Position Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Perform all necessary repairs for the facility including mechanical, electrical, support equipment repairs, building and grounds maintenance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Examine machines and mechanical equipment to diagnose source of trouble.
          </li>
          <li>
           Dismantle or partly dismantle machines and perform repairs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Replace broken or defective parts with items obtained from stock.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with the inventory of replacement parts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Preform preventative maintenance on machining.
          </li>
          <li>
           Report any faulty or inefficient equipment and schedule for repair.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide support to production personnel by answering breakdown assistance calls.
          </li>
          <li>
           Troubles shoot machine breakdowns and provide solutions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow proper lockout/tagout procedures when working on equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow department and company policies and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow safety rules and regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reports all food safety and quality problems to the Quality Team.
          </li>
          <li>
           May be required to perform other duties as requested, directed or assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Essential skills and experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in working with low voltage machinery and equipment such as Sheeters (Good Strong), Print Presses (Man Roland), Die Cutters (Bobst) and Gluing equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read schematics and working with PLCs
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of working with several various hand &amp; power tools.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to operate a forklift truck.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

           Have a valid Driver's license, reliable transportation and is available to travel out of state
          </li>
          <li>
           Be located in the greater Seattle area
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

         </p>
         <p>
          Beecher's is a non-smoking company.
         </p>
         <p>
          Beecher's Handmade Cheese is part of the Sugar Mountain family and is committed to pure, all-natural foods. In keeping with our commitment to pure food, Sugar Mountain companies contribute 1% of all sales to the Pure Food Kids Foundation, founded by Beecher's in 2004.
         </p>

         <p>
          <b>
           REPOWER
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Since 2007, Solar Universe has led the Solar Franchise industry and acquired the pioneer of the Solar Utility industry (Gen110) in September of 2013. With the sales and marketing expertise from Gen110 and the Solar Universe network, we teamed up to create the first solar company that integrates solar energy and home automation.
          <b>
           We have paved the way for zero-down solar programs and now we are paving the way for smart power and smarter homes.
          </b>
          We are passionate about renewable energy and determined to convert every home in America to onsite electricity. We help our homeowners unplug their dependence on expensive utilitys and give them the tools to live in a more comfortable, safer, and smarter home.
         </p>
         <p>
          Forbes Magazine recently described Solar Universe as: Silicon Valley meets clean tech, with the consumer in mind.
         </p>
         <p>

           The Role
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Inside Sales Associate - Livermore, CA
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          REPOWER is seeking a full-time Inside Sales Associate to work out of our Livermore office. The Inside Sales Associate (ISA) role is one of the most important components to our inside sales department. We are looking for energetic and organized individuals to join our rapidly growing team. The ISA will handle both inbound and outbound leads as well as verify customer information and confirm consultation times. A great ISA must enjoy building long lasting rapport with each customer. The ideal ISA candidate must have exceptional phone skills, be detail oriented, and have experience making outbound phone calls.
         </p>

          <b>
           talent
          </b>
          , not experience.

          <br/>

          </b>

Well, you will be surrounded by like-minded people that have a passion for what they do and the energy is quite contagious.  <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u11dv9ob97od0t" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Territory Sales Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       USAgain
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Sell textile recycling collection services to retail, commercial, industrial, and municipal business opportunities. Develop and maintain relationships with new and current client accounts in specified market areas, focusing on customer satisfaction, quality of revenue, bringing in new business as well as selling within customer base in the Chicago area. Our division office is located in West Chicago and incumbent will be in this office once per week.
         </p>
         <p>
          ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Sell textile recycling collection services to new retail, commercial, industrial, and municipal business opportunities within territory
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop and maintain business relationships with territory accounts through periodic personal follow up, proactive customer service, prompt attention and resolution to concerns or issues and timely contract updates
          </li>
          <li>
           Increase revenue potential through additional textile recycling container placements
          </li>
          <li>
           Retain existing territory accounts through personal contact, proactive customer surveys and contract updates. Handle customer cancellation requests with priority and personal follow up
          </li>
          <li>
           Sell and manage all business within territory where opportunities are present
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct effective sales presentations by emphasizing environmental impact and need for textile recycling services
          </li>
          <li>
           Utilize negotiation skills to close the sale and secure the contract
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare contracts and renewals with terms and services
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage customer contracts, correspondence, administration, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete account status reporting requirements accurately and timely
          </li>
          <li>
           Achieve budget net sales, customer acquisition and retention goals
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow up on commitments with customers to ensure 100% satisfaction
          </li>
          <li>
           Execute the sales and overall goals of the division as directed by management
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend major industry trade shows as required
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Job Requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors degree in business, marketing or related area preferred, but not required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of 2 years sales experience selling to targeted markets/territory accounts
          </li>
          <li>
           Industry experience preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Effective communication skills with customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to effectively make sales presentations in large or small groups of customers or employees
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates strong sales skills through building and sustaining business relationships with major clients
          </li>
          <li>
           Exceptional customer service skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Resolves customer issues in a timely manner through gathering appropriate information; analyze; and communicate solution(s)
          </li>
          <li>
           Self-starter, able to take initiative and provide results; proactive approach with customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to adapt to a dynamic work environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to multi-task through balancing individual and team responsibilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Effective oral and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Confident in making presentations to small and large groups
          </li>
          <li>
           Works with integrity, enthusiasm and creativity
          </li>
          <li>
           Driven by commitment to success through aligning work priorities with strategic goals and opportunities
          </li>
          <li>
           Uses effective time management and organizational skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Strives to continuously build sales knowledge and skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Displays professionalism in behaviors and attitudes in and out of the work environment
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          To apply, please visit our website at www.usagain.com/careers or apply directly at the link below and select the West Chicago Territory Sales Manager position:
          <br/>
          https://jobs.ecipay.com/Prod/NET/EmpApp/JobList.aspx?
          <br/>
          ID=V2tPdzc6MoA%2fg8nf4B230g%3d%3d
         </p>
         <p>
          About us:
          <br/>
          USAgain is a dynamic, fast-growing industry leader of 'for profit' textile recycling services. The Companys various operating units provide textile recycling services for retail, commercial, industrial, and municipal customers. USAgains approximately 200 employees currently serve markets in many major areas across the US and are well recognized as an industry leader in service standards and customer satisfaction.
         </p>
         <p>
          Mission Statement:
          <br/>
          At USAgain we have a 3 P mission statement...for People, for Planet, and for Profit. Our mission is to provide industry-leading textile recycling services that exceed customer expectations. We offer a safe, respectful and rewarding workplace for our employees as we continue to develop a company dedicated to excellence, environmental responsibility, and ethical behavior. To date, USAgain has diverted more than 400 million pounds of used clothes from landfills; for re-wear, re-use, and re-cycling in the US and abroad.
         </p>
         <p>
          USAgain is a dynamic fast-growing company that offers a competitive base plus commission compensation and benefits package including major medical coverage, supplemental insurance programs, and paid PTO/holidays.
          <br/>
          USAgain promotes a drug-free and alcohol-free workplace and conducts pre-employment drug testing.
         </p>

          <b>

          </b>

We seek individuals passionate about student development who demonstrate the educator and leadership skills to make it happen. Great interpersonal skills, independent initiative, and creativity are essential. Our culture values a sense of humor, personal responsibility, optimism, and work/life balance.

         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

           We provide detailed information about the student and family before each assignment.
          </li>
          <li>
           We manage all marketing, payments, and systems and provide related support resources so that your focus can be on the student.
          </li>
          <li>
           We offer competitive hourly rates and schedule flexibility; you choose the work volume and hours you wish.
          </li>
          <li>
           Our tutors are independent contractors typically engaged with students 3-10 hours per week.
          </li>
          <li>
           Growth Opportunity: Tutor Doctor is an expanding international supplemental education firm offering in-home, one-on-one tutoring to students of all ages, all subjects.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Tutor compensation is $20.00 - $35.00 per hour based on qualifications and specialties. Tutors can also earn referral and renewal income. In addition to tutoring opportunities our growth means jobs are available in management, business development and administration.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required Qualifications:
          <br/>
          1. Tutoring / Education Services Background: We require significant experience as a tutor or teacher, the more years the better. Identify your primary / favorite subject matter and student age group. Experience with a range of learning styles, learning environments and special needs a bonus.
         </p>
         <p>
          2. Geographic Availability: Our tutors provide in-student-home service for client families in close proximity to their own home; apply only if you can reliably serve within 20-minute commute of our service territory of Redmond, Kirkland, Bothell and Woodinville, WA.
         </p>
         <p>
          3. Schedule Availability: Our tutors must have a reliable vehicle to travel to student homes on weekdays for 60-90-min sessions between 2 pm and 8 pm, and occasionally weekends as well. Assignments are generally long-term, so ability to serve a family for up to12+ months is preferred. We do not hire summer-only tutors.If you want to make a difference in people's lives and earn good money doing it, apply today!
         </p>

         </p>

         <p>
          Since 1994, The Essential Baking Company has set out to preserve, cultivate, and honor traditional methods of food preparation with a commitment to using organic ingredients. The bakery has grown in size and production to meet the demand for a high quality, authentic culinary experience. We have a current opening for a Sanitation Manager who will act as a key member of our overall operations management team by provide leadership for all sanitation programs and staff members. This is a great opportunity for someone to expand their supervisory skills and help us continue to grow our business.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>

          </b>
          In this role you will be hands on, working directly with our multi-cultural staff ensuring work is being completed in an efficient, safe and effective manner and that all food safety guidelines are being followed
         </p>

           Control inventory and order all cleaning supplies, managing the budget for this area Develop and implement productivity strategies to lower controllable costs while driving sanitation standard improvements
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure good housekeeping in facilities and continuously work on improvements
          </li>
          <li>
           Promote safety through work procedures
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with company vendors including pest control and waste management ensuring we are getting the best pricing and service
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct performance reviews, training and coaching sessions for approximately 13 staff members
          </li>
          <li>
           Light maintenance of equipment and machines
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School diploma or its equivalent
          </li>
          <li>
           3 + years of sanitation supervision experience within a food manufacturing environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to troubleshoot problems, develop and implement procedures, train and lead staff
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong communication skills with all levels in the organization
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer and technical skills are a must.
          </li>
          <li>
           Customer focused attitude
          </li>
          <li>
           Dependable, with a flexible schedule to work some weekends and rotating shifts
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read, write and speak English
          </li>
          <li>
           Exposure to supply chain and supply chain best practices
          </li>
         </ul>

          If interested email your cover letter and resume in either Word format, or the body of your email with "sanitation manager" in the subject line.

         </p>

          The Companys portfolio is comprised of trophy multifamily and retail properties in the City of San Francisco. Currently, the Company is experiencing tremendous growth. The Company is a team of energetic, committed, and experienced professionals that always strive for excellence and outstanding services for our clients. This role reports to the Director of Operations.
         </p>
         <p>
          To succeed in the role, the candidate must be organized, possess excellent communication skills, and the ability to multi-task. We strive to provide a collaborative and creative environment where each employee is encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.
         </p>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with maintenance requests and schedule
          </li>
          <li>
           Create and monitor work orders
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Highly self-motivated and dependable
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent interpersonal skills to interact with internal and external clients at a variety of levels
          </li>
          <li>
           Outstanding professionalism maintaining the appropriate levels of confidentiality and maturity even in high pressure situations
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to anticipate, be resourceful and proactive
          </li>
         </ul>

          <br/>

          <br/>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Electrician Journeyman
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Pure Electric
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Hayward, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          A well-rounded Journeyman Electrician with minimum five years' experience is needed for projects throughout the Greater San Francisco Bay area. We perform small to large scale tenant improvements on apartments, homes, and commercial buildings. We also perform service work for a large customer base as well as new customers. A background check and drug test will be performed. You must submit a resume to be considered.
         </p>
         <p>
          Electrician must have the following skills and qualifications:
          <br/>
          1. Assemble, install, test, and maintain electrical and data/comm wiring, equipment, and fixtures using hand tools and power tools.
          <br/>
          2. Diagnose malfunctioning systems and components, using test equipment and hand tools, to locate the cause of a breakdown and correct the problem.
          <br/>
          3. Connect wires to circuit breakers, transformers, or other components.
          <br/>
          4. Inspect electrical systems, equipment, and components to identify hazards, defects, and the need for adjustment or repair, and to ensure compliance with codes.
          <br/>
          5. Test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures using testing devices such as ohmmeters, voltmeters, and megohmmeters to ensure compatibility and safety of system.
          <br/>
          6. Maintain CA electrician certification to meet governmental regulations.
          <br/>
          7. Plan layout and installation of electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures based on job specifications, plans, and local codes.
          <br/>
          8. Direct and train workers to install, maintain, or repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures.
          <br/>
          9. Prepare sketches or follow blueprints to determine the location of wiring and equipment and to ensure conformance to building and safety codes.
          <br/>
          10. Use a variety of tools and equipment such as power construction equipment, measuring devices, power tools, and testing equipment including multimeters, ammeters, and test lamps.
          <br/>
          11. Install ground leads and connect power cables to equipment, such as motors and transformers.
          <br/>
          12. Perform business management duties such as maintaining records and files, preparing reports and invoices/sales receipts, and ordering supplies and equipment for assigned projects.
          <br/>
          13. Repair or replace wiring, equipment, and fixtures using hand tools and power tools.
          <br/>
          14. Work from ladders, scaffolds, scissor lifts, and roofs to install, maintain or repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures.
          <br/>
          15. Place conduit (pipes or tubing) inside designated partitions, walls, or other concealed areas, and pull insulated wires or cables through the conduit to complete circuits between junction boxes.
          <br/>
          16. Construct and fabricate parts, using hand tools and specifications.
          <br/>
          17. Fasten small metal or plastic boxes to walls to house electrical switches or receptacles.
          <br/>
          18. Perform physically demanding tasks, such as digging trenches to lay conduit and moving and lifting heavy objects.
          <br/>
          19. Provide cost estimates for materials and services.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Electrician: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_bc1e4b244b3118ad">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

       Tri-City Health Center
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Fremont, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Overall Summary
          </b>
          <br/>
          Patient Services Clerks will provide customer service to all Tri-City Health Center (TCHC) patients in the call center. Clerks will answer calls, verify and update patient demographic information, screen for program eligibility, gather required information. Screen and schedule patient appointments based on medical need and established appointment scheduling guidelines. Answer general questions and provide information. Conduct appointment reminder calls, appointment reschedules and lab result appointments as assigned. Work flexible schedule to include evenings and weekends.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Essential Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Verify and update patient demographics, screen for program eligibility, and gather required information,
          </li>
          <li>
           Screen and schedule patient appointments based on medical need and established appointment scheduling guidelines.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform appointment reminder calls, appointment reschedules and lab result appointments as assigned.
          </li>
          <li>
           Answer general questions and provide information.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate commitment to, and understanding of, TCHCs Behaviors for Success and GUEST (Customer Service Model), by modeling customer service excellence in all internal and external relationships and in the performance of all duties and responsibilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work flexible schedule and overtime, as necessary.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Secondary Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Attend workshops, training, and meetings as needed, and as requested.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS
          </b>
          <br/>
          Required education, experience, training
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School Diploma or equivalent
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of three months medical office experience or similarly related experience in a customer service setting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient in Microsoft Office products including Excel, Word and Outlook.
          </li>
          <li>
           Bilingual  Spanish preferred
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Preferred education, experience, training
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           One year medical office experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Community or public health experience preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Medical practice management program
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Critical Success Factors in this role include
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to follow directions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintaining confidentiality and HIPAA compliance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent customer service and client services philosophy in all interactions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Appreciation and respect for working with and serving a diverse population.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reading and writing in order to review records for accuracy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and multi-tasking skills with attention to detail.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency in Microsoft Office and the internet.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Physical Demands
          </b>
          :
          <br/>
          This position requires:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Sitting, walking, and standing associated with a normal medical office environment, some bending, stretching and lifting required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manual dexterity used to include, but not limited to, standard office equipment, and computer keyboard.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read, sort, check, count, and verify numbers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reading and writing in order to review records for accuracy.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain ongoing preventive maintenance program to ensure optimum equipment performance
          </li>
          <li>
           Oversee equipment upgrades and refurbishment projects, effectively coordinating with vendor support.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure accurate spare parts inventory and on-site availability to support equipment repairs and upgrades
          </li>
         </ul>

          <br/>

          </li>
          <li>
           Creating quotes for traffic control product sales and equipment rentals
          </li>
          <li>
           Entering and tracking sales and equipment rental orders
          </li>
          <li>
           Assisting in tracking equipment rental and inventory management
          </li>
          <li>
           Thinking outside the box to assist with organizational streamlining and resource management
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Requirements and qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum 3 years sales/rental experience preferably in the Traffic Control Industry or a related Construction Field
          </li>
          <li>
           We will train the right candidate!
          </li>
          <li>
           A minimum of an Associates Degree
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook and Quick Books
          </li>
          <li>
           Exceptional attention to detail
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational skills and the ability to get along with others
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to adjust to rapidly changing priorities
          </li>
          <li>
           Have the ability to provide positive and professional customer service
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess the ability to diagnose and solve problems including computer issues
          </li>
          <li>
           Be able to pass criminal background check and drug screen process
          </li>
          <li>
           Spanish fluency is desirable
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We are a family-oriented organization with great career growth opportunities. Your efforts and contributions will not go unnoticed. Our benefit package includes-competitive salary, medical and dental compensation and paid time off
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>

          </li>
         </ul>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0eaiu7bqik8h5" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Auto Parts Delivery Driver-Part Time- Oakland
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Genuine Parts Company/NAPA Auto Parts
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Oakland, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $12.30 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          In the 1920's, America fell in love with the automobile. More and more vehicles began traveling the roads, creating a need for an auto parts distribution system that could keep pace with the demand to keep our automobiles running. In 1925, NAPA was founded to meet those needs. Since then, we've sped our way to become a powerhouse in the auto parts industry. Fueled by the popularity of the automobile, our name can now be seen on over 5,800 stores, 58 distribution centers, and 13,000 NAPA AutoCare facilities across the country, and we're not stopping there.Our 80 years of experience has made us an industry leader, but don't let our age lead you to believe we can't keep up with the changing times. We're not your grandfather's NAPA. As our vehicles become more advanced, we've adapted our business in ways that allow us to stay ahead of the curve. We're constantly updating our inventory of over 500,000 parts, opening new stores, reaching out to customers in new ways, and most importantly, we're hiring new talent to join our ranks.It's an exciting time to join our team and we need people like you to help us accelerate our business into the future. Our growth depends on the dedication and enthusiasm of our employees. At NAPA, we want to continue to expand our presence, but at the heart of our business we just love automobiles. That's probably one of the reasons you're visiting this page. You share our passion to help customers, both retail and wholesale, keep their vehicles running. At NAPA, you'll be part a team that's building on an 80-year legacy of NAPA KNOW HOW, backed by the best employees in the world.We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.NAPA Auto Parts is seeking a skilled, enthusiastic and hard working part time Delivery Driver to join our growing team of auto parts professionals. As a Delivery Driver your primary focus is on getting the right parts to the right people at the right time, and engaging with customers as the face of NAPA throughout the day. Other responsibilities for the Delivery Driver will include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Building long-term relationships with the customers you deliver to
          </li>
          <li>
           Driving throughout the metropolitan area using maps and directions
          </li>
          <li>
           Utilizing both manual and automatic transmission vehicles
          </li>
          <li>
           Handling cash charge transactions correctly and core/part returns appropriately
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintaining a distribution log or tracking system to record all deliveries/pickups made
          </li>
          <li>
           Lifting merchandise up to 60 lbs for deliveries
          </li>
          <li>
           Inspecting, protecting and maintaining company assets, merchandise, vehicles, building and people
          </li>
          <li>
           Starting pay $12.30 per hour
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          The ideal NAPA Delivery Driver will have a passion for delivering customer care on an everyday basis, and must also have excellent driving aptitude for both manual and automatic vehicles.Other requirements for the Delivery Driver include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Agility to bend to floor-level shelves and reach to upper shelves (eight feet) with use of stool or ladder when necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Stamina to stand and walk for entire work shift
          </li>
          <li>
           Strength to lift 60 lbs of merchandise
          </li>
          <li>
           Clear speaking and attentive listening skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Motivated to train and learn
          </li>
          <li>
           Flexibility in schedule including evenings, weekends and holidays
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid driver's license with:
          </li>
          <li>
           No DWI convictions within the past seven years
          </li>
          <li>
           No more than one moving violation AND/OR fault accident in the last three years
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum 18 years of age
          </li>
          <li>
           Pre-Employment drug screen and background check
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Salary: $12.30 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $12.30 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Auto Parts Delivery: 1 year
          </li>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0cjrbib06lah1" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Community Support Facilitator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Thrive Support Services, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Alameda, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $45,000 a year
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Department:
          </b>
          Supported Living Services
          <br/>
          <b>
           Hours of Work:
          </b>
          Full Time Exempt
          <br/>
          <b>
           Salary:
          </b>
          $40,000 and $45,000annually depending on experience
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Description:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           The Community Support Facilitator
          </b>
          mission is to ensure quality Individualized Services to all people we serve. The
          <b>
           Community Support Facilitator
          </b>
          will maintain program integrity and coordinate supports for client and staff to ensure successful outcomes. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The work environment is a combination of both the office and the clients homes.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications and Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Education and Experience
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA Degree in human services or general studies with a minimum of 4 years of experience in developmental disabilities or related field or MSW with experience or knowledge of developmental disabilities
          </li>
          <li>
           LVN with minimum of
           <b>
            5 years of experience in developmental disabilities or RN with related experience or knowledge
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           A reasonable combination of the above education and experience requirements.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          2. Transportation:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Valid California drivers license
          </li>
          <li>
           Clean driving record (DMV printout is required)
          </li>
          <li>
           Current vehicle registration and use of a vehicle in good running condition during work hours
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid automobile insurance with the required coverage for that vehicle and all passengers.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          3. Other:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The willingness and ability to perform the Essential functions required within the company, such as office reception, answering phone, new referral consultation, use of computer for projects; typing, duties with may be necessary to promote client safety, work collaboratively with the clients and others.
          </li>
          <li>
           Tuberculosis Clearance Screen, Current CPR and First Aid certification
          </li>
          <li>
           Pass criminal background check through fingerprint clearance
          </li>
          <li>
           The willingness and ability to perform all the essential functions of the job.
          </li>
          <li>
           The ability to work collaboratively with clients and coworkers.
          </li>
          <li>
           An employment record of punctuality, good work attendance and reliability.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must provide Social Security Card and complete a I9 application as proof of eligibility to work in the U.S.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Case Management: Under direction of the Program Manager of SLS:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Basic coordination of generic services and natural supports will be performed
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist client with essential lifestyle planning, developing and monitoring the clients individualized Support Plan (ISP) with the Program Manager of SLS.
          </li>
          <li>
           Help the clients with understanding choices regarding lifestyle and assist them in making informed choices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Help the client fulfill the shortterm goals of the ISP, keeping the longterm goals in mind
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain case records according to company procedures. Document progress in Written Annual Plan, Quarterly Reports, Case Supervision Reports, Home Visit Records and Service notes. Ensure all pertinent information is documented in the clients Home Log and the case file.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop a list of specific duties needed to provide for the individual needs of each client and lead the team of each client in a collaborative effort to meet those needs and obtain the clients short and long term goals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor ongoing health, mental/emotional and social status of developmentally disabled adults receiving services.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform routine home visits, assess needs and coordinate and/or perform assistance with community access to doctors or health appointments, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reassess care plan regularly and identify changes in needs for ongoing services.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate and monitor appointments with other agencies, medical and mental health services to be arranged according to the clients needs. Advocate for clients at appointments, coordinating followup measures as indicated.
          </li>
          <li>
           Advocate for the client and provide support during Interdisciplinary Team (IDT) meetings and activities in the community.
          </li>
          <li>
           Network in the community to facilitate the development of natural supports for the clients.
          </li>
          <li>
           Initiate and cofacilitate Circle of Support gatherings to assist the client in maintaining an effective Circle of Support.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          2. Supervision of Team Leaders (TL): Under the direction of the Supported Living Services Program Manager ,
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assisting with the New hire Process: Assist with interview for potential new staff when the team is in need, Conduct Initial Training for all incoming staff that will serve their clients and Introduce new staff to client and team
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide supervision to the Personal Attendants (PA) working in each clients home
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform as a leader to the clients, PA, TL, staff, providing encouragement, direction and training
          </li>
          <li>
           Routinely review the Home Log to ensure proper documentation. Followup on problem issues indicated by the home log documentation
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          3. Conduct Education and Training:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provide initial and ongoing training to PA and TL staff regarding the proper techniques and procedures for care of the client in accordance with Consumer Orientation checklist
          </li>
          <li>
           Approve initial training checklists and all updates to checklist
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide SLS Title 17 training to consumers
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct education and training sessions to team staff members
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide individual training to staff needing additional instruction and/or counsel
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Other related Job Duties and Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Emergency Assistance:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assist as back up in providing 24hour crisis intervention and direct care coverage to the clients as necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedule PA staffing and/or perform direct care and protective supervision
          </li>
          <li>
           Implement the clients individualized Emergency Assistance Plan (E.A.P.) The E.A.P. is monitored on a quarterly basis and modifications are made when necessary and under the direction of the Supported Living Services Program Manager .
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          2. Required Reporting:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Perform all reporting requirements, such as special Incident Reporting and Suspected Abuse Reports
          </li>
          <li>
           Report suspected abuse with 24 hours to the appropriate agencies and THRIVE management
          </li>
          <li>
           Immediately report to supervisors and/or the responsible person for the client about any decline in the clients physical or mental health, any medication refusal, alcohol or illegal drug abuse
          </li>
          <li>
           Report employee accidents immediately fill out accident report for Workers Compensation Employee Claim form so the employee can get medical assistance. Direct employees to our PEO
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          While achieving the above job results, the following objectives must always be met: Maintains THRIVE Support Services, Inc. stability and reputation by complying with all applicable state and federal regulations and applying a professional and diplomatic behavior at all times. Following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes; performing other job related duties as assigned
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_2a6a1270c1dde6f2">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Preschool Teacher
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Gan Noe Preschool
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Growing Preschool Looking for Energetic Teachers (noe valley)
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          WHO WE ARE
          <br/>
          A non-profit, play-based preschool in San Francisco's Noe Valley. We are an integral part of our community, and the families we serve.
         </p>
         <p>
          SEARCHING FOR
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A great team player
          </li>
          <li>
           A communicative person who takes initiative
          </li>
          <li>
           Someone energetic, responsible, and punctual
          </li>
          <li>
           Someone who loves working with children
          </li>
          <li>
           Someone familiar with Jewish Holidays and themes
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          RESPONSIBILITIES
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Prepare and implement daily curriculum and lesson plans
          </li>
          <li>
           Create and maintain a safe, clean, and orderly environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Engage and actively supervise children outside during outdoor playtime.
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend scheduled staff meetings
          </li>
          <li>
           Set-up and clean-up indoor and outdoor environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Notify the Director of any significant change in a child's behavior, physical condition or family situation
          </li>
          <li>
           Notify Director of any injuries to a child on school grounds.
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend school events (including monthly Tot Shabbat) that promote the preschool.
          </li>
          <li>
           Upholding our Preschool's mission and philosophies on teaching and conflict resolution.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          REQUIREMENTS
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           At least 6 units in ECE/CD (core classes)
          </li>
          <li>
           TB Test, and Fingerprint Clearance
          </li>
          <li>
           CPR/First Aid training
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          BENEFITS
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Competitive pay
          </li>
          <li>
           Professional development
          </li>
          <li>
           An opportunity to be a positive influence in the lives of so many children!
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We look forward to hearing from you by email with a cover letter and resume! THANK YOU!
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_830a3534b54e7af1">

         </div>

  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Diesel Truck Driver -Local Delivery - Marin County
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Grange Debris Box
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Rafael, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Truck Driver HELP Wanted
          <br/>
          Diesel Truck / Local Marin County Delivery
          <br/>
          IMMEDIATE OPENING! Imagine driving a 2 or 3 axel trucks around beautiful Marin County all day and being paid for it by joining a well established 55 year old Marin County company as a roll off truck driver. A Class A or B license is required.
         </p>
         <p>
          The job consists of delivering, exchanging, and picking up roll-off boxes with a heavy duty 2 axel class 7, or a 3 axel class 8 diesel truck with air brakes, tarping and tying down the loads, and hauling the contents to various local recycling facilities.
         </p>
         <p>
          A preferred candidate will be a stable well established Marin County Resident. Diesel truck driving and mechanical ability and tools are a plus, but not a requirement. Routes often require Drivers to navigate through communities and tight areas in city and suburban locations. Backing skills are essential. Our drivers routinely climb in and out of the truck cab to climb on to the containers to smooth loads or secure tarps for transport. Drivers must have safe driving records and be able to communicate professionally with customers and dispatch at all times, and comply with all local, state, and federal transportation regulations and Company policies.
         </p>
         <p>
          Work hours may be up to full time and may require occasional weekend work. Drivers must be able to complete daily driver logs as well as pre and post trip truck inspections. Extra work maintaining other trucks, containers, and other equipment could also be available.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Requirements:
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Must be at least 21 years of age or older. We prefer a Marin County Resident.
          <br/>
          2. Clean driving record and no major violations or multiple speeding violations, negligent or reckless driving, DUI, or driving on a suspended or revoked license
          <br/>
          3. Legally eligible to work in the United States.
          <br/>
          4. Provide resume listing ALL past employment and education.
          <br/>
          5. High school diploma or GED degree. Advanced education is a plus.
          <br/>
          6. Present a CDL with a 2nd form of ID (birth certificate, social security card, passport etc).
          <br/>
          7. Successfully pass pre-employment (post offer) drug screen, background and motor vehicle records check and Department of Transportation Physical.
          <br/>
          8. Must be able to speak and read English well enough to converse with the general public, understand highway traffic and signals, respond to official questions, and be able to make legible entries on reports and records.
          <br/>
          9. Must have or get a valid California Class A or B drivers license with airbrakes endorsement.
          <br/>
          10. At least 1 year of previous truck driving experience operating a similar vehicle requiring a Class B or Class A CDL
          <br/>
          11. Ability to perform all of the physical requirements of the position with or without reasonable accommodations.
          <br/>
          12. Cleans and maintains truck in top condition.
          <br/>
          13. Operate the truck and equipment in a safe and professional manner.
          <br/>
          14. Maintain Vehicle Log and Driver Pay sheets.
          <br/>
          16. Pass alcohol and drug testing.
          <br/>
          17. Mechanical ability and tools are a real plus, but not required.
          <br/>
          18. Computers, Welding and painting ability another plus.
         </p>
         <p>
          Representative Responsibilities - Driver - Roll Off:
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Performs complete pre-trip inspection including, but not limited to, tire pressure, fluid levels, safety equipment, gauges and controls.
          <br/>
          2. Drives heavy diesel truck to and from customer locations and recycling facility(s).
          <br/>
          3. Climbs into and out of truck at customer locations and recycling facility(s).
          <br/>
          4. Operates loading and discharge cylinder mechanisms.
          <br/>
          5. Operates hydraulic controls to deposit collected material at the recycling facility.
          <br/>
          6. Tarps containers and secures container to rails while wearing required protective equipment.
          <br/>
          7. Courteously interactions with customers, dispatchers and supervisors.
          <br/>
          8. Cleans up the area around accidental waste spills.
          <br/>
          9. Reads route sheets. Services each customer as assigned by the dispatcher and/or supervisor.
          <br/>
          10. Completes route/productivity sheets, Vehicle Condition Reports (VCRs) and other forms.
          <br/>
          11. Performs driver check-in procedures upon returning to the facility at the end of the day.
          <br/>
          12. Operates in a manner that is aimed at creating capacity and ensuring productivity by meeting company specified productivity goals while ensuring safe operations at all times.
          <br/>
          13. Follows all safety policies and procedures.
          <br/>
          14. Provide and operate GPS, iPhone or other similar smart phone.
          <br/>
          15. Performs other job-related duties as assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          Physical Demands:
         </p>
         <p>
          The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 35 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 70 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move more than 100 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. *All candidates are subject to Human Performance Exam, Physical, background checks and drug testing. EOE/AAP/MF. Interested candidates should first submit resumes and salary requirements. Please submit your resume and salary requirements via email to fred at GrangeBox dot Com. Then call Fred at 415-456-2712 to discuss this opportunity.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: Existing drivers earn $40K to $80,000 Per year
         </p>
         <p>
          Directions: 200 Tamal Vista is the address of our office complex. The internal street is Tamal Plaza. Our physical address is 200 Tamal Plaza, Suite 115, Corte Madera, Ca., 94925. We are located along Tamal Vista between Warnum and Fifer on the west side of Hwy 101. We are next door to the Marin Municipal Water District Corporation Yard, directly across Tamal Vista from the former Handi Cup property where 180 residential units are currently under construction, and north of the DMV Motor Vehicles Dept. Of the five buildings in our complex, Building 100, 200, &amp; 300 are in front; Building 400 &amp; 500 are in the back. Drive between the front and back buildings, around the south side of building 200 and you will see a blue colored storefront with the letters 115 above our door, between Bldg 200 and 300.
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           San Rafael, CA
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Commercial Truck Driver: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required license or certification:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Class B
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_7581fedcb52c660e">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          We are looking for a dynamic person with a great work ethic and excellent attention to detail to fulfill our Purchasing Project Manager role using Shop-Tech E2 ERP. The purchasing project associate will be responsible for purchasing our daily inventory needs as part of a purchasing team, and managing the parts needs of a multitude of different projects to their completion. Part of the responsibility of the project manager will be ongoing data entry, building bill of materials is the main part of the job, learning our inventory,and working with shoptech E2 system. The purchasing project associate must be proficient with computers, Microsoft Office Suit, etc. The candidate will be responsible for quickly learning our processes and procedures. The candidate for this position will be responsible for quickly learning inventory parts and their function. Experience using an ERP system to make bill of materials is a must. Must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Please note: This position is a non supervisory position and we are looking for team members with experience making Bill Of Materials in the SHOPTECH E2 system, we may consider experience in other ERP systems.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Purchasing and Data Entry Required : 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
