     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Statista Inc.- New York, NY
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Statista.com is the first statistics portal in the world to integrate over 60,000 diverse topics of data and facts from more than 18,000 sources onto a single professional platform. Statista provides business customers, researchers, and the academic community with direct access to relevant quantitative facts and statistics. Our customers include advertising agencies, television broadcasters, management consultancies, and international corporations.
         </p>
         <p>
          Statista is an award winning company that was founded in 2008 in Hamburg, Germany and is now moving to NYC! We are looking for several motivated individuals to help build up and grow our team in New York.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Successful candidates will:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Individually manage sales across a wide list of key clients as well as generate new business from existing customers and prospective clients.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop B2B accounts with warm and cold leads generated by existing customers from our website
          </li>
          <li>
           Consistently deliver individual sales targets every month
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively sell new business model platform for business supplies procurement
          </li>
          <li>
           Proactively develop sales opportunities within a variety of business product categories
          </li>
          <li>
           Report directly to the Managing Director and &amp; Global Head of Sales
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualified candidates must possess:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           2 + years direct sales experience with enterprise software solution sales required, with sales of web analytics or business intelligence software and services strongly preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Competitive, aggressive sales nature with a desire to win
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to manage frequent telephone calls
          </li>
          <li>
           Selling skills with a proven ability to close business
          </li>
          <li>
           Sales relationship building skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Professional Growth Potential
          </li>
          <li>
           Desire to be part of of rapidly expanding business
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Professional attitude and appearance
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           For additional company information: http://www.statista.com/
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Statista.com
          </b>
          is the first statistics portal in the world to integrate over 60,000 diverse topics of data and facts from more than 18,000 sources onto a single professional platform. Statista provides business customers, researchers, and the academic community with direct access to relevant quantitative facts and statistics. Our customers include advertising agencies, television broadcasters, management consultancies, and international corporations.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           How to Apply:
          </b>
         </p>

          <b>

          </b>
          . Please no phone calls!
         </p>

       <font size="+1">
        Industrial Maintenance Technician
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Hunter Foundry Machinery Corporation
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Schaumburg, IL
      </span>

     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           INDUSTRIAL MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Hunter Foundry Machinery Corporation currently has an opening for a Maintenance Technician. This person is responsible for all levels of preventative maintenance on plant equipment. Must be able to analyze mechanical and operational problems on production equipment and take corrective action. Should be able to work independently to diagnose problems, replace or repair parts, test and make adjustments. Experience with CNC machines is a must. This position includes coordinating outside vendors to perform building maintenance.
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a physically demanding job that includes standing, kneeling, stooping, and climbing on a daily basis. Requires the use of a variety of hand and power tools. Candidates should have a significant mechanical aptitude and previous experience with heavy machinery. Knowledge or background in electricity and hydraulics is strongly preferred.
         </p>
         <p>
          Hunter recently celebrated its 50th year in business manufacturing molding machines for the foundry industry. This is a full-time position with competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           CNC Machines: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school or equivalent
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Server/Pone Person/Cashiers
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Red Boy Pizza
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Novato, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          RED BOY PIZZA - 2 NOVATO STORES are Seeking For Qualified And Energetic Individuals To Work With Us In A High Pace Environment. Looking For Long Term SERVERS And /Or PHONE PERSON/CASHIER To Become Part Of Our Team! Part Time/Full Time positions available. We offer a family, friendly, fun and attractive working environment. We have two stores in Novato. The DIABLO Store is located at 940 Diablo Ave @ Novato Fair Shopping Center and the ENTRADA Store is located at 459 Entrada Drive @ Ignacio Center.
         </p>
         <p>
          REQUIREMENTS:
          <br/>
          - Experience in the food industry, POS System and phone order is a plus, but we are willing to train the right individual if they fit our competency and customers service profile.
          <br/>
          - Must be outgoing, upbeat, self motivated, energetic and posses a friendly smile and a positive attitude.
          <br/>
          - Must have a genuine passion for hospitality and restaurant industry.
          <br/>
          - Must provide attentive and friendly service to guests.
          <br/>
          - Must be able to multitask and have an ability to move quickly and be able to prioritize simultaneous service tasks. Duties will include taking orders over the phones and tables, serving food, bussing tables, stocking, light cleaning, restaurant set up and breakdown.
          <br/>
          - Must work as a team as well as alone..
          <br/>
          - Must be willing to learn the work and our menu inside and out and do whatever takes to get the job done.
          <br/>
          - Candidates with aspirations of transitioning from a start up to a more qualified role are very welcome!
         </p>
         <p>
          HIGHER PAY ACCORDING TO PERFORMANCE!!! GREAT EARNING POTENTIAL!!! FREE MEALS! If you believe that you would be a fit for this position WE WOULD LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU. . Qualified candidates will be pre selected and invited for an interview in the next couple weeks. APPLY NOW! PLEASE DO NOT INQUIRE WITHIN! DO NOT CALL THE STORE!

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Coordinator, Clinic Operations
       </font>

       <font size="+1">
        Senior Executive Search Associate
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       TalentRISE
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Executive Search Senior Associate
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Position Summary:
          </b>
          <br/>
          TalentRISE LLC is recruiting and evaluating candidates for the position of
          <b>
           Senior Associate
          </b>
          for our national executive search practice. This position will be located in our Chicago, Illinois headquarters and work directly with the firms Partners, executive recruitment team and research department. We are seeking an individual who wants to be a part of a rapidly growing company and who thrives in working in a very fast paced environment. Additionally we desire a candidate who wants to be a thought leader within a specific industry and is actively working to build this reputation.
          <br/>
          The selected individual will have a strong background in senior level executive recruitment from a boutique or multinational search firm. A strong intellectual curiosity as well as a drive to be the best. The ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously is critical. A background and existing networks either in health care, financial services, professional services, technology or manufacturing is highly desired.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Primary Responsibilities:
          </b>
          <br/>
           Full life-cycle recruiting: sourcing, scheduling interviews, checking references, and offer discussions.
          <br/>
           Works alongside Partners / Senior Associate Partner in building up competitive intelligence around industries, companies and top executives.
          <br/>
           Manages on-going cultivation and relationship building.
          <br/>
           Act as the recruitment subject matter expert and a strategic advisor to a network to enhance the TalentRISE brand.
          <br/>
           Identifies screening criteria and screens pre-qualified candidates, presenting a shortlist to Partners for review and working closely with the client team.
          <br/>
           Executes and monitors sourcing activities and programs across a variety of channels.
          <br/>
           Develop deep knowledge of key competitors and industry.
          <br/>
           Provides feedback on candidates to Partners and directly to candidates.
          <br/>
           Ensures the recruitment process/lifecycle is completed in a fast, efficient and professional manner at all times, minimizing the time to hire.
          <br/>
           Works to understand short-and long-term talent objectives and hiring forecasts for area of responsibility.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
          <br/>
           Minimum 7-10 years of experience: technical recruitment, consulting, management, B2B Sales. Experience from one of Big 4 is a plus.
          <br/>
           Ability to understand and adapt to the culture of a professional services organization that strives to be the top services organization in professional services, healthcare and financial services.
          <br/>
           Polished presence with high level of professionalism and integrity; resilient work ethic and the ability to persevere in challenging situations.
          <br/>
           Strong relationship builder with a proven ability to develop a network of talent at the Director/Partner level.
          <br/>
           Excellent project management skills; demonstrated ability to prioritize and multitask in a fast-paced environment.
          <br/>
           Strong job tenure and documented track record of success with quota attainment.
          <br/>
           Creative, strategic, entrepreneurial spirit, comfortable developing and trying new methods.
          <br/>
           Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; confident with a natural ability to sell.
          <br/>
           Deep problem solving skills with the ability to bring forward strategic ideas and initiatives.
          <br/>
           Knowledge of the consulting industry, business terminology and processes preferred.
          <br/>
           Ability to work independently and as an integral part of a team in a collaborative environment.
          <br/>
           Demonstrated leadership and team-building abilities.
          <br/>
           High energy and passion for recruiting.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Executive Search: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        GROUNDSKEEPER / PORTER /Lynnwood WA
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Trinity Property Consultants
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Lynnwood, WA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $11.50 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          GROUNDSKEEPER/PORTER
          <br/>
          A Groundskeeper/Porter staff persons duties and responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to the following tasks:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BASIC FUNCTIONS:   Responsible for helping to maintain the entire property in an attractive, comfortable condition. Assists in trash pick up on the property.   Assist in all types of maintenance, when necessary and as requested.   Assists in completing the turnovers/make readies of vacant units, as requested.   On-call in accordance with scheduling to handle maintenance emergencies from residents and property emergencies.
          </li>
          <li>
           RELATIONSHIPS:   Reports to Maintenance Supervisor and/or Property Manager on a regular basis, as directed.   Maintains relationship with other staff members, working with the Rental Office staff and under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor.   Maintains good rapport with outside, contract vendors working on the property.   Maintains good rapport with current and prospective residents.
          </li>
          <li>
           RESPONSIBILITIES: The activities listed below are not all inclusive; however, they are indicative of the types of activities normally performed by the Groundskeeper/Porter personnel.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Complete all duties regarding make-ready/vacant units.   Service appliances, as requested.   Services general plumbing and basic electrical needs of the property to include replacing/fixing toilets, light switches, garbage disposals, ceiling fans, etc.   Re-key locks, as requested.   Assists in maintaining inventory of tools, equipment and supplies.   Replace burned out light bulbs, broken globes, etc., in units and throughout the exterior of the property, as needed.   Performs corrective maintenance and satisfies residents needs following company procedures when performing service requests.   Observes condition of apartment and reports any unusual circumstances. (That is, size and number of pets in occupied apartment, etc.)   Observes condition of property in general and reports any unusual circumstances.   Makes regular inspection of the grounds, buildings, plumbing, electrical fixtures, appliances and major equipment, as directed. q Should be familiar with location of power, water and gas turnoff valves, clean-out traps, fire extinguishers and fire hydrants on the property.   Enters occupied apartments to make necessary repairs.   Cleans up thoroughly after performing work in an occupied or vacant apartment.   Notifies Maintenance Supervisor and/or Property Manager, as directed, regarding any supplies or parts necessary to complete service requests.   Performs pool and spa maintenance, as directed.   Follows company procedures regarding safety and emergencies.   Attends employee meetings and training seminars, as requested. 4. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:   High School education or equivalent   Full time maintenance experience   Provides own transportation   All necessary tools will be provided   Uses good safety habits at all times   Neat, clean appearance   Compatible with wide range of people   Needs to be thorough, reliable, responsible, honest, organized, flexible and be service-oriented   Possesses basic knowledge of the following: - electrical systems - plumbing systems - painting procedures
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BASIC PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:   Frequent lifting, carrying, pushing or pulling 20-50 lbs. and constantly moving appliances and heavy machinery correctly and safely.   Frequent climbing  ascending and descending ladders, stairs, scaffolding, ramps,   oles, etc., in addition to using feet, legs, hands and/or arms.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Body agility is important.   Ability to maintain equilibrium is also important to prevent falling from high places or when walking, standing or crouching.   Stooping  downward and forward by bending legs and spine at the waist, requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles. q Frequent kneeling and bending legs at the knees to come to rest on one or both knees.   Frequent crouching downward and forward by bending legs and back/spine.   Frequent reaching by extending hand(s) or arm(s) in any direction.   Frequent handling of various sizes and weights of items. Needs the ability to seize, hold, grasp, turn or otherwise work with one or both hands. Fingers are involved only to the extent that they are an extension of the hands, such as to turn a switch or shift automobile gears.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $11.50 /hour
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_f37add96d302fea7">

          Qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Experience in electrical, plumbing, minor carpentry and HVAC
          </li>
          <li>
           Prior hands on experience in building maintenance necessary
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Job Functions:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Maintain work log documenting daily tasks * Procures, stores and inventories maintenance supplies as directed
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with preventative maintenance of the facility
          </li>
          <li>
           All work must meet department standards to make certain that all safety precautions are followed; and ensure that work is being completed in an acceptable time frame
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that the maintenance shop is kept in an orderly manner
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to 50 lbs lift and carry tools and equipment
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          This position will work 20 hours a week Monday - Friday 4 hour Shift. Can start at 9am, 10am or 11am, exact shift will be worked out with the selected candidate

       <font size="+1">
        Outside Sales Representative
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">

      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          AFCO Distribution, a wholesale distribution company based in Spokane Valley, WA serves over 800 retail customers in Washington, Oregon, Idaho, Montana Nevada, Utah, Wyoming, and Alaska. The company distributes over 7,000 products including animal feed, garden and nursery supplies, wildlife products, pet food and supplies, fencing and livestock equipment. Customers receive weekly orders within our routed territories. Delivery is provided by a fleet of company trucks from the companys distribution center warehouse. The employees of AFCO Distribution take great pride in offering excellent products at competitive prices with our benchmark customer service.
          <br/>
          AFCO Distribution is in search of a dynamic Outside Sales Representatives to coordinate all aspects of selling the companys products and services on a business to business scale. Sales area includes Western Washington (Seattle and surrounding areas).
         </p>
         <p>
          The position will focus on coordinating the efforts of all staff to developing a highly effective supply chain focused on customer satisfaction and brand image. The Outside Sales Representative will possess a high level of initiative, discretion and independent judgment, with a can-do attitude and the ability to multi-task. The ideal candidate will also be one who can see things that need to be done and figure out a way to do them effectively and efficiently.
         </p>
         <p>
          RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Identify, target and generate business to business (B2B) sales leads to meet specified sales goals
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct sales presentations and accurately measure and price products
          </li>
          <li>
           Cold call and prospect new sales opportunities
          </li>
          <li>
           Understand and communicate information regarding company products, services and policies and procedures to new and existing clients in a timely manner
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend and participate in strategic sales meetings and training sessions
          </li>
          <li>
           Continually gather information on local competition and prevalent industry and business climate with the region; communicate information to management and others as needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Identify market trends and competitive rate actions, and communicate those trends to management
          </li>
          <li>
           Exercise discretion and independent judgment by developing, engaging and maintaining a short and long-term forecast and sales plan
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all required client paperwork is complete, accurate and submitted on time
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide timely and accurate reports as required
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide a high level of relationship-based customer service to new and existing customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Safely deliver merchandise to customer locations
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for other duties including, but not limited to: sales presentations, writing sales proposing, implementation, creating and adding to existing marketing materials, and other assignments as directed by management
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          JOB REQUIREMENTS
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school diploma (or equivalent), or any combination of education, training, or experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities with an emphasis on correctly calculating figures and amounts
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Familiar with business reports and retail math.
          </li>
          <li>
           Solid forecasting, organizational and planning skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to understand and create reports from sales data, showing financial and mathematical analysis that will enhance business making decisions
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess a valid drivers license and have a clear driving record
          </li>
          <li>
           Must pass background check and pre-employment drug screen as a condition of employment
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to travel. Must have own reliable transportation and proof of insurance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing with co-workers and customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Commitment to excellence and high standards especially in regard to customer service
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift, carry and load 60 pound (minimum) weight requirements
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency with Windows operating system and Microsoft Office
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven track record of being dependable and reliable.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           One to three years of related professional experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, retail merchandising or equivalent combination of experience and training that provides the required knowledge and skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Exhibit a high level of product knowledge in one or more of the following areas: feed, seed, pet food &amp; supplies, hardware, fencing, animal health, tack, clothing &amp; footwear, lawn &amp; garden or wild bird supplies
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of Epicor retail software (formerly Activant/Eagle) and Compass Analytics software
          </li>
          <li>
           Helpful and cheerful attitude important
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate a willingness to work long hours and/or weekends
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          HOURS / DAYS / SCHEDULE
          <br/>
          This is a full time, 40+ hours per week position (typically Monday  Friday). Qualified applicants must be available to work evenings and/or weekends as needed.
         </p>
         <p>
          SALARY / WAGE / BENEFITS
          <br/>
          A salary will be discussed during the interview process. The company offers medical, dental and life &amp; long term disability benefits to full time employees. Employees may also participate in the companys 401(k) plan after meeting eligibility requirements
         </p>
         <p>
          TO APPLY
          <br/>
          Applications for Employment can be obtained from www.afcodistribution.com and submitted by mail, email or fax. Resumes are appreciated as an accompaniment to official applications for employment. Visit the careers section at www.afcodistribution.com for a full job description and details on how to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          The Senior Client Consultant is responsible for onboarding new CPG clients, and ensuring fast and successful deployment of the BluePlanner TPM/Analytics and Optimization software. The Senior Client Consultant is also involved in the client acquisition process (pre-sales) working with prospects, and presenting the BluePlanner software to support Revenue Management initiatives.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           RESPONSIBILITIES
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Support the pre-sales process, including running software presentations, requirements reviews and project planning
          </li>
          <li>
           Lead client deployment projects, working with client leadership on project management, business process and software configuration and integration
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain client relationships, present new features and/or ideas to improve business results
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in industry events and develop leadership expertise in Revenue Management and Trade Promotion Management
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in the development of UpClear Client Services team, including recruitment, training and management
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in company marketing and business development initiatives, including industry events &amp; publications
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS &amp; EXPERIENCE
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors or Masters degree in a business discipline with minimum 4-5 years of work experience, including Business Analysis and Project or Account Management
          </li>
          <li>
           Technical experience and/or understanding of technical concepts, covering Databases, SQL, and Web Applications.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated understanding and experience with the Software Development Life Cycle.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience within the Retail or Consumer Packaged Goods industries (as an employee, business consultant, and/or software/service provider) especially Trade Promotion Management (TPM)
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong autonomy, attention to detail, organizational skills, leadership skills, and interpersonal skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent written and verbal communication proficiency
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB PERSPECTIVES
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Contribute to the development of a young software company, including strategy, marketing, and sales activities
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop consulting experience and expertise in the CPG / Retail industry
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop exemplary management, negotiation, and communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Grow with the company in one of 4 areas (Client Services, Business Development, Technology, or Corporate)
          </li>
          <li>
           Compensation varies based on relevant experience
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           ABOUT UPCLEAR
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          UpClear (www.upclear.com) is an enterprise software company focused on the Consumer Packaged Goods industry. Our flagship software, BluePlanner, focuses on Sales Planning, Trade Promotion Management, Analytics, and Optimization. UpClear has clients in more than 18 countries, and operates out of New York City, London, and Hong Kong. BluePlanner has been recognized by Consumer Goods Technology as one of the leading solutions for Sales Optimization. UpClear is growing at a rate of more than 50% per year.
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           New York, NY
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           CPG, CPG Consulting: 4 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_0fa40283d9e9b933">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Administrative/Event Coordinator Assistant
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Diabetes Technology Society
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Burlingame, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Diabetes Technology Society (DTS), a nonprofit organization committed to promoting development and use of technology in the fight against diabetes, seeks a full-time (40 Hours/week) Administrative and Event Coordinator Assistant. DTS hosts four annual diabetes technology conferences and the Admin/Event Assistant duties will include assisting with daily office tasks and in preparing all aspects of conferences and other ongoing projects.
         </p>
         <p>
          The ideal candidate will be able to work under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful, and efficient. A high level of professionalism and confidentiality are crucial to this role. Strong written and verbal communication skills and attention to detail are equally important. Candidates should be deadline-driven, well organized, communicative, team-oriented, and have the ability to prioritize efficiently and manage multiple projects. Candidates must also have a background in science (either through education or work experience).
         </p>
         <p>
          Job duties:
          <br/>
          Work closely with multiple project directors to assist in completing various tasks.
         </p>
         <p>
          Administrative:
          <br/>
          - Screen and route phone calls
          <br/>
          - Assist president of organization with various tasks
          <br/>
          - Manage executive schedules, including meetings, conference calls, and appointments
          <br/>
          - Assist in general office tasks
          <br/>
          - Compose and edit general correspondence
          <br/>
          - Update and maintain databases and mailing lists

          </b>

          The right person for this position will be responsible for the administrative activity required to support a multi-client distribution center. This person will urgently provide answers to internal and external client needs with timely responses; proactively participates in a company team approach; and effectively communicates operational needs and priorities with internal team members.

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

         </p>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0rf82rbqmkcvu" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Insurance Payment Administrator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Lifelong
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          PAYMENT ADMINISTRATOR
         </p>
         <p>
          Lifelong AIDS Alliance is a non-profit community agency committed to preventing the spread of HIV, providing practical support services and advocating for those whose lives are affected by HIV and AIDS. The Evergreen Health Insurance Program (EHIP) is a state-wide program that pays medical insurance premiums for people living with HIV/AIDS in order that they may maintain access to healthcare and life-saving medications.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           DEFINITION:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Insurance Payment Administrator provides operational support for the Washington State Department of Health HIV Insurance Benefits Management Program administered by Lifelong AIDS Alliance, known as the Evergreen Health Insurance Program (EHIP). The Payment Administrator is responsible for administrative, accounting, and reporting tasks that help keep people living with HIV/AIDS insured and supports the work of the EHIP management team. The Insurance Payment Administrator reports to the Insurance Program Manager. This is a full-time, non-exempt, union, regular position.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Premium Coordination
          </b>
          <br/>
          Under the direct supervision of the Program Manager, coordinate the timely and accurate payment of all insurance premiums. Coordinate with Program staff to ensure proper communication, planning, and preparation of payments and processes related to insurance premium payments. Maintain and update accurate information related to premium payments using tools and resources available including client database.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Check Printing
          </b>
          <br/>
          Oversee, manage, and coordinate the weekly, monthly, and quarterly check printing process. Review check requests, conduct audit sample of check request, authorize printing, and distribute check stock. Maintain adequate fiscal controls of payments and check stock. Ensure timely payment of insurance premiums. Maintain adequate cash reserves, monitor and track invoices and payments to and from department of health. Verify eligibility of every payment prior to releasing.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Communication:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Maintain effective, timely, and thorough communication in all direction to ensure co-workers, partners, community stakeholders, clients, funders, and management are well-informed and knowledgeable of the status of the client issues and any program and related issues or projects. Keep clients and case managers apprised of adjustments and changes in the program.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Client Service/Quality Assurance:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Ensure the highest quality service delivery in a culturally appropriate manner by maintaining quality and customer service standards and expectations. Work with vendors and clients to respond to complaints, enquiries, and questions. Maintain secure and confidential client information
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Technical knowledge:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Serve as a technical resource on matters related to COBRA regulations, Washington state insurance laws and regulations, Medicare, Medicaid, insurance plans, the insurance marketplace, the Affordable Care Act, and state-funded insurance programs. Be an expert on matters related to ADAP, insurance enrollment and EIP enrollment. Assist clients and case managers to determine appropriate insurance.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Research and Analysis:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Engage critical thinking skills to conduct thorough and comprehensive analysis and research. Analyze data and information to ensure correct, thorough, and appropriate action is taken to respond to client application and/or vendor accounts. Conduct thorough research and complete investigations in matters related to fiscal and financial anomalies in the program.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Program Coordination
          </b>
          <br/>
          Maintain and track data and reports pertaining to insurance program as directed. Process reports and data requests from Program Management and/or DOH. Ensure complete and accurate case notes in client database. Monitor and order office supplies. Oversee and facilitate all incoming and outgoing mail. Process insurance verification from carriers and vendors.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           ORGANIZATIONAL CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Attend and participate in team and all-staff meetings.
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in Lifelong Team Building trainings and events.
          </li>
          <li>
           Remain active in the recruitment and appreciation of volunteers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in Lifelongs Employee Performance Management Process.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate ability to work effectively and productively with others (including supervisors, colleagues, volunteers and clients).
          </li>
          <li>
           Regular and reliable attendance, with regular and reliable hours as defined by your supervisor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledgeable about the progression and treatment of HIV/AIDS.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate ability to work with people of diverse socio-economic backgrounds, ethnicities, beliefs, sexual orientation and lifestyle.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain confidentiality of financial, donor and client records.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Three or more years of relevant experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to organize, prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines in a time-sensitive environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Detail oriented with a high level of accuracy
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with project planning, implementation and evaluation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess an understanding of professional boundaries.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated skills and strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of applications, including Excel, Access and Word.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience working with Dynamics or similar accounting software
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate clearly and professionally in both verbal and written form.
          </li>
          <li>
           Professional phone skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Comfort with public speaking and public outreach
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven ability to work independently and in a collaborative team environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with group facilitation, conflict resolution and a working knowledge of organizational development issues.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to respond quickly to change.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to develop good working relationships with internal and external customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated ability to work effectively under stressful conditions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift up to 25 lbs
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           Candidates for employment at Lifelong should be aware that this is a unique work environment in which topics of sexuality and sexual orientation are an integral part of our everyday prevention and care work and are often discussed openly. Individuals who are uncomfortable with such topics, discussions and the occasional related graphic representations may choose not to work at Lifelong.
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Accuracy: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_0fbf237e8a054dd1">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Support Technician
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       First Choice Health
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Who We Are:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          First Choice Health is a Seattle-based, physician and hospital-owned company serving Washington and the Northwest since 1985. We now serve well over one million people with our array of products and services. Our Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) is recognized as the leading independent PPO in Washington State and has a growing regional presence in Oregon, Idaho, Montana and Alaska.
         </p>
         <p>
          We occupy a great downtown location, pay competitive salaries and offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, health savings accounts, flexible spending accounts, life and disability insurance, EAP, 401(k), profit sharing, tuition reimbursement, transportation assistance, credit union and gym
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Who We're Looking For:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Our team is looking for a customer service focused individual who enjoys helping people solve problems and use their technology more effectively. You should have a superior understanding of the Windows 7 operating system and be well versed in a variety of common productivity and business applications. As a service desk technician you'll be responsible for prioritizing technology issues reported from fellow employees and work to resolve issues and fulfill requests. Youll need to clearly communicate the status of our systems and create concise documents that help people make better use of their technology. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are fundamental to this position.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Who You'll Be Working With:
          </b>
          <br/>
          You'll rely on an infrastructure team available for problem escalation and troubleshooting assistance. Our team of skilled support technicians, system administrators, and system engineers are focused on ensuring our users have access to the tools and resources necessary to support our growing business. Since we're a small team, youll be exposed to many different components of the technology infrastructure. The scope of your job may be broader when compared to similar positions at other organizations  this provides you the opportunity to develop and grow your skills with a wide range of technologies.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           What You'll Be Doing:
          </b>
          <br/>
          We've made some big investments to keep our infrastructure robust, reliable, and current. We have a highly virtualized infrastructure and almost half of our users work in a virtual desktop environment. We interact regularly with our in-house development team to support several mission-critical applications. As a service desk technician, youll work directly with our employees in person and over the phone to ensure that not only their problems are resolved but that new technologies are leveraged to make their jobs easier.
         </p>
         <p>
          Here are some of the technologies youll be working with:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           VMWARE View Horizon VDI
          </li>
          <li>
           Veeam Backup and Recovery
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft Exchange 2013
          </li>
          <li>
           Skype for Business
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft Active Directory
          </li>
          <li>
           System Center Configuration Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Windows 7
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft Office 2010/13
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Some of the Skills We're Looking For:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong in person and over-the-phone customer support skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Solid written and verbal communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical people
          </li>
          <li>
           Aptitude to efficiently organize and prioritize tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Advanced working knowledge of Windows 7 and common software applications
          </li>
          <li>
           Fundamental understanding of Active Directory and common administrative tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Innate desire to solve problems
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Why Work Here
          </b>
          <b>
           :
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           You'll be part of a small, effective team that values collaboration and welcomes new ideas
          </li>
          <li>
           We offer some great benefits that go beyond the standard stuff: among a host of other benefits, youll have access to an Orca card, discounts at many local companies, a wellness program, and technical training resources.
          </li>
          <li>
           Great downtown Seattle location and flexible work schedules
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Knowledge of Windows 7 and common software applications: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0ro9lpb9jpcjl" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Case Manager, Mental Health
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Fairfax Behavioral Health
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Monroe, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Case Manager, mental health
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Here at Fairfax
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Theres a unique reward in improving lives.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          It takes a passion for meeting the behavioral health needs of our communities and a special experience that meets the high expectations patients have come to expect of the Fairfax Behavioral Health team. We are currently expanding into Snohomish County with a new 34-bed psychiatric hospital serving older adults on the campus of Evergreen Health Monroe You could join our newest team in one of the following openings:
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Case Manager, Mental Health
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          You will utilize evidence-based practice in assist patients in meeting their psychosocial needs while enabling them, through therapeutic skills, to achieve an optimal level of emotional health. This includes treatment planning, psycho-social assessment, psycho-education, short-term supportive family, group therapy and discharge planning, including liaison with community resources.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           What You Need to Succeed
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          We prefer 3 years, post-Masters experience in a psychiatric health care setting which should include a background in individual and family group therapies, crisis intervention, and treatment planning as well as strong clinical assessment skills.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Masters degree from an accredited college or university in Social Work is preferred; mental health field required
          </li>
          <li>
           Strongly preferred for the employee be licensed in the state of Washington as a Social Worker
          </li>
          <li>
           Masters degree in a Behavioral Health science, excepting MSW, must possess a valid Washington State Counseling License
          </li>
          <li>
           Employee will obtain CPR, first aid, Handle with Care, and Verbal De-Escalation certification
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Generous Benefits Portfolio
          </b>
          <br/>
          Fairfax Behavioral Health offers an excellent time off plan, medical, dental, vision, employee assistance program, life and long-term disability benefits, 401(k) plan, and no parking fees for full-time and part-time employees.
         </p>
         <p>

        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Looking for an exciting opportunity with career growth? The Bay Club Company is currently accepting applications for part-time and full-time positions of Front Desk Attendant. We are looking for motivated team players who are comfortable working in a structured environment to work at our location in Corte Madera. Our members provide our Club with a dedicated clientele, and we encourage a strong customer service focus in our team.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Bay Club Company maintains the highest standards of professional service, and has earned a reputation as one of the leading private-club companies in the United States. Visit our website at www.bayclubs.com to explore our clubs.
         </p>
         <p>
          Position responsibilities include but are not limited to:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Greet members and guests upon arrival to the Club
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide exceptional customer service, while checking members into the club, answering and transferring phone calls, and providing information about the club and programs
          </li>
          <li>
           Understand and anticipate the needs of members; be attentive, listen carefully and follow up
          </li>
          <li>
           Operate cash register, process payments and book program and class reservations
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain a clean, safe work environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Opening and/or closing duties including cash management
          </li>
          <li>
           Enforce the rules and policies of the Club
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Qualified candidates will possess the following skills, abilities and experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum of one (1) year of experience in the hospitality industry or related customer service position
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent communication with employees, members, and guests
          </li>
          <li>
           Enthusiastic, friendly attitude and professional appearance
          </li>
          <li>
           Good organizational skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Reliable team player with the ability to work under pressure and multitask
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of hospitality and/or fitness industry a plus
          </li>
          <li>
           A flexible schedule and the ability to work mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Enjoy the following benefits of employment with the Bay Club Company:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A strong member base and dedicated clientele
          </li>
          <li>
           Employee service and retail discount
          </li>
          <li>
           Full use of Club facilities and services including tennis, aquatics, and athletics
          </li>
          <li>
           Employment with a large, financially sound Company with a growing family of clubs
          </li>
          <li>
           The tenets of the Bay Club Company mission statement, service promise and values, and the delivery of these tenets to our members, guests, and Associates
          </li>
          <li>
           Service Standards and the support of the standards through training and practice
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           That is 34 to 44 Hours per Week.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
          <b>
           COPY
          </b>
          <b>
           OF THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          DMV driving report: You may pick up your DMV report from the DMV office or go online at: https://www.dmv.ca.gov/portal/dmv/detail/online/dr/welcome
         </p>

          <b>

          </b>
          Ages 21 to 25 yrs.
         </p>

           </b>
          </li>
          <li>

           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>

           </b>
          </li>

           </b>
          </li>

           </b>

           </b>
          </li>

          </b>

         </p>

          </li>

           </b>
          </li>

           </b>

           <b>
            No cell phone violations
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          *
          <br/>
          <b>
           Full Time positions are available with Progistics and after a probationary period
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           We offer Medical, &amp; PTO. 90 DAYS PTO, 60 DAYS Medical coverage
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Hourly Wage: $13.50 per hour ($20.25 per hour overtime rate)
          <br/>

         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Work Schedule:
          </b>
          <br/>
          You MUST be available 7 days a week.
          <br/>
          You will work 5 days, weekends days are a MUST!!
         </p>
         <p>

         <p>

           Qualifications/Competencies/Position Requirements:
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           <i>
            Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The ability to demonstrate Company values of Honesty, Integrity and Commitment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reliable, resilient and good administrative skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Team player with the ability to work using own initiative.
          </li>
          <li>
           Detail oriented.
          </li>

          </li>

           Work well under pressure.
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer skills  Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Bluebeam ,Foundation
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to multi-task and handle consistent workflow.
          </li>
          <li>
           Good listening skills and retention/memory.
          </li>
          <li>
           Focused, determined and motivated.
          </li>
          <li>
           Calm, helpful and professional approach.
          </li>
          <li>
           Initiative to follow-up on pending issues.
          </li>
          <li>
           Self disciplined and able to work independently with minimal supervision.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           <i>
            Proposals
           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assist estimators to prepare proposals for delivery to customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow up with customers as requested by Estimators.
          </li>
          <li>
           Expedite any requests made by the customers regarding proposals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare site maps for the proposals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Requesting plans and specs from prospective customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           E-mail/mail/fax proposals and site maps to customer within 1 hour of request from estimator.
          </li>
          <li>
           Process T&amp;M Jobs for all Estimator's
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>
            Job Opening
           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Enter all aspects of job information into accounting system- Foundation
          </li>
          <li>
           Create job site magnets for scheduling purposes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Check wish sheet to determine magnet information including quantity, check with estimator for scheduled days.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare job folder (1) original to be filed central location, Estimator's files, include site drawings, details, plans and any other pertinent information that pertains to completing the job. (1) electronic file to be scanned on the M Drive.
          </li>
          <li>
           Process all Change Orders as requested by Estimator.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>
            Public Bids
           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Visit different websites for upcoming public bid opportunities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Requesting plans and specs from prospective customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Request, prepare, and coordinate responsive bid documents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assisting in DVBE requirements, meeting good faith effort, advertisements, mailings, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Order bonds -
           <i>
            Bid Bond, Payment &amp; Performance Bond.
           </i>
          </li>
          <li>
           Post bid documents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Notify bonding company of bid results.
          </li>
          <li>
           Preparation of post-bid paperwork when a bid is won.
          </li>
          <li>
           Publish Bid List on a Weekly Basis.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>

           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Submit for appropriate signatures
           <i>
            . (Alan B./ Daren Y/Sandra Y.)
           </i>
          </li>
          <li>
           Obtain Certificate of Insurance as specified in contract documents.
          </li>
          <li>
           <i>
            Submit to customer with all requested documents, schedule of values, insurance certificate, business license, etc.
            <i>
             (Create Transmittal Sheet prior to sending, scan copies of all into J: Drive - Current Year - Jobs - Estimator's name).
            </i>
           </i>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>

           </i>
          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Office Services Coordinator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Otis McAllister, Inc
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Oakland, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Overview
          </b>
          <br/>
          The primary role of the Office Services Coordinator is to assure the Company that she provides exemplary administrative support in the areas listed below. This would be accomplished by performing the tasks below and identifying opportunities and areas of improvement in general office operations and utilize Otis McAllisters resources more efficiently.
          <br/>
          Primary Job Duties and Responsibilities:
          <br/>
          <b>
           Shipments
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Prepare samples for shipment (i.e., re-package, label, organize).
          </li>
          <li>
           Package product samples for shipment including shipping documentation and commercial invoices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Produce daily shipping manifest.
          </li>
          <li>
           Receive shipments and route to recipient; produce daily inbound shipments reports.
          </li>
          <li>
           Process/route incoming mail; post outgoing mail.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           General Office/Clerical:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Sign for packages, deliveries, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Operate Kyocera scanning equipment (copy, fax, scan, print).
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare light correspondence and report preparation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ordering of shipping, mail, file room/office and kitchen supplies supplies.
          </li>
          <li>
           Photocopy, collate, and file general correspondence accurately, both numerically and alphabetically.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide administrative support to senior management as needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform company/office errands.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain kitchen area (i.e., dishwasher, coffee machines; clean general area).
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Technology
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Maintain office machines (i.e., multi-function copiers, printers, facsimiles, postage meter, scales, etc.); and when necessary, arrange for maintenance services of office equipment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Accounting
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Prepare monthly and yearly account folders:
          </li>
          <li>
           Orders billing
          </li>
          <li>
           Cash receipts
          </li>
          <li>
           Pre-Post invoices
          </li>
          <li>
           Sales journal
          </li>
          <li>
           Service journal
          </li>
          <li>
           Military sales report
          </li>
          <li>
           Sorts receivables
          </li>
          <li>
           Creates and files cash receipts book
          </li>
          <li>
           Files receivable checks by customer
          </li>
          <li>
           Files invoices by customer and year
          </li>
          <li>
           Sorts and files invoices (end of month)
          </li>
          <li>
           File all payables by customer and year.
          </li>
          <li>
           Sort, stuff, and mail payable checks and invoices.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Records Retention:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Digitize (scan) physical records into PDF-searchable and non-searchable electronic archive format for retrieval by all company employees.
          </li>
          <li>
           Dispose of physical files in accordance with the companys Records Retention Plan.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist in maintaining archive (off-site) storage for ease of retrieval.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Reception/Conference Room:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Greet guests and all walk-in traffic.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare welcome signage for important visitors.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with the needs of conference room meetings (water/coffee/tea service, snacks, lunches, clean-up, etc.).
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with office celebrations (birthdays, quarterly luncheons, special events), including planning, setup, and clean-up.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with company flowers and plants (maintenance/watering, disposal, etc.).
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Job Requirements and Experience:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum of a high school diploma and/or associates degree, and/or minimum of one year of work experience in positions with similar duties as listed above.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to deal effectively and professionally with all types of individuals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Effective communication skills to include written, verbal and interpersonal.  * * High degree of accuracy, detail and results oriented.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reliable, dependable, and strong work ethic.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite as well as proficiency in Internet usage.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to multi-task is paramount for this position.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Professional Responsibilities:
          </b>
          <br/>
          All employees are expected to keep abreast of current trends and techniques in the food trading industry; participate in the activities of professionals appropriate for the food trading business and the company (if and when appropriate); pursue continuing education as needed.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Special Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to sit at computer for several hours/day.
          </li>
          <li>
           Lifting of 50 pounds.
          </li>
          <li>
           Physical ability to maintain office equipment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          From time to time tasks may be assigned outside the parameters of this job description. Every attempt will be made to supply advance notice; however there may be times when advance notice is not possible. This job description will be updated as items are added, changed or deleted. During the annual review the candidate should advise the supervisor of areas that have evolved and need revisions.
          <br/>
          We offer a competitive compensation package including medical, dental, and life insurances and flexible spending account and profit sharing (discretionary). Additionally, we offer a 401(k) plan and employee stock options upon eligibility.
          <i>
           An Equal Opportunity Employer.
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Oakland, CA
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_448281d5e115891a">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">

       </td>

       </font>

      </span>

      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Founded in 2001, Arkadin is one of the largest and fastest growing collaboration service providers in the world. With a vision rooted in the belief that progress emerges from people's desire to share, Arkadin offers a complete range of remote audio, web, and video conferencing and Unified Communications solutions.
         </p>
         <p>
          The services are delivered in the SaaS model for fast, scalable deployments and a high ROI. Its global network of 55 operating centers in 33 countries has dedicated local-language support teams to service its 37,000 customers.
         </p>
         <p>
          Specialties
          <br/>
          cloud, remote collaboration solutions, webcasting, webinar services, unified communications, web conferencing, conference calling, video conferencing, audio conferencing
         </p>
         <p>
          For more information, please visit www.arkadin.com
         </p>
         <p>
          $12.50 per hour + yearly bonus
         </p>
         <p>
          Objective
          <br/>
          The Event Specialist provides support for events utilizing Audio Conferencing and/or Web Conferencing by managing the event and/or providing live assistance with basic audio and/or web questions. The Event Specialist will manage Investor Relations calls, High Profile Events and interact with High Profile customers. The Event Specialist uses enhanced customer service skills to resolve challenging situations, communicates in a clear and professional speaking voice and applies knowledge learned to ensure a professional and successful event.
         </p>
         <p>
          Key Tasks
          <br/>
          Manages and ensures a successful event by timely and properly preparing for assigned events, review all pertinent information with the customer during preconference, provides guidance and support to the customer during the event and handles any post call duties.Answer participant lines timely and properly identifies and places into conference. Answer participant lines requiring assistance timely during live events. Provides the necessary follow-up on quality issues. Contributes to the continuous quality improvement of processes. Assess customer requirements and offers accurate solutions to customer requests. Maintains current on job knowledge in order to assist in various team areas
         </p>
         <p>
          Core Skills
          <br/>
          Professional and clear speaking voice
          <br/>
          Excellent written communication skills
          <br/>
          Strong organizational and time management skills
          <br/>
          Excellent customer service skills2-4 years of Customer Service
          <br/>
          Proven track record in conflict and problem resolution
          <br/>
          Able to work independently or as part of a team, with strict attention to detail and an ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment
          <br/>
          Computer proficient with a strong working knowledge of Microsoft
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Schaumburg, IL
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school or equivalent
          </li>
         </ul>
