     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Assistant Store Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Salvation Army ARC
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           The Salvation Army Adult Rehabilitation Center (ARC)
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Seattle, WA
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           POSITION AVAILABLE: ASSISTANT STORE MANAGER
          </b>
          <br/>
          STATUS: Non-Exempt, Full Time
         </p>
         <p>
          The Salvation Army ARC in Seattle has an opening for an Assistant Store Manager.
          <b>
           This position will work out of our Seattle SODO and our Shoreline stores.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          We are seeking candidates that are personable, positive and like to work in an energetic team environment. The successful candidate needs to have retail management experience preferably in a non-profit environment. They also need to believe in providing excellent customer service and enjoy driving sales. We are not the typical retail store as our merchandise changes almost every day depending on our donations. We have everything from furniture to clothing to electronics to china. Our store will reflect a fresh new approach to traditional thrift shopping.
          <br/>
          If this sounds like you please forward your resume and cover letter.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School diploma or equivalent
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Minimum of one full year supervisory retail experience
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to operate POS/Cash Registers and have the ability to schedule and supervise store employees
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent customer service skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate effectively with management, store employees, customers and donors
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid Drivers License
          </li>
          <li>
           Must pass a criminal background check
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           DUTIES:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Take an active role and partner with the Store Manager in the day-to-day operation of the store
          </li>
          <li>
           Assume responsibility for all store operations in the absence of the Store Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides coaching, training and development of store employees
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain good customer relations with customers and the community
          </li>
          <li>
           Set an example by greeting all customers and donors
          </li>
          <li>
           In the absence of the Store Manager communicate any personnel issues with Administration
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure all sales staff are providing excellent customer service, handling of customer complaints in a fair and expeditious manner
          </li>
          <li>
           In absence of Store Manager put payroll information together
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure timely completion of paperwork including store reports, daily deposits, safety reports, timekeeping
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete all tasks as assigned by the Store Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties and responsibilities as may be assigned, from time to time, as related to the position
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to sit, walk, stand, bend , squat, climb, kneel and twist on an intermittent or continuous basis
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate clearly on the telephone
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to perform various repetitive motion tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
          </li>
         </ul>

           THE SALVATION ARMY MISSION STATEMENT:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian Church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the Gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.

      </span>

      <span class="location">

       <td class="snip">

         <p>
          BioCentury's Database Group has full-time openings for Research Analysts.
         </p>
         <p>
          Research Analysts write for BioCentury's Week in Review Report and collect, categorize, input, and edit various types of data (e.g. clinical, financial, licensing and M&amp;A transactions) that populate BioCentury's database platform BCIQ. The responsibilities include writing news items, data collection, data entry and data curation. Data collection may include reviewing company press releases and SEC filings, conducting phone interviews with company executives, and searching relevant sections of BioCentury archives.
         </p>
         <p>
          The position requires at least an undergraduate degree in one of the following disciplines: Life Sciences (e.g. Biology), Business, Finance, Journalism, English, Economics or related fields. Relevant work experience is a plus.
         </p>
         <p>
          All candidates will be asked to:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Demonstrate the ability to write clearly and accurately to deadline
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate the ability to multitask and quickly prioritize work assignments
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate the ability to research, write and manipulate data through knowledgeable use of online technologies, including Access as well as Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Demonstrate the ability to analyze, categorize and summarize key aspects of drugs in development, clinical trial data, company financial data, and licensing transactions
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Demonstrate the ability to communicate effectively with information sources and colleagues in a professional manner
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          The work environment is casual; however, professional behavior, rapt attention to detail and the ability to meet deadlines are absolute requirements.
         </p>
         <p>
          Finally, all BioCentury employees are obligated to meet the highest standards with respect to accuracy, conflict of interest, intellectual property rights, slander, confidentiality and respect for information sources and readers.
         </p>

          Compensation and Benefits commensurate with experience
          <br/>
          Company sponsored health and life insurance
          <br/>
          Bonus / 401K Plan
          <br/>

We are a non-smoking facility, first time applicants only please. No phone calls, as we are a small office and not staffed to accept phone inquiries. For information about our clinic, visit www.rundoctor.com. Candidates of interest will be contacted for an interview. We welcome serious candidates to visit our clinic and drop off resume in person. Thank you.
          <br/>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Medical Office preferred, but not required.: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Accounts Payable Clerk
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       PR Asset Management
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Park Ridge, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Property management company headquartered in Park Ridge, Illinois has an immediate position available for an Accounts Payable person to add to its staff. Responsibilities include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Charges expenses to accounts and cost centers by analyzing invoice/expense reports; records payables via web-based accounts payable software.
          </li>
          <li>
           Completes portion of team-based check run, sends out payment and follows up on vendor accounts as assigned to ensure payments posted properly.
          </li>
          <li>
           Issues Purchase Orders as assigned and reconciles differences in spending to original purchase order amounts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reconciles processed work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balances.
          </li>
          <li>
           Executes inter-company reimbursement process; helps to establish better procedures for inter-company reimbursement process over time.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains company policy in regards to monitoring discount opportunities; verifying federal id numbers; scheduling and preparing checks; resolving purchase order, contract, invoice, or payment discrepancies and documentation; insuring credit is received for outstanding memos; issuing stop-payments or purchase order amendments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains accounting ledgers by verifying and posting account transactions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Verifies vendor accounts by reconciling monthly statements and related transactions; acts as front line of communication with all assigned vendor accounts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains records and books in accordance with company policy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential.
          </li>
          <li>
           Continuously improves job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, seeking feedback from supervisor, and working with peers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Accomplishes accounting and organizational mission through completing other tasks as assigned.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicates to supervisor input on process improvement and works with Accounts Payable team to achieve continuous improvement.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           2+ years of Accounts Payable experience;
          </li>
          <li>
           High school diploma required, Bachelors Degree preferred with college courses in accounting, business, or a related discipline;
          </li>
          <li>
           Detail oriented, professional attitude, reliable
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient in Excel and Word
          </li>
          <li>
           Previous experience with Yardi software, property management accounting or construction accounting a plus;
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess strong organizational and time management skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Thorough knowledge of applicable accounts payable/general ledger systems and procedures, financial chart of accounts and corporate procedures
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to interact with employees and vendors in a professional manner
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently and with a team in a fast-paced and high volume environment with emphasis on accuracy and timeliness.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          This is an excellent opportunity for the right person. If interested, please submit resume outlining salary requirements.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Accounts Payable : 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>

          DMV driving report: You may pick up your DMV report from the DMV office or go online at: https://www.dmv.ca.gov/portal/dmv/detail/online/dr/welcome

         </p>

         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>
           Familiarity with UX / UI
          <br/>
           Can internalize and interpret direction
          <br/>
           Can do the above without rolling your eyes (mostly)
          <br/>
           Don't find the notion of a generally fast pace to be disagreeable or concerning

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0tphgabqikf9u" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        SAT teacher - Yleana follow-up program
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Yleana Leadership Academy
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       New York, NY
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $25 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Yleana Leadership Academy is a residential summer academy for high school students preparing for the SAT. Students (all of whom qualify for free or reduced lunch, most of whom are first-generation) attend on full scholarship and, besides studying for the SAT, study entrepreneurship (which culminates in a one-day startup fair with real live entrepreneurs) and discuss issues that will come to affect them as they enter The Rest Of Their Lives (intended caps) through the writings of authors such as bell hooks, Sherman Alexie, Junot Diaz, Judith Ortiz Cofer, Richard Wright, etc, while becoming a part of a welcoming and introspective camp community. One of the greatest compliments we received last year was a student who had been in foster care and had had trouble with her parents telling us that Yleana was the first place she felt safe, like people really cared about her. We strive to create and promote that atmosphere - a loving place for kids who haven't always had it easy.
         </p>
         <p>
          In 2015, our average score improvement in a 3-week period was 250 points on the SAT. Besides just raising our kids' SAT scores, we also ensure that they have the one-on-one financial aid follow-up that they need in order to apply those SAT scores to the schools that would meet both their financial and academic needs, and we are currently working on the institution of a mentoring program which would track the kids throughout their college career, hopefully helping them stay in school and graduate. To learn more about us, check out our promotional video (which gives the look and feel of an Yleana experience): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vzrQKbI37jg
         </p>
         <p>
          We are seeking teachers who are willing to follow the Yleana strategic approach to the SAT (some training will be provided; students already have materials, and teachers will be provided materials as well). Teachers should have significant SAT teaching experience as well as familiarity with the specific classroom management challenges of working in an after-school urban setting.
         </p>
         <p>
          Dates of employ will be
          <b>
           September 12, 19, and 26, 2015 from 9:30am-4:30pm
          </b>
          . Teachers will administer tests/portions of a test as well as teaching. On those days when teachers administer tests/portions of a test, they will be responsible for scanning students' answer sheets and uploading them to a scoring DB, and then printing them and distributing them in the next class, after they are scored.
          <br/>
          THIS IS A SHORT-TERM COMMITMENT, but with the possibility of future work (Yleana is always seeking teachers in a variety of settings). We are looking for creative, engaging, exciting individuals who are willing to take the lead in making learning happen, while still sticking to the strategies that the kids have learned. It is EXTREMELY important to us that you honor the way kids have already learned to take the test and the strategies they know.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are a diverse camp and are actively recruiting a diverse staff.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Contract
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $25.00 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           SAT tutoring experience/currently tutoring the SATs - desired not required: 1 year: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required license or certification:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           scored above 650 on all three sections - desired not required
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required language:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           feel comfortable tutoring both verbal and math
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_34dc4bbea0fd97a0">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">

As 'no ordinary designer label', Ted Baker offers menswear, womenswear, accessories (and everything in between), and is renowned for high quality and a distinctive use of pattern and color. The brand's unconventional approach to fashion, irreverent sense of humor and, above all, unswerving attention to detail, appeals to style-conscious men and women who trust Ted to deliver that certain something... a little out of the ordinary.

If you're a fashionable lad or lass and know the difference between a loo and a lift, then you might just make the cut. And don't forget, Ted has a soft spot for the cheeky, innovative, creative and flirty. If this is music to your ears, then you may very well have found your next home.
         </p>
         <p>
          ExciTED for a new opportunity? Ted Baker London is currently seeking a talented and Store Manager for our beautiful standalone in San Francisco!
         </p>
         <p>

       <font size="+1">

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">

      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Country Club Hills, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Crew Member
          <br/>
          Sonic Drive-in  Country Club Hills, IL
          <br/>
          Crew Member
         </p>
         <p>
          SONIC is all about having fun while you work and gaining a sense of accomplishment along the way. Not only do you work with fantastic people, you'll get great pay, flexible hours and a cool uniform.
         </p>
         <p>
          As a Sonic Crew Member, you will be responsible for performing in several fun, basic stations as needed. These stations include: Fountain &amp; Frozen, Food Production, Grill, Fryer, Switchboard, and if applicable, Drive-Thru. Duties may include:
         </p>
         <p>
          - Taking orders and making accurate change quickly
          <br/>
          - Serving our guests with enthusiasm
          <br/>
          - Packaging all menu items and checking for product quality and consistency
          <br/>
          - Preparing drinks and ice cream treats
          <br/>
          - Preparing food orders, cooking on the grill, operating the fry station as needed
          <br/>
          - Cleaning the drive-in -- including trash disposal, mopping, sweeping, washing dishes, wiping counter-tops and sanitizing food areas
         </p>
         <p>
          What were looking for...
         </p>
         <p>
          - Friendly and welcoming individuals who enjoy providing pleasant and courteous service to our guests!
          <br/>
          - A willingness to cross-train in all of the stations. It never gets dull here!
          <br/>
          - Team members who have a passion for Sonic!
          <br/>
          - Motivated individuals who are team players and committed to keeping our drive-in clean and safe.
         </p>
         <p>
          Sure, classic cars and vintage threads may be things of the past, but the Sonic Drive-In experience will always be groovy, right on, awesome, wicked, fab, the bees knees, cruisin . . . you get the picture! Its downright sensational!!
         </p>
         <p>
          All thats missing is you so Apply Today!
         </p>
         <p>
          Sonic and its independent franchise owners are Equal Opportunity Employers.
         </p>
         <p>
          Additional Requirements:
         </p>
         <p>
          - Ability to work irregular hours, nights, weekends and holidays
          <br/>
          - Ability to be flexible in all situations based on business need
          <br/>
          - Effective communication skills; basic math and reading skills
          <br/>
          - Abide by the companys appearance, uniform and hygiene standards

       <font size="+1">

       </font>
      </b>

      <span class="company">

      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Mateo, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The main lobby Receptionist is the initial contact for clients, staff and the public, whether in person or over the telephone. This position is responsible for making every person who visits or calls feel welcome and valued, assisting them in a considerate, helpful and professional manner. In addition, the Receptionist performs general clerical duties and assists with processing program payments, creating and maintaining logs of checks and credit card payments received, and other projects and facilities.
         </p>
         <p>
          REPORTS TO: Facilities Manager
         </p>
         <p>
          JOB CLASSIFICATION: Full Time, Non-exempt
         </p>
         <p>
          QUALIFICATIONS:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bilingual English/Spanish is required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Good organizational skills, accuracy and attention to detail.
          </li>
          <li>
           Tact, maturity, good judgment, and a cheerful, welcoming manner.  * Intermediate level computer literacy (Microsoft Office, Internet &amp; Email).
          </li>
          <li>
           Good verbal and written communication skills.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Dependability, punctuality, and flexibility in handling unexpected situations.  * Displays a consistently calm, cheerful, respectful, and confident presence.  * Ability to handle cash and check receipts with reliability and accountability.  * Previous front desk/customer service experience preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Comfortable with exposure to sensitive and personal information; able to maintain strict confidentiality at all times.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be over 18, have a High School diploma or equivalent, and pass an background check (FBI/DOJ).
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           General office functions (multi-line phones, faxes, accurate messages documented and forwarded to appropriate persons, copiers, mail distribution, and miscellaneous requests for assistance as prioritized and approved by manager).
          </li>
          <li>
           Operation of common office machines, including a postage meter, fax machine, copier, and credit card processor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Receive, log and issue receipts for cash, check, money orders, and credit card payments.  * Help with collection and logging of credit card receipts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be familiar with all Peninsula Family Service Programs, assisting clients and visitors with referrals as necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure safety of children in our Early Learning Center by keeping track of parents/relatives/other adults that drop off/pick up and allow only specified adults to pick them up.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follows Peninsula Family Service Policies and Procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with Facilities Manager as a team, apprising manager of pertinent issues/problem areas and assisting with solutions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to perform duties with minimal supervision.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned by supervisor.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          We are a global logistics and freight forwarding company with over 30 years experience in over 160 locations worldwide. Our office is located in South San Francisco, CA. At this time, we have the immediate need for a customer service agent.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Acts as customer liaison
          </li>
          <li>
           Collaborates with customer service team and sales representative to maintain customer profile
          </li>
          <li>
           Determines the most efficient routing method
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists in the processing of shipment and/or orders
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate with internal offices and/or international agents as necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists dispatch counterparts in communication with various transportation &amp; warehouse agents
          </li>
          <li>
           Tracks/traces shipment through proof of delivery as applicable
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to efficiently and effectively handle heavy phone calls
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to effectively and promptly respond to heavy email volume
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to independently answer questions or inquiries regarding shipments and resolve problems
          </li>
          <li>
           Capable of navigating through our computer systems and applications to retrieve invaluable information
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Requirements and Skills:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Demonstrates excellent interpersonal skills. Able to work effectively with all levels of the organization, internal and external customers and current and potential clients in the marketplace.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills. Exhibits a high degree of professionalism.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to prioritize, multi-task and work independently with minimal supervision.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to keep current with changes in our business trends, customer base and agents servicing our clients so that calls are efficiently and accurately routed to the proper CSR or department.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates accuracy, thoroughness, effectiveness and efficiency in carryout out new assignments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to consistently meet the Companys expectations of attendance, punctuality. Stays on task.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient at using computer systems and applications (e.g. MS Word Office, Excel, CW and other IT applications as trained/required).
          </li>
          <li>
           Has a working knowledge of government regulations and industry standards as applicable.
          </li>
          <li>
           May be required to work alternative work schedules (4/10, weekends, nights, etc.)
          </li>
          <li>
           Some industry experience preferred with focus on Export shipments.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Compensation: Base salary is commensurate with experience. We offer full benefits, matching 401(k) and career growth opportunities. EOE.
         </p>
         <p>
          If a career in global logistics is right for you, please email your resume, cover letter and salary requirements to the email address shown on this job posting.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Some industry experience preferred: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          It is an exciting time to join Mission Neighborhood Centers, Inc. (MNC)!
         </p>
         <p>
          Mission Neighborhood Centers is seeking a part-time Bi-Lingual English/Spanish
          <b>
           Parent Leadership Assistant
          </b>
          to support the Parent Leadership Manager.
         </p>
         <p>
          The
          <b>
           Parent Leadership Assistant
          </b>
          is responsible for assisting with the administration functions and office support activities such as: facilities coordination, reception, mail, purchasing, phone calls, maintaining client files, and other various clerical projects and duties as assigned, including but not limited to: typing, copying, taking phone messages, answering client questions, restocking supplies, cleaning work area, preparing and sending outgoing mail.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you are seeking an organization that values, promotes and develops leadership by delivering culturally sensitive, multi-generational, community based services that empower families to build strong, healthy, and vibrant neighborhoods with the vision of a strong, healthier and more vibrant community that respects and celebrates its many rich, cultural traditions, please apply.
         </p>
         <p>
          We would like to meet you if you are looking for an opportunity to be part of an organization whose mission it is to provide quality childcare and restorative services for troubled youth, enrich in-school and after-school programs, develop workforces for a changing economy, and provide our elders with activities and support that help them avoid isolation and depression and you can answer "yes" to all of the following questions:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Do you want to improve the quality of peoples lives?
          </li>
          <li>
           Are you seeking meaning and purpose in your career?
          </li>
          <li>
           Do you wish you could work with an organization actually making a difference in peoples lives?
          </li>
          <li>
           Are you self-motivated and results driven, yet lighthearted and fun?
          </li>
          <li>
           Do you exceed people's expectations of you on a regular basis?
          </li>
          <li>
           Is being busy preferable to being bored?
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Our ideal candidate loves to multi-task, enjoys managing a variety of responsibilities and has strong customer service skills, proficient with MS Word, mixed with a variety of strong administrative skills and experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          Primary Duties
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           File Management  filing, updating and creating files for clients, vendors, freelancers and employees.
          </li>
          <li>
           Data entry in a variety of databases.
          </li>
          <li>
           Receive/sort/distribute all incoming postal mail  sort all accounts payable: invoices/checks etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with clerical duties such as photocopying, binding proposals/presentations, faxing, filing and collating.
          </li>
          <li>
           Primary phone duty; provide callers with information such as company address, directions to the company location, company fax numbers, company website, and other related information.
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct outreach calls to parents to schedule for required involvement in the program.
          </li>
          <li>
           Greeting arriving parents and children and engaging parents and children in activities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for childcare coordination and delivery.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain child recreation areas and prep for upcoming activities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Track and maintain parent and child sign in sheets and contracts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain and update contacts in address book and client lists.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proofread copy for spelling, grammar, and layout, making appropriate changes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for all shipping, packaging, shipping tracking, postage, and receiving.
          </li>
          <li>
           Greet clients, set up the conference room and organize beverages and food for clients.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain inventory and coordinate ordering, receiving and stocking of all commonly used office, education, art supplies, janitorial and kitchen supplies.
          </li>
          <li>
           Negotiate the purchase of office supplies and furniture, office equipment, etc. in accordance with company purchasing policies and budgets.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for the facilities day-to-day operations (such as recycling, stocking supplies, maintain cleanliness of common areas on a daily basis, etc.)
          </li>
          <li>
           Supervise the maintenance of office equipment, including copier, fax machine, etc. Perform simple maintenance on office equipment and within confines of facility.
          </li>
          <li>
           Participates in development and implementation of corporate disaster preparedness and risk management plan and trainings.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Participates as needed in special projects and runs errands as directed by staff.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Qualifications
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           1+ year administrative experience in an office setting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Bi-Lingual English/Spanish required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work requires consistent attention to detail in materials, establishing priorities and meeting deadlines.
          </li>
          <li>
           Possession of a high school diploma or equivalent (GED).
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational, analytical, interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal).
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be proactive, self-directing and project oriented with ability to meet deadlines.
          </li>
          <li>
           Personality: Upbeat, energetic, takes initiative, fast learner, detail oriented, dependable, takes pride in work and a positive attitude.
          </li>
          <li>
           Professional Appearance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to maintain flexible attitude and approach towards assignments and successfully operate under ambiguous guidelines in a changing environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Consistently demonstrate cooperative behavior and relate to all levels of staff, supervisors, children and families from diverse ethnic, cultural and linguistic backgrounds.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be willing to take on all manner of assignments, be flexible and work well both independently and in a team environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient computer skills: Microsoft Word.
          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Benefits
         </p>
         <p>
          This position is part-time (20 hours) Tuesday and Thursday 8:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., and an additional 4 hours with flexibility for Monday or Wednesday, with an hourly rate of $16 plus benefits, which include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           SF Sick Time
          </li>
          <li>
           Commuter Benefits an easy access to Public Transportation
          </li>
          <li>
           Amazing SF location the Mission and Excelsior Districts melting pot of cultures, cuisines and colorful Latino markets; close to upscale restaurants and the best taquerias and street foods.
          </li>
          <li>
           Close knit, caring team
          </li>
          <li>
           And more!
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

         </p>

          If you are qualified and interested in applying, please send your resume and cover letter with Parent Leadership Assistant in the subject line. Phone calls are not accepted nor will we call you if you dont submit employment information. Please visit our web site for additional information on our company at: www.mncsf.org

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Production Supervisor
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Taylor Farms Northwest
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Kent, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Taylor Farms Northwest is a Food Processing facility located in Kent, WA. Our company services the retail and food service industry offering a variety of value added items including but not limited to ready to eat green and pasta salads, dips, quiches, veggie trays and fruit trays. We are a growing business that currently employs over 500 individuals. We are searching for qualified candidates that are looking for the ability to learn and grow within our organization.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Summary of Responsibilities:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Job responsibilities include but are not limited to supervising employees in Production, along with monitoring and recording the operation of the machinery/equipment and production process to attain daily production requirements. The Production Supervisor will effectively train and/or assist in training production personnel to operate the machinery/equipment and understand production methods. Adhere to existing corporate policies and procedures in the Production Department. The Supervisor is also responsible for following all allergen procedures. Assist in maintaining accurate documentation related to employee performance, machinery/equipment operation, and production of finished products. Ensure audits and preventative maintenance schedules are performed to established procedures. Provide the Production Manager with objective feedback to affect objective evaluations. Meet or exceed daily production requirements per product specifications as set by production planning. Perform other job-related duties and responsibilities in a timely fashion as requested. Reports directly to the Production Manager and then the Plant Manager in turn. Production Supervisors are responsible for Food Safety and Quality. The Production Supervisors is to cover in the absence of the Production Managers.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Train and monitor production staff by giving direction on daily tasks to meet production deadlines.
          </li>
          <li>
           Report all food safety and quality issues immediately to management.
          </li>
          <li>
           Requires hands-on capability to operate all machinery and equipment within the boundaries of available manuals, instruction, and personal expertise.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to work in cold a refrigerated environment of 34 -37 degrees.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to lift a minimum of 50lbs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure Production crew is processing food according to HACPP and GMP regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Pack items in designated containers or bags per customer order.
          </li>
          <li>
           Order and plan for daily ingredients needed for recipes of food service items.
          </li>
          <li>
           Oversee that crew is safely using equipment as necessary in preparation of food service items by providing training and appropriate PPE.
          </li>
          <li>
           Operate all functions of position alone and without assistance if necessary. Fill in for the Production Manager when absent.
          </li>
          <li>
           Oversee that production employees are accurately storing, labeling, and dating all incoming food product to insure maximum shelf life and fixing any discrepancies.
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure all food storage areas are properly secured and locked.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide a clean and orderly work area for employees to ensure safety and insure proper sanitation guidelines are followed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Minimum Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school education or up to 6 months related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read/write/record data and perform mathematical calculations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to direct a diverse group of people with excellent written or oral communication.
          </li>
          <li>
           Attendance is critical; employee must be dependable to report to work on time and work a flexible schedule.
          </li>
          <li>
           Required to follow Safety policy and report employee accidents or unsafe work conditions to Production Manager.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have working knowledge and experience in the preparation of food items.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work under more than average stressful conditions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to perform work in limited physical space with variable ventilation, smoke and extreme temperatures.
          </li>
          <li>
           At least 2 years of Production and Processing leadership experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Intermediate word and excel skills for correspondence and reporting duties
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational skills
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Full time employees are eligible for benefits after 60-days, which includes medical, dental, vision, Short Term and Long Term disability and Life Insurance. 401k 4% match is available after 90 days.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Production and Processing leadership: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
          <br/>
          Construction Administrator is responsible for performing a wide range of administrative duties including the coordination, preparation, processing, distribution and tracking of all construction documentation associated with multiple projects.           </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Serve as a liaison between all project team members including the Client, Architect, Engineer, Subcontractors, Project Managers and Field Personnel to communicate and coordinate project schedules, submittals, drawings and contractual documents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to coordinate, prioritize and organize multiple projects with fast pace schedules
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to utilize software programs and templates to fit the Project Managers documentation processing, distribution and tracking
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate and support all areas of the project from startup to closeout.
          </li>
          <li>
           Utilize organizational skills to handle multiple tasks effectively and coordinate events and people.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           SKILLS
          </b>
          <br/>
          We are looking for a highly organized, task orientated person that works with accuracy and urgency to support a Project Manager and Estimator with the day to day management of multiple construction projects. This person should have knowledge of construction contracts, RFI's, RFP's, AIA documentation, insurance requirements, change order process management. It is expected that this person will be a confident communicator both with internal and external subcontractors, architects and engineering firms. Strong computer skills will be critical to the coordination of multiple projects but candidate must be extremely proficient with Excel and good working knowledge of Outlook, Powerpoint. Familiarity with Quickbooks, Timberline and Microsoft Publisher a plus. Detail-oriented approach to problem solving. Flexible attitude to do whatever it takes to get the job done. Positive attitude and excellent customer service.
         </p>
         <p>
          A minimum of 4 years of experience as a Construction Administrator, Coordinator or Assistant PM role is preferred but enthusiastic and capable candidates with just 2 years would be considered.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           TASKS
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Accounts Receivable creation and tracking
          </li>
          <li>
           Billing/Requisitions/Lien-waiver, sworn statement process
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensuring insurance requirements are met
          </li>
          <li>
           Subcontractor/vendor set up
          </li>
          <li>
           Job set up
          </li>
          <li>
           Processing and tracking submittals
          </li>
          <li>
           Contractor and sub-contractor change orders
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare contracts and purchase orders
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare accounting/profitability reports using Quickbooks
          </li>
          <li>
           Compiling Close-Out Books
          </li>
          <li>
           Processing of lien waivers, sworn statements
          </li>
          <li>
           The ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Chicago, IL
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A minimum of 4 years as a Construction Administrator, Coordinator or Assistant PM : 4 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_99decff7c15dca19">

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Educational Assistant - Before &amp; After School Care
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Issaquah School District
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $14.62 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          JOB TITLE: Issaquah School District Before &amp; After School Care Educational Assistant
         </p>
         <p>
          COMPENSATION: 14.62 / hour
         </p>
         <p>
          BENEFITS: Full benefit package available for select 20+ hour / week positions. Heath insurance, retirement, etc. See the ISD job portal posting for benefit details.
         </p>
         <p>
          POSITION SUMMARY: Under the direction of the BASC leadership, the Educational Assistant instructs individual and/or small groups of students
         </p>
         <p>
          HOURS: Multiple 30+ hours / week afternoon and morning shifts available. Elementary and middle school positions available.
         </p>
         <p>
          Sample Hours - (hours will vary depending on school)
         </p>
         <p>
          Morning:
          <br/>
          6:30 - 9:15AM (M - F)
          <br/>
          6:30 - 8:30AM (M - F)
         </p>
         <p>
          Afternoon:
          <br/>
          2:30 - 6:00PM (M, T, Thu, F), 12:00 - 6:30PM (W)
          <br/>
          3:00 - 6:00PM (M, T, Thur, F), 12:30 - 6:30PM (W)
          <br/>
          2:00 - 6:00PM (M - F)
         </p>
         <p>
          ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assists in implementing the daily program under the direction of the BASC Site Coordinator.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists in daily set-up, maintaining a clean and well-organized area. * Greets parents and students coming to the center.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responds directly to the needs of the children and initiates steps to satisfy concerns in a timely manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides positive discipline and redirection when interacting with students about appropriate behavior.
          </li>
          <li>
           Documents the interaction and submits paperwork as appropriate to the BASC Site Coordinator.
          </li>
          <li>
           Treats all students and co-workers with dignity and respect
          </li>
          <li>
           Supervises daily routines, such as snack and outdoor play.
          </li>
          <li>
           Helps with general housekeeping and custodial tasks.
          </li>
          <li>
           Possesses knowledge of and adheres to District Regulations and Procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Participates in special projects as assigned and perform related duties and key responsibilities consistent with the scope and intent of the position.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          QUALIFICATIONS: Skills, Knowledge and Abilities
         </p>
         <p>
          SKILLS are required to perform multiple tasks with a potential need to upgrade skills in order to meet changing job conditions. Specific skill based competencies required to satisfactorily perform the functions of the job include: Communication skills, initiative, carrying out planned activities.
         </p>
         <p>
          KNOWLEDGE is required pertaining to concepts of grammar and punctuation; stages of child development and learning styles; and age appropriate activities.
         </p>
         <p>
          ABILITY is required to relate to students, staff, parents, and building staff; to work with other adults in a team situation; follow directions.
         </p>
         <p>
          EDUCATION: High school diploma or GED.EXPEREINCE: Job related experience is desired..
         </p>
         <p>
          CLEARANCES: Criminal Justice fingerprint/Background Clearance.
         </p>
         <p>
          TO APPLY: Please visit the Issaquah School District job portal at
          <b>
           https://issaquahjobs.hrmplus.net/
          </b>
          . Under the classified tab look for job 1113. A complete application including a resume, cover letter and references are required to move on to the interview step.
         </p>
         <p>
          For more information about the position and our program, please visit the Before &amp; After School Care website at
          <b>
           http://beforeandafterschoolcare.weebly.com/job-opportunities.html.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Part-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $14.62 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required license or certification:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Drivers License
          </li>
         </ul>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Senior Mortgage Processor
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Seattle Bank
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Senior Mortgage Loan Processor
         </p>
         <p>
          Seattle Bank is a boutique bank focused on the needs of individuals, businesses and business owners throughout the Pacific Northwest and beyond. Our experienced team of bankers blends big-bank solutions with boutique-bank service  creating more value by aligning tailored financial resources and services to match each client's needs. Through a combination of customized solutions, exceptional service and accelerated answers from local decision-makers, we make the complex simple.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our ideal candidate will be skilled in many areas of mortgage lending, have high ethical standards, and be inspired and driven by the idea of working with a team to provide a great customer experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          Essential Duties
          <br/>
          1) Process conforming, jumbo, FHA, VA loans.
          <br/>
          2) Process applications from time of receipt of application to submission of the loan package to underwriting, closing and loan funding.
          <br/>
          3) Gather, organize and track loan documentation utilizing loan origination system.
          <br/>
          4) Work closely with mortgage production officer, underwriters and vendors, including secondary market institutions as applicable.
          <br/>
          5) Verify customer income documentation, order flood, credit reports and other required documentation.
          <br/>
          6) Order and review preliminary title reports for accuracy and coordinate the clearing of title issues/exceptions, ensuring proper lien position is secure.
          <br/>
          7) Open escrow with title/escrow companies.
          <br/>
          8) Effectively communicate verbally and in writing with internal and external customers.
          <br/>
          9) Execute closing actions to ensure a timely and effective closing process.
          <br/>
          10) Provide coverage to the front desk receptionist during breaks and lunches.
          <br/>
          11) Perform other duties/projects as assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          Minimum requirements
         </p>
         <p>
          These specifications are general guidelines based on the minimum experience normally considered essential to the satisfactory performance of this position. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required to perform the position in a satisfactory manner. Individual abilities may result in some deviation from these guidelines.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School Diploma and Some College
          </li>
          <li>
           5+ years senior processing experience: conforming jumbo, FHA, VA loans.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient in the following software systems  Calyx Point, Encompass, PC Lender, Doc Magic, Microsoft Office Suite, and AUS.
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of Lending Regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Tactfulness and proven ability to handle sensitive and confidential situations.
          </li>
          <li>
           High energy, self-motivated, and service-oriented attitude.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work on multiple projects with the flexibility for changing priorities; the ability to work with constant interruptions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and assist other department needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must display strong team attitude and have strong professional skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Effective organizational and time management skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to effectively utilize computer technology. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite programs.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Seattle Bank is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status, such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age.
         </p>
         <p>
          Offers of employment are subject to successfully passing credit and criminal background check.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Senior Processing Experience: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Construction Accounting Manager/Controller
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Cobra BEC, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Auburn, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Construction Controller/Accounting Manager
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for a highly driven, talented and diverse accountant to join our growing team! Cobra BEC is a full scope building envelope contractor with four office locations: Auburn WA, Spokane WA, Boise ID, and Dallas TX. Cobra is family owned and operated, and employs 200-300 people throughout the United States. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to be involved in various areas of the company and handle accounting responsibilities for multiple offices!
         </p>
         <p>
          The position is responsible for direct oversight of the accounting team. Responsibilities also include creating and implementing policies and procedures, resolving and documenting accounting issues in addition to creating procedures to make the close and reporting processes more efficient and accurate.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Construction Controller Duties:
          </b>
          <br/>
          -Timely preparation, review and distribution of all monthly financial reporting packages.
          <br/>
          -Maintain both stand-alone and consolidated entity financials.
          <br/>
          -Review all monthly job cost reconciliations and branch work in progress schedules.
          <br/>
          -Work with the accounting team to complete the monthly accounting close process.
          <br/>
          -Develop accounting procedures, job cost budgets for new projects. Oversee their monthly progress reports.
          <br/>
          -Oversee cash management functions for the entire company and all construction projects. Complete all bank reconciliations.
          <br/>
          -Oversee the accounts payable function as all projects in progress. Ensure that all subcontractors and vendors meet all requirements of contract agreement prior to any payments.
          <br/>
          -Coordinate the preparation of annual tax return with outside CPA firm.
          <br/>
          -Prepare internal books and schedules for outside auditors in timely fashion (quarterly, annually).
          <br/>
          -Asset Management via depreciation schedules, inventory, cost centers.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Risk Management:
          </b>
          <br/>
          -Ensure all subcontractors have completed our insurance, Accident Prevention Program and sub-tier contract requirements prior to starting work and/or getting paid.
          <br/>
          -Maintain certificates of insurance and help assist CFO during annual insurance audit.
          <br/>
          -Work with CFO to ensure all new customer contracts that come in are reviewed by our attorney's on retainer.
          <br/>
          -Create a summary of those attorney's comments to create an internal knowledge database.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Business Development:
          </b>
          <br/>
          -Research and complete licensing requirements in all states we are looking at going after work in.
          <br/>
          -Become active in Industry Associations as well as with Customers and Contractors.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Education and Experience:
          </b>
          <br/>
          -4 year degree in Accounting or related field.
          <br/>
          -CPA preferred, but not required.
          <br/>
          -Background of familiarity in construction industry would be beneficial, especially experience in percentage of completion accounting.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Salary:
          </b>
          <br/>
          DOE, with full benefits and bonus structure.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
        </span>

Coupled with a commitment to quality and dedication to customer service, the staff and management of URG professionals are working to exceed customer expectations and help them meet their operational goals and financial objectives. URG strives to earn a reputation as a recognized and respected leader in the underground utility contracting industry, while maintaining the highest standards of safety and integrity in the industry. Ultimately, URG aims to become the premier, one stop shop for customers by providing a multitude of services including underground utility locating, natural gas leakage surveying , underground utility construction and maintenance, customer retention, audits, and damage investigations and recoupment. Our relationship with our customers is more than just a contract, it is a partnership based on a shared commitment to quality, service, and success. Our customers success is our success.

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Project Purchasing Associate
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Western Truck Fab
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Hayward, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          We are looking for a dynamic person with a great work ethic and excellent attention to detail to fulfill our Purchasing Project Manager role using Shop-Tech E2 ERP. The purchasing project associate will be responsible for purchasing our daily inventory needs as part of a purchasing team, and managing the parts needs of a multitude of different projects to their completion. Part of the responsibility of the project manager will be ongoing data entry, building bill of materials is the main part of the job, learning our inventory,and working with shoptech E2 system. The purchasing project associate must be proficient with computers, Microsoft Office Suit, etc. The candidate will be responsible for quickly learning our processes and procedures. The candidate for this position will be responsible for quickly learning inventory parts and their function. Experience using an ERP system to make bill of materials is a must. Must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Please note: This position is a non supervisory position and we are looking for team members with experience making Bill Of Materials in the SHOPTECH E2 system, we may consider experience in other ERP systems.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Purchasing and Data Entry Required : 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_936490312f300a14">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0t6r9ab9jqd9p" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Facility Coordinator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       The NJ Center of Physical Therapy
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Wayne, NJ
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $13 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           FACILITY COORDINATOR
          </b>
          <br/>
          <i>
           Full Time - Start ASAP - Wayne, NJ
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           OUR OPPORTUNITY
          </b>
          <br/>
          Facility Coordinators play key roles in our organization. They are in charge of knowing the schedule and readying the treatment area and equipment before patients even arrive, so no one ever has to wait. They ensure no one is ever left alone, and that everyone has a friendly person to keep them company (plus offer snacks and coffee!) to everyone who walks into the office a level of world-class, personalized customer service they wont find elsewhere. They ensure our patients begin and end their sessions with smiles on their faces. Our Facility Coordinators also maintain the clinic and organize our supplies to create a very smooth workflow for all departments. They also act as the conduits of communication between our different departments and between the patients and team when needed.
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a fun, lively opportunity for people who love to be up and active and not stuck behind a desk. You must be positive, organized, professional, and genuinely enjoy helping people and serving others.
         </p>
         <p>
          At a higher level, leaders in this position will focus on leading communication, continual innovation and development, training others, and will take an active role in growing our business.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           OUR CULTURE
          </b>
          <br/>
          Our company was founded on the philosophy that helping people and treating them like people (not like injuries) is the most fulfilling and rewarding thing to do -- and its the right thing to do. Thats why we spend more time getting to know our patients than any other practice in the area.
         </p>
         <p>
          As a result our patients feel more comfortable with each step of their recovery, and often they actually feel better faster as a result of having so much direct care by our Doctors. Feeling positive is a very powerful thing, and when combined with true professionalism and Doctoral expertise, its unstoppable.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES
          </b>
          <br/>
          This opportunity is geared toward people who want to stay and grow their careers right here in the company! Long-term applicants only, please. All opportunities are self-directed -- internally motivated people will do well here.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our current Facility Managers at each office, our Organizational Facility Manager (who runs this department for the whole company), our Training Managers, Supply Manager, and others such as our Reimbursement and Organizational Admin managers all started as Facility Coordinators. Additionally, the companys Executive Team is open to people in every position. You can create a career within the organization any way you choose.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
          </b>
          <br/>
          Pay starts at $13/hour with the opportunity to grow from there. We also offer an above-and-beyond benefit package (effective at 90 days) that is better than whats offered by companies much larger and more famous than ours.
         </p>
         <p>
          We have an awesome three-day full time schedule. One team works Mon/Weds/Fri, and the other team works Tues/Thurs/Sat. And yes, this means you get the other 4 days off! We're open 7:45am-9:30pm Monday through Friday, and 7:15am-6:30pm on Saturdays. Team placement depends upon where we need someone the most once we find the right person for the job.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           HOW TO APPLY
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          1. E-mail me (Trish) directly at njptpeople(at)gmail(dot)com with both your resume and a personalized note. Blank emails or form letters cannot be accepted. I want to get to know you as a person! Tell me about you, your goals, and why you think youll be great for this position.
         </p>
         <p>
          2.BONUS! If you feel connected to this ad, make me a 1-minute Video Cover Letter and send me a link to it (Email attachments probably wont work, but Youtube, Dropbox, Google Drive, or any cloud storage solution will work).
         </p>
         <p>
          Im looking forward to talking with you!
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_9708f2ea2031cbf4">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>

      </b>

      </span>

      <span class="location">

      </span>

       $30,000 - $42,000 a year
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Progistics Distribution is continuing our massive expansion with Google Express here in the SF Bay Area.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are hiring Google Express Drivers for our Mountain View, CA location to deliver products purchased from Google Express.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for drivers with great knowledge of the San Francisco bay area along with the use of GPS technology.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           **Replies to your applying are made through email correspondence**
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           **Please check your spam filter as well**
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           *SERIOUS APPLICANTS ONLY THAT CAN COMMIT TO A SCHEDULE*
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           *MUST BE OVER 21 YEARS OLD TO APPLY*
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Drivers will be dispatched from our Mountain View, CA location.
          </li>
          <li>
           Shifts average between 7-9 hours per day.
          </li>
          <li>
           That is 34 to 44 Hours per Week.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           We provide the following:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Company cargo vans, box trucks
          </li>
          <li>
           Gas cards
          </li>
          <li>
           Uniforms
          </li>
          <li>
           Scanner equipment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          You MUST pass a background check &amp; drug screen in order to join our team.
          <br/>
          <b>
           TO BE CONSIDERED TO APPLY/ INTERVIEW
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           YOU MUST COME PREPARED &amp; MUST PROVIDE A
          </b>
          <b>
           COPY
          </b>
          <b>
           OF THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Copy of a valid (CURRENT) driver license.
          <br/>
          Proof to work in the U.S; Social Security Card, Current Passport.
          <br/>
          DMV driving report: You may pick up your DMV report from the DMV office or go online at: https://www.dmv.ca.gov/portal/dmv/detail/online/dr/welcome
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           DMV REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
          Ages 21 to 25 yrs.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <b>
            Clean driving report, nothing on DMV report
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No moving violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No seat belt violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No at-fault accidents
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No suspensions
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No cell phone violations
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           DMV REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
          25 yrs. +
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           One point within the last 3 years
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No seat belt violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No at-fault accidents
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No suspensions
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No cell phone violations
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          *
          <br/>
          <b>
           Full Time positions are available with Progistics and after a probationary period
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           We offer Medical, &amp; PTO. 90 DAYS PTO, 60 DAYS Medical coverage
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Hourly Wage: $13.50 per hour ($20.25 per hour overtime rate)
          <br/>
          Pay: $30,000 to $42,000 per year based off Hourly wage, potential overtime, &amp; benefits.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Work Schedule:
          </b>
          <br/>
          You MUST be available 7 days a week.
          <br/>
          You will work 5 days, weekends days are a MUST!!
         </p>
         <p>
          Please email your resumes ASAP for your chance to work with a GREAT TEAM!!!
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Mountain View, CA
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Delivery Experience, Cargo Van, Clean DMV record: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school or equivalent
          </li>
         </ul>

         <p>
          Would you like to be part of a growing, fast-paced, fulfilling workplace? Do you enjoy desserts, celebrating birthdays, and making people happy? If so, keep reading. . . Deerfields Bakery 125+ year family baking tradition begins with its people. Deerfields Bakery believes its team members are the most important part of the recipe for success. We help put smiles on over 100,000 faces annually with delicious cakes, cookies, pastries, gluten-free products, home-roasted organic coffee, and more. At Deerfields Bakery, we believe in celebrating all that life has to offer. We believe that every moment deserves the very best, whether celebrating your child's first birthday or simply sharing a cup of coffee with an old friend. What do you believe in? We have high expectations for those that join our team; we aren't just looking for anyone, so if you think you've got what it takes, this is the place for you!
          <br/>
          What we need from you:
          <br/>
          1) Experience working in retail and merchandising stock
          <br/>
          2) Availability on weekends and holidays
          <br/>
          3) Upbeat and energetic attitude to ensure exceptional customer service
          <br/>
          4) Resume complete with references.
         </p>
         <p>
          Deerfields Bakery offers excellent health, dental and vision benefits, paid holidays &amp; PTO, along with professional development training opportunities.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Retail: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0d6ui2bqmjfp9" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
