   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Sales and Customer Service - Start Now (Ref: #!#JP-83242#!#)
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       SLS Recruitment
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Our Client within San Francisco is looking for a driven individual to work within their growing team.
         </p>

       </font>
      </b>

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          In the nations most exclusive urban enclaves from one coast to the other, Crescent Heights has earned a reputation for producing landmark, high-rise new construction residences, as well as Hotels, Office Space, and Rental Properties. Our properties have dramatically reshaped the traditional concepts of living in America. The finest amenities. Innovative architecture. Signature interiors. Quality construction. These attributes define Crescent Heights properties. As one of the nations largest developers and marketers of high-rise, multifamily housing and hotels, the companys premier properties stretch from New York to Los Angeles, from Miami to Chicago, and points in between with corporate headquarters in Miami, Florida.
         </p>
         <p>
          We provide a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package to all full time regular employees.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           SUMMARY:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Serves as the guests liaison for both hotel and non-hotel services. Functions are an extension of front desk agent duties. Assists the guest-regardless of whether inquiries concern in-hotel or off-premises attractions, facilities, services, or activities. Knows how to provide concise and accurate directions. Makes reservations and obtains tickets for flights, the theater, or special events. Organizes special functions such as VIP cocktail receptions. Arranges for secretarial services.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Develops a strong knowledge of the hotels facilities and services and of the surrounding community.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides guests with directions to attractions or facilities in or outside the property.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides guests with information about attractions, facilities, services, and activities in or outside the property.
          </li>
          <li>
           Makes guest reservations for air or other forms of transportation when requested. Obtains necessary itinerary and tickets.
          </li>
          <li>
           Makes guest reservations for the theater and other forms of entertainment when requested. Obtains necessary tickets and provides directions to facilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Organizes special functions as directed by management.
          </li>
          <li>
           Arranges secretarial and other office services.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates guest requests for special services or equipment with the appropriate department.
          </li>
          <li>
           Contacts roomed guests periodically to ascertain any special needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Handles guest complaints and solves problems to the degree possible.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
          </b>
          <br/>
          None
          <br/>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Requires knowledge of basic front desk equipment and procedures including the operation of a multi-line telephone system.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
          </b>
          :
          <br/>
          Minimum of two years college education with emphasis in business, sales, or marketing.
          <br/>
          Minimum of two years sales experience with a minimum of one year supervisory experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           CERTIFICATES and LICENSES:
          </b>
          <br/>
          None.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           LANGUAGE SKILLS:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Must be able to speak, read, write and understand the primary language(s) used in the workplace
          <br/>
          and by guests who visit the workplace.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           REASONING ABILITY:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Ability to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Requires bending, stooping, climbing, standing, walking, sitting, fingering, reaching, grasping,
          <br/>
          lifting, carrying, repetitive motions, visual acuity, hearing, writing, and speaking. Must exert
          <br/>
          well-paced mobility to reach other departments of the hotel on a timely basis.
         </p>

          </b>
          <br/>
          The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This job is performed in a hotel environment with a moderate noise level.

         <p>
          AnchorFree is looking to hire an A player to lead the global organic user acquisition efforts for Hotspot Shield on both web and mobile, based out of our Menlo Park corporate headquarters, reporting directly to the Director of Marketing. ASO and Mobile Growth Manager will be responsible for optimizing Hotspot Shields keyword rankings on Apple App Store and Google Play Store with the goal of increasing organic installs. Establishing direct relationships with store managers at Apple and Google and working with them to get more visibility for Hotspot Shield on app stores will be one of the key priorities. Growth manager will also be responsible for identifying 3rd party Android app stores globally, getting Hotspot Shield listed in each of them and establishing direct relationships with them to improve Hotspot Shields visibility.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Responsibilities:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The goal of this position is to increase the number of new Hotspot Shield users exponentially, through the following initiatives:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Improve Hotspot Shields keyword rankings on Apple App Store and Google Play.
          </li>
          <li>
           Come up with innovative ideas to improve Hotspot Shields star rating and reviews on mobile stores.
          </li>
          <li>
           Establish direct relationships with store managers at Apple and Google and work with them to get more visibility for Hotspot Shield on the app stores, through initiatives such as getting our app featured.
          </li>
          <li>
           Get Hotspot Shield listed on 3rd party Android app stores globally and establish direct relationships with these stores to increase the visibility of our app.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Preferable Job Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Experience with App Store Optimization (ASO).
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven track record of optimizing and improving keyword rankings on major app stores (iOS App Store and Google Play Store).
          </li>
          <li>
           Existing solid relationships with app store managers at Apple and Google.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with mobile attribution tracking and analytics tools (Tune, Ad-x, Kochava, Apsalar, Appsflyer, etc.)
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with mobile marketing tools including AppAnnie, SensorTower, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with large mobile userbases, cohort studies, ROI analysis, revenue-per-user metrics.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with consumer-based Internet companies.
          </li>
          <li>
           Extensive knowledge of web analytics, metrics and tools/platforms such as Google Analytics or others
          </li>
          <li>
           Exceptional Excel Skills, proficiency with Powerpoint and Word
          </li>
          <li>
           Outstanding analytical skills and data-driven mindset
          </li>
          <li>
           HTML knowledge preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent verbal and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Detailed oriented and organized
          </li>
          <li>
           Understanding of success metrics and ability to measure performance accurately
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelors degree or higher required
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>
            AnchorFree Compensation and Benefits:
           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Waterproofing Applicator/Foremen
          <br/>
          M Squared Safety, LLC
         </p>
         <p>
          The Waterproofing applicator coordinates the activities of a commercial waterproofing team, works as part of a team and is responsible for overall knowledge of above grade, between slab, and below grade waterproofing installations. A working knowledge of industrial floor coatings is a bonus.
         </p>
         <p>
          2+ yrs. of direct waterproofing experience that includes liquid applied and sheet applied experience. Hot rubber a plus. Air barrier a plus.
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Communicates project details and status to the client and management team.
          <br/>
          2. Prepares concrete surfaces for waterproofing systems
          <br/>
          3. Installs various waterproofing systems.
          <br/>
          3. Installs industrial floor coatings (Epoxies, urethanes, MMAs, polyaspartics).
          <br/>
          5. Keeps job trailers and warehouse space cleaned and organized.
          <br/>
          6. Maintains flooring equipment, which includes making minor repairs and ensures proper supplies are on-hand to complete assigned tasks.
          <br/>
          7. Works effectively as a member of a team, while continuously striving to improve and develop individual skills and knowledge.
          <br/>
          8. Observes and adheres to company and client safety policies, operating procedures, and technical requirements and specifications.
         </p>
         <p>
          KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
         </p>
         <p>
          Ability to:
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Read and understand service requests, material labels, production information, and directions.
          <br/>
          2. Operate various pieces of equipment, such as sanders, concrete grinders (hand and walk behind), burnishers, scrubbers, and other specialty equipment.
          <br/>
          3. Follow directions, understand work rules and procedures, and work as part of a team.
          <br/>
          4. Work independently with minimal supervision.
          <br/>
          5. Possess good multitasking skills.
          <br/>
          6. Meet or exceed deadlines and schedules.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Requirements:
         </p>
         <p>
          Must have a clean driving record within the last three years and must be able to pass a drug screen and a nationwide background check. Bi-Lingual (Spanish/English)
         </p>
         <p>
          Experience Requirement:
         </p>
         <p>
          Waterproofing-above between and below grade/Caulking
          <br/>
          Trowel/Roller Experience
         </p>
         <p>
          Experience with any of the following systems is a bonus:
         </p>
         <p>
          Deck Coating Systems
          <br/>
          NeoGuard, Blydeck, Vulcom, Pacific Polymers, Tremco
         </p>
         <p>
          Below Grade and Between Slab Waterproofing
         </p>
         <p>
          Dry Sheets Goods - Bituthane
         </p>
         <p>

          <br/>

         </p>
         <p>
          Hot Rubber Waterproofing using Henrys, Tremco
          <br/>
          Between Slab and Below Grade
         </p>

         </p>

          <br/>

         </p>

          <br/>

         </p>

          <br/>

         </p>

         </p>
         <p>

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.          </p>
         <p>
          Commercial/Industrial Work Environment:
         </p>
         <p>
          While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand and reach with hands and arms. The employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear.
         </p>
         <p>
          The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 80 pounds. Any lifting in excess of 80 pounds requires a team lifting approach. Employee must possess sufficient physical strength and ability to perform a variety of maintenance tasks related to the care and maintenance of buildings and equipment. The use of other personal protective equipment is required as it applies to working in inside or outside conditions; such as, excessive heat, dust, wind, sun, rain, storms, or any other conditions requiring personal safety practices.
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>

          </li>

       Bensenville, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Do you spend your free time window shopping or browsing home decor catalogs and e-commerce sites? Do you have a background in digital marketing or merchandising? Do you love thinking about why customers buy?
          <br/>
          The Baxton Studio / Wholesale Interiors Site Merchandising team is looking for an enthusiastic and data-driven site merchandiser to help grow our Furniture categories. This person will join a team of e-commerce professionals focused on building a world-class customer experience across our online customer's stores. The Furniture category are the core of the Baxton Studio catalog and this is an excellent opportunity for an individual to make a significant impact on the business.
         </p>
         <p>
          The successful Site Merchandiser will combine an understanding of what drives e-commerce sales, an interest in the home goods retail sector, and a passion for user experience to improve Baxton Studio's onsite merchandising strategy. He/she will build an unparalleled shopping experience in collaboration with team leaders across the company including Category Management, Sales, Customer Service, Merchandising Operations, Brand, and Marketing. As an expert on how our customers shop for sofas, dining tables, rugs, lamps, and many other productsmembers of the Site Merchandising team advocate for the needs of our customers and serve as go-to people for insight on site traffic and merchandising performance.
         </p>
         <p>
          The ideal candidate is innovative, enthusiastic, and customer-focused with great judgment and creative problem-solving skills. He/she has demonstrated skill with technical tools &amp; processes through website management, digital marketing, advanced data analysis or other similar experience. He/she is passionate about customer behavior and about the ecommerce shopping experience. He/she is extremely organized and comfortable managing multiple cross-functional projects at once. He/she is a skilled personnel manager able to provide strong direction, remove roadblocks, and coach employees to success. He/she must be able to work at both a strategic level (generating innovative ideas for growth) and at a tactical level (executing updates with site merchandising tools, analyzing site and customer data, and solving problems).
          <br/>
          This position will serve our major accounts like Overstock.com, Wayfair, Target, Sears, ect.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities Include:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Serve as the department subject matter expert on merchandising and traffic in a given customer area, product catalog
          </li>
          <li>
           Relentlessly drive improvements to the Baxton Studio's customers' site experience in the Furniture categories through the development and execution of strategic cross-functional projects that will improve conversion rate and drive revenue growth
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain a strong vision for potential site improvements driven by passion for the Baxton Studio customer and brand.
          </li>
          <li>
           Analyze site metrics and related data to identify opportunities to improve merchandising and the customer experience across the various product categories
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain and update the Furniture category pages, product merchandising standards, and navigation experience onsite
          </li>
          <li>
           Partner across Category Management, Storefront, Merchandising Operations, Brand, and Marketing to drive collaborative projects to completion and ensure cohesive customer experience across all touch points
          </li>
          <li>
           Use site, customer, and sales data to analyze results across initiatives and report out on progress
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills/Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA plus 2+ years relevant experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Passionate about the customer with a strong interest in understanding and driving customer behavior
          </li>
          <li>
           Senior presence, able to clearly and consistently work side-by-side across functions and departments and synthesize multiple points of view into a coherent action plan
          </li>
          <li>
           Analytical and process-oriented, comfortable working with large data sets and making data-driven decisions. Experience with web analytics strongly preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to think both creatively and critically. Willing to think outside the box and challenge the status quo, while also fairly evaluating all possible solutions in making strategic decisions
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to manage through ambiguous and subjective situations, including balancing operational efficiency and data analysis with high quality standards and a sense of what is right for the customer
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to manage many projects and drive multiple threads of work to completion
          </li>
          <li>
           Superb communication skills, clear and concise in both written and verbal communication
          </li>
          <li>
           Comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Positive, energetic attitude
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience managing others strongly preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to quickly learn necessary technical tools. Experience with Excel a plus.
          </li>
          <li>
           Passion for the home goods market is a plus
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           About Us
          </b>
          Baxton Studio / Wholesale Interiors offers an extensive selection of home furnishings and decor across all styles and price points. With an unparallelled 1,800 skus, Baxton Studio / Wholesale Interiors helps people find the right product at the right price.
         </p>
         <p>
          Baxton Studio / Wholesale Interiors is headquarted in Bensenville, Il, and employs over 120 people. The company also operates two outlet stores, one in Bensenville, IL and one in Lombard, IL. The company has previously been named one of America's fastest growing companies by the Inc. 500.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Buying / Merchandising: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_4e94fc3e71482f1a">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

          </li>

          </b>

Screen and schedule patient appointments based on medical need and established appointment scheduling guidelines. Answer general questions and provide information.    <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Electronics Technician II
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Laser Techniques Co LLC
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Redmond, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Company:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Laser Techniques Company is involved in cutting-edge design, development and manufacture of precision laser-based measurement and inspection systems for a worldwide client base, including commercial, power, defense, and space applications. Contact us for an opportunity to join our dynamic and fast-paced work environment. Please visit our website at www.laser-ndt.com for more information about our business, technology and client base. Laser Techniques is an equal opportunity employer and offers a competitive pay and benefits package.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Description:
          </b>
          <br/>
          We are looking for an intermediate-level Electronics Technician who is motivated, innovative, and able to work with minimum supervision.
         </p>
         <p>
          The position is expected to include:
          <br/>
           Wiring, mechanical assembly, and testing of electronic instrumentation, sensors and cables
          <br/>
           Trouble-shooting computer instrument hardware and software issues
          <br/>
           Loading software and drivers onto computer instruments
          <br/>
           Testing of PCBs, with minor PCB rework.
          <br/>
           Documentation of electronic assembly and test procedures
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
          <br/>
           A fast learner with solid understanding of electronics and mechanical components.
          <br/>
           Excellent organizational skills, attention-to-detail, and multitasking capability.
          <br/>
           Excellent soldering skills of wires for cables, small wires, and surface mount components.
          <br/>
           Experience with assembly of miniature mechanical components.
          <br/>
           Experience with computer assembly and hardware/software troubleshooting.
          <br/>
           Familiarity with requirements for rugged instrument assembly.
          <br/>
           Ability to read electronic schematics, wiring diagrams and mechanical drawings.
          <br/>
           AA or BS in Electronics.
          <br/>
           Minimum 3 years experience in electronics assembly
          <br/>
           Proficient in MS Word, Excel. OrCAD and Visio experience a plus.
          <br/>
           IPC-A-610 Level II, J-STD-001 training and certification preferred.
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0cjpekb9rpcp1" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Support Coordinator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Novelles Developmental Services/CPES
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Lorenzo, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          In the Supported Living Services (SLS) Program, Support Coordinators are responsible for supervising support to individuals with developmental disabilities. They work independently and use their skills, knowledge, and judgment to develop and affect appropriate individual support plans (ISPs) that enable individuals to live in and connect with their community.
          <br/>
          Their work includes collaboration with the families, Regional Centers, and other service providers. Support Coordinators supervise Direct Support Professional staff and create and approve staff schedules, including requests for time off and coverage for staff that call off sick. Support Coordinators are also responsible for working with individuals, often on flexible schedules, to identify and respond to their needs and preferences.
         </p>
         <p>
          High School Diploma or GED
          <br/>
          Ability to pass Department of Justice background check
          <br/>
          1 year experience in working with individuals with developmental disabilities
          <br/>
          Valid California driver's license and ability to meet insurance requirements
         </p>
         <p>
          EOE
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Experience in working with individuals with developmental disabilities: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_b62f42ad21b3e0e8">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

          We are looking for smart and dynamic individuals to join a phenomenal and fast growing company with big plans to impact the homecare industry. The Implementation Associate role is an entry level position within our Customer Success Department. Youll work closely with new customers, guiding them through the implementation process. You will help them set up their new ClearCare site and make sure their users are trained and that their stakeholders are informed to ensure that the new system will add value to their business. Youll build relationships and be the voice and face of ClearCare. The home care business is a personal one, so in addition to serving as their project manager and business consultant, you may even find yourself becoming a counselor and friend to the customers that you work with.

          Target, Metreon in downtown San Francisco is looking for a passionate, fast, fun, and friendly entry-level HR generalist!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Description:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provide HR support, including time and attendance processing, compliance, schedule generation and editing, payroll processing and other tasks as assigned.
          </li>
          <li>
           Track team member training by entering it in Training Meter.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with recognition programs in the store.
          </li>
          <li>
           Support the compliance and safety culture.
          </li>
          <li>
           Facilitate effective communication within the store by maintaining communication boards and table talkers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Respond to all team member questions and concerns promptly and courteously, directing them to appropriate leaders or resources as needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow company procedures related to HR process best practices and handling confidential information.
          </li>
          <li>
           Give job applicants the help and direction they need by using the Job Application System (JAS), scheduling interviews and understanding the interview process.
          </li>
          <li>
           Keep the Team Service Center (TSC) clean and organized, maintain office files and communication boards, and help maintain break room cleanliness.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Requirements
          </b>
          <b>
           Minimum Requirements
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Cheerful and helpful attitude toward guests and other team members; demonstrates Fast, Fun and Friendly.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to learn and adapt to current technology needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to think quickly on the spot to resolve guest questions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to work independently.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Physical Ability
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Able to enter information on computers and PDAs keyboards.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to scan and handle all merchandise.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to accurately handle cash register operations and cash transactions
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to climb and descend ladders carrying merchandise.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to lift 40 lbs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to place and arrange items on all shelves and racks on selling floor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to move merchandise with appropriate equipment (e.g., tubs, carts and flats) between the stockroom and sales floor.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Job Type: Part-time
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_00ae233a789ed0f5">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

During peak demands the number of transactions in a pay period can reach 12 thousand entries. Experience with multiple pay work-rules for union contacts is a plus.
          <br/>
          2 Process payrolls and benefits for various departments using the E-Time, Payforce Oracle, and manual labor reporting method.
          <br/>
          3 Prepare and process labor/payroll related reports and records to outside organizations such as NYS Unemployment, labor unions, etc.
          <br/>
          4 Provide support, assistance and guidance to other payroll coordinators and assume managerial role in the absence of Assistant Manager.
          <br/>
          5 Process updates to employee master payroll file such as tax exemptions, bank account information and deductions for accurate payroll processing in a timely manner, assume responsibility for Wage Garnishment Enforcement.
          <br/>
          6 Maintain statistical reports for managements use in financial decision.
          <br/>
          7 Maintain highly effective electronic imaging for data retention to comply with internal procedures and NYS / Federal law.
          <br/>
          8 Perform other tasks and special projects as directed to assist in development of departmental goals.
         </p>

          <b>
           Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Experience:
          </b>

          <br/>
           A minimum of five years experience in processing payroll related and financial transactions.
          <br/>
           Customer Service oriented and strong interpersonal skills
          <br/>
           Ability to adapt to shifting priorities, demands and timelines within a fast-paced environment.
          <br/>
          Must be punctual, ability to work flexible hours, to include holidays, dictated by the needs of the business.
          <br/>
           Attention to detail and perform assigned tasks accurately and completely.
          <br/>
           Ability to complete assigned tasks within established deadline.
          <br/>
           Ability to work with little supervision.
         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Community Support Facilitator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Thrive Support Services, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Alameda, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $45,000 a year
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Department:
          </b>
          Supported Living Services
          <br/>
          <b>
           Hours of Work:
          </b>
          Full Time Exempt
          <br/>
          <b>
           Salary:
          </b>
          $40,000 and $45,000annually depending on experience
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Description:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           The Community Support Facilitator
          </b>
          mission is to ensure quality Individualized Services to all people we serve. The
          <b>
           Community Support Facilitator
          </b>
          will maintain program integrity and coordinate supports for client and staff to ensure successful outcomes. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The work environment is a combination of both the office and the clients homes.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications and Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Education and Experience
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA Degree in human services or general studies with a minimum of 4 years of experience in developmental disabilities or related field or MSW with experience or knowledge of developmental disabilities
          </li>
          <li>
           LVN with minimum of
           <b>
            5 years of experience in developmental disabilities or RN with related experience or knowledge
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           A reasonable combination of the above education and experience requirements.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          2. Transportation:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Valid California drivers license
          </li>
          <li>
           Clean driving record (DMV printout is required)
          </li>
          <li>
           Current vehicle registration and use of a vehicle in good running condition during work hours
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid automobile insurance with the required coverage for that vehicle and all passengers.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          3. Other:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The willingness and ability to perform the Essential functions required within the company, such as office reception, answering phone, new referral consultation, use of computer for projects; typing, duties with may be necessary to promote client safety, work collaboratively with the clients and others.
          </li>
          <li>
           Tuberculosis Clearance Screen, Current CPR and First Aid certification
          </li>
          <li>
           Pass criminal background check through fingerprint clearance
          </li>
          <li>
           The willingness and ability to perform all the essential functions of the job.
          </li>
          <li>
           The ability to work collaboratively with clients and coworkers.
          </li>
          <li>
           An employment record of punctuality, good work attendance and reliability.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must provide Social Security Card and complete a I9 application as proof of eligibility to work in the U.S.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Case Management: Under direction of the Program Manager of SLS:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Basic coordination of generic services and natural supports will be performed
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist client with essential lifestyle planning, developing and monitoring the clients individualized Support Plan (ISP) with the Program Manager of SLS.
          </li>
          <li>
           Help the clients with understanding choices regarding lifestyle and assist them in making informed choices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Help the client fulfill the shortterm goals of the ISP, keeping the longterm goals in mind
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain case records according to company procedures. Document progress in Written Annual Plan, Quarterly Reports, Case Supervision Reports, Home Visit Records and Service notes. Ensure all pertinent information is documented in the clients Home Log and the case file.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop a list of specific duties needed to provide for the individual needs of each client and lead the team of each client in a collaborative effort to meet those needs and obtain the clients short and long term goals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor ongoing health, mental/emotional and social status of developmentally disabled adults receiving services.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform routine home visits, assess needs and coordinate and/or perform assistance with community access to doctors or health appointments, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reassess care plan regularly and identify changes in needs for ongoing services.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate and monitor appointments with other agencies, medical and mental health services to be arranged according to the clients needs. Advocate for clients at appointments, coordinating followup measures as indicated.
          </li>
          <li>
           Advocate for the client and provide support during Interdisciplinary Team (IDT) meetings and activities in the community.
          </li>
          <li>
           Network in the community to facilitate the development of natural supports for the clients.
          </li>
          <li>
           Initiate and cofacilitate Circle of Support gatherings to assist the client in maintaining an effective Circle of Support.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          2. Supervision of Team Leaders (TL): Under the direction of the Supported Living Services Program Manager ,
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assisting with the New hire Process: Assist with interview for potential new staff when the team is in need, Conduct Initial Training for all incoming staff that will serve their clients and Introduce new staff to client and team
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide supervision to the Personal Attendants (PA) working in each clients home
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform as a leader to the clients, PA, TL, staff, providing encouragement, direction and training
          </li>
          <li>
           Routinely review the Home Log to ensure proper documentation. Followup on problem issues indicated by the home log documentation
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          3. Conduct Education and Training:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provide initial and ongoing training to PA and TL staff regarding the proper techniques and procedures for care of the client in accordance with Consumer Orientation checklist
          </li>
          <li>
           Approve initial training checklists and all updates to checklist
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide SLS Title 17 training to consumers
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct education and training sessions to team staff members
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide individual training to staff needing additional instruction and/or counsel
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Other related Job Duties and Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Emergency Assistance:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assist as back up in providing 24hour crisis intervention and direct care coverage to the clients as necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedule PA staffing and/or perform direct care and protective supervision
          </li>
          <li>
           Implement the clients individualized Emergency Assistance Plan (E.A.P.) The E.A.P. is monitored on a quarterly basis and modifications are made when necessary and under the direction of the Supported Living Services Program Manager .
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          2. Required Reporting:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Perform all reporting requirements, such as special Incident Reporting and Suspected Abuse Reports
          </li>
          <li>
           Report suspected abuse with 24 hours to the appropriate agencies and THRIVE management
          </li>
          <li>
           Immediately report to supervisors and/or the responsible person for the client about any decline in the clients physical or mental health, any medication refusal, alcohol or illegal drug abuse
          </li>
          <li>
           Report employee accidents immediately fill out accident report for Workers Compensation Employee Claim form so the employee can get medical assistance. Direct employees to our PEO
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          While achieving the above job results, the following objectives must always be met: Maintains THRIVE Support Services, Inc. stability and reputation by complying with all applicable state and federal regulations and applying a professional and diplomatic behavior at all times. Following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes; performing other job related duties as assigned
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_2a6a1270c1dde6f2">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <!-- -->
 </body>
</html>

       </font>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Description
          </b>
          Audience Partners, the market leader in providing enterprise advertising management solutions to the political, healthcare and commercial markets, is seeking a smart and collaborative team member to help drive our client relationships, ensure flawless execution of digital campaigns, and interact with clients in a manner to inspire them to business with us again and again. You will be responsible for providing day-to-day management of the pre-close, post-close, pre-campaign launch, live campaign, and post campaign retention efforts.
         </p>
         <p>
          Audience Partners leverages the power of first party data, programmatic media and predictive analytics to drive best-in-class media campaigns across devices. This is a rare opportunity for the right individual to play a key role in our growth and client retention strategy. Reporting to the vertical sales lead, this key role will be responsible for prospect and client engagement ranging from pulling digital availabilities to supporting campaign management, and then reporting on post campaign success. This will involve everything from developing media plans, producing insertion orders, leading weekly success calls, to post campaign engagement and retention tactics to help better position Audience Partners as the one-stop shop for media planning and placement across digital screens.
         </p>
         <p>
          Location: New York, Washington DC, or Fort Washington, PA.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Pre-Close/Sales Process
          </li>
          <li>
           Create targeting maps to support multiple sales account executives
          </li>
          <li>
           Identify digital inventory to ensure the proper impressions are available for specific geographies, date rages and target audiences
          </li>
          <li>
           Create digital media plans
          </li>
          <li>
           Pre-Campaign Launch
          </li>
          <li>
           Acquire campaign assets
          </li>
          <li>
           Clarify the goals and objectives of the campaign with the sales account executive and client
          </li>
          <li>
           Begin pre-campaign targeting activities
          </li>
          <li>
           Live Campaign
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedule regular campaign reporting check-ins with clients and deliver applicable reports and analytics
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedule weekly success calls as necessary depending on campaign
          </li>
          <li>
           Act as the internal champion working on the clients behalf and serve as internal hub for all client questions, concerns, and successes acting as the main point of contact for the client post sale
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct/lead the post campaign closing call as appropriate
          </li>
          <li>
           Post Campaign
          </li>
          <li>
           Determine an appropriate level of outreach to keep Audience Partners top of mind for consideration for the next digital campaign.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage Billing and Invoices
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Desired Skills and Experience:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           2-5 years of experience in client relationship management with some level of revenue generation responsibility
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in digital media (in AdTech, Analytics, CRM, Digital Media, and/or Social Media) with a successful track record in a high-growth, hands-on culture preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Undergraduate degree in Business / Marketing / Political Science / Communications / Liberal Arts preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Intellectually curious with a strong desire to learn and to better understand online interactions for politics and healthcare
          </li>
          <li>
           Self-motivated, organized and deadline-driven with the ability manage and support multiple projects simultaneously
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Self-motivated, entrepreneurial in nature and comfortable in ambiguous situations
          </li>

           Strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop solid working relationships inside and outside of Audience Partners
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          </li>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0pi6t5b9jp9dp" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Sales Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Kenworth Northwest
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       SeaTac, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           SUMMARY
          </b>
          <br/>
          Kenworth Northwest is one of the regions premier commercial truck dealerships operating seven Kenworth Truck Dealerships in the States of Washington and Alaska.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Sales Manager is responsible for customer retention, acquisition, and profitability in the new- truck department. The responsibilities are fulfilled primarily through effective personnel management, knowledge of market potential, established performance standards, and a keen awareness of the department's financial data.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           ESSENTIAL DUTIES
          </b>
          include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          Hires, trains, supervises, and monitors the performance of the new- truck department personnel across the region
         </p>
         <p>
          Works with sales personnel to establish annual and monthly objectives for unit sales, gross profits, expenses, and operating profit. Profiles prospective customers and develops strategies for acquiring business. Ensures a high level of customer satisfaction and addresses complaints promptly.
         </p>
         <p>
          Ensures that sales personnel understand dealership policies, procedures, and sales systems. Creates systems that ensure ongoing sales training. Reviews and approves all deals before they are posted into accounting.
         </p>
         <p>
          Studies local market conditions, demographics, and past sales history. Makes recommendations to the CEO regarding staffing needs and compensation plans.
         </p>
         <p>
          Works with CEO and Chief Financial Officer to determine appropriate inventory for new vehicles and orders accordingly.
         </p>
         <p>
          Manages new inventory to maintain no more than a 60 day supply. Establishes procedures for quick disposal of overaged vehicles. Reviews appraisals of trade-in vehicles. Facilitates new-truck pre-delivery with the service manager.
         </p>
         <p>
          Establishes standards for displaying, merchandising, and maintaining new and used vehicles. Directs and monitors inventory promotion and advertising.
         </p>
         <p>
          Participates in the preparation of the annual dealership forecast by projecting unit sales, gross profits, expenses, and operating profits for the new- sales departments. Benchmarks performance against 20 group and other industry standards.
         </p>
         <p>
          Meets with the CEO to review monthly forecasts, commission sheets, productivity reports, and the profit performance of the department as a whole and each salesperson individually.
         </p>
         <p>
          Makes sure facility is secure, well lit, and professional in appearance.
         </p>
         <p>
          Maintains a professional appearance and ensures that the Company dress policy is adhered to.
         </p>
         <p>
          Other duties as may be assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS
          </b>
          To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
          </b>
          Bachelors degree from a four year college or university and five years related experience in the heavy truck business; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           LANGUAGE SKILLS
          </b>
          Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           COMPUTER SKILLS
          </b>
          <br/>
          Familiarity with creating and editing Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel documents is required.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
          </b>
          <br/>
          Commercial Driver License (CDL) preferred.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           PHYSICAL DEMANDS
          </b>
          While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, stretch, kneel, stoop, crawl, climb, balance, twist, turn, handle, reach, lift and carry up to 50 lbs. The employee is frequently required to talk or hear. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           WORK ENVIRONMENT
          </b>
          The work environment can range from slow to fast paced. The work environment is indoor and outdoor and may include inclement weather. The work environment is a multi-tasking, front line customer service environment. The noise level in the work environment is moderate to extreme.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Commercial Truck Business: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required license or certification:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           CDL
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_5465b095d75344b1">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">

       </td>

       </font>
      </b>

      <span class="company">
       Gaming Hospitality Executive
      </span>
      -

       Des Plaines, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Currently looking for a Promotions and Events Manager to fill a vacancy in Des Plaines, IL. The successful candidate will have casino/gaming marketing experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Promotions and Events
          </b>
          <b>
           Manager Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Manages the research, development, planning, execution and evaluation of all promotions, events and entertainment for Casino both on and off property.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manages all aspects of promotions and events, from the beginning planning stages, to execution of all details for the insurance of a successful event, through completion of the event and event analysis.
          </li>
          <li>
           Directly works with cross-department execution plan(s) for all promotions and events.
          </li>
          <li>
           Directly works with promotional kiosk vendor and other promotional vendors to ensure proper utilization and execution of all assets.
          </li>
          <li>
           Works directly with the Illinois Gaming Board, including submitting official details for all promotions and events and ensures compliance with all approved Marketing submissions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for testing of all promotional details prior to submission and execution.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for helping to present ideas to expand the brand and consideration set beyond strictly gaming assets. Utilizes promotional and entertainment opportunities to support the brand.
          </li>
          <li>
           Guides and ensures proper implementation of all new entertainment and promotional strategies to ensure that they are successful while providing a high level of return on investment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Promotions and Events Manager
          </b>
          <b>
           Requirements
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           3+ years experience in casino gaming required
          </li>
          <li>
           1-2 years experience in marketing required
          </li>
          <li>
           1-2 years managerial experience preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent oral and written communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent leadership / motivation skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organization and planning skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent knowledge in various computer programs including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.).
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

We are privately funded by Element Partners, T Rowe Price, and Virgin Green Fund, among others, and recently joined forces with Seven Seas Water to create AquaVenture Holdings to help fuel our mission to create the largest independent provider of water solutions in the Americas.

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          Pacific Office Automation is a recognized leader in office management solutions, offering state-of-the-art technology and award-winning customer service. We have grown to 25 office throughout 7 states -- Oregon, Washington, California, Arizona, New Mexico, Utah, and Colorado.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are the largest private dealership in the nation, and one of the world's largest dealers for Konica Minolta copiers, printers, faxes and multifunctional devices. Yet our focus remains local.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are a company with deep roots in the West, employing 750+ hard-working men and women. We are dedicated to supporting the communities in which we operate, including many philanthropic efforts to support academics and athletics.
         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Communicating with customers to ensure satisfaction
          </li>
          <li>
           Developing options to solve unusual problems
          </li>
          <li>
           Managing time, resources and territorial considerations
          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          <li>
           You must be a people person with strong interpersonal skills
          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Valid drivers license
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong work ethic and positive attitude
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          What POA Has To Offer:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           FULL benefits package!
          </li>
          <li>
           Matched 401k
          </li>
          <li>
           Signing Bonus for experienced candidates
          </li>
          <li>
           Company car
          </li>
          <li>
           PTO, FSA Programs
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          If you are a problem solver who is detail-oriented and capable of multi-tasking, we want to talk to you.

The ORCA (Organic Refuse Conversion Alternative) machine allows for rapid decomposition of most organic material in institutional and commercial end-user applications, after which the liquid effluent is disposed of through the ordinary sewer system. The machine creates meaningful cost savings for customers while diverting food waste from landfills and reducing methane gas production. For more information, please visit www.totallygreen.com

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Product Demonstrator inside Costco
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Club Demonstration Services (CDS)
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Foster City, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $11.50 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Have you ever been to Costco and received a free sample? If so, it's likely come from one of our employees. For more than 25 years, Club Demonstration Services (CDS) has helped Costco members make shopping decisions and shaped the identity that Costco is perhaps best known for: its awesome free samples.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you have worked in food services, the retail industry or customer service and like interacting with customers, we want you to join our team as a part-time Product Demonstrator.
         </p>
         <p>
          As the in-house product demonstration company for Costco Wholesale, CDS has friendly, professional and talented employees who provide high quality product demonstrations and marketing services to Costco Wholesale and its vendors. The goal of our teams is to create a great member experience that increases sales the day of a demonstration and the months that follow.
         </p>
         <p>
          The part-time Product Demonstrator position requires you to prepare and demonstrate both food and non-food vendor products to Costco club members. You must be able to positively engage members to promote and increase the sales of products.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The ideal candidate must have excellent communication skills, a neat appearance, and superb customer focus.
          </li>
          <li>
           Part-time schedule-must be able to work flexible hours to include work availability for weekends.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to stand the duration of the shift and perform routine tasks with minimal supervision.
          </li>
          <li>
           Requires ability to follow written and verbal instructions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have basic computer skills.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Equal Opportunity Employer
          </b>
          <br/>
          Daymon Worldwide is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, or any other legally protected basis under federal, state or local law.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Associates joining Daymon may be subject to pre-employment screening.
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $11.50 /hour
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_656f9c921a53b616">

      </span>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          You have the compassion and dedication to make a difference for our residents. Bring it all to this rewarding role at Regency of Monroe, located in Monroe, Washington.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are currently recruiting for a Resident Care Manager (RCM) on our special needs unit to provide management direction and leadership to all of our caregivers and nursing staff. This position provides oversight and supervision of day-to-day resident care services for our skilled nursing residents. This position requires independent judgment, timely management of deadlines as well as discretion in carrying out responsibilities. You must be a RN/LPN with excellent people and interpersonal skills.
         </p>
         <p>
          Regency of Monroe believes in taking care of their employees as well as their residents, by offering an excellent benefits package along with a competitive salary.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you have a stable background within either a long-term care or skilled nursing setting, this opportunity is well worth exploring. Please forward your resume and salary requirements for immediate consideration.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           2 years of nurse management experience: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>

We are currently seeking energetic C.N.A.'s to work for our Home Care Services. Qualified applicants must have excellent communication skills, a compassion for serving the elderly and a desire to provide outstanding quality care! New CNA / HCA grads are eligible!

May include preparation of meals and light housekeeping as well.

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0dnk7pbr1hc62" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Bi-Lingual English/Spanish Family Services Specialist III
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Mission Neighborhood Centers
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $23.05 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          It is an exciting time to join Mission Neighborhood Centers, Inc. (MNC)!
         </p>
         <p>
          Mission Neighborhood Center is seeking a full-time Bi-lingual English/Spanish
          <b>
           Family Services Specialist III
          </b>
          to work with our Family and Community Partnership Manager. This position requires working knowledge of relevant community resources and building partnerships amongst community agencies, have a compassionate approach to working with children and families, and effectively interact with families of diverse economic, social, ethnic, and linguistic backgrounds.
         </p>
         <p>
          The
          <b>
           Family Services Specialist III
          </b>
          is responsible for recruiting and enrolling eligible families for the Head Start/Early Head Start Program, maintaining the caseload, and working closely with each family to support identified goals and provide needed referrals to community agencies. This position is responsible for providing services training to families enrolled in the toddler and pre-school programs.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you are seeking an organization that values, promotes and develops leadership by delivering culturally sensitive, multi-generational, community based services that empower families to build strong, healthy, and vibrant neighborhoods with the vision of a strong, healthier and more vibrant community that respects and celebrates its many rich, cultural traditions, please apply.
         </p>
         <p>
          We would like to meet you if you are looking for an opportunity to be part of an organization whose mission it is to provide quality childcare and restorative services for troubled youth, enrich in-school and after-school programs, develop workforces for a changing economy, and provide our elders with activities and support that help them avoid isolation and depression and you can answer "yes" to all of the following questions:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Do you want to improve the quality of peoples lives?
          </li>
          <li>
           Are you seeking meaning and purpose in your career?
          </li>
          <li>
           Do you wish you could work with an organization actually making a difference in peoples lives?
          </li>
          <li>
           Are you self-motivated and results driven, yet lighthearted and fun?
          </li>
          <li>
           Do you exceed people's expectations of you on a regular basis?
          </li>
          <li>
           Is being busy preferable to being bored?
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Must be detailed-oriented and maintain case documentation and record keeping in accordance with program requirements. Must also be flexible for rotation assignment. Our ideal candidate will have strong interpersonal and communication skills; superior organizational and planning skills; good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Primary Duties
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Community outreach and engagement including: widespread canvasing, mailings, presentations, interviews and follow up on all inquiries.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure 100% enrollment and a minimum of 20% waiting list.
          </li>
          <li>
           Active participation in resource fairs, recruitment events, community and neighborhood groups and assist in resolving emerging community issues, build rapport and publicize supportive services available.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop and retain ongoing family engagement efforts including: orientations, proper documentation and tracking, develop IFPA (Individual Family Partnership Plans and yearly training calendars, conduct trainings and support groups.
          </li>
          <li>
           Supports families in completion of paperwork and documentation requirements for Head Start enrollment, CCTR and CDE documentation (CD9600, CD9600A, CDE #1, and Notice of Action Form, employment verification, training verification, Statement of Incapacity, CPS Action Plan) and provides follow-up.
          </li>
          <li>
           Conducts interviews with families to verify age, income and residence eligibility according to Head Start Federal Guidelines, CDE and PFA.
          </li>
          <li>
           Completes accurate documentation of required enrollment, eligibility and need status for toddler and preschool, according to CCTR and CDE Funding Terms and Conditions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Completes Developmental Assessment during enrollment of toddlers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist supervisor to ensure integration of funded strategies.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure enrollment compliance with Federal, State &amp; City regulations; family interviews and compliance support; completes timely and accurate documentation and submittal.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor participation attendance and ensure 85% attendance rate.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures and maintains compliance with health, mental health and disabilities requirements and enrollment including: documentation assistance, education, referrals and follow ups for children and parents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Active participation in staff meetings and trainings.
          </li>
          <li>
           Consistent communication with supervisor to report, problem-solve and plan.
          </li>
          <li>
           Administrative duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A Bachelors Degree (BA/BS) in a related Human Services field: Human Services, Social Work, Sociology, Psychology, Family Studies, Counseling, Family Development, or Family Systems Theory
          </li>
          <li>
           3+ years work experience with a social service agency, community work, low-income families, and diverse populations and/or commensurable experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Bilingual in English/Spanish required
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer skills  Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and internet
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational, analytical, interpersonal and communication skills - written and verbal (excellent spelling and grammar) both in English and Spanish
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven organization skills, including the ability to manage priorities and workflow, set goals and objectives, schedule others and develops realistic action plans.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experienced at developing and supporting a culture of teamwork
          </li>
          <li>
           Personality: dependable, dedicated, takes initiative, detail oriented, takes pride in producing quality work
          </li>
          <li>
           Supports the mission, vision and values of Mission Neighborhood Center
          </li>
          <li>
           CPR/ First Aid Training Certificate or the ability and desire to take and pass a certification course
          </li>
          <li>
           Current CA Drivers License, current auto insurance and a clean driving record
          </li>
          <li>
           Background Check clearance upon hire  FBI/DOJ Fingerprint, Child Abuse Index, Physical Exam, TB Test
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits
          </b>
          <br/>
          This position is full time Monday through Wednesday 8 hours daily, with an hourly rate of $23.05 and will require some weekend and evening hours and includes an excellent benefit package:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Medical, dental and vision coverage
          </li>
          <li>
           Vacation and Sick Time
          </li>
          <li>
           11 Paid Holidays
          </li>
          <li>
           Retirement Program 401 (b)
          </li>
          <li>
           Life Insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Long Term Disability
          </li>
          <li>
           Employee Assistance Program
          </li>
          <li>
           Commuter Benefits an easy access to Public Transportation
          </li>
          <li>
           Amazing SF location the Mission and Excelsior Districts melting pot of cultures, cuisines and colorful Latino markets; close to upscale restaurants and the best taquerias and street foods.
          </li>
          <li>
           Close knit, caring team
          </li>
          <li>
           And more!
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           How To Apply
          </b>
          <br/>
          If you are qualified and interested in applying, please send your resume and cover letter with Family Services Specialist III in the subject line, if youre someone we want to get to know better, well ask you to fill out an application and criminal background check (CBC) form (all candidates must fill out the application and CBC to be considered). Phone calls are not accepted nor will we call you if you dont submit employment information. Please visit our web site for additional information on our company at: www.mncsf.org
         </p>
         <p>
          We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome diversity in the workplace. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Part-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $23.05 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Work experience with social service agency, community work or similar: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required language:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Spanish
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_84cf2d9f1b001d31">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

          Founded in 1962 and a public company since 1983, Raymond James is a diversified financial services holding company with subsidiaries engaged primarily in investment and financial planning, in addition to investment banking and asset management. Our stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (RJF).
          <br/>
          Assistant position
          <br/>
          This position is ideal for a well-organized person who enjoys multi-tasking and working with technology as well as people. Daily office administration duties include overseeing appointment setting, schedules and processing deposits and transactions. RaymondJames representatives excel on a one-to-one relationships with their clients. When the Clients have questions, the Financial Advisor will often depend on the Administrative assistant to provide a timely response. Our office is located in the Mill Creek Town Center area of Mill Creek.

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          Answer/screen calls, interact, assist, and follow-up, as appropriate.
          <br/>
          Revise, edit, and proofread various documents.
          <br/>
          Perform related clerical tasks such as photocopying, faxing, mailing, and scheduling meetings.
          <br/>
          Communicate and ensure the Firms standards for formatting are applied to all correspondence, presentations, and reports.
          <br/>
          Open New Accounts, process paperwork
         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>
