          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          Must be flexible in assuming new responsibilities as they arise.
          <br/>
          Excellent writing and proofreading abilities are mandatory with an emphasis on accuracy, spelling, punctuation, and grammar.
          <br/>
          The candidate must be detail-oriented, efficient, organized and focused on accuracy. Ideal candidate will be personable and customer service driven.

          Neurotech Northwest is a leading provider in Electroencephalograms (EEG) testing services. We specialize in providing in-home patient studies and using advanced technology to meet the needs of our patients and physicians. Recently, Neurotech was awarded ambulatory health care accreditation from The Joint Commission by demonstrating continuous compliance with its nationally-recognized standards.
         </p>

          We are looking for an experienced EEG Technologist to work out of our Seattle, WA office either full-time or part-time.
         </p>

          <i>
           <b>

           </b>
          </i>
          The individual seeking this position will be responsible for understanding how to perform Neurotech EEG Set Ups, EEG Scanning and Remote Monitoring functions. Considered a plus if candidate is experienced working with EPs, has worked with multiple EEG equipment (Xltek, Nihon Kohden, etc).Ideal candidate will possess outstanding organization, communication, trouble shooting, and customer service skills, be a team player, maintain confidentiality, and be comfortable working with technology.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           <b>
            Technologist responsibilities include
           </b>
          </i>
          <i>
           :
          </i>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Driving to patient homes or physician offices to conduct EEG studies
          </li>
          <li>
           Conducting EEG hookups using 10/20 system
          </li>
          <li>
           Conducting EEG hookups at patients residence
          </li>
          <li>
           Taking an accurate and detailed patient history
          </li>
          <li>
           Clipping and scanning EEG studies
          </li>
          <li>
           Cleaning and sterilizing EEG equipment
          </li>
          <li>
           Remotely monitoring patients to verify quality of EEG
          </li>
          <li>
           Troubleshooting equipment or patient issues, as necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Participating in on-call rotation and/or working occasional weekends
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           <b>
            Full Time Benefits include:
           </b>
          </i>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           401k Plan
          </li>
          <li>
           Cell phone reimbursement up to $50 per month
          </li>
          <li>
           Company vehicle or mileage reimbursement
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid Time Off (PTO)
          </li>
          <li>
           Health, dental and vision insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           <b>
            Salary:
           </b>
          </i>
          $45,000 to $55,000 (based on experience)
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Candidate must have at least 2 years of EEG experience, ABRET R. T. preferred, but not required.: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Senior Mortgage Processor
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Seattle Bank
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Senior Mortgage Loan Processor
         </p>
         <p>
          Seattle Bank is a boutique bank focused on the needs of individuals, businesses and business owners throughout the Pacific Northwest and beyond. Our experienced team of bankers blends big-bank solutions with boutique-bank service  creating more value by aligning tailored financial resources and services to match each client's needs. Through a combination of customized solutions, exceptional service and accelerated answers from local decision-makers, we make the complex simple.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our ideal candidate will be skilled in many areas of mortgage lending, have high ethical standards, and be inspired and driven by the idea of working with a team to provide a great customer experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          Essential Duties
          <br/>
          1) Process conforming, jumbo, FHA, VA loans.
          <br/>
          2) Process applications from time of receipt of application to submission of the loan package to underwriting, closing and loan funding.
          <br/>
          3) Gather, organize and track loan documentation utilizing loan origination system.
          <br/>
          4) Work closely with mortgage production officer, underwriters and vendors, including secondary market institutions as applicable.
          <br/>
          5) Verify customer income documentation, order flood, credit reports and other required documentation.
          <br/>
          6) Order and review preliminary title reports for accuracy and coordinate the clearing of title issues/exceptions, ensuring proper lien position is secure.
          <br/>
          7) Open escrow with title/escrow companies.
          <br/>
          8) Effectively communicate verbally and in writing with internal and external customers.
          <br/>
          9) Execute closing actions to ensure a timely and effective closing process.
          <br/>
          10) Provide coverage to the front desk receptionist during breaks and lunches.
          <br/>
          11) Perform other duties/projects as assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          Minimum requirements
         </p>
         <p>
          These specifications are general guidelines based on the minimum experience normally considered essential to the satisfactory performance of this position. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required to perform the position in a satisfactory manner. Individual abilities may result in some deviation from these guidelines.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School Diploma and Some College
          </li>
          <li>
           5+ years senior processing experience: conforming jumbo, FHA, VA loans.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient in the following software systems  Calyx Point, Encompass, PC Lender, Doc Magic, Microsoft Office Suite, and AUS.
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of Lending Regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Tactfulness and proven ability to handle sensitive and confidential situations.
          </li>
          <li>
           High energy, self-motivated, and service-oriented attitude.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work on multiple projects with the flexibility for changing priorities; the ability to work with constant interruptions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and assist other department needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must display strong team attitude and have strong professional skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Effective organizational and time management skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to effectively utilize computer technology. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite programs.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Seattle Bank is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status, such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age.

          </b>

         </p>

          </b>
          From removing grills to adding cooking machines, using 100% recycled plastic to build our counter tops, using LED lighting and donating our grease to a company that uses it for gas, we're striving to build 100% green self-sustaining restaurants.

They ensure operational procedures are in place to minimize inventory shrinkage. The MIT models the PGA TOUR Superstore core values of cultivating our customers and developing our associates. They utilize strong business acumen and retail knowledge to formulate goals, develop objectives, and lead a team of associates to execute tasks.

      <span class="location">

      </span>

      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          *** Due to an overwhelming response we would encourage you to walk in for an interview to be hired right away ***
         </p>
         <p>
          We are hiring for a food production company that is considered the second largest company in the world in their product. They have won awards for service and pride themselves in quality.
         </p>
         <p>
          Looking for hardworking individuals to join their team. They have part time and full time openings available. They promote within to other departments! The day off is based on the client's need.
          <br/>
          We offer Direct Deposit and Health Benefits! All SmartTalent employees are eligible for monthly giveaways: gift cards, gas cards etc.
         </p>
         <p>
          Location: Redmond
          <br/>
          Shift: Day shift: 6am  4:30pm  Monday  Thursday
          <br/>
          Pay: $10.40 an hour
          <br/>
          Length: temp to hire
         </p>
         <p>
          ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
          <br/>
          FILLER: Worker puts product into the bottom of a vacuum container.
          <br/>
          PASTEURIZER LOADER: Sealed packages are grasped from a conveyor and placed onto a moving belt leading to the cooking process conveyor.
          <br/>
          FREEZER LOADER: Sealed packages are taken from the conveyor and arranged onto moving belt leading to the freezer.
          <br/>
          PACKER: Packaged product is moved from a conveyor and/or holding bin and placed into a fiber box. The box is pushed through a taping machine, then lifted and stacked onto a pallet.
          <br/>
          PAR-FRY AND FRY LINE: Continual inspections and repairs during line operation.
         </p>
         <p>
          Ability to properly prepare product for production per specifications, including accurate product weighing.
          <br/>
          Responsible for preparing, adding and counting labels. Must be able to recognize proper coding and report deficiencies for corrections.
          <br/>
          Evaluate bag seals and report deficiencies for corrections.
          <br/>
          Understand proper procedure for reworking of product.
          <br/>
          Operate case erector and/or manually construct and label boxes.
          <br/>
          Accurate and timely recording and processing of all required paperwork.
          <br/>
          Effective clean-up and sanitation of equipment per Standard Operating Procedures.
          <br/>
          Train and assist team members.
          <br/>
          Ability to work in fast-paced, high-pressure environment and work well with others.
          <br/>
          Flexible work schedules depending on production needs.
         </p>
         <p>
          About you:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Able to lift 30 lbs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be a team player-able to work in a fun and diverse environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to pass a background check and drug screen
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           Qualified applicants will be required to submit information for a lawful Criminal Background check. While disclosure of criminal history will not automatically disqualify you from consideration for employment or advancement, falsification of information and/or failure to disclose any requested information may be grounds for immediate disqualification, rescission of offer and/or termination.
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           SmartTalent
          </i>

          <li>
           Enter previous day's accounts receivable payments
          </li>
          <li>
           Review &amp; enter credit card batch deposits
          </li>
          <li>
           Reconcile Petty Cash
          </li>
          <li>
           Post previous day's expenses
          </li>
          <li>
           Post previous day's accounts payables and review
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Weekly Duties:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Reconcile &amp; pay accounts payables
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare checking deposits
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Semi-monthly Duties:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Review and submit payroll information to ADP
          </li>
          <li>
           Import ADP payroll data into Quickbooks
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Monthly Duties:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Audit previous month's business
          </li>
          <li>
           Audit accounts receivables
          </li>
          <li>
           Issue accounts receivables statements
          </li>
          <li>
           Reconcile all bank, cash, credit card, &amp; liability accounts
          </li>
          <li>
           Calculate Sale figures for payroll incentives &amp; commissions
          </li>
          <li>
           Calculate, file, &amp; pay WA Department of Revenue liability
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Quarterly Duties:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Review Payroll liability returns and payments made by ADP for:
          </li>
          <li>
           WA Labor &amp; Industries
          </li>
          <li>
           WA Employment Security
          </li>
          <li>
           IRS 941 federal filing
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Annual Duties:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Maintain organized filing system &amp; record keeping
          </li>
          <li>
           Audit previous year's business
          </li>
          <li>
           Audit Use Tax for previous year
          </li>
          <li>
           Reconcile all accounts
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare year-end information for CPA
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare and distribute IRS 1099 forms to vendors
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare &amp; file IRS 1096
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage customer liability insurance compliance
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage W9/1099 vendor forms
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage WA Reseller permits
          </li>
          <li>
           Renew city and state business licenses
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Miscellaneous duties as assigned.
          <br/>
          Health Care Benefit for full time employees PTO
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Accounting/Bookkeeping: Quickbooks Premium or Enterprise in a retail small business : 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_c0af7bfe304bdc79">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>

          </li>
          <li>
           Perform preventative maintenance, troubleshooting or diagnose service problems and repairs as needed. Making sure to check quality of all products and cleaning in and around machines etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain inventory and maintenance on equipment such as: parts, tools, and vehicle.
          </li>
          <li>
           Document all work performed and close out all activities upon completion.
          </li>
          <li>
           In some locations, the Service Technician will be responsible for machine movement and various other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, the Service Technician must be self-motivated and have the ability to stay on task with minimal to no supervision. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Mechanical aptitude.
          </li>
          <li>
           Customer relations, interpersonal relationships, team relations and service.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational and time management skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Great oral and written communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prior plumbing, electrical, or refrigeration experienced preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid Drivers License with a clean record
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate with customers, call center, sales team, and others
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Mechanical apptitude, plumbing, electrical or refrigeration: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_a548654fe431006a">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

         </p>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           That is 34 to 44 Hours per Week.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </b>
          <b>
           COPY
          </b>
          <b>

          </b>
         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          </b>

           </b>

           </b>

          </b>

          <br/>

         </p>

          </b>

          <br/>

We want to meet you! **Please fill out an application on our website: www.evergreens-salad.com/careers Evergreens is a Healthy Quick Service Restaurant located in downtown Seattle, specializing in 100% all natural custom built salads, wraps, and quinoa bowls.

          </li>

          <li>
           Lead by example and motivate your team  * Interact with guests and make them feel special  * Build salads  * Move quickly at all times
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

         <p>
          Honda of Kirkland Cashier/Rental Assistants provide excellent customer service to both internal and external rental customers. They prepare and processes contracts as well as update rental department reports and maintain our fleet on a day-to-day basis. Essential job duties include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Providing a high level of customer service for our rental guests at all times
          </li>
          <li>
           Preparing and processing rental contracts
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintaining the rental fleet by gassing, washing and vacuuming vehicles when needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Updating, organizing and filing rental department contracts
          </li>
          <li>
           Multitasking and maintaining composure during stressful and busy situations
          </li>
          <li>
           Supporting fellow co-workers by assisting during busy hours and striving to work well as a group
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Special Requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Able to drive rental and dealership vehicles
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have valid Washington state drivers license
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to lift up to 30 pounds
          </li>
          <li>
           Job requires a mix of standing/sitting/walking/driving
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

          <br/>
          Rental Yard Associate for Truck Rental Company
          <br/>
          Welcome 2015! Looking for a new Job Why not join our team?
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Summary
          <br/>
          Service and maintain all rental equipment and prepare rental orders to go to customers.
          <br/>
          Removes dirt, concrete, or other debris from rental equipment.
          <br/>
          Ensures all rental equipment is in good, useable condition before it goes out to the customer.
          <br/>
          Oils and lubricates all equipment and tilt-up braces according to specifications before they go out.
          <br/>
          Prepares and stage rentals orders to go out.
          <br/>
          Inspects all rental equipment for damage when it comes back from a customer.
          <br/>
          Reports any damage according to established procedure. Cleans rental area and equipment on a regular basis.
         </p>
         <p>
          Work Environment
          <br/>
          Requires intermittent periods during which continuous physical exertion is required, such as walking, standing, stooping, climbing, lifting and maneuvering material or equipment, some of which may be heavy or awkward. Typically in a comfortable environment but with regular exposure to factors such as temperature extremes, moving machinery, loud noise, and fumes, which may cause noticeable discomfort or a moderate risk of accident or illness.
          <br/>
          Must work weekends.
          <br/>
          Days working are erratic and changes weekly.
         </p>
         <p>
          Essential Skills:
          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

         </p>

          <br/>
          Must be eighteen years of age

          Be Self Motivated
          <br/>

         </p>
         <p>
          Education and Experience
          <br/>
          HS Diploma or GED required.
          <br/>
          0-2 years of experience in area of responsibility.
         </p>
         <p>
          Qualifications
          <br/>
          Must have a Valid Washington State Drivers License
          <br/>
          Must have good driving record.
          <br/>
          We have full and part time for this position.
          <br/>
          All positions start as part time.

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        E-Commerce Implementer
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Bling Jewelry
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       New York, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Behind the bling, style and coolness of the Bling Jewelry brand (www.blingjewelry.com), there is a highly efficient, 24/7 e-commerce operation. We are looking for an incredible candidate to join our team in our NYC office.
         </p>
         <p>
          The ideal candidate is sharp, tech-savvy, highly-motivated and not only brings their own skills to the table, but is willing to learn new skills and apply them in a dynamic marketing environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          The E-comm Implementers main task will be to provide direct support to senior members of the team, and grow into responsibility for specifying and executing online marketing and e-commerce campaigns. The leadership team will pass along marketing initiatives (big and small) and it is up to you to coordinate key players and to directly implement projects to completion.
         </p>
         <p>
          We operate in a highly entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment, and those with an entrepreneurial mindset will excel and thrive in our company.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you're ready to challenge yourself in a dynamic, rewarding environment, read on.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB DESCRIPTION
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          As an E-Commerce Implementer, you will be tossed into the deep end with a team of expert e-commerce and marketing professionals who want you to grow and succeed. The on-the-job training you receive will equip you to perform the job duties below, and more.
         </p>
         <p>
          There are no typical days at Bling Jewelry, but the types of tasks you will be responsible for include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Website updates - copy, images
          </li>
          <li>
           Social media updates based on our editorial calendar
          </li>
          <li>
           Landing page and email marketing coordination
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate projects with the graphic design team and put together all the pieces of campaigns
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in new product and campaign launches
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide feedback on current marketing initiatives regarding content, creative, ideas, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Track keyword and style trends, and suggest opportunities for Bling Jewelry to expand our reach in the market both strategically and tactically
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage company content (photo, video, press release, etc) and ensure that content is being pushed to appropriate distribution channels
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor Google Analytics, provide feedback to marketing team and prepare summaries
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB REQUIREMENTS
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor Degree and/or equivalent experience
          </li>
          <li>
           1-3 years of work experience, preferably in the online space
          </li>
          <li>
           You must be incredibly organized.
          </li>
          <li>
           You must have STRONG communication skills, both written and verbal.
          </li>
          <li>
           You need to be comfortable with working through ambiguous or open-ended tasks and figuring things out as you go.
          </li>
          <li>
           You must have a creative edge and not be afraid to voice your opinion.
          </li>
          <li>
           You must be open to learning and adaptation.
          </li>
          <li>
           You must be someone who works quickly AND efficiently.
          </li>
          <li>
           You must be willing to work odd hours occasionally, since e-commerce is a 24/7 operation and we are entering the busiest time of the year (holidays).
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We need an A-player who can get it done, and is willing to rise to the challenge.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           READY FOR NEXT STEPS?
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Think youre the perfect fit? Visit www.blingjewelry.com to see our site and submit your resume and cover letter through Indeed. In your cover letter, give us five bullet points as to why you think you would be a perfect fit for this role.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Online Marketing and/or E-commerce: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u126jnmb9no8qb" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>

  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Technical Support Specialist II - Field Service Engineer
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Network PhD, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Schiller Park, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Position Details
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Type
          </b>
          : Full-Time/Salary
          <br/>
          <b>
           Department
          </b>
          : Technical Support
          <br/>
          <b>
           Reports to
          </b>
          : Service Manager
          <br/>
          <b>
           Benefits
          </b>
          : Medical/Dental and cell phone reimbursement
          <br/>
          <b>
           Vacation
          </b>
          : 15 days PTO plus company holidays
          <br/>
          <b>
           Salary Range
          </b>
          :
          <i>
           $50,000-65,000/ year plus bonus and incentive pay
          </i>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Travel
          </b>
          :
          <i>
           YES-Local (approximately 50%)
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          Duties/Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <p>
          The Level 2 Support Specialist, Field Service Engineer is strong in all of the most common and popular hardware and software technologies in use at any typical small office. The TSS2 will need to have the technical and people skills to communicate clearly with clients in the heat of a technical outage and be able to manage client expectations. This person should be prompt and/or know the importance of communicating ETA's to clients. This person should be skillful at pre-project/work-briefings with each client on each project. This person should then be able to execute with a high degree of success in integrating and/or solving problems in environments rich in Windows Server, Exchange, IIS, Cisco Internetworking, VPN's, firewalls, backup systems and more. The more truly capable the engineer is in all these areas, the higher the utility value.
          <br/>
          The L2 TSS will also work with senior staff to contribute to service projects as both participants and project lead. They technician will maintain and monitor the clients network systems, troubleshoot when necessary, and make improvements to the network. The Level 2 Support Specialist will assist in providing additional support to Level 1 Support Specialists.
          <br/>
          The technician will operate according to defined policies and procedures and provide feedback to senior staff regarding these procedures and policies. The technician will interface directly with clients and will need to be able to think critically, communicate clearly, and work independently. This position will require frequent travel to client locations.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Log all time on a daily basis.
          </li>
          <li>
           Document and communicate problems, solutions, and the implementation process.
          </li>
          <li>
           Review LAN architecture; Document, install, and configure LAN, network devices, and software including workstations, switches, routers, and servers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Administer, maintain, and support LAN, network devices, and software including workstations, switches, routers, and servers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Establish and maintain user accounts and manage security according to defined security policies.
          </li>
          <li>
           Analyze problems and research solutions; regularly review current computer systems, peripherals, and procedures for potential cost savings and improvements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Interface with clients, vendors and peers to assist with identifying needs and resolving technical support request.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide support at client locations and remotely.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop contingency and disaster recovery plans.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Skills &amp; Qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           4+ years experience working as a Support Technician
          </li>
          <li>
           A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related technical, Engineering, or scientificfield, or equivalent experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Any of the following certifications:
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft MTA/MCSA/MOS
          </li>
          <li>
           CCNA/CCNP
          </li>
          <li>
           A+/Network +
          </li>
          <li>
           Other
          </li>
          <li>
           Implementation, administration, and support experience with any/all of the following technologies:
          </li>
          <li>
           Windows Desktop: Windows 7/8.1
          </li>
          <li>
           Windows Server: 2008 Standard &amp; SBS; 2012 Standard &amp; Essentials Server.
          </li>
          <li>
           Client Software: MS Office; ESET Antivirus; Quickbooks; etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Server Software: Exchange, SQL, Sharepoint, IIS
          </li>
          <li>
           Virtualization: VMWare; Microsoft.
          </li>
          <li>
           Network Switches, Firewalls and Wireless Access Points: Cisco; SonicWall; Netopia; Netgear.
          </li>
          <li>
           Mobility Solutions: Windows Mobile; Active Sync; Apple; Android.
          </li>
          <li>
           VoIP: Asterisk
          </li>
          <li>
           Group Policy Administration
          </li>
          <li>
           Scripting: Batch, Powershell, WMI, WSH
          </li>
          <li>
           Intermediate knowledge of networking concepts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Working knowledge of ConnectWise, LabTech or other ticketing and network management systems preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong troubleshooting skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent communication and documentation skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven ability to work independently
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have valid drivers license and reliable means of insured transportation.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Promotion:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           At least three years work experience as a Level 2 Technician and/or appropriate mastery ofskills
          </li>
          <li>
           Billing consistently above 3-X W2 for at least year
          </li>
          <li>
           Obtains at least one certification per year: Minimum of A+, Server+; MCSA.
          </li>
          <li>
           Shows ability to independently work off site
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Support Technician: 4 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_ac2e5c4321693e43">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Bartenders, Servers and Food Runners at Private Luxury Club
          <br/>
          Redwood Shores, CA
         </p>
         <p>
          Position Summary: Responsible for execution of upscale bar/lounge operation, and providing exceptional member service in a timely and professional manner.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are seeking an experienced hospitality professional who is interested in growing his or her career with one of the Bay Area's most prestigious private clubs. Bay Club Redwood Shores is a modernized country club that is introducing a brand new upscale food &amp; beverage operation. This bar/lounge operation will include a variety of premium small-plate dishes, a comprehensive yet affordable list of wines and beers, and a progressive and evolving cocktail menu. Individuals will be in many ways the face of our operation, and must exhibit the charisma, professionalism, and knowledge that will make the experience of our members and guests as special as possible.
          <br/>
          Job Duties Include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Serving and being knowledgeable about many types of wine, beer, and cocktail items.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Work private events when needed - Banquet experience a plus
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Interacting with a regular customer base in an upscale casual service environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintaining and enforcing high standards of cleanliness, hospitality, and professionalism among a team of front of house personnel.
          </li>
          <li>
           Managing a variety of financial transactions simultaneously, and overseeing financial transactions across the operation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Providing upscale food &amp; beverage service in both a bar and table-service setting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Physically set up bar at beginning of shift and tear down at end of shift.
          </li>
          <li>
           Take accurate inventory of bar supplies and communicate/order bar supply needs to the Bar/Lounge GM in a timely manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Carry out assignments accurately and timely with minimal supervision.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Requirements (additional detail provided below):
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum 1-2 year experience in high-volume bar/lounge operation required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have intermediate to advanced knowledge of wine, beer, and cocktail-making.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to stay standing for extended periods of time.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to lift and carry loads of up to 50 lbs as part of Bar/Lounge operations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Employment with our organization requires passing of a preliminary background check.
          </li>
          <li>
           Position requires working nights and weekends, as well as some holidays.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proper bar handling and sanitation practices required at all times.
          </li>
          <li>
           Serve-Safe, TIPS, LEAD or other similar alcohol training.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to determine age of customer and whether or not they are legally able to be served alcoholic beverages.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as customer service attitude and abilities with a professional, friendly manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Enthusiastic, responsible, and dependable team player.
          </li>
          <li>
           Self motivated, takes initiative and idea-driven.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ethical, reliable and takes pride in performance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Well-organized and detail-oriented.
          </li>
          <li>
           MICROS Point-of-sale experience strongly preferred.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Language Skills - Ability to read, write, and comprehend instructions, correspondence, and memos. Ability to effectively present information in small group or one-on-one situations and respond to questions from managers, co-workers, members, guests and the general public. Ability to read and understand operations and safety procedures.
          <br/>
          Reasoning Ability - Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables; ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
          <br/>
          Physical Demands:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; kneel; bend; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear stoop, communicate, reach and manipulate objects. The employee is occasionally required to crouch, or crawl; taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
          </li>
          <li>
           Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Work environment: The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud. This position's physical location is inside, though it may require time working outdoors, especially during warmer months. The outdoor temperature varies dramatically and can be cool (low 60 degrees) to hot (up to over 100 degrees). Heat Illness Safety and Prevention measures and training are in place.
          <br/>
          The language skills, reasoning ability, physical demands, and work environment described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
          <br/>
          Reporting to this position -- Reports directly to Bar/Lounge General Manager.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bartending / Server expereince : 1 year
          </li>

          Worldwide leader with
          <i>

           </b>

           </b>

         </p>

         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position:
          </b>
          Production Scheduler
          <br/>
          <b>
           Location:
          </b>
          Kent
          <br/>

          </b>
          (DOE) Hourly Wage + Profit Sharing Plan
          <br/>
          <b>

          </b>
          Yes - Full benefits package.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           SUMMARY:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Provide professional material planning and scheduling support to the organization including close coordination with Sales, Customer Service and Manufacturing departments. Maintain and improve MRP system parameters and planning systems, generate and release work orders, reschedule by Order Action reports and maintain area capacity plans and product forecasts. Responsible for internal customer contact relating to availability of product as well as scheduling and capacity information. Track, monitor and advise management on production plans and schedules to achieve planned production levels and provide excellent customer service to meet company goals and objectives.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Two (2) year degree or equivalent experience is mandatory. Bachelor degree from four-year college or university, Business, Supply Chain, or Technical, is highly preferred. APICS/ISM/Supply Chain certification or willing to complete first module of APICS certification program, or equivalent, within two years of employment is preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           One (1) or more years of experience in planning and scheduling position(s) preferred. Cable and electronic component planning experience desired.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent ability to learn material management skills including Planning/Scheduling techniques and methodologies, General Manufacturing knowledge, Materials Requirement Planning (MRP), general knowledge of Engineering Change processes, Inventory Control, Transactional Management and critical thinking and problem solving capability.
          </li>
          <li>
           Solid organizational interface skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Team player relating to people at all levels of the organization and possess excellent communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           An energetic, forward-thinking and creative individual with high ethical standards and a positive professional image.
          </li>
          <li>
           Flexible and able to function comfortably in a fast paced, constantly changing and ambiguous environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Write reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, suppliers and employees.
          </li>
          <li>
           Portray a positive and professional image. Establish relations with a wide range of personalities, cultural backgrounds and educational levels.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with basic mathematical concepts such as probability, percentages, ratios and proportions to job-related situations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Define problems, collect data, establishes facts and draw valid conclusions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent knowledge of ERP systems. SAP MM and PP module knowledge is preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer skills  General MS-Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills are mandatory; advanced skills in MS Office including MS-Access are beneficial.
          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

Our Offices are located in Redwood City, CA, Boulder, CO and Kyoto, Japan.

The office is a casual, flexible and fun "start-up" environment; fast moving, creative, and hard working. Our kitchen is stocked; we enjoy Tuesday and Thursday team lunch and other company events including golf tournaments, dinners, wine events, and more.

           This is an opportunity to work with one of the worlds largest tech companies!
          </b>
          <br/>

          <br/>
          It is important that you have the ability to maintain relationships with clients by providing clear concise education on the procedures and aspects of there personalized User Interface.
          <br/>
          We are looking for individuals who make it their responsibility to find out why the customer has a concern, and are quick in finding the solution.
          <br/>
          That being said, this is not primarily a customer facing role, most of what we do is customer/agent education and troubleshooting to ensure ads are serving or data manipulation to explain to a customer why their ads may not be serving.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Daily Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

           </i>

           <i>

           </i>
          </li>
          <li>
           <i>

           </i>
          </li>
          <li>
           <i>
            Ensuring masks are in place for specific ads.
           </i>
          </li>
          <li>
           <i>
            Escalating masks that are not triggering correctly to engineering for review or changes.
           </i>
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

           </i>

           </i>
          </li>
         </ul>

          </i>
          <br/>
          <i>
           You would be an employee of Flexasoft working for our client company. Its important to mention that we are only looking for serious candidates, your knowledge of the required technical aspects of this position will be tested during the interview process.

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Development Coordinator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Castilleja School
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Palo Alto, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Castilleja School, a 6-12 independent girls school located in Palo Alto, CA, is embarking on a multi-year capital campaign to enhance facilities and programs. The school is seeking a full-time Development Coordinator to assist in laying the foundation for successfully executing the schools next campaign by providing support to the schools overall fundraising efforts including annual giving and major giving efforts.
         </p>
         <p>
          In collaboration with the Chief Advancement Officer and the Director of Development, the Development Coordinator will help to support every aspect of the schools ambitious fundraising goals including a likely $100M capital campaign. As a part of the multi member development team and 9 member Advancement department, the Development Coordinator will be responsible for several tasks associated with the successful accomplishment and recording of the schools fundraising goals. This would include supporting the strategic planning for the campaign, providing reporting, campaign communications and support with the execution, solicitation and stewardship activities to support the Schools fundraising goals and priorities.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Development Coordinator reports directly to the Director of Development and works closely with the Chief Advancement Officer, Advancement staff, trustees and volunteers to help to identify and record donor and prospect activities and engagement. S/he will track campaign progress and work with the Director of Development to provide timely reports to the Chief Advancement Officer, Head of School, Board of Trustees, and other key leaders and volunteers.
         </p>
         <p>
          The ideal candidate will excel at providing support to the fundraising team and developing relationships with all members of the school community, as well as the greater Silicon Valley community.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Working collaboratively with the Director of Development and Chief Advancement Officer to execute the Schools overall fundraising strategy
          </li>
          <li>
           Serving as a key staff member of the schools upcoming campaign including support for the fundraising team and campaign co-chairs and volunteers
          </li>
          <li>
           Accurate data entry and gift processing in collaboration with the Database Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Drafting and preparing correspondence and coordinate mailings
          </li>
          <li>
           Preparing development materials for meetings and events
          </li>
          <li>
           Scheduling meetings and provide coordination as needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Prospect research
          </li>
          <li>
           Solicitation of corporate support for fundraising goals
          </li>
          <li>
           Supporting stewardship efforts of annual giving and restricted gifts
          </li>
          <li>
           Helping to support the schools relationship with fundraising counsel including providing information, feedback and research as needed throughout various phases of the campaign
          </li>
          <li>
           Helping to bring the campaign to a successful close by targeted project end date
          </li>
          <li>
           Conducting prospect research and reports to identify prospective donors as well as support to nurture relationships, and secure contributions to the campaign
          </li>
          <li>
           Conceiving and executing Campaign events with the support of Advancement staff
          </li>
          <li>
           Building systems for identifying, tracking, and soliciting funding prospects
          </li>
          <li>
           Working in partnership with the Director of Development to determine strategies for annual giving and other fundraising initiatives so that they reinforce the Campaigns success.
          </li>
          <li>
           Keeping record systems up to date and producing regular reports on the capital campaign, as well as statements for donors
          </li>
          <li>
           Helping to recruit, manage and guide a large group of fundraising volunteers
          </li>
          <li>
           Working as a member of a 9-person Advancement team and supporting the overall success of the schools Advancement efforts
          </li>
          <li>
           Overseeing the Schools planned giving initiatives
          </li>
          <li>
           Assuming special projects at the direction of the Chief Advancement Officer
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Key Qualifications
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Possess a minimum of a bachelors degree.
          </li>
          <li>
           A minimum of 3 years of experience in development
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong track record of success in supporting the management of large fundraising campaigns
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent written and oral communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with Raisers Edge or similar tool
          </li>
          <li>
           Commitment to excellence and best practices
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency with Microsoft Office, social media tools and comfort with technology
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently and as part of a team
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to problem-solve and think creatively
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates initiative and flexibility with long and short term responsibilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to connect with others using various forms of communication tools
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with, or understanding of, the culture of independent schools
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to pass state and federal fingerprinting and background check and provide a recent negative TB test or screening
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          The position is 12 months and exempt. It requires occasional weekend and evening work as well as limited local and national travel.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           For Consideration
          </b>
          <br/>
          If interested, please visit our careers website at castilleja.org to download the application, and then email/attach completed application, resume and cover letter as directed. Please indicate
          <b>

          </b>
          in the subject field. Compensation is commensurate with experience. No recruiters please.

      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          When students come to us, it's at a critical moment in their schooling. Maybe they're struggling with math, their grades have slipped or they're preparing for the ACT. At Nurturing Wisdom, we want to be supportive and come up with a plan to help students overcome obstacles to success. And that's where
          <b>
           you
          </b>
          come in.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our tutors love to
          <b>
           make a difference
          </b>
          in the lives of our students by teaching them new skills, building their confidence and tracking their progress along the way. We don't ask you to follow a script, to "sell" parents on tutoring they don't need, or to teach something you don't believe in. Instead, we provide you with tools and support so you can focus on helping your students.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you have a passion for education and love working one-on-one with students, consider joining our team of tutors! Even if you haven't tutored professionally before,
          <b>
           we have a great program and team in place to help you become an awesome tutor.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           About Us:
          </b>
          <br/>
          For the past nine years, Nurturing Wisdom has provided one-on-one, in-home tutoring throughout Chicago. Our customized academic, test prep and executive functioning tutoring has helped thousands of students achieve their educational goals. Our families love us because we get great results and give them lots of personal attention. Our tutors love us for the same reasons.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           We offer. . .
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <b>
            Flexibility:
           </b>
           You'll set your own schedule and decide where you're willing to travel. We have students in Chicago, the North Shore, the western suburbs and the south suburbs.
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Top-notch curriculum:
           </b>
           We need tutors for all academic subjects, for standardized tests, and to teach organizational and study skills. You decide what you're willing to tutor and we'll teach you our highly effective tutoring strategies.
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Great matches:
           </b>
           We ask you to commit to at least three students, but beyond that it's up to you. We'll match you with students who we think are a great fit, but you'll always have the chance to accept or reject any new students.
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Resources and support:
           </b>
           You'll have a dedicated tutoring coach to answer your questions and help you grow as a tutor. We'll also provide you with a tutoring plan and curriculum resources for each student, and stay in contact with you and your families throughout tutoring.
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Competitive pay with opportunities for increases:
           </b>
           $54-$60 per 2-hour ACT tutoring session; $40-$45 per 1.5-hour middle school/high school academic tutoring session; $27-$30 per 1-hour elementary school tutoring session. Some of our tutors have decided they love working with our students so much that they've become "super tutors," working 20-30 hours a week! You earn a higher hourly rate when you take on more students.
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Career opportunities:
           </b>
           A number of our tutors have joined our team of educators as full-time staff members or as teachers at our private school in Hinsdale.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualified applicants will have. . .
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A completed bachelor's degree (additional education is a plus)
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience teaching, mentoring, tutoring or working with students in some capacity, or a desire to learn
          </li>
          <li>
           Reliable transportation to your students' homes
          </li>
          <li>
           Availability to meet with three or more students for the entire school year
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           To apply, please visit
          </b>
          <b>
           http://nurturingwisdom.com/join-our-team/nurturing-wisdom-tutoring-application/
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          We personally read and respond to every application.
         </p>
         <p>
          Areas where we need tutors: Chicago, Oak Park, River Forest, Melrose Park, Hinsdale, La Grange, Lisle, Downers Grove, Clarendon Hills, Western Springs, Elmhurst, Elmwood Park, Oak Brook, Burr Ridge, Naperville, St. Charles, Wheaton, Aurora, Addison, Bloomingdale, Glen Ellyn, Lombard, Hanover Park, Palatine, Barrington, Hoffman Estates, Inverness, Arlington Heights, Prospect Heights, Mount Prospect, Elk Grove, Orland Park, Homer Glen, Lemont, Lockport, Tinley Park, New Lenox, Palos Hills, and more.
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_16c88afbfab0420b">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>

       </font>

      </span>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          For the experienced Print Press Operator, this is your opportunity to join Eagle Flexible Packaging! We believe that good employees are one of our most valuable assets and your success in this role will be rewarded with possible advancement opportunities in the future. You will be joining a stable and successful company that can provide you with a secure and long-term career. Join our team to launch your career with an industry leader.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Job Functions:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Take the lead on all aspects of printing job - from set-up through to job completion
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with Eagle's Quality team to complete a job approval checklist
          </li>
          <li>
           Press Operators must monitor every aspect of a job as it runs, including web width, edge position, colors, print quality and screen quality.
          </li>
          <li>
           Document production issues, including material problems, down-time and plate-related problems.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complies with company policies, procedures, and core processes.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Requirements
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           2-3 years of recent work experience working with a flexographic in-line printing press.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have a high level of mechanical aptitude and be able to pass a Mechanical Reasoning test.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ideal candidates will have an understanding of in-line lamination process, as well as in-line slitting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of and experience with a defect detection system.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to work overtime as required by workload and customer-driven deadlines.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent work ethic, attitude and a strong willingness to learn.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Physical Requirements
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must be able to continuously stand for long periods of time and lift 50 pounds or more.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to stoop and kneel frequently.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have excellent color vision and be able to detect color variations.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Eagle Flexible Packaging offers a competitive salary and a strong benefits package, including health, dental, life insurance, long term disability,401K with company match.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           flexographic in-line printing press: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>

       <font size="+1">

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Eden II Programs
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Staten Island, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Residence Manager
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA/BS degree (Masters degree preferred)
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities. (autism preferred)
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid drivers license from state of residence
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent communication skills---verbal and written
          </li>
          <li>
           Good computer skills---Microsoft Word and Excel
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong supervisory experience
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Reports To:
          </b>
          Director, Residential Services
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provide on-going supervision and necessary training and feedback to direct care staff to promote effective job performance and skilled care and treatment of residents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Serve as an expert and model in the understanding of each residents needs and special alerts, and the implementation of their behavior and goal plans.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that staff is continually engaging consumers in structured learning activities and active treatment, in accordance with their individual program plan and interdisciplinary team recommendations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Document on-going supervision and feedback given to direct care staff, using supervisors observation records and other methods of documentation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that house is clean and well maintained, and that all vehicles and property are in safe and working order.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete monthly, weekly and daily staffing schedules. Ensure that there is an adequate number of trained staff available on each shift. Submit look-ahead schedules prior to the beginning of the month for administrative review, and follow-up staffing records at the close of the month for quality assurance and oversight purposes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate, schedule and participate in in-services and staff meetings on a regular basis and other meetings upon request.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain and submit accurate employee records of attendance, accrued personal time, benefits, hours and wage information for payroll purposes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all employees and volunteers have necessary information on file, including evidence of annual tuberculosis testing; current First Aid/CPR, AMAP and SCIP-R certification, and other paperwork as required by agency policy, state regulations and federal law.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that fire safety and emergency procedures are carried out in compliance with policy and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all direct support staff receive required training in areas specified and required by regulation and agency policy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide direct consumer care and treatment as necessary, including the administration of medication in accordance with AMAP guidelines and agency policy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that direct care staff receives the necessary training, guidance and feedback to complete necessary household tasks in a satisfactory manner (including meal preparation, cleaning, laundry, clothing repair, shopping and home repairs).
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all residents have adequate clothing and personal supplies at all times.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that necessary supplies for the safe and effective operation of the house are present (including food in accordance with diet plans, cleaning supplies and equipment, office supplies, etc.)
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure proper implementation and documentation of individual treatment plans and group recreational programming.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain case disbursement receipts and forward to main office for accounting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide resident banking system in the house.
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedule staff/supervisor in order to provide necessary coverage at all times.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain communication with shift supervisors, team leaders, active treatment coordinator and designated staff of daily events.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain on-going contact with consumer day programs and other providers of care and treatment to the consumers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Serve as an interdisciplinary team member and advocate for all consumers served.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete occurrence and incident follow up as necessary and in accordance with agency policies and IRC recommendations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate relevant information regarding needs of consumers and house to agency administration as requested.
          </li>
          <li>
           Respond to emergencies, crises, and unforeseen circumstances in a responsible and conscientious manner, consulting with agency administration as necessary and appropriate.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be available on an on-call basis as needed for consultation and relief.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned by supervisor.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We offer excellent benefits including a family medical and dental plan, employee life insurance, LTD insurance, FSA plan, HRA plan, tuition reimbursement, employer matching pension plan, EAP benefits, generous paid time off policy, home and auto discounts and many others.
         </p>
         <p>
          Please visit our website for more information at:
          <br/>
          www.eden2.org
         </p>
         <p>
          *Resumes without salary requirements will not be considered.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Staten Island, NY
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Developmental Disabilities: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required license or certification:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Driver's License
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">

       </font>
      </b>

      </span>

      </span>
     </div>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          At ZIRX, our mission is to make time rewording for our customers. Were the leading on-demand valet parking service and were looking to expand our team. We want a Customer Services Lead who can drive customer delight by providing world-class support and building scalable internal processes around it. The ideal candidate is a fiercely loyal advocate for our customers, a creative problem-solver, and a collaborative team member. This person is energized by working with people, while still being a strong independent worker.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Your Role and Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Heres some ideas on what youll work on at ZIRX:
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively solve customer inquiries via phone, email, and Twitter.
          </li>
          <li>
           Build and hold an extremely high bar for support and customer outreach.
          </li>
          <li>
           Own every customer touch point internal documentation
          </li>
          <li>
           Collaborate with members of other teams to root out answers and be a resource to teammates
          </li>
          <li>
           Treat support as a product at ZIRX, innovating and iterating on the customer experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively and efficiently liaise between our customers and product teams to enhance ZIRXs offerings
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Our Needs and Qualifications
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Heres some ideas on what you need to work at ZIRX and what were looking for:
          </li>
          <li>
           You have thrived, or be 100% sure you can thrive, in a small, fast and nimble team.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Strong organizational, analytical, written and verbal communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Superb attention to detail
          </li>
          <li>
           Expertise in effectively influencing and communicating cross-functionally
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits, Pay and Opportunities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Work at a great company with amazing people  all focused on solving a really big problem.
          </li>

           Great SF office location  close to Caltrain, but we also provide valet parking
          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
