<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0e70r8b06kf7n" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Academic and Test Preparation Tutor
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       New Coda
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Burlingame, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $40 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Join our Team
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          New Coda is seeking personable tutors who excel in their specialty subject area(s) and SAT, ACT, and SAT II test preparation.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Who We Are
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          A boutique academic and test preparation tutoring center based in Burlingame, CA, New Coda navigate students through the educational landscape at both the micro and macro level. Whether students bring a short-term research and writing project or need long-term guidance negotiating the standardized test timetable, we are here to help.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Philosophy
          </i>
          <br/>
          Before tutors can effectively connect students with content, tutors must connect with the students. At New Coda, all sessions meet student goals based on each student's personality and learning style. Unlike larger, corporate tutoring chains, New Coda is not limited by standardized approaches to learning; decisions pertinent to content and methodology are made individually to best serve the student.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Culture
          </i>
          <br/>
          It wasnt so long ago that tutors at New Coda were students themselves. Our tutors have a natural love of learning and are inspired to pass this passion on with energy and enthusiasm. Tutors have access to New Codas library, and they are encouraged to supplement these materials with content that excites their own interests and animates their sessions. We are flexible, collaborative, and value an innovative spirit. When tutors have the freedom to tailor lessons to the student and can incorporate stimulating content, learning evolves from simple instruction to an experience of collaborative scholarship.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Challenges
          </i>
          <br/>
          New Coda is a small-scale tutoring center with a sizable and expanding client base. With our focus fixated on student learning, we must explore how to continue to improve our service to existing students while also sharing our experience and expertise with a wider audience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Goals
          </i>
          <br/>
          To better share best practices and reach more students, New Coda is expanding our talent pool, developing relevant and engaging curricular content, and reaching out to new clients.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Our Tutors
          </i>
          <br/>
          We are not the brilliant yet curmudgeonly intellectuals steeped too deeply in the old ways of academia. Our tutors are the heart of New Codas operations; their enthusiasm and talent make our modest tutoring center mighty, and they are valued for their experience, expertise, zeal, and dedication to their craft. Tutoring is an art, and true artistry is rare.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications
          </b>
          <br/>
          We are seeking specialty tutors for ongoing test preparation and academic sessions with high school students.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Specialities:
          </i>
          <br/>
          English (Grammar, Writing, Literary Analysis)
          <br/>
          Social Studies (US and World History, Economics, American Government)
          <br/>
          Mathematics (Algebra, Geometry, Precalculus, Calculus)
          <br/>
          Science (Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Environmental Science)
         </p>
         <p>
          The test preparation component (SAT, ACT, SAT II) is paramount; most of our students first seek this service, then some continue with academic sessions. Experience working with test prep materials is ideal, but not required. Our tutors are willing to research and master new content as well as work within their specialty (or specialties!). Our tutors primary concern is to connect with students and make the learning experience a positive social experience, both relevant and productive to the students test preparation and academic needs.
         </p>
         <p>
          New tutors would begin with a trial period, working with one or two students, and then gradually add more students based on the tutors expertise and our students needs. Ultimately, a successful tutor at New Coda would work with up to twenty students per week.
         </p>
         <p>
          Rates depend on experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          New Coda works with students in our Burlingame location, and tutors are also expected to travel to students' locations as needed. Our service area includes the peninsula: Millbrae down through Los Gatos. Tutors must provide reliable transportation.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our tutors a have excellent communication and time management skills.
         </p>
         <p>
          Interested applicants should send a resume and cover letter, including references and a brief (1-2 page) explanation of your tutoring philosophy.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $40.00 /hour
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_d8f8f0688716acf5">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>

 </body>

    <td width="1125">

   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        LEAD DC Power Technician
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       ETAK Systems, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Description:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Partnered with a fellow technician, drive equipment to cell sites during the day (and in some cases the evening) and install DC Power &amp; Battery systems. Tremendous autonomy while you are working in shelters and cabinets within cell site compounds constructing battery racks &amp; cable trays. Perform simple voltage &amp; resistance tests and minor trouble shooting of equipment such as rectifiers, disconnects, power plants and battery plants. Repair problems found and install and upgrade breakers, cable and other related equipment. This position offers the opportunity to work outdoors and on the ground (no tower work) for a fast growing company in the wireless industry.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Wireless Equipment Installation  routers, DC Power, LTE Upgrades, RF
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepares hardware and equipment to be installed, for himself/herself or a higher level technician
          </li>
          <li>
           Equipment construction of battery racks
          </li>
          <li>
           Power plants, Cable tray, racking systems, performs simple voltage &amp; resistance test procedures
          </li>
          <li>
           Performs/ trouble shooting equipment such as rectifiers, disconnects, power plants and battery plants, repairs
          </li>
          <li>
           Installs and upgrades components, parts, cable, equipment and systems for backup DC Power
          </li>
          <li>
           Test circuits and components of malfunctioning telecommunications equipment to isolate sources of malfunctions, using test meters, circuit diagrams, polarity probes, and other hand tools.
          </li>
          <li>
           Test repaired, newly installed, or updated equipment to ensure that it functions properly and conforms to specifications, using test equipment and observation.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Skills Qualifications
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Document procedures for hardware and software installation and use
          </li>
          <li>
           Document technical specifications and operating standards for telecommunications equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Load and Unload company vehicles
          </li>
          <li>
           Drive vehicles weighing 26,001 + pounds
          </li>
          <li>
           Use power tools
          </li>
          <li>
           Simple electrical knowledge
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow safety standards
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Valid Driver's License with good driving record - Required
          </li>
          <li>
           Associates or Technical degree from college, or High School Degree /GED and military training, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in DC Power and RF
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer skills - Microsoft Office products, Great Plains experience a plus
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent interpersonal skills , Professional demeanor
          </li>
          <li>
           Must Pass DOT Physical, Prehire Drug Screen, and background check
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to lift 100+ pounds regularly unassisted  High Impact / High Activity Job Consistence Basis
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to travel 100%
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Other Duties
          </b>
          <br/>
          Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Chicago, IL
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           DC Power/Batteries/Installation/Telecommunications: 4 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Associate
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Restaurant General Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Pacific Bells, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Pacific Bells, Inc., a large franchisee of Taco Bell, is seeking a Restaurant General Manager to lead a team in one of our fast food restaurants in the Seattle area. Our Restaurant General Managers are the key operators in our organization, responsible for the success of their restaurant. They provide overall leadership and direct supervision for operations. We are looking for a strong leader who can motivate and lead a dynamic team to success. If you have restaurant management experience and are ready to advance your career by joining a winning team, heres your opportunity!
         </p>
         <p>
          Restaurant Operations Manager (Fast Food)
         </p>
         <p>
          As an Operations Manager you are accountable for the organized, efficient and profitable operation of the restaurant through achieving and maintaining high standards of cleanliness, hospitality, accuracy, building maintenance, product quality and speed of service.
         </p>
         <p>
          Specific duties:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ensuring cost categories/controllable expenses are controlled to company guidelines/budgeted levels
          </li>
          <li>
           Working within their restaurant to produce positive sales growth by executing standards in all areas
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintaining adequate staffing levels to meet all scheduling requirements
          </li>
          <li>
           Preparing and conducting Team Member, Shift Leader and assistant managerperformance appraisals
          </li>
          <li>
           Coaching, counseling, training and developing all Team Members and managersto expected certification and performance levels
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensuring that all foodservice sanitation guidelines/regulations are met
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensuring excellent levels of customer service on all shifts and properly handles guestcomplaints/concerns to facilitate repeat business
          </li>
          <li>
           Providing relevant and timely feedback to their Area Coach on operating results
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively managing turnover by practicing effective selection and training and by treating their people right
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Job Requirements
         </p>
         <p>
          Successful Restaurant General Managers have experience and demonstrated ability to lead and manage a business as well as their teams. This restaurant management role requires a strong leader that can motivate, coach and correct team members as necessary. Effective time management, organizational and communication skills are also essential.
         </p>
         <p>
          Additional requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School Diploma, a degree is a plus but not required
          </li>
          <li>
           3 years general manager experience, previous Yum! Brands experience is a plus
          </li>
          <li>
           Fast food/quick service experience a plus
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent oral and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent planning, organization and follow-up skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong decision making and conflict resolution skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Bilingual is a plus
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Benefits
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a great opportunity to build a rewarding career with a growing company. We are opening new restaurants almost every quarter creating plenty of opportunities for advancement. With a career at Taco Bell your hard work will not go unnoticed. We have a recognition and reward program where our Operations Managers can earn various incentives based on performance and years of service. Every year the 8 top performing general managers go on an all-expenses paid trip to Las Vegas with the Owner and Vice Presidents. That is just one example of the many bonuses and benefits we offer in addition to a competitive compensation plan.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Medical, dental, vision
          </li>
          <li>
           Life insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Flexible spending
          </li>
          <li>
           401(k)
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid holiday, vacation and sick time (the longer youre with us, the more paid time off we give you!)
          </li>
          <li>
           Bonus plan
          </li>
          <li>
           Management referral bonus
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Restaurant Management: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Human Resources Assistant (Part-Time)
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Charter Oak Communities
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Stamford, CT
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Human Resources Assistant
          </b>
          <br/>
          Part-Time (25 hours per week)
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Summary:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Areas of responsibility include the following: employee benefits administration, recruitment, payroll review, identifying and coordination of training programs.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Duties and Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Reviews and verifies employees medical, dental, short term and long term benefit calculations to ensure accuracy of monthly premium statements and maintains statistical data relative to premiums, claims and costs; resolves administrative problems with carrier representatives
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists employees with claim issues, i.e. disability, insurance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicates regularly with insurance carrier representatives on wellness program initiatives and communicates accordingly.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reviews current insurance legislation to determine necessary changes in insurance requirements and coverage.
          </li>
          <li>
           Plans and conducts annual audit of employees individual benefits to ensure eligibility of plan members. Provides cost savings when applicable.
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedules and coordinates enrollment periods, presentations and training concerning benefit programs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains ADPs HRB system module with employee pertinent data, i.e. change of address.
          </li>
          <li>
           Makes changes in ADPs Payroll system module when applicable, i.e. add, delete medical benefits.
          </li>
          <li>
           Populates and audits ADPs HRB system regularly to ensure accuracy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Serves as a Custodian of Records for personnel and related files.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains I-9 records to ensure legal adherence.
          </li>
          <li>
           Supports the Human Resources records retention plan/policy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reviews invoices and processes appropriate finance paperwork as required for payment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Makes appointments, coordinates meetings and organizes training as requested.
          </li>
          <li>
           Surveys industry and/or community to determine organizations competitive position in employee benefits.
          </li>
          <li>
           Identifies and coordinates staff training.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists in providing pertinent data for bargaining unit negotiations, i.e. cost saving comparison in medical programs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Recruits, phone screens and coordinates when applicable interviews with COC management.
          </li>
          <li>
           Attends applicable association meetings and engages educational institutes, i.e. colleges, technical schools, to proactively recruit for positions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists in the ongoing development of internship programs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists in the development of apprenticeship programs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates and conducts New Hire Employee Orientation Training to all new hires.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists in the development and/or revision of policies and procedures and other related documents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Creates, writes and reviews articles for the Employee Newsletter.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists in reviewing all annual performance reviews to ensure completeness and timely submittal.
          </li>
          <li>
           May participate in a team or individually in improvement efforts, wellness initiatives and special event preparation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Acts on behalf of human resources management in her/his absence.
          </li>
          <li>
           May be required to perform other related duties as required and/or assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Superior customer service skills to employees, residents, vendors.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to adhere to all human resources assignments in a confidential manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to identify proactively employee related issues and bring to managements attention immediately.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to financially reconcile invoices when necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong attention to detail skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong conflict resolution skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent interpersonal, judgment, reasoning, time management, follow-up and organizational skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to manage multiple priorities under pressure.
          </li>
          <li>
           Extensive ability to communicate successfully with people from a broad range of backgrounds.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong ability to work in a fast-paced, high pressured and changing environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent ability to speak with diplomacy and professionalism with individuals and groups.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong ability to write well for internal and external communications.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work with minimal supervision.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Minimum Education/Experience Requirements:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Graduation from an accredited college or university with an Associates Degree in Business Management, Human Resources or a related field. Two (2) years of human resources experience.
          <br/>
          or
          <br/>
          Diploma from an accredited high school. Four (4) years of human resources experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Additional Requirements:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook proficiency. An exam may be administered which will assess competency level in accordance with position description criteria. A current drivers license and the ability to maintain a current license. Pass a pre-employment physical, drug screening, educational background check and criminal investigation.
         </p>
         <p>
          An Equal Opportunity Employer
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>

      </span>

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          4G Wireless Inc. is seeking talented Store Managers!
         </p>
         <p>
          Please feel free to visit our website: www.4gwireless.com
          <br/>
          Like us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/4GWirelessINC
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Company Information:
          </b>
          <br/>
          4G Wireless, Inc. The Premium Agent of Verizon Wireless, with over 130 locations in CA and NV is growing faster than wireless industry. Success, innovation and development are all part of our growth and driven each day by exceptional people at 4G wireless, Inc.
         </p>
         <p>
          By joining our team, you will team up with some of the best and brightest people from wireless industry who share your vision and passion for success. Our team will help you develop new skills and channel your energy into amazing results, exciting experiences and great rewards and success. A team of the best talents and resources working together in the Wireless Communication industry toward shared goal of Ruling the Air Waves.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           We Offer:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Base plus commission; Sales Consultant(s) can earn $1,000 or more per month in commission by meeting and/or exceeding sales quota
          </li>
          <li>
           Medical, dental, vision, disability and life benefit plan (full-time employee)
          </li>
          <li>
           401K retirement planning (after 6 months)
          </li>
          <li>
           Total rewards package including high quality training, Verizon Wireless phone service discount, limitless advancement and transfer between multiple locations
          </li>
          <li>
           4G Wireless is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce M/F/D/V
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Looking for a career which provides professional and personal growth? Are you ready to work with the latest technology on the market? Are you an outgoing person with high energy loves to help people? Can you increase sales and profitability while working within a dynamic and highly motivated sales team? If so, your new Career is calling you!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Summary:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          The Sales Store Manager role is responsible for meeting or exceeding the monthly sales generation goals assigned to his/her store by actively managing his/her stores sales staff and personally driving sales. The Store Manager role also ensures that all operational and procedural objectives of the store are met, coordinates the safety and security of its employees and products, participates in the the hiring training and development of his/her team, and ensures location sales objectives are attained.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Recruits, trains, coaches and develops sales staff on all aspects of sales for 4G Wireless, including, but not limited to, sales techniques, products, promotions, and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Actively manages and motivates sales team on a daily basis to ensure 4G sales quotas are being met or exceeded.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides effective performance feedback to all staff and sets timeframe for achievement.
          </li>
          <li>
           Consistently finds ways to increase employee and location productivity, DRIVES sales.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains appropriate level of staffing at location by recruiting, selecting, orienting and training employees.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures availability of merchandise by maintaining inventory levels.
          </li>
          <li>
           Markets merchandise by adhering to advertising, sales promotion, and display plans.
          </li>
          <li>
           Secures merchandise and protects employees by adhering to security standards.
          </li>
          <li>
           Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Handles scheduling of staff at location to ensure appropriate shift coverage.
          </li>
          <li>
           Handles all escalated customer service issues with professionalism.
          </li>
          <li>
           Executes daily operational procedures with efficiency, diligence, and integrity.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicates, executes, and enforces 4G policies and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           This is not an exhaustive list of duties or functions and may not necessarily comprise all of the "essential functions" for purposes of the ADA.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Expected Areas of Competence (i.e. KSAs):
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to create sales momentum.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven ability to work well in a team environment and ability to lead by example.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent interpersonal skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates commitment to excellent customer service.
          </li>
          <li>
           Basic interview skills and enhanced staffing knowledge.
          </li>
          <li>
           Relevant history of high retail sales performance.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Education/ Experience Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School diploma, AA preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           3-5 years of experience in Retail sales environment, 2 years in a leadership/supervisory role.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

         <p>
          **IMMEDIATE OPENING** Experience Only. Must have CHUMS and SAR. Essential Job Duties:  * Responsible for assessing the risk of a loan and making an approval or decline decision based on the quality of the data in the loan file.  * Reviews and ensures data integrity to confirm the accuracy of automated underwriting findings.  * Applies all internal underwriting guidelines, investor requirements and federal regulations to the decision process to ensure loan quality.  * Analyze and verify the employment profile, credit strength, property characteristics and all other information pertinent to the credit decision process on each loan application.  * Interacts with Mortgage Professionals to obtain information from the borrower or to seek clarification about documents in the loan file.  * Communicates required conditions and stipulations, and provides assistance to expedite the final approval of a file.  * Provides strong and clear communication to processors, underwriters, mortgage professionals and borrowers regarding documents needed for mortgage loan files to ensure quick turnaround time.  * Adhere to all applicable policies and procedures, and protect the confidentiality of borrower information.  * Other duties as assigned. Kiel Mortgage - CL 53969
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           CHUMS and SAR Required: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_3b703515209e08bc">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          In the Supported Living Services (SLS) Program, Support Coordinators are responsible for supervising support to individuals with developmental disabilities. They work independently and use their skills, knowledge, and judgment to develop and affect appropriate individual support plans (ISPs) that enable individuals to live in and connect with their community.
          <br/>
          Their work includes collaboration with the families, Regional Centers, and other service providers. Support Coordinators supervise Direct Support Professional staff and create and approve staff schedules, including requests for time off and coverage for staff that call off sick. Support Coordinators are also responsible for working with individuals, often on flexible schedules, to identify and respond to their needs and preferences.
         </p>
         <p>
          High School Diploma or GED
          <br/>

          <br/>

          </li>

      </span>
      -

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Electrician Journeyman
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Pure Electric
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Hayward, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          A well-rounded Journeyman Electrician with minimum five years' experience is needed for projects throughout the Greater San Francisco Bay area. We perform small to large scale tenant improvements on apartments, homes, and commercial buildings. We also perform service work for a large customer base as well as new customers. A background check and drug test will be performed. You must submit a resume to be considered.
         </p>
         <p>
          Electrician must have the following skills and qualifications:
          <br/>
          1. Assemble, install, test, and maintain electrical and data/comm wiring, equipment, and fixtures using hand tools and power tools.
          <br/>
          2. Diagnose malfunctioning systems and components, using test equipment and hand tools, to locate the cause of a breakdown and correct the problem.
          <br/>
          3. Connect wires to circuit breakers, transformers, or other components.
          <br/>
          4. Inspect electrical systems, equipment, and components to identify hazards, defects, and the need for adjustment or repair, and to ensure compliance with codes.
          <br/>
          5. Test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures using testing devices such as ohmmeters, voltmeters, and megohmmeters to ensure compatibility and safety of system.
          <br/>
          6. Maintain CA electrician certification to meet governmental regulations.
          <br/>
          7. Plan layout and installation of electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures based on job specifications, plans, and local codes.
          <br/>
          8. Direct and train workers to install, maintain, or repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures.
          <br/>
          9. Prepare sketches or follow blueprints to determine the location of wiring and equipment and to ensure conformance to building and safety codes.
          <br/>
          10. Use a variety of tools and equipment such as power construction equipment, measuring devices, power tools, and testing equipment including multimeters, ammeters, and test lamps.
          <br/>
          11. Install ground leads and connect power cables to equipment, such as motors and transformers.
          <br/>
          12. Perform business management duties such as maintaining records and files, preparing reports and invoices/sales receipts, and ordering supplies and equipment for assigned projects.
          <br/>
          13. Repair or replace wiring, equipment, and fixtures using hand tools and power tools.
          <br/>
          14. Work from ladders, scaffolds, scissor lifts, and roofs to install, maintain or repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures.
          <br/>
          15. Place conduit (pipes or tubing) inside designated partitions, walls, or other concealed areas, and pull insulated wires or cables through the conduit to complete circuits between junction boxes.
          <br/>
          16. Construct and fabricate parts, using hand tools and specifications.
          <br/>
          17. Fasten small metal or plastic boxes to walls to house electrical switches or receptacles.
          <br/>
          18. Perform physically demanding tasks, such as digging trenches to lay conduit and moving and lifting heavy objects.
          <br/>
          19. Provide cost estimates for materials and services.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Electrician: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_bc1e4b244b3118ad">

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>

      </span>

      </span>

         <p>
          <b>
           PLEASE DO NOT REPLY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE DESIRED EXPERIENCE; CANDIDATES WITH LESS THAN 5 YEARS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Summary:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           This position requires someone who has experience in leading all aspects of accounts payable processing, including three-way matching, approval, verification and payments in an inventory-based, purchase order driven industry (retail sales and wholesale equipment distribution).
          </li>
          <li>
           Who has effectively overseen vendor invoice reconciliation and maintenance of vendor accounts (including discounts and rebate programs), is customer service focused and will take ownership of the accounts payable process. This position reports to the Accounts Payable Supervisor and may include assisting with accounting functions.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Objective:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Oversee as a team all activities in the accounts payable function.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure timely payments ofvendor invoices, maximize available discounts and rebates, reconcile expense vouchers and procurement cards as well as maintain accurate records and internal controls to ensure proper payments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for preparing accounts payable register and related reports.
          </li>
          <li>
           Process Monthly, Quarterly and Yearly Sales Tax.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain skills current with accounts payable trends, concepts, practices, procedures and controls.
          </li>
          <li>
           Rely on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Will perform a variety of tasks. At times may lead and direct the work of others.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills/Qualifications:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of solid, stable, high volume and full cycle Accounts Payable experience and must also have demonstrated strong leadership skills in building and maintaining positive / effective relationships with vendors and internal departments while resolving inventory receiving and payment issues.
          <br/>
          Must have strong MS Excel skills.
          <br/>
          Navision experience and a college degree is a plus.
         </p>
         <p>
          You will enjoy the support of the top vendors and suppliers in the industry, a proven and experienced management team, and a strong in-house customer support focus. We offer a competitive benefits package with health plans, a 401k, profit sharing plan, and the security of working for an industry leader with over 80 years of proven success.
         </p>
         <p>
          EBRS cares about the safety and well-being of our Team members and therefore, utilizes background checks, as well as drug screens as a condition of employment.
         </p>
         <p>
          See us at www.eastbayrestaurantsupply.com.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>

          <li>

          </li>

         <p>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          Snoqialmie, WA 98065
          <br/>

          <br/>
          Sous Chef

          <br/>
          -Ability to create menus, recipes &amp; production procedures
          <br/>
          -May be required to write and price custom menus for banquet events; such as Vegetarian or Gluten free options
          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          -Working knowledge of cost controls
          <br/>
          -Maintains standards and specifications related to food preparation/handling on a daily basis
          <br/>
          -Execution of all menu categories and specific recipes for each menu item including timing, quality, temperature, portion and presentation
          <br/>
          -Knowledge, responsibility and thorough understanding of food safety and sanitation guidelines including temperature requirements, while understanding the science of cooking temperatures while maintaining proper temperatures throughout preparation, cooling, holding and serving of food items; this includes adjusting thermostat controls to regulate temperatures
          <br/>
          -Observe and test food being cooked by tasting, smelling and piercing with cooking utensil to determine that food is cooked properly, according to specifications

          <br/>
          -Strong communication, leadership and interpersonal skills
          <br/>
          -Exp. With coaching and motivating employees
          <br/>
          -Adept at troubleshooting and can calmly handle difficult situations
          <br/>
          -Able to create, read and understand recipes
          <br/>
          -Must have adequate knife skills and knowledge of proper use
          <br/>
          -Organizational skills; able to lead a team in a very fast paced environment
          <br/>
          -Positive, friendly and helpful attitude to our guests and fellow team members
          <br/>
          -Motivates and encourages team members through daily reinforcement and coaching
          <br/>
          -Demonstrates passion and enthusiasm for working in the kitchen; proven knowledge of culinary techniques and terminology
          <br/>
          -Food Safety Certification or equivalent
          <br/>
          -Must be flexible and able to work a variety of shifts, including days, nights, weekends, holidays and special events
          <br/>
          -At least 18 years of age to be considered
          <br/>
          -This role is Full Time and requires full availability for any shift, seven (7) days per week, including nights and holidays
         </p>

          Required experience:
         </p>

          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          We are a multi-level retirement community located in Castro Valley currently looking for an experienced dining room supervisor to work full time on our campus. Ideal candidates have a strong work ethic, are hospitality minded, possess a passion for food and quality, always put forth their best effort, excellent communication skills, plan ahead, follow directions and guidance from supervisory and management team, able to work well with others and adhere to safety and sanitation regulations, are safety conscious, possess a sense of urgency, pay attention to the "little things", and are able to function in a high volume, fast-paced, multi-tasking environment.

         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

          </b>
          <br/>
          Supervision of front of house staff; will be involved in orientation of new staff, ongoing training and in-services, counseling/carrying out discipline of staff as required, evaluating staff for 90 day and annual reviews.
          <br/>
          Supervise physical appearance of dining room and waitstaff stations to ensure standards are being met.
          <br/>
          Ensures that all policies and procedures related to safety and health are followed, including but not limited to safe work practices, infection control, etc.
          <br/>
          Ensures posted schedules meet all staffing/labor/budget guidelines.
          <br/>
          Promotes team work within the department and between departments to ensure smooth operations and quality service.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Ability to read, speak and write the English language in order to effectively communicate with staff, residents and guests of Baywood Court.
          <br/>
          Excellent interpersonal skills Ability to plan and organize work; ability to multi-task and prioritize
          <br/>
          Computer skills - MS Office: Outlook, Word, Excel
          <br/>
          Possess a sense of urgency, attention to detail and quality
          <br/>
          Minimum one year experience as dining room supervisor with experience in counseling/disciplining staff
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORKING CONDITIONS:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Work indoors; light to moderate physical effort 90% of the time. Must be able to stand and walk 90% of the work day. Ability to stoop, bend and stretch frequently. Must be able to lift up to 20 pounds.
         </p>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Restaurant General Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Pacific Bells, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Pacific Bells, Inc., a large franchisee of Taco Bell, is seeking a Restaurant General Manager to lead a team in one of our fast food restaurants in the Seattle area. Our Restaurant General Managers are the key operators in our organization, responsible for the success of their restaurant. They provide overall leadership and direct supervision for operations. We are looking for a strong leader who can motivate and lead a dynamic team to success. If you have restaurant management experience and are ready to advance your career by joining a winning team, heres your opportunity!
         </p>
         <p>
          Restaurant Operations Manager (Fast Food)
         </p>
         <p>
          As an Operations Manager you are accountable for the organized, efficient and profitable operation of the restaurant through achieving and maintaining high standards of cleanliness, hospitality, accuracy, building maintenance, product quality and speed of service.
         </p>
         <p>
          Specific duties:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ensuring cost categories/controllable expenses are controlled to company guidelines/budgeted levels
          </li>
          <li>
           Working within their restaurant to produce positive sales growth by executing standards in all areas
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintaining adequate staffing levels to meet all scheduling requirements
          </li>
          <li>
           Preparing and conducting Team Member, Shift Leader and assistant managerperformance appraisals
          </li>
          <li>
           Coaching, counseling, training and developing all Team Members and managersto expected certification and performance levels
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensuring that all foodservice sanitation guidelines/regulations are met
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensuring excellent levels of customer service on all shifts and properly handles guestcomplaints/concerns to facilitate repeat business
          </li>
          <li>
           Providing relevant and timely feedback to their Area Coach on operating results
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively managing turnover by practicing effective selection and training and by treating their people right
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Job Requirements
         </p>
         <p>
          Successful Restaurant General Managers have experience and demonstrated ability to lead and manage a business as well as their teams. This restaurant management role requires a strong leader that can motivate, coach and correct team members as necessary. Effective time management, organizational and communication skills are also essential.
         </p>
         <p>
          Additional requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School Diploma, a degree is a plus but not required
          </li>
          <li>
           3 years general manager experience, previous Yum! Brands experience is a plus
          </li>
          <li>
           Fast food/quick service experience a plus
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent oral and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent planning, organization and follow-up skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong decision making and conflict resolution skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Bilingual is a plus
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Benefits
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a great opportunity to build a rewarding career with a growing company. We are opening new restaurants almost every quarter creating plenty of opportunities for advancement. With a career at Taco Bell your hard work will not go unnoticed. We have a recognition and reward program where our Operations Managers can earn various incentives based on performance and years of service. Every year the 8 top performing general managers go on an all-expenses paid trip to Las Vegas with the Owner and Vice Presidents. That is just one example of the many bonuses and benefits we offer in addition to a competitive compensation plan.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Medical, dental, vision
          </li>
          <li>
           Life insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Flexible spending
          </li>
          <li>
           401(k)
          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

       </font>
      </b>

      </span>
     </div>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Currently looking for a Promotions and Events Manager to fill a vacancy in Des Plaines, IL. The successful candidate will have casino/gaming marketing experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Promotions and Events
          </b>
          <b>
           Manager Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Manages the research, development, planning, execution and evaluation of all promotions, events and entertainment for Casino both on and off property.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manages all aspects of promotions and events, from the beginning planning stages, to execution of all details for the insurance of a successful event, through completion of the event and event analysis.
          </li>
          <li>
           Directly works with cross-department execution plan(s) for all promotions and events.
          </li>
          <li>
           Directly works with promotional kiosk vendor and other promotional vendors to ensure proper utilization and execution of all assets.
          </li>
          <li>
           Works directly with the Illinois Gaming Board, including submitting official details for all promotions and events and ensures compliance with all approved Marketing submissions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for testing of all promotional details prior to submission and execution.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for helping to present ideas to expand the brand and consideration set beyond strictly gaming assets. Utilizes promotional and entertainment opportunities to support the brand.
          </li>
          <li>
           Guides and ensures proper implementation of all new entertainment and promotional strategies to ensure that they are successful while providing a high level of return on investment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Promotions and Events Manager
          </b>
          <b>
           Requirements
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           3+ years experience in casino gaming required
          </li>
          <li>
           1-2 years experience in marketing required

           POSITION TITLE:
          </b>
          Store Manager
          <br/>
          <b>
           DEPARTMENT:
          </b>
          Retail
          <br/>
          <b>
           COMPANY:
          </b>
          Second Time Around
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Who we are!
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Second Time Around is a growing, upscale, re-sale fashion boutique with 41+ stores. STA offers a curated fashion point of view and sought after styles from such brands as Stella McCartney, Chloe, Rag &amp; Bone Theory, DVF, Rebecca Minkoff among other contemporary and luxury brands.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our vision is to empower women to feel beautiful and smart. We are looking for dynamic leaders hungry to make a difference and be part of a growth story.
         </p>
         <p>
          We offer great retail hours, a fun and creative environment, and opportunity for career growth
         </p>
         <p>
          What you bring!
          <br/>
          We seek energetic, people-focused, leaders who simply love fashion and love people. If you are goal oriented, self-motivated, with a keen eye for fashion we are looking for you!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           The Store Stylist Sales Manager must be client-focused, energetic, positive, with a strong desire to drive sales!
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Achieve financial goals for the store.
          </li>
          <li>
           Motivate associates to increase sales and profitability.
          </li>
          <li>
           Define and exemplify customer service expectations for associates.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop and instill a selling culture with associates.
          </li>
          <li>
           Praise and motivate associates for all successes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor and control store expenses.
          </li>
          <li>
           Hold self-accountable for results.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Store Environment Goals:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ensure store experience is inspiring, enticing, and welcoming
          </li>
          <li>
           Meet all company standards in regards to cleanliness, store layout, signage and merchandising.
          </li>
          <li>
           Train all employees to be customer focused with the ability to style a customer and leave her feeling GREAT.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coach employees to continually improve the customer experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Enforce standards for employee behavior and appearance.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Staffing Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Oversee employee hiring and termination processes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop a promotable pool of employees.
          </li>
          <li>
           React quickly to performance issues, both positive and for improvement
          </li>
          <li>
           Instill a sense of pride among all store employees.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           General Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Possess the ability to self manage and others simultaneously.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Human Resources Administrator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Connelly Skis Inc./CWB Board Co.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Lynnwood, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Position: Human Resources Administrator
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Compensation: DOE
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Connelly Skis, Inc. has been in business since 1965 manufacturing watersports products. Our products are sold world-wide. Our work environment is casual and fun. Connelly Skis promotes a healthy workplace for all of our employees. It is our policy to not offer employment to individuals who smoke or use tobacco products and hire only those who successfully pass a drug test. This is a great job for water sports enthusiasts - we offer discounts as part of our benefit package!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB OVERVIEW:
          </b>
          This position is responsible for performing a variety of human resources, accounting and office administrative duties. Assists Managers and Employees with their HR needs. Processes payroll, manages the time records and related reports. Coordinates a variety of employee activities. Responsible for coordinating recruiting, the orientation of new employees, employee benefit enrollments and other related activities. Processes Workers Comp claims, handles OSHA reports and participates in Safety Committee activities. Maintains Human Resource records and files, ensuring confidential information are secure.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB RESPONSIBILITIES (include, but are not limited to):
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Maintains knowledge of employment policies, contributes to employee handbook editing, distributes employee handbook when changes are received and answers employee questions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates recruiting/hiring functions for approved job openings. Screens applicants and conducts phone interviews. May also attend second interviews to provide insight. Coordinates final interviews with the hiring manager. Ensures decisions are documented. Responds to applications/resumes received for positions, including unsolicited applications. As needed, assists managers in preparing/revising job descriptions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for payroll functions and related reports: Registers employees into the time clock system and monitors time clock; sets up the annual payroll calendar and coordinates needs with the payroll processing company; collects data; processes hours/departments, various deductions, payroll changes and enters required information into the automated payroll system; balances and verifies processed payroll and resolves discrepancies; prepares checks and distributes; prepares payroll-related reports, files/secures payroll data; answers employee questions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates the 401 (k) Plan and insurance enrollment processes and requested benefit changes, including the annual enrollment period.
          </li>
          <li>
           Carries out a variety of employee events and activities: employee meetings, luncheons, gifts, celebrations and events like United Way campaigns.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains in-house communications: bulletin board posting (legal and informational), birthdays and employment anniversary announcements, compiles monthly/annual activity calendars, distributes newsletters, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains human resource, benefit and employee files according to the records retention schedule, keeping appropriate data secure and confidential.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           DESIRED SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           At least two years of office experience work requiring computer skills, detail work, working with office equipment (phones, copiers, etc.), independent project coordination and working with people at all levels in an organization.
          </li>
          <li>
           Human Resource work experience desired.
          </li>
          <li>
           Payroll experience desired, preferably using ADP.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be a high school graduate or have equivalent experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess a high degree of integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality.
          </li>
          <li>
           Exceptional oral communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to write clear communications with accurate spelling and punctuation and display data professionally.
          </li>
          <li>
           Self-motivated, able to prioritize and plan work activities, balance multiple tasks and change priorities as needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently and as a team member.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to relate to other people and maintain positive relationships and remain open to others ideas.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent computer skills and quick to learn new systems.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We are a tobacco-free and drug-free company. Must be a non-tobacco user (for the last 6 months) and drug free (required to pass a drug test).
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must be a high school graduate or have equivalent experience. Human Resources experience desired.: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_c5cdaa53597f71fa">

         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

In 1925, NAPA was founded to meet those needs. Since then, we've sped our way to become a powerhouse in the auto parts industry. Fueled by the popularity of the automobile, our name can now be seen on over 5,800 stores, 58 distribution centers, and 13,000 NAPA AutoCare facilities across the country, and we're not stopping there.Our 80 years of experience has made us an industry leader, but don't let our age lead you to believe we can't keep up with the changing times. We're not your grandfather's NAPA. As our vehicles become more advanced, we've adapted our business in ways that allow us to stay ahead of the curve.          </p>
         <p>
          This is what it takes to get this job!
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Automotive Finance Experience is a MUST.
          </li>
          <li>
           Make responsible hiring &amp; discipline decisions to motivate a large sales force that includes internet sales.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists sales team with processing or completing sales.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide world class Interaction with customers to ensure customer satisfaction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Structure sale price &amp; trade-in presentations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains CSI at or above company standards
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure and manager proper follow up and communication with both existing and prospective clients through telephone, mailings and electronic media prior to purchase and service.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure and manager incoming e-mail and phone calls by responding to customers via electronic media
          </li>
          <li>
           Reinforces company policies and adheres to company standards
          </li>
          <li>
           Encourages compliance with applicable laws and regulations
          </li>
          <li>
           Promotes and maintains good Employee Satisfaction
          </li>
          <li>
           Attends required manager meetings.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follows Safeguards rules and regulations.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Route Driver
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Trade Supplies, Inc
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Hayward, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Trade Supplies is a leading distributor of foodservice disposable items, packaging solutions, janitorial supplies and dry foods. We strive to offer innovating, high quality products, competitive prices and exceptional customer service while working to maximize profits for our clients.
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a delivery position responsible for driving a Van or 26 Bobtail for the purpose of delivering various products. This requires using excellent customer service skills, and working in accordance with state and DOT regulations. Early morning start times are required in order to successfully meet customers needs. An individual must be able to satisfactorily perform each essential duty listed below
          <i>
           .
          </i>
          The requirements listed are a representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Operate vehicle in a variety of traffic and weather conditions
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain ongoing inter-department communications related to routing, safety, and customer relations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate strong customer relations
          </li>
          <li>
           Lift up to 50 lbs. on consistent basis
          </li>
          <li>
           Load and unload Van or Bobtail for multi-stop deliveries.
          </li>
          <li>
           Transport product by driving a van or bobtail truck.
          </li>
          <li>
           Use hand truck
          </li>
          <li>
           Accurately record delivery information and all company required documentation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for the proper documentation and disposition for any return product.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate delivery- customer issues to proper authority (i.e., Customer Service, Marketing Associate, Routers, etc.).
          </li>
          <li>
           Deliver product to each of the designated stops on assigned route.
          </li>
          <li>
           Unload product safely and deliver to customer in designated space.
          </li>
          <li>
           Check invoice for complete delivery. Process paperwork and damaged merchandise if any.
          </li>
          <li>
           Collect payments if necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Basic Requirements
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Valid Drivers License with a clean driving record (including: no single DUI in the last 3 years and no multiple DUIs within the last 7 years).
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to read, write and communicate in English as it relates to the job and to the safety regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Use safe lifting and loading techniques
          </li>
          <li>
           Have interpersonal skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Have knowledge of area and/or map reading abilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must pass pre-employment testing (Drug Screen, Background Check).
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Route Driver : 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

         </p>

          </b>
         </p>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           That is 34 to 44 Hours per Week.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </b>

          </b>

          </b>
         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          </b>

           </b>
          </li>
          <li>

           </b>
          </li>

           </b>
          </li>

           </b>

          </b>

          <br/>

          </b>

          <br/>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0dqr0lbqmk89r" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Marketing Manager, North America
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       NCC Group
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          NCC Group is looking for a dynamic and motivated Marketing Manager to manage marketing programs for NCC Group North America to drive sales and build brand awareness. The Marketing Manager will be responsible for planning, creating and delivering marketing campaigns as well as content creation and management.
         </p>
         <p>
          The successful candidate will be expected to quickly gain an understanding of the Group, global structure, target audiences, requirements and the information security industry. The candidate will report directly to the Marketing Director, North America and work closely with the global marketing team based in the UK, ensuring the NA plan is aligned to global activity.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Creation of both new content and the maintenance of existing collateral for services and sales support
          </li>
          <li>
           Planning, developing and delivering integrated customer and prospect campaigns aligned with sales objectives
          </li>
          <li>
           Increasing awareness of and educating customers and prospects about NCC Group service offerings
          </li>
          <li>
           Creating campaign assets including html email communications, invitations, landing pages and graphics
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintenance of the North America website content and coordination with UK Online Marketing Managers to implement updates in line with wider marketing plan
          </li>
          <li>
           Managing a marketing library of the following:
          </li>
          <li>
           Product collateral and data sheets
          </li>
          <li>
           New case study program
          </li>
          <li>
           Sales support documents, presentations etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Email campaigns
          </li>
          <li>
           New webinar program
          </li>
          <li>
           Website content
          </li>
          <li>
           Logos &amp; branded templates
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Develop and manage client case studies
          </li>
          <li>
           Build webinar series, manage topics, speakers and registration.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitoring, reporting and tracking of all online and offline marketing activity with a strong focus on ROI.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensuring quality control processes are maintained across all branded materials.
          </li>
          <li>
           Providing sales support to the multiple offices regarding branding, collateral requests, campaign activity and other tools to aid the sales team.
          </li>
          <li>
           Social media coordination &amp; management when applicable
          </li>
          <li>
           Collaborative project planning with marketing, sales and internal divisions both local and international
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate with research teams on promotion of whitepapers, briefs, blogs
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Solid and broad range of marketing experience and knowledge.
          </li>
          <li>
           Confident and clear communications skills with the ability to work with senior teams and Directors.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong copy writing skills and a command of the English language - correct punctuation, spelling and grammar,
           <i>
            writing samples may be requested
           </i>
          </li>
          <li>
           Understanding and experience of developing, managing, delivering and tracking multiple types of marketing campaigns/activity with focus on ROI and evaluation.
          </li>
          <li>
           A team player with desire to work on different types of marketing projects and events
          </li>
          <li>
           Creative design, layout and formatting skills,
           <i>
            design samples may be requested
           </i>
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience working as part of a larger team within marketing group as well as across organization
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of social networks and web-based technology solutions
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to monitor industry and internal trends and create stimulating content
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Understanding of the production process for all aspects of marketing, including costs, timings and key stages.
          </li>
          <li>
           2-3 years minimum marketing experience in Information Technology industry preferred. Marketing experience in other industries will be considered.
          </li>
          <li>
           Degree in Marketing, Business, PR, Communications or Journalism
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           About the Company:
          </b>
          <br/>
          NCC Group is a global information assurance specialist. We provide freedom from doubt that business critical information, websites, applications and infrastructure are available, protected, and operating as they should be at all times. Our services include software escrow &amp; verification, security testing, website performance, software testing &amp; domain services. As the cyber arms race and technology revolution continue to outpace the ability of organizations to cope with the plethora of security, performance and availability issues, we are best placed to help organizations to manage the risk and limit the threat. With our knowledge, experience, capability and global footprint we are committed to ensuring that organizations have access to a total information assurance solution that works for them. Our complementary service areas provide comprehensive end-to-end information assurance for over 15,000 organizations worldwide. We have 18 locations across the UK, Europe, North America and Australia.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Marketing in Information Technology &amp; Security: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_806f845aaae28ff6">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
