          PetersenDean Roofing and Solar Systems is the largest residential roofing and solar company in the United States. With divisions in Arizona, California, Florida, Nevada and Texas, PetersenDean installs new roofs, provides re-roofing services, and designs and installs solar power systems. Founded more than 20 years ago, our commitment to safety, superior quality customer service, and the environment has earned us an industry-wide reputation for excellence. If you haven't seen our ads please check out our website at www.petersendean.com or.www.powersaverseries.com. We are making solar ownership easy.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           !!! Immediate opening for Night Shift Call Center Supervisor !!!
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Call Center Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Schedule sales appointments and interface with Design team, to schedule and set appropriate meeting objectives and requirements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain expert level of knowledge of product as it is received and processed within the organization; demonstrate a basic knowledge of the business process. Ability to respond to requests to add/change data types within the applications as required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor application processes for appropriate trends, service levels, contract compliance, etc. within assigned area of specialty.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure activities meet or exceed all other organizational requirements for sales, safety, and general duty of care. Ensure activities meet or exceed department and contractual guidelines
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides support for personnel on day-to-day operations of assigned tasks, recommending solutions for issues.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist in changes in processes and procedures. Assist in process improvements to the company's software program and CRM.
          </li>
          <li>
           Resolve and respond to internal and external client inquiries. Support the field/Sales organizations to meet corporate revenue objectives.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Supervisor Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provide daily oversight of contact center associates.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage, train and mentor employees in the call center.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with the VP of Sales to resolve employee relations conflicts, complaints, or concerns as appropriate.
          </li>
          <li>
           Inspect and monitor the contact center associates interaction with customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage specific approved call center customer programs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Drive Petersen Dean's culture and customer values.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor scheduling and attendance issues.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with senior management as necessary to meet company's goals and objectives.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties/functions as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum of 5-years telemarketing experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of 5+ years of Call Center experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of 5-years supervisory or sales management experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           High school or GED equivalent required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience preferred.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

         </p>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Process Technician - 3rd Shift
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Wise Plastics Technologies
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Saint Charles, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Wise Plastics Technologies is experiencing explosive growth and is seeking a talented Process Technician with plastics injection molding manufacturing experience to join our Company on the 3rd shift (9:30 pm-6:00 am).
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           General Description:
          </b>
          The Process Technician is responsible for the Start-up, shut down, and troubleshooting of the molding process during normal production runs. In addition, to setting up injection molding machines and all related equipment to allow the manufacture of product that meets or exceeds the established quality levels at the standard rates that have been established.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assembling and disassembling workstations with the required secondary equipment to support manufacturing of product.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with new mold samples, and assist in the creation of full documentation on all processing
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          parameters.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Meets with the Shift Supervisor and other Process Technicians to discuss any and all issues relating to the shop floor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists the Shift Supervisor and the Lead Operators in training the operators to ensure the part quality is understood, standard production rates are maintained, and to ensure that ONLY product that meets or exceeds quality criteria is packaged.
          </li>
          <li>
           Train any Set-up Technicians, Set-up Trainees, and Material Handlers as assigned to insure that the set-ups being performed are done properly, in a safe manner, as well as a timely manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow all departmental operational procedures relating to the set-up, operation, and shut down of jobs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform special duties and or projects as assigned. Operate the machine as needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Document any and all process changes per internal procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to act as an interim supervisor.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
          High School diploma required or GED equivalent, 2 to 4 years injection molding experience required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Basic computer skills are required. Any Injection Molding Training and/or Certificates are a plus. Familiar with Toyo, Arburg, Van Dorn and Battenfeld. Must have the ability to make decisions regarding equipment and tools is very important. Ability to lift up to 50 lb. frequently.
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_18d3006c14a127a1">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

    </td>

          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

         <p>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          <b>
           Job Title:
          </b>

          <br/>
          <b>
           Requisition Number:
          </b>
          3263
          <br/>
          <b>
           Country:
          </b>
          United States
          <br/>
          <b>

          </b>

          <br/>

          </b>

          <br/>

          </b>

          <br/>

          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           State/Province:
          </b>
          California
          <br/>
          <b>
           Job Level:
          </b>

          <br/>

          </b>

          <br/>
          <b>

          </b>

          </b>

          </b>
          Marketing/PR/Corp. Info
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Description:
          </b>
          As a member of the small, fast-paced in-house social media and public relations team, this role is responsible for helping tell the SVB story in traditional and social media channels. Responsibilities include monitoring SVBs social media channels, curating and publishing content, responding to questions and feedback, and handling monthly and quarterly reporting. This department handles external communication for all areas of the company, including corporate, product, community, government affairs and our various lines of business.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Help manage SVBs social media presences on Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn and other relevant social media sites
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate daily in SVB social media channels by monitoring conversations/posts; posting content; responding to questions and feedback; identifying post authors using CRM and sharing interactions, feedback and sales leads with appropriate client service, relationship and product teams; monitoring competitive activities; escalate issues as needed to the social media manager and/or PR director
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop and deliver monthly and quarterly reports
          </li>
          <li>
           Serve as a back-up for the social media manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Other public relations activities as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills and Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Experience in social media and B2B communications
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience using social media management software (Sprinklr experience a plus) and a variety of social media platforms
          </li>
          <li>
           Writing/ editing/ proofing
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to multi-task and shift gears quickly
          </li>
          <li>
           Project management and organizational skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Attention to detail and sense of urgency
          </li>
          <li>
           Reporting/data analysis
          </li>
          <li>
           Positive attitude
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Social Media and B2B Communications: 1 year
          </li>

         <p>
          Envelope Machine Adjuster Training Program
          <br/>
          Continental Envelope in Geneva, Illinois is seeking a select group of people to join our Envelope Machine Adjuster Training Program. Continental Envelope is a family run business that is one of the largest commercial envelope manufacturers in the Midwest. We focus on delivering dependable results by listening to our customers and working with them to make sure the job is done right the first time. Continental Envelope is a thriving company producing 8 to 10 million envelopes per day and runs 13 machines on 3 shifts.
         </p>
         <p>
          Candidates will receive extensive and comprehensive training to develop all the skills needed to become a qualified Machine Adjuster in a manufactuing environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          Upon completion of the training program you would be able to:
          <br/>
           Repair, adjustment, and preventative and daily maintenance to establish and maintain proper machine speeds.
          <br/>
           Analyze mechanical operational problems on equipment.
          <br/>
           Make necessary corrections and adjustments to maintain production and quality.
          <br/>
          Trainees should possess some mechanical aptitude, understand basic functions of machines, have problem solving skills, and be serious about learning a new trade.
          <br/>
          We will also consider experienced adjusters with any machine experience and we will also consider applicants who have prior mechanical experience from other types of production or manufacturing environments (i.e. automotive, printing, construction).
         </p>
         <p>
          Pay rate is based on level of experience and expertise.
         </p>
         <p>
          Serious applicants only please.
         </p>

         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities &amp; Preferred Background:
          </b>
          Responsibilities include maintaining and developing relationships with existing and new customers at all levels. The emphasis on building rapport and relationships with individuals and groups requires an outgoing, poised and persuasive communication style. Additionally, this position will provide product, installation and sales training for customers and other sales professionals, and will be involved in problem resolution as it pertains to customers. The ability to speak in front of a large group is essential.
         </p>
         <p>
          This person will be goal oriented and expected to maintain and grow existing business. Candidate should possess the ability to act independently and the confidence to handle a variety of challenges. A full commitment to the success of the business and high standards of achievement are expected in this position. The job environment is flexible, constantly changing, and provides growth opportunity, recognition, and reward for the achievement of business results. Candidates should be experienced in window and door sales and must have a proven ability to acquire new business and grow market share through building materials dealers. Hunter characteristics required for position as this is not an account maintenance position.
         </p>

           JOB QUALIFICATIONS
          </b>
          <br/>

          </b>

          </b>

          </li>
          <li>
           Prospecting ability to develop new business and work with existing distribution customers to prospect new business with and for them.
          </li>

           Knowledge of the building products end users in assigned market; Builders, Contractors, &amp; Specifiers.
          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent customer relations skills.
          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Be self-disciplined.
          </li>
          <li>
           Competency and proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
          </li>
          <li>
           Hunter versus Farmer mentality.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
          <br/>
          Must be able to lift/carry materials up to 20-30lbs sample unites, move about the work site, turn on and operate a computer in the applicable environment, communicate efficiently and effectively on the telephone or in person, and complete required paperwork. Long hours in a car.
         </p>

Our full-time employees are eligible to participate in a comprehensive benefits program that includes two medical plan options with EAP and telemedicine, two dental plan options, a vision plan, medical and dependent care FSA accounts, life and disability options, a wellness program with a Health Reimbursement Account, and a 401(k) plan.

       </font>

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Customer Loyalty Associate is responsible for processes pre and post departure customer bookings, revisions and issues while providing a resolution that satisfies both the customer and clients expectation. The associate must be able to exceed customer expectations by providing outstanding service.
         </p>
         <p>
          Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Book Group and FIT travel for Travel Agent partners clients
          </li>
          <li>
           Price Match when competitor pricing is more advantageous
          </li>
          <li>
           Resolve service issues by understanding the customers complaint/issue/challenge, determine the cause of the problem and finding the best solution to solve the problem.
          </li>
          <li>
           Identify and escalate repetitive and continuous service problems in a timely manner
          </li>
          <li>
           Expedite solutions and adjustments in order to provide amazing service and follow up in a timely manner whenever necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Process pre-notifications and onsite travel customer service issues
          </li>
          <li>
           Process all customer adjustments, including refunds, while maintaining the financial integrity of the booking
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for the proper tracking of issues and adjustments
          </li>
          <li>
           Exceed customer expectations by providing exceptional customer service
          </li>
          <li>
           Escalate service issues when necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain proper documentation for each issue
          </li>
          <li>
           Utilize all training tools for ongoing development of skills and role * Other duties as assigned
          </li>
         </ul>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Office Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Alta Vista Solutions
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Richmond, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Company Summary:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Alta Vista Solutions (AVS) is a client-centered firm focused on effectively and efficiently solving todays engineering challenges to keep projects moving forward. Recognized in our industry for providing innovative, realistic, and practical solutions, AVS has helped owners deliver some of the worlds largest and most challenging infrastructure projects. Our team of approachable experts and meticulous technicians work diligently to advance projects without compromising quality.
         </p>
         <p>
          We have offices across California, New York, Europe, and Asia, and we are continuing to expand our services and expertise worldwide.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Summary:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Alta Vista Solutions is seeking an experienced, highly effective office manager who can oversee daily business of the corporate office and some personal tasks for multiple executives. Reporting to the VP of Administration and Human Resources, the office manager will be responsible for all administrative functions that occur throughout the AVS corporate office and in support of multiple executives. The successful candidate will be proactive, enthusiastic and resourceful with the capability to keep multiple projects on track simultaneously. This role requires superior organizational, writing and computer skills.
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a full time position based out of corporate office in Richmond.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Duties:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Manage facilities for the corporate office including office and building access keys, office layout and planning, janitorial needs, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide administrative support to corporate office and executives including calendar management, travel arrangements, preparation for and set-up of meetings, internal and external lunches as well as assist with corporate events.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with corporate insurance, certifications for projects and certifications for requesting COIs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct quarterly audit of current contracts to COIs and reconcile as necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate office needs with IT for the corporate and field offices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Act as point-of-contact for corporate telecommunications and weekly calls.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete daily morning bank reports.
          </li>
          <li>
           Approve timesheets on behalf of the President.
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct wire transfer approvals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Process bank deposits and assist with other banking needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Sign checks on behalf of the corporate office.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage AMEX office cards.
          </li>
          <li>
           Set up office space and equipment for new employees including laptops, email, phones, office supplies, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain vehicle keys for the corporate office.
          </li>
          <li>
           Oversee corporate condos/apartments, leases and ensures full set-up, cleaning and maintenance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Updates emergency binders for each office including accident fact sheets and workers compensation processes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate ergonomics trainings and assessments for employees.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate and execute safety training for the corporate office.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide advanced computer skills to create spreadsheets, tables, charts, templates, presentation materials, and org. charts of responsibilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide backup support to the Front Desk Administrator as necessary, including but not limited to answer and route incoming calls, update PTO Calendar, greet guests, clients, employees, and outside vendors, maintain office supplies, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain and update contacts, files, and records.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare and proofread documentation and correspondence, including letters, reports, memos, and emails.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete personal errands for executives as needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Additional duties assigned as needed.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills &amp; Abilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Effective written, interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work as part of a team involving staff, clients and outside agencies
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong technical and computer skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong problem-solving skills, including an ability to prioritize activities and work with limited supervision
          </li>
          <li>
           Results oriented and able to complete tasks on deadline
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to handle highly confidential information
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to schedule complex domestic and international travel arrangements
          </li>
          <li>
           Flexible to frequent schedule changes and priorities
          </li>
          <li>
           Keen sense of urgency
          </li>
          <li>
           Detail minded
          </li>
          <li>
           Not afraid to ask questions
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to make good decisions using sound, professional judgment
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Minimum Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           College graduate and/or 3-5 years of directly related experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient in MS Office including; Word, Excel and PowerPoint
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to think and plan ahead, anticipate the unexpected
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid California driver license
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Office Manager: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </b>

         <p>

           POSITION AVAILABLE: ASSISTANT STORE MANAGER
          </b>
          <br/>
          STATUS: Non-Exempt, Full Time
         </p>
         <p>
          The Salvation Army ARC in Seattle has an opening for an Assistant Store Manager.
          <b>
           This position will work out of our Seattle SODO and our Shoreline stores.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          We are seeking candidates that are personable, positive and like to work in an energetic team environment. The successful candidate needs to have retail management experience preferably in a non-profit environment. They also need to believe in providing excellent customer service and enjoy driving sales. We are not the typical retail store as our merchandise changes almost every day depending on our donations. We have everything from furniture to clothing to electronics to china. Our store will reflect a fresh new approach to traditional thrift shopping.

         </p>

          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Minimum of one full year supervisory retail experience
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to operate POS/Cash Registers and have the ability to schedule and supervise store employees
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent customer service skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate effectively with management, store employees, customers and donors
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid Drivers License
          </li>
          <li>
           Must pass a criminal background check
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           DUTIES:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Take an active role and partner with the Store Manager in the day-to-day operation of the store
          </li>
          <li>
           Assume responsibility for all store operations in the absence of the Store Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides coaching, training and development of store employees
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain good customer relations with customers and the community
          </li>
          <li>
           Set an example by greeting all customers and donors
          </li>
          <li>
           In the absence of the Store Manager communicate any personnel issues with Administration
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure all sales staff are providing excellent customer service, handling of customer complaints in a fair and expeditious manner
          </li>
          <li>
           In absence of Store Manager put payroll information together
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure timely completion of paperwork including store reports, daily deposits, safety reports, timekeeping
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete all tasks as assigned by the Store Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties and responsibilities as may be assigned, from time to time, as related to the position
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to sit, walk, stand, bend , squat, climb, kneel and twist on an intermittent or continuous basis
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to grasp, push, pull objects such as files, file cabinet drawers, and other office equipment
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate clearly on the telephone
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to perform various repetitive motion tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           THE SALVATION ARMY MISSION STATEMENT:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian Church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the Gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.
          <br/>

           EOE

          </li>

          </li>

          </b>

         </p>

          </b>

          </li>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          <br/>

         </p>

          </b>
         </p>

          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          <li>
           Set up tables, banners, displays, and giveaways.
          </li>

          </li>

           Provide a summary report to the marketing department within 24 hours of the event.
          </li>
          <li>
           Wear branded attire during events.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           About us:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Founded in 2007, formerly known as Avego, Carma is a world-leader in real-time occupancy technology used by hundreds of application developers, cities, governments, transport operators and tens of thousands of individual consumers. Users in dozens of cities are matched with neighbors and colleagues to reduce congestions using carmacarpool.com, and commuters in San Francisco can commute in style using our ownerless car service at gocarma.com. Carma is headquartered in San Francisco, CA with offices in Cork, Ireland, San Jose, CA, Austin TX, and Bergen, Norway.

        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Real Estate Institute seeks a full time Customer Service Representative to provide in-person and over-the-phone support for our students and potential students.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our customers work (or seek to begin work) in real estate, mortgage, insurance, and legal professions. We provide high-quality course programs and service. As a member of our customer service team, youll play an integral role in the growth and ongoing success of the company.
         </p>
         <p>
          Core Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Respond to customer inquiries regarding regulatory requirements for professional licensing and license renewals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Advise and encourage customers to register in the most appropriate course programs offered by our school.
          </li>
          <li>
           Meet with customers in person, at our office, to answer questions and promote course enrollment by building relationships and looking for sales opportunities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Process course enrollments using our enrollment system.
          </li>
          <li>
           Learn complex licensing and course requirements and maintain/update these skills on an ongoing basis.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist students with scheduling online and in-person exams upon completing our courses.
          </li>
          <li>
           Initiate communication or respond to clients seeking group and in-office course programs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide basic technical support for students enrolled in online courses delivered through webinars and learning management systems.
          </li>
          <li>
           Additional administrative-type responsibilities as assigned. Must be comfortable with both directed administrative tasks and taking the lead on projects as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          For consideration, you must have the following skills and experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           5 years of experience in an office setting in which your job was dependent on successful customer interactions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience providing over-the-phone technical support preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Business writing skills are required
          </li>
          <li>
           This is not a sales/commission-based position, but experience with soft selling is preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Self-starter with a strong work ethic who can reliably work independently (as needed).
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient using Microsoft Office programs, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
          </li>
          <li>
           Accurate typing of at least 40 words per minute. You may be asked to demonstrate this skill during the interview.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent grammar and business writing skills. You should know whats wrong with this sentence and be anxious to correct it.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to calmly, quickly, and effectively solve time-sensitive problems.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be detail oriented and able to multitask in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Additional Requirements and Considerations:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           You will be subject to a credit check, background check, and pre-employment drug testing.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have a verifiable past employment record.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reliable transportation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Very professional appearance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Willingness to work occasional evenings and weekends
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Company Information:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Benefits: Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Retirement Plan, Paid Time Off
          </li>
          <li>
           Attire: Business Casual
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

          Investigates and resolves customer problems with deliveries.
         </p>
         <p>
          Attends trade shows and company sales meetings.
         </p>

         <p>
          Washington First Mortgage Loan Corp. | WA First Mortgage is a large, privately owned mortgage broker that is approved with over 50 national &amp; local lenders and also has an in house bank line. WA First Mortgage has offices in Kirkland &amp; Ballard, serving borrowers throughout the states of Washington, California, &amp; Oregon. WA First Mortgage is a strong and growing mortgage broker with over 50 employees.
          <br/>
          We are growing and are looking for an experienced, energetic, processor to join our growing team at our Kirkland office. We're looking for a team player that must also be able to work independently, be self-motivated, a problem solver, and punctual.
         </p>
         <p>
          Desired Education/ Experience
          <br/>
          -High School Graduate with a minimum of 5 years experience processing in the mortgage/banking industry.
          <br/>
          It is preferred that applicants are current on SARS &amp; Anti-Money Laundering classes and/or any other Mortgage related training that ensures that the applicant is current on today's mortgage practices and regulations.
         </p>

          Specific Duties
          <br/>
          -Review files and reconcile all documents
          <br/>
          -Review loan submission form
          <br/>
          -Review loan approval from lender to verify terms of approval, match terms of request, assign conditions required to LO/Processor. Processor will number and write the responsible party initials next to the conditions needed.
          <br/>
          -Clear conditions as necessary
          <br/>
          -Order VOE, VOR, VOM, VOD
          <br/>
          -Order Title, Escrow and Appraisal if not already ordered
          <br/>
          -Order Insurance Binder, CPL's
          <br/>
          -Confirm escrow fees, and Email address for docs
          <br/>
          -Request Est. HUD-1 from escrow
          <br/>
          -Order Docs
          <br/>
          -Complete broker demand and Review with LO
          <br/>
          -Review HUD-1 with LO
          <br/>
          -Review Funding Conditions and Assign to LO/Processor
          <br/>
          -Review Final 1003, 92900, GFE/TIL, Note and DOT from escrow
          <br/>
          -Deliver funded file to compliance/payroll department
         </p>
         <p>
          Compensation
          <br/>
          -Hourly + Bonuses: Based on experience
          <br/>
          -Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k &amp; 2 weeks paid time off
         </p>
         <p>
          Equal Opportunity Employer
         </p>

           Office Equipment Delivery /Network Connectivity Technician (Everett, WA)
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Looking to join a local company where you can make a difference? Come join a proven winner where you will be appreciated and compensated for your efforts. We are Electronic Business Machines, a well-established Office Products dealer representing Canon &amp; Kyocera office equipment products in the Greater North Puget Sound area.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB SUMMARY
          </b>
          <br/>
          EBM is currently accepting applications for the position of Office Equipment Delivery/ Network Connectivity technician for our South Everett location. Qualified applicants should have a valid WA State Drivers license, a clean driving record, demonstrate and/or have experience providing excellent customer service and possess good communication skills. This position includes the responsibilities of performing network connectivity for the customer on their new equipment so networking experience is preferred. Employment will be contingent on the applicant passing a drug screening test and having an acceptable background check.
         </p>
         <p>
          Some of the duties are, but not limited to;
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Driving a 24-foot delivery truck, parking in tight areas such as loading docks and alley ways.
          </li>
          <li>
           Load/unload the truck with office equipment using a hand truck, lift gate, strapping as well as operating a stair climber when necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate with the customer regarding delivery, set-up of the equipment, operation as well as set up network functions of equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure all proper delivery and pick-up paperwork is complete and accurate.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist Warehouse manager with moving equipment around warehouse and set up equipment when necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain company truck to include washing and wiping down interior when necessary.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
          </b>
          <br/>
          Networking experience and/or 2 year certificate/AA in computer science or technology related degree would be preferred.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB REQUIREMENTS
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Possess and maintain reliable transportation
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess and maintain valid drivers license
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide certificate of insurance with adequate liability coverage and include statement from insurance company of their knowledge that you use your vehicle for work
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift 50 lbs. and drive the truck throughout the entire work day.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to stand, crouch, walk, kneel, crawl, lay, bend, and perform simple and firm grasping functions with both left and right hands through an entire 8 hour work day.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be prompt and on time to work and scheduled appointments
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess strong interpersonal and customer service skills, able to maintain professional demeanor under stress
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate the ability to supervisor to seek assistance if you are unable to perform the task in a timely fashion or if you encounter any reasons that are preventing the timely resolution of delivery/installation.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          This is a full-time position, Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. We offer a very competitive compensation package with benefits including medical, dental, retirement/401(k) program and paid vacations, to name a few. This is a driving /technical position and requires someone with exceptional organizational skills, ability to handle detailed paperwork as well as work without constant supervision.
         </p>
         <p>
          Electronic Business Systems is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free workplace with an outstanding reputation within the community. We are looking for individuals who share our commitment to providing outstanding products and services to our customers through work ethic and a passion for overall team success.

          We are looking for applicants in the San Mateo, CA zip codes of 94403, 94002 and 94070, and who are available to work part time at a pay rate of $12 per hour.
         </p>
         <p>
          THE PART TIME FIELD SALES REPRESENTATIVE POSITION WILL: Influence the purchase of Natural Balance brand products by educating pet parents on the ingredients and benefits to dogs and/or cats; ask questions to determine the best Natural Balance, Inc. brand product for the pet; develop positive relationships with all retail store personnel to generate good will and position Natural Balance, Inc. as the retail store personnel's preferred in-store brand.THE IDEAL PART TIME FIELD SALES REPRESENTATIVE MUST HAVE THE ABILITY TO: Work a minimum of 3 out of every 4 weekends per month; work up to 16 hours each week at assigned retail locations; work double shifts as assigned and when deemed necessary;work with minimal supervision and be accountable; have access to reliable transportation; have constant access to a mobile phone; have constant access to high speed internet for websites; use Word/Excel/Power Point and emails; lift a minimum of 40 lbs.; comfortably stand the entire shift of 4 hours or more; kneel, bend, reach and lift display tables and other slightly heavy items.BASIC SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS FOR THE PART TIME FIELD SALES REPRESENTATIVE: Knowledgeable of basic retail sales principles; strong interpersonal skills and excellent relationship building skills; demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment/decision making; demonstrate professional composure especially during difficult interactions.Required experience: Retail Sales: 1 year
         </p>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Billing Specialist
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Stanford Children's Health
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Menlo Park, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          At Stanford Children's Health, were focused on bringing world-class, family-centered care to communities spanning throughout the San Francisco Bay Area. A new physician group developed in partnership with Lucile Packard Childrens Hospital Stanford and the Stanford School of Medicine, we are bringing together some of medicines premier talent to meet the health challenges faced by todays children and expectant mothers. If youd like to be part of an organization thats establishing new standards of careand helping children and their families grow stronger every step of the way - consider joining us today.
         </p>
         <p>
          Working in an outpatient setting, you will perform a variety of charge related and clerical support services, including creating claims within the practice management system and responding to billing queries from our 3rd party accounts receivable vendor. You will be responsible for the front-end components of the billing process by entering charges, ensuring that all professional activity is captured, completing encounter claims with correct CPT and ICD-9 codes, and appropriately registering patient insurance and authorization data.
         </p>
         <p>
          Qualified candidates must have a HS diploma/equivalent, 2-5 years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience in a healthcare setting, and knowledge of insurance, medical terminology and ICD/CPT codes. Experience with EPIC and patient accounting skills preferred. Requires good customer service, phone, prioritization, interpersonal, computer and recordkeeping skills, along with the ability to follow oral/written instructions, interpret policies accurately, maintain confidentiality and gather, analyze and display data in appropriate format. The ability to perform basic math, compute rate ratio/percent and draw/interpret graphs is needed, as is knowledge of medical reimbursement policies/procedures and experience with managing multi-line telephones.
         </p>
         <p>
          To find out more about how you can make an impact on our growing organization, please send resume with
          <b>
           Billing Specialist  Menlo Park
          </b>
          by clicking the "Apply Now" button. You may also visit our website at: http://www.stanfordchildrens.org/en/about/our-network. Equal Opportunity Employer
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_87754c62d6db9c80">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">

        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Founded in 2001, Arkadin is one of the largest and fastest growing collaboration service providers in the world. With a vision rooted in the belief that progress emerges from people's desire to share, Arkadin offers a complete range of remote audio, web, and video conferencing and Unified Communications solutions.
         </p>
         <p>
          The services are delivered in the SaaS model for fast, scalable deployments and a high ROI. Its global network of 55 operating centers in 33 countries has dedicated local-language support teams to service its 37,000 customers.
         </p>
         <p>
          Specialties
          <br/>
          cloud, remote collaboration solutions, webcasting, webinar services, unified communications, web conferencing, conference calling, video conferencing, audio conferencing
         </p>
         <p>
          For more information, please visit www.arkadin.com
         </p>
         <p>
          $12.50 per hour + yearly bonus
         </p>
         <p>
          Objective
          <br/>
          The Event Specialist provides support for events utilizing Audio Conferencing and/or Web Conferencing by managing the event and/or providing live assistance with basic audio and/or web questions. The Event Specialist will manage Investor Relations calls, High Profile Events and interact with High Profile customers. The Event Specialist uses enhanced customer service skills to resolve challenging situations, communicates in a clear and professional speaking voice and applies knowledge learned to ensure a professional and successful event.
         </p>
         <p>
          Key Tasks
          <br/>
          Manages and ensures a successful event by timely and properly preparing for assigned events, review all pertinent information with the customer during preconference, provides guidance and support to the customer during the event and handles any post call duties.Answer participant lines timely and properly identifies and places into conference. Answer participant lines requiring assistance timely during live events. Provides the necessary follow-up on quality issues. Contributes to the continuous quality improvement of processes. Assess customer requirements and offers accurate solutions to customer requests. Maintains current on job knowledge in order to assist in various team areas
         </p>
         <p>
          Core Skills
          <br/>
          Professional and clear speaking voice
          <br/>
          Excellent written communication skills
          <br/>
          Strong organizational and time management skills
          <br/>
          Excellent customer service skills2-4 years of Customer Service
          <br/>
          Proven track record in conflict and problem resolution
          <br/>
          Able to work independently or as part of a team, with strict attention to detail and an ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment
          <br/>
          Computer proficient with a strong working knowledge of Microsoft
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>

          </li>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Naperville - Restaurant / Front of House Manager - New Location
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Fogo De Chao
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Naperville, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The culture of
          <b>
           Fogo de Cho
          </b>
          (fo-go de shoun) is at the heart of our success. We offer a high end dining experience like no other! Our restaurants captivate guests with a truly unique Churrascaria (Brazilian steakhouse) atmosphere from where it all started, the mountainous countryside of Rio Grande do Sul in Southern Brazil.
         </p>
         <p>
          We feature meats seasoned to perfection and slow-roasted over an open flame and carved tableside by our authentic Gaucho chefs. Each of our distinctive restaurants also contain an extensive, Wine Spectator award-winning wine list, traditional Brazilian beverages, and a variety of decadent desserts in addition to our signature meats.
         </p>
         <p>
          With over thirty years of history and 33 thriving locations in the United States and Brazil, we are maintaining solid sales growth and will continue to expand this exciting concept into new and diverse markets.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are always seeking new opportunities to get our restaurant in front of the local community, to engage guests who may not have experienced our culture and to develop relationships with those who come to
          <b>
           Fogo de Cho
          </b>
          for the ultimate dining experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Dining Room Manager (FOH)
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          In this position you will assist in the management of the authentic southern Brazilian cultural and dining experience provided by the team of Churrasqueiros, Servers, Customer Service, Host / Hostesses, Cashiers, Bussers, Kitchen Staff and Dishwashers.
         </p>
         <p>
          Duties include supervision of the kitchen, dining room, bar and office, personnel as well as administrative responsibilities. Assist the GM by assuming an active role in providing an outstanding customer experience, building the team with the very best people, serving a high quality consistent product, ensuring sound financial results, and upholding Fogo standards.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           3+ year of high volume (4+ million dollar) restaurant management experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Fine Dining experience preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Bilingual preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Four Year College Degree preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Aloha, Menulink &amp; HotSchedules experience preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have a high level of endurance and mental acuity and ability to manage conflict and deal successfully with high stress situations.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          This opportunity offers a salary commensurate with experience plus bonus incentives, excellent company benefits and career growth potential.
         </p>
         <p>
          An equal opportunity employer - www.fogo.com
         </p>
         <p>
          | Restaurant | restaurant manager | manager | restaurant job | restaurant employment | restaurant careers | restaurant management jobs | restaurant manager jobs | Restaurant manager careers | restaurant management job | restaurant management jobs | restaurant managers | FOH manager | restaurant management | restaurant management careers | restaurant management | manager | assistant manager | restaurants | dining | management | Service Manager | Server Manager | Assistant Restaurant Manager | Sous Chef | Fogo de Chao | Fogo | Upscale | Steakhouse | Brazilian Hospitality | Brazilian Steakhouse | Brazilian Restaurant |

          <b>

          </b>
          for the Pacific North West region. The position involves assisting our franchise locations with the marketing and promotion of their Minuteman Press franchise location. The applicant should have experience within the printing industry, some design software knowledge, excellent verbal and writing skills and the ability to multitask and manage your time efficiently. Having sales and marketing experience is a plus.
         </p>
         <p>
          Minuteman Press International is the world's largest printing and graphics franchise. We are headquartered in Farmingdale, New York and have over 900 franchise locations around the world. Our franchise locations are full service providers of print related services dedicated to providing excellent service and outstanding quality to their customers. Our customers range in size from Blue chip companies to home based businesses and everything in between. The products we provide to our customers include stationery, business cards, newsletters, color brochures, posters, signs, instruction manuals, point of sales displays, vehicle graphics, and numerous other creative and complex projects.
         </p>

          This is a unique position that offers benefits, travel, growth opportunity and a future.
          <br/>
          To apply for this position please submit a PDF of your resume.

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Billing Assistant
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       AdvaCare Systems, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Billing Assistant is responsible for the accuracy, quality, and timeliness of certain billable services processed by the company.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Company Description
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          For over twenty years, AdvaCare Systems has worked with hospice organizations, nursing homes, rehabilitation centers, assisted living facilities, and hospitals to provide quality products and service. Our commitment to providing end-of-life quality drives us, and we are proud to call like-minded individuals our employees. If patient care is your passion, or if you are looking for a career that makes a difference, consider AdvaCare Systems.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Duties
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Billing/Invoicing facilities, home care, and hospice for services rendered
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Interface with Billing Manager to determine billing corrections
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Interface with customers and company personnel to determine billing/invoice adjustments
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Enter and adjust billing rates
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assists in Medicare billing function (i.e., insurance verification, CMN, doctors orders, etc.)
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Requirements
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Preferred candidates will have 1+ years of billing, Medicare billing, or accounts receivable experience (health care industry preferred). Preferred candidates will also possess strong data entry, organizational and interpersonal skills, and function at an intermediate skill-level with Excel (experience with pivot tables a must).
         </p>
         <p>
          As this position comes in direct contact with private patient information, all candidates must possess a clean criminal background record (candidates will undergo a criminal background check as part of the hiring process).
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          We offer our employees an extensive benefit package which includes: 401(k), Medical, Dental, Vision, Short-Term &amp; Long-Term Disability, Group Term &amp; Supplemental Life Insurance, Paid Sick/Personal Days, Holidays, and Vacation.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Medical/Medicare Billing: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school or equivalent
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_efcf9ae74d053ebf">

        Project Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       endpoint Clinical
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Overview:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Project Manager is the primary client interface for client implementations, from initial engagement to final launch. They are responsible for shepherding projects through the development life-cycle while working collaboratively with teammates and maintaining exceptional client satisfaction.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Act as primary point of contact for clients, keeping them apprised of all project developments while maintaining stellar client satisfaction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Build effective partnerships with other internal teams to move project through all phases of the development process.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop and maintain project schedule, identify and track milestones and identify and manage cross-functional dependencies
          </li>
          <li>
           Establish baseline requirements and manage change control throughout the development process.
          </li>
          <li>
           Act as subject matter expert on client clinical study protocol and the transfer of study requirements into the endpoint PULSE platform.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage ongoing reporting of project health and profitability to internal and external stakeholders.
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct end- user training.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's degree or equivalent preferred; appropriate experience in the IRT industry may substitute for the degree requirement.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in a software Project Management role, with a proven ability to understand technical concepts and learn very quickly.
          </li>
          <li>
           Some experience in the life science industry.
          </li>
          <li>
           An excruciatingly high-level of attention to detail with excellent organizational skills and a proven ability to multi-task.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with a wide variety of professionals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Previous experience working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prior experience delivering voice (IVR) web (IWR) and mobile (IMR) platforms a big plus.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong attention to detail
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational and time management skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Good communication skills
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

         </p>

           Duties
          </b>
          <br/>

Primary duties are leasing units, retail sales, customer service, maintaining and renting U-haul trucks, and assisting with basic facility maintenance. The individual will have good computer skills and the ability to handle customers efficiently.
         </p>

           Essential Functions/Tasks
          </b>
         </p>

          </li>

           Answer phone inquiries from prospective and current tenants
          </li>
          <li>
           Show property to prospective tenants, explain terms of occupancy and provide information about facility
          </li>
          <li>
           May be required to be outside for extended periods of time during inclement weather
          </li>
          <li>
           Some physical activity which includes yard work, weed eating, blowing, weed pulling, painting and light U-haul truck cleaning/maintenance
          </li>
          <li>
           Reports to on-site Manager
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Successful candidates are experienced in customer-centered, selling environments
          </li>
          <li>
           Previous self-storage and U-haul experience is highly desirable!!!
          </li>
          <li>
           MUST be willing to work WEEKENDS!
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer experience required
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Salary: $9.50 /hour
         </p>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Property Damage Estimator - Sales
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Paul Davis Restoration &amp; Remodeling
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco Bay Area, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          PROPERTY DAMAGE ESTIMATOR - SALES (San Francisco Bay Area)
         </p>
         <p>
          Paul Davis Restoration &amp; Remodeling, a nationwide Insurance Repair and Disaster Restoration Contractor has an excellent career opportunity available. We are seeking an energetic and experienced Property Damage / Construction Sales Estimator to join our professional team serving our Bay Area customers that have suffered property damages from fire, water, storm, floods, and other disasters.
          <br/>
          Loss assignment leads are provided by direct repair program participation. Additional sales opportunities become available by the development of long-term relationships in the insurance claims and property/facilities management industries.
         </p>
         <p>
          Responsibilities include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Candidates must have experience working with insurance companies, accurately estimating property damage claims, and interfacing with insurance adjusters and property owners.
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of 3 years experience in sales &amp; estimating in the field of property damage restoration required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have strong time management and organizational skills, as all work requires a sense of urgency.
          </li>
          <li>
           Should be proficient in the use of Xactimate, and Windows applications.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Skills and Traits:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Professional appearance and demeanor required at all times
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to pass pre and random employment drug tests
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong verbal and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Self Starter with excellent follow-through and problem solving skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Goal oriented achiever that enjoys helping people in a time of need
          </li>
          <li>
           Networking, prospecting, and sales closing skills with industry specific knowledge
          </li>
          <li>
           Good work ethic with stable history
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Compensation: Bi-weekly draw and commissions. $75,000 - $150,000 based on effort and abilities
         </p>
         <p>
          Please e-mail letter of interest outlining the reasons you are a strong applicant for the position and resume outlining your employment experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          Click here to apply: http://app.hireology.com/s/31032
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Sales &amp; Estimating experience using Xactimate : 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

          Service Technician Position Available
         </p>

          United Pest Solutions seeks service driven, problem solving, and team-oriented individual to round out our service team. Key responsibilities include:
         </p>
         <p>
          - Providing pest control services in residential and commercial environments
          <br/>
          - Evaluating pest issues and creating a plan for control consistent with company protocols
          <br/>
          - Evaluating structural and environmental concerns leading to pest issues
          <br/>
          - Writing proposals
          <br/>
          - Documenting findings and completing work orders for customer reports
         </p>
         <p>
          The qualified applicant will possess:
         </p>

          - A strong desire to make a difference
          <br/>
          - Strong problem solving skills
          <br/>
          - Competency with smartphones and various software applications
          <br/>
          - Good physical condition and ready for physical work
          <br/>
          - Excellent written and verbal communication skills
          <br/>
          - A positive attitude
          <br/>
          - Ability to learn and work independently
          <br/>
          - Initiative to get things done
          <br/>
          - A commitment to Safety, The Environment, Excellence, and Personal Growth
         </p>
         <p>
          Work schedules are Monday thru Friday, general business hours.
         </p>
         <p>
          We offer:
          <br/>
          - Hourly plus commission
          <br/>
          - Paid vacation &amp; paid holidays
          <br/>
          - A small office environment
          <br/>

         </p>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Service Dispatcher
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       KBA DOCUSYS, INC.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Union City, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Service Dispatcher
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           General Purpose
          </b>
          <br/>
          Serves customers by responding to service and supply requests and resolving service problems.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Duties
          </b>
          <br/>
          1. Receive incoming customer service calls and processes requests into e-Automate
          <br/>
          2. Maintains call center database
          <br/>
          3. Monitors open calls and field technician call loads
          <br/>
          4. Manages call assignment to ensure the best response times and customer satisfaction
          <br/>
          5. Receives incoming supply requests from customers via phone and website. Enter data into e-Automate to create packing slips/billing
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills and Qualifications
          </b>
          <br/>
          1. 1-2 years dispatching, order processing or related experience
          <br/>
          2. Good listening and verbal communication skills
          <br/>
          3. Data entry
          <br/>
          4. Problem solving
          <br/>
          5. Positive and professional attitude, works well with others
          <br/>
          6. Good time management
          <br/>
          7. Able to work independently and in group settings
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits
          </b>
          <br/>
          We offer a wide variety of benefits to choose from:
          <br/>
          Medical
          <br/>
          Dental
          <br/>
          Vision
          <br/>
          401k
          <br/>
          Supplemental Insurance
          <br/>
          Company Paid Life Insurance
          <br/>
          Flexible Spending Accounts
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           l Year: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school or equivalent
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_c381e8333492c66d">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Center Associate / Digital Print Specialist
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       The UPS Store 6431
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $13.75 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           The UPS Store INC an Equal Opportunity Employer
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          The nation's largest shipping and printing retailer, The UPS Store, is growing at an exceptional rate in the San Francisco Bay Area. We employ exceptionally professional service-oriented people who are motivated to provide the world-class customer service synonymous with UPS, one of the world's most recognized brands.
         </p>
         <p>
          Locally owned and operated, The UPS Store in San Francisco offers competitive wages and health benefits. Opportunities for advancement are robust -- every current manager at the 7 locations under this ownership began as an entry-level sales associates. The ownership is developing current employees for multiple new local store openings in the near future.
         </p>
         <p>
          All applicants must pass a criminal background check and become a California Notary Public and a Certified Fingerprinting (LiveScan) technician within the first 90 days of employment.
         </p>
         <p>
          Duties include, but are not limited to:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Providing world-class customer service for every client
          </li>
          <li>
           Taking ownership and independently resolving customer satisfaction issues
          </li>
          <li>
           Providing consultative service that incorporates upselling and cross-selling to maximize revenue and encourage return visits
          </li>
          <li>
           Packing &amp; shipping certification
          </li>
          <li>
           Parcel management and delivery
          </li>
          <li>
           Providing fingerprint rolling service -- ink and LiveScan
          </li>
          <li>
           Providing notary public service during all business hours
          </li>
          <li>
           Becoming a retail expert in all product and service offerings by actively engaging in ongoing training
          </li>
          <li>
           Actively selling and mastering production of print service products
          </li>
          <li>
           Managing the logistics of small to medium print/design projects, follow-through to completion, and updating all parties as needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Producing designs, proofs, and updating materials for print projects using Adobe Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, Indeisgn) on PC Platform
          </li>
          <li>
           Operates all equipment, software, and devices in an expert fashion and is willing to teach others
          </li>
          <li>
           Prioritizes and optimizes the work load to streamline the production flow
          </li>
          <li>
           Frequently multi-tasks while maintaining extreme attention to detail and high quality control
          </li>
          <li>
           Arriving early for every shift and being prepared to help customers immediately upon clocking in -- if you have trouble with punctuality, please do not apply.
          </li>
          <li>
           Being a "team player with co-workers and managers
          </li>
          <li>
           Keeping store image pristine for corporate compliance
          </li>
          <li>
           Continually cleaning and preparing store for next round of business
          </li>
          <li>
           Being able to stand for 3.75 hours at a time and able to lift at least 50 pounds repeatedly throughout the day without assistance
          </li>
          <li>
           Being available on weekends
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Our starting wage is $13.75/hour, negotiable depending on experience. We offer a quarterly incentive program and the Kaiser Health Coverage Silver Plan
          <br/>
          Motivated, engaged, inquisitive, and positive people are encouraged to apply --
          <b>
           Persons with previous experience in High-end/Luxurious retail, Print shops, and Hospitality are also encouraged to apply
          </b>
          . A fast-paced and rewarding opportunity awaits you.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $13.75 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Graphic Design/ Print Production : 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
