    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        CSR - Customer Service Representative
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       ATGStores.com a Lowe's Company
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Kirkland, WA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $14 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Function
          </b>
          : The essential function of a Customer Care Representative is to uphold and promote the brand reputation of ATGStores.com by providing a superior customer experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          This includes building and maintaining customer loyalty through resolution of customer issues, assisting with order placement, and answering customer inquiries.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Reporting Relationships
          </b>
          : The Customer Care Representative reports to the Customer Care Supervisor.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities and Duties:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Place customer orders primarily with credit cards
          </li>
          <li>
           Handle personal confidential customer information
          </li>
          <li>
           Post-purchase functions including cancellations, requests for refunds, substitutions, returns, and damages
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with vendors and carriers to confirm product inventory availability, status of orders, and issue resolution
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively finds opportunities to upsell and cross sell to customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Fields customer contacts which may include phone calls, online chats, and email * Proactively follows up with customers and partners to ensure full resolution of customers reason for contact
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform any task from time-to-time that may be assigned by leadership
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Performance Criteria
          </b>
          :
          <br/>
          The Customer Care Representative for ATGStores.com will be evaluated based upon the following criteria:
          <br/>
           Consistently provides excellent customer service for every customer contact
          <br/>
           Resolves customer concerns in a timely manner
          <br/>
           Understands and effectively uses internal tools and processes
          <br/>
           Ability to obtain vendor and carrier information regarding orders and shipments.
          <br/>
           Effective inter-departmental communication with Fulfillment, Business Development, and Accounting on behalf of the customer
          <br/>
           Achieves established performance goals covering productivity, availability, quality, and attendance set forth by leadership.
          <br/>
          Requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must be able to work rotating shifts including nights, weekends, early mornings, etc.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits/Perks:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Medical Insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Dental Insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Vision Insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid Time Off
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid Holidays
          </li>
          <li>
           Tuition Reimbursement
          </li>
          <li>
           Free Snacks
          </li>
          <li>
           Casual Dress Code
          </li>
          <li>
           Company BBQ's
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Type
          </b>
          : Full-time
          <br/>
          <b>
           Salary:
          </b>
          $14.00 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>

         <p>
          EyeQue Corporation conducts research and product development related to measuring Human Vision. The company aims to help the world See more clearly through the creation and distribution of innovative technologies. The initial company product is a Smart Phone Eye Analysis of Refraction (SPEAR) Device. The device will revolutionize the way people get vision assessments, and open up vision testing to large portions of the world that do not have access to eye care professionals.
          <br/>
          The Administrative Assistant will provide a variety of administrative support including as liaison to support information technology, finance and human resource related needs and general reception. The position is located in Newark, CA. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a major business enterprise.
         </p>
         <p>

           Essential Position Duties:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare/handle incoming and outgoing mail and packages including preparing special handling items such as certified, overnight, UPS and Fed Ex.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate/purchase all office supplies including coordinating with external vendors.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate a variety of meetings and travel arrangements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist team with a variety of lab support needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide finance and human resources related support including coordination for invoice and expense report approval/processing, maintaining a variety of information packets for employees, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist technology staff with the EyeQue website including updating/maintaining content.
          </li>
          <li>
           Handle routine and non-routine document preparation; provide filing, faxing, copying, collating and other administrative support utilizing word processing, spreadsheet and presentation software.
          </li>
          <li>
           Establish, update and maintain a variety of electronic and paper files/information.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform internet research to support a variety of administrative needs.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
         </p>

           3+ years of office administration experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven experience handling confidential and sensitive information.
          </li>
          <li>
           Intermediate to Advanced skills using MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent interpersonal skills to develop collaborative internal and external relationships.
          </li>
          <li>
           Collaborative, engaged team player who also has ability to work independently without close direction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with strong attention to detail.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven ability to work under tight deadlines and pressure in a composed manner; ability to multi-task and shift priorities quickly.
          </li>
          <li>
           Self-starter with excellent follow through on assigned tasks.
          </li>
          <li>
           Flexible, resourceful with a can do attitude.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          Piquadro is an Italian brand of leather goods for professional and travel products. Piquadro specializes in business bags and accessories. Piquadro continues the centuries-old Italian tradition of leather work, with a modern and original interpretation. Piquadro products combine craftsmanship, high quality leathers and attention to detail with the brands three distinctive values: design, functionality and technology.
          <br/>
          Description of Job for Sales Associate If you can:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Achieve individual goals and objectives set by the company and your store management team
          </li>
          <li>
           Deliver high standard of client relationship management services at all times
          </li>
          <li>
           Be aware of, and contribute to achieving your store's daily/weekly/monthly sales goals
          </li>
          <li>
           Great customer service experience  * Candidate is expected to assist with inventory control, order stock, and stock shelves
          </li>
          <li>
           Advised customers on utilization and care of merchandise
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimal visual merchandising experience working with plan-o-grams
          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>

         <p>
          Residential property managers help investment property owners and homeowners in preserving and increasing the value of their real estate investments. They manage the day-to-day financial operations of the property, including finding and placing qualified tenants, and they ensure the property is in good working order.
          <br/>
          Principal Duties
          <br/>
          Tenant Relations  develops rental agreements, selects qualified tenants, collects deposits and rents, enforces terms of rental agreements, resolves tenant complaints, oversees eviction proceedings if necessary.
          <br/>
          Facilities Management  schedules maintenance and repairs, negotiates contracts with vendors, regularly inspects property to ensure it is in good working order, quickly resolves emergency maintenance issues.
          <br/>
          Financial Reporting  keeps financial records from property operations, creates monthly financial reports for property owner.
          <br/>
          Owner Relations  keeps open dialogue with property owner on vacancies, tenants, physical condition of property, financial issues.
          <br/>
          Knowledge &amp; Skills Needed
          <br/>
          Familiar with applicable local, state, and federal laws and regulations
          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          Knowledge of BuildingLink a plus
          <br/>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Warehouse Worker - Swing Shift
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Veritable Vegetable
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $17 - $20 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Warehouse workers at VERITABLE VEGETABE receive, warehouse and ship
          <i>
           <b>
            fresh organic produce
           </b>
          </i>
          in a safe, accurate and timely manner while maintaining high quality standards with minimal product loss.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Pull customer orders in an accurate, timely and safe manner
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete pick slips accurately and neatly
          </li>
          <li>
           Build safe and sturdy pallets and load product to meet truck completion deadlines
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in the safe and efficient flow of incoming product to ensure timely availability of product for order pulling
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide accurate accounting of received product
          </li>
          <li>
           Be familiar with storage requirements, product sensitivity and handling needs
          </li>
          <li>
           Stock incoming product, rotating new stock into old, and dating lots
          </li>
          <li>
           Understand and comply with VVs safety policies, procedures and best practices and encourage co-workers to do the same
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain warehouse in a green, clean and orderly condition
          </li>
          <li>
           Report equipment and facilities issues to Warehouse Supervisor and Facilities Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Successfully complete training on the safe use of material handling equipment and consistently operate equipment in a safe manner
          </li>
          <li>
           Report product quality issues to Team Lead and Inventory Control
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend and participate in Warehouse crew meetings
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate as required in other tasks to ensure achievement of warehouse department goals
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           At least 2 years of full time work experience
          </li>
          <li>
           High school diploma or GED
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Physical Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must be able to consistently lift
           <b>
            up to 55 lbs
           </b>
           . without assistance
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to lift more than 55  70 lbs. with assistance
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to stand, walk, bend, twist and perform a variety of other physical functions on a consistent basis
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to walk and stand on concrete floors for prolonged periods of time
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to follow safety procedures (i.e., proper lifting techniques)
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to work in varying environments including the ability to withstand cold temperatures with proper protective clothing for long periods of time
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           The regular schedule for Swing Warehouser positions is:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           #1 Thursday through Monday 2:00 pm - 10:30 pm
          </b>
          <br/>
          (Mon hours are from 1:00 pm - 9:30 pm) (42.5 hrs/week w/ paid meal period)
          <br/>
          Tuesday/Wednesday WEEKEND
          <br/>
          .
          <br/>
          <b>
           #2 Friday through Tuesday 2:00 pm - 10:30 pm
          </b>
          <br/>
          (Mon. hours are from 1:00 pm - 9:30 pm) (42.5 hrs/week w/ paid meal period)
          <br/>
          Wednesday/Thursday WEEKEND
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           The schedule during the month long training period varies from the schedules above and includes several day shifts.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Compensation: $17.00 - $20.00/hour
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           TO BE CONSIDERED YOU MUST SUBMIT A COVER LETTER AND RESUME!
          </b>

Veritable Vegetable is a woman owned business, founded on principles of cooperation, participatory management, and ethical business practices. Located in San Francisco, California, we have been creating community alliances and promoting sustainable agriculture since 1974. We are the oldest organic produce distributor in the nation.

We are seeking a self-motivated and organized Project Manager to add to our successful team. Our customers are repeat clients with expansion/ growth plans in the Western States regions. If you enjoy building relationships with repeat customers, take pride in your work and appreciate the consistency of repeat customers, we encourage you to apply.

          The role of the estimator PM is to successfully manage and oversee execution of assigned projects. The PM is responsible for ensuring that all contracted work is executed in accordance with the companys policies, including contract documents, budget, schedule, safety, quality control and customer satisfaction. The PM is responsible for managing all subcontractors / suppliers on each project while also directing the Superintendent. Ultimately, the PM is responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction and repeat business.

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Experience managing retail, restaurant, medical and office projects
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to think and react quickly under pressure
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated leadership abilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to deal with unforeseen challenges and variety of personality types
          </li>
          <li>
           High level of customer service
          </li>
         </ul>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0su9gdbqejd0a" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Senior Associate
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Essex Lake Group
      </span>

      <span class="location">
       New York, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Roles and Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <p>
          Senior Associates* are the owners of one or more work streams and deliverables within a project; in many cases they would have high responsibility and entire visibility across all work streams within an engagement. They will be leading a team of Analysts and Associates and are expected to show leadership skills in content delivery as well as team management. SAs will be interacting with clients, synthesizing analysis with team, formulating recommendations, preparing and managing implementation efforts. They will closely work with Engagement Manager and Client Initiative Leader in managing all client expectations from an engagement. They are expected to contribute to firm development by leading training, logistics functions within the firm and helping develop areas of expertise within the firm. They should be an expert at performing complex quantitative analysis on large amounts of granular client data using data manipulation and statistical tools like SAS, WPS, R, CART. They will also apply proprietary Essex techniques on business problems and establish best practices to be used across the firm e.g. Portfolio Evaluations, Forecasting Risk etc.
         </p>
         <p>
          Skillset/Requirement:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Total Professional experience of 3-5 years with excellent analytical capabilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Should be an expert of working on statistical tools like SAS, WPS, R, CART
          </li>
          <li>
           M.Tech /MBA/Masters from Premier Academic Institutes, with excellent academic records
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent track record of handling very complex and challenging analytical/ scientific assignments
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven track record of communication, interpersonal and leadership skills and team management skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Should be able to take ownership
          </li>
          <li>
           Should have analytical bent of mind and should be interested in travelling and exploring the world
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Professional competencies:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Willing to work in an international environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Team player
          </li>
          <li>
           Good interpersonal skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Well organized
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines on time
          </li>
          <li>
           Good communication skills
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          *Please note that Essex uses internal job titles separate from those mentioned on job boards. The Senior Associate position is referred to internally as Profit Enhancement Specialist
         </p>
        </span>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Electronics Test Technician - 2nd Shift
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Sigmatron International
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Elk Grove Village, IL
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $15 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Electronic Test Technician - 2nd Shift M-F 3:15pm - 11:45pm
         </p>
         <p>
          SigmaTron, International Inc., an electronics manufacturer located in Elk Grove Village, IL currently has an opening for an Electronics Technician.
          <br/>
          Job Description:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The Electronics Technician is responsible for analyzing and trouble-shooting SMT and thru-hole printed circuit boards in a production environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able test complex electronic assembled printed circuit boards and assemblies using test processes and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able to demonstrate the ability to trouble-shoot complex electronic assemblies to component level using various test equipment including but not limited to oscilloscopes, multi-meters, power supplies, function generators, frequency counters, audio analyzers and computer controlled test equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able to read and interpret electronic schematics and assembly drawings.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able to work closely with both internal and or customer Engineers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able to train test operators
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A minimum of an Associates Degree in electronics or military equivalent in electronic technology.
          </li>
          <li>
           3-5 years of direct experience analyzing &amp; trouble-shooting electronics based products
          </li>
          <li>
           Familiarity with digital circuitry: micro  processors, digital logic gates, Multiplexors, and decoders, and analog circuitry: op  amp circuits and filters, discrete mosfets, and power regulation circuitry.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to perform light mechanical assembly and disassembly
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to read/write and communicate in English
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to read electronics based schematics
          </li>
          <li>
           Applicants must pass electronics basic skills test as well as basic English and math test.
          </li>
          <li>
           Applicant must be available to work overtime when needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have good verbal and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have experience in Windows Operating Systems, Excel, Word,
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           $15.00/hr 2nd shift
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $15.00 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Component Level Testing: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_31145681a0866b70">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Construction Accounting Manager/Controller
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Cobra BEC, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Auburn, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Construction Controller/Accounting Manager
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for a highly driven, talented and diverse accountant to join our growing team! Cobra BEC is a full scope building envelope contractor with four office locations: Auburn WA, Spokane WA, Boise ID, and Dallas TX. Cobra is family owned and operated, and employs 200-300 people throughout the United States. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to be involved in various areas of the company and handle accounting responsibilities for multiple offices!
         </p>
         <p>
          The position is responsible for direct oversight of the accounting team. Responsibilities also include creating and implementing policies and procedures, resolving and documenting accounting issues in addition to creating procedures to make the close and reporting processes more efficient and accurate.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Construction Controller Duties:
          </b>
          <br/>
          -Timely preparation, review and distribution of all monthly financial reporting packages.
          <br/>
          -Maintain both stand-alone and consolidated entity financials.
          <br/>
          -Review all monthly job cost reconciliations and branch work in progress schedules.
          <br/>
          -Work with the accounting team to complete the monthly accounting close process.
          <br/>
          -Develop accounting procedures, job cost budgets for new projects. Oversee their monthly progress reports.
          <br/>
          -Oversee cash management functions for the entire company and all construction projects. Complete all bank reconciliations.
          <br/>
          -Oversee the accounts payable function as all projects in progress. Ensure that all subcontractors and vendors meet all requirements of contract agreement prior to any payments.
          <br/>
          -Coordinate the preparation of annual tax return with outside CPA firm.
          <br/>
          -Prepare internal books and schedules for outside auditors in timely fashion (quarterly, annually).
          <br/>
          -Asset Management via depreciation schedules, inventory, cost centers.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Risk Management:
          </b>
          <br/>
          -Ensure all subcontractors have completed our insurance, Accident Prevention Program and sub-tier contract requirements prior to starting work and/or getting paid.
          <br/>
          -Maintain certificates of insurance and help assist CFO during annual insurance audit.
          <br/>
          -Work with CFO to ensure all new customer contracts that come in are reviewed by our attorney's on retainer.
          <br/>
          -Create a summary of those attorney's comments to create an internal knowledge database.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Business Development:
          </b>
          <br/>
          -Research and complete licensing requirements in all states we are looking at going after work in.
          <br/>
          -Become active in Industry Associations as well as with Customers and Contractors.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Education and Experience:
          </b>
          <br/>
          -4 year degree in Accounting or related field.
          <br/>
          -CPA preferred, but not required.
          <br/>
          -Background of familiarity in construction industry would be beneficial, especially experience in percentage of completion accounting.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Salary:
          </b>
          <br/>
          DOE, with full benefits and bonus structure.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_a71f830a7b1dbf92">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Ecommerce Merchandiser - groupon.com, wayfair.com, overstock.com, ect.
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Wholesale Interiors Inc / Baxton Studio
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Bensenville, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Do you spend your free time window shopping or browsing home decor catalogs and e-commerce sites? Do you have a background in digital marketing or merchandising? Do you love thinking about why customers buy?
          <br/>
          The Baxton Studio / Wholesale Interiors Site Merchandising team is looking for an enthusiastic and data-driven site merchandiser to help grow our Furniture categories. This person will join a team of e-commerce professionals focused on building a world-class customer experience across our online customer's stores. The Furniture category are the core of the Baxton Studio catalog and this is an excellent opportunity for an individual to make a significant impact on the business.
         </p>
         <p>
          The successful Site Merchandiser will combine an understanding of what drives e-commerce sales, an interest in the home goods retail sector, and a passion for user experience to improve Baxton Studio's onsite merchandising strategy. He/she will build an unparalleled shopping experience in collaboration with team leaders across the company including Category Management, Sales, Customer Service, Merchandising Operations, Brand, and Marketing. As an expert on how our customers shop for sofas, dining tables, rugs, lamps, and many other productsmembers of the Site Merchandising team advocate for the needs of our customers and serve as go-to people for insight on site traffic and merchandising performance.
         </p>
         <p>
          The ideal candidate is innovative, enthusiastic, and customer-focused with great judgment and creative problem-solving skills. He/she has demonstrated skill with technical tools &amp; processes through website management, digital marketing, advanced data analysis or other similar experience. He/she is passionate about customer behavior and about the ecommerce shopping experience. He/she is extremely organized and comfortable managing multiple cross-functional projects at once. He/she is a skilled personnel manager able to provide strong direction, remove roadblocks, and coach employees to success. He/she must be able to work at both a strategic level (generating innovative ideas for growth) and at a tactical level (executing updates with site merchandising tools, analyzing site and customer data, and solving problems).
          <br/>
          This position will serve our major accounts like Overstock.com, Wayfair, Target, Sears, ect.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities Include:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Serve as the department subject matter expert on merchandising and traffic in a given customer area, product catalog
          </li>
          <li>
           Relentlessly drive improvements to the Baxton Studio's customers' site experience in the Furniture categories through the development and execution of strategic cross-functional projects that will improve conversion rate and drive revenue growth
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain a strong vision for potential site improvements driven by passion for the Baxton Studio customer and brand.
          </li>
          <li>
           Analyze site metrics and related data to identify opportunities to improve merchandising and the customer experience across the various product categories
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain and update the Furniture category pages, product merchandising standards, and navigation experience onsite
          </li>
          <li>
           Partner across Category Management, Storefront, Merchandising Operations, Brand, and Marketing to drive collaborative projects to completion and ensure cohesive customer experience across all touch points
          </li>
          <li>
           Use site, customer, and sales data to analyze results across initiatives and report out on progress
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills/Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA plus 2+ years relevant experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Passionate about the customer with a strong interest in understanding and driving customer behavior
          </li>
          <li>
           Senior presence, able to clearly and consistently work side-by-side across functions and departments and synthesize multiple points of view into a coherent action plan
          </li>
          <li>
           Analytical and process-oriented, comfortable working with large data sets and making data-driven decisions. Experience with web analytics strongly preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to think both creatively and critically. Willing to think outside the box and challenge the status quo, while also fairly evaluating all possible solutions in making strategic decisions
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to manage through ambiguous and subjective situations, including balancing operational efficiency and data analysis with high quality standards and a sense of what is right for the customer
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to manage many projects and drive multiple threads of work to completion
          </li>
          <li>
           Superb communication skills, clear and concise in both written and verbal communication
          </li>
          <li>
           Comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Positive, energetic attitude
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience managing others strongly preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to quickly learn necessary technical tools. Experience with Excel a plus.
          </li>
          <li>
           Passion for the home goods market is a plus
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           About Us
          </b>
          Baxton Studio / Wholesale Interiors offers an extensive selection of home furnishings and decor across all styles and price points. With an unparallelled 1,800 skus, Baxton Studio / Wholesale Interiors helps people find the right product at the right price.
         </p>
         <p>
          Baxton Studio / Wholesale Interiors is headquarted in Bensenville, Il, and employs over 120 people. The company also operates two outlet stores, one in Bensenville, IL and one in Lombard, IL. The company has previously been named one of America's fastest growing companies by the Inc. 500.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Buying / Merchandising: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_4e94fc3e71482f1a">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Google Express Drivers positions Available Now!!
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Progistics Distribution Mountain View, CA
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Mountain View, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $30,000 - $42,000 a year
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Progistics Distribution is continuing our massive expansion with Google Express here in the SF Bay Area.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are hiring Google Express Drivers for our Mountain View, CA location to deliver products purchased from Google Express.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for drivers with great knowledge of the San Francisco bay area along with the use of GPS technology.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           **Replies to your applying are made through email correspondence**
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           **Please check your spam filter as well**
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           *SERIOUS APPLICANTS ONLY THAT CAN COMMIT TO A SCHEDULE*
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           *MUST BE OVER 21 YEARS OLD TO APPLY*
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Drivers will be dispatched from our Mountain View, CA location.
          </li>
          <li>
           Shifts average between 7-9 hours per day.
          </li>
          <li>
           That is 34 to 44 Hours per Week.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           We provide the following:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Company cargo vans, box trucks
          </li>
          <li>
           Gas cards
          </li>
          <li>
           Uniforms
          </li>
          <li>
           Scanner equipment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          You MUST pass a background check &amp; drug screen in order to join our team.
          <br/>
          <b>
           TO BE CONSIDERED TO APPLY/ INTERVIEW
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           YOU MUST COME PREPARED &amp; MUST PROVIDE A
          </b>
          <b>
           COPY
          </b>
          <b>
           OF THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Copy of a valid (CURRENT) driver license.
          <br/>
          Proof to work in the U.S; Social Security Card, Current Passport.
          <br/>
          DMV driving report: You may pick up your DMV report from the DMV office or go online at: https://www.dmv.ca.gov/portal/dmv/detail/online/dr/welcome
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           DMV REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
          Ages 21 to 25 yrs.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <b>
            Clean driving report, nothing on DMV report
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No moving violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No seat belt violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No at-fault accidents
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No suspensions
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No cell phone violations
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           DMV REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
          25 yrs. +
         </p>
         <ul>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Explaining all completed work and charges to customers, active delivery
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

         </p>

          </li>

      </span>

      </span>

      </nobr>

     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Lafayette Physical Therapy has been an established private practice for over 40 years in the community providing rehabilitation, massage and wellness services to a diverse clientele including orthopedics, sports and geriatric rehabilitation. We have a highly productive and efficient team and are looking for a personable and motivated individual that will thrive in our team environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for someone who will help to maintain a high level of customer service and professionalism. The Patient Services Representative works at the front desk assisting patients in person and over the phone as well as assisting the clinic in complete patient records, insurance verification and authorization, payment collection, scheduling and a other front office tasks. If you are detail oriented and looking to be a part of a wonderfully caring and effective team we would love to meet you!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Mission Statement
          </b>
          <br/>
          Lafayette Physical Therapy strives to provide extraordinary physical therapy in a professional, caring, results-oriented and cost-effective way to restore, enhance and preserve function, movement, and health. We will help each patient achieve his or her highest functional level by being dedicated to excellence in our clinical practice. We will treat patients with dignity and respect by truly listening to them to help them meet their goals. Finally, we will provide these services in an environment that fosters the professional and personal growth of each LPT employee.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Core Values
          </b>
          <br/>
          1. To provide an extraordinary customer service experience for all clients, treating them as unique and important individuals.
          <br/>
          2. To produce industry leading clinical outcomes.
          <br/>
          3. To meet and exceed all measures of financial performance through production and fiscal responsibility.
          <br/>
          4. To offer a great employment experience by promoting a working environment that fosters personal and professional growth, team enthusiasm, synergy, and integrity, so that staff meet and exceed their professional goals, and so that good people stay with the company for a long time.
          <br/>
          5. To have the company operate with ease so that each person can focus on their key production area with efficiency and production quotas exceeded regularly.
          <br/>
          6. To have our PTs recognized as autonomous professionals by patients and referral sources.
          <br/>
          7. To continually create new referral relationships and nurture existing ones so that we have a large and growing database of referrals.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Characteristics Needed
          </b>
          : The right candidate is friendly, professional, organized, reliable, accountable and ethical. We have a strong team atmosphere that requires an energetic and positive person with a good work ethic, accountability, and reliability.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills &amp; Abilities Needed
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Quick Learner
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Strong Multitasking abilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent Phone Etiquette
          </li>
          <li>
           Confidence in speaking to patients about money owed
          </li>
          <li>
           Detail-oriented with high accuracy
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to prioritize tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to follow directions and meet deadlines
          </li>
          <li>
           Adaptable to a growing practice
          </li>
          <li>
           Good spoken and written English (strong grammar)
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>

           </b>
           : MS Word and Excel, email, Windows 7 &amp; 8,
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Customer Service
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Typing Speed of 45wpm or higher by touch
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Scheduling physical therapy, massage and wellness appointments
          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Preparing and pulling charts
          </li>
          <li>
           Filing
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively manage daily logs and record keeping
          </li>
          <li>
           Process Patient Referrals, No-Shows/Cancellations, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Data Entry
          </li>
          <li>
           Work as a team with other staff members in order to provide the best possible customer service and workplace efficiency
          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </b>
          : 40 hours per week - Must be able to work full time.
         </p>

         </p>

         <p>
          BEHAVIOR INTERVENTIONIST
          <br/>
          (candidates must reside in San Francisco, Daly City, Palo Alto, Redwood City,San Mateo, San Carlos &amp; San Bruno areas)
         </p>
         <p>
          You can make a difference in the lives of children impacted with Autism. Join a fun workplace filled with passionate people. As ACES continues to expand, it is an exciting time for those also looking to build on their career in the field of behavior intervention. ACES is looking for motivated individuals who demonstrate flexibility, passion, and desire to make a difference in the lives of children and families. Now is the time to join our team of professionals dedicated to making positive change every day.
         </p>
         <p>
          Looking for individuals:
         </p>
         <p>
          Working towards a Bachelor's Degree or higher (48+ college credits)
          <br/>
          Previous experience working with children is preferred but not required
          <br/>
          A plus if you are experienced with working with children with Autism or in ABA, PECS, PRT, or VB. However, we are willing to train the right people with the right attitude.
          <br/>
          This is a FIELD BASED JOB and requires RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION and a VALID DRIVER'S LICENSE
          <br/>
          MUST BE AVAILABLE TO WORK THE FOLLOWING SHIFT: M-F 1pm-8pm; Availability to work on Saturdays from 9:00am - 4:00pm is a plus
          <br/>

          <br/>
          A plus if you are CPI/CPR Trained, but not necessary
         </p>
         <p>
          Our programs are designed by our certified and experienced Supervisors and are created in order to maximize opportunities for learning and growth across multiple settings. You will be part of a dedicated team and take part in implementation of individualized programs in the home, clinic, school and community based settings.
         </p>
         <p>
          What We Offer:
         </p>
         <p>
          Initial 1-2 week training (in our San Jose office) and ongoing learning opportunities
          <br/>
          Opportunity to learn from Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs), Masters, and PhD level Clinical Supervisors and Directors
          <br/>
          Provide CPI/CPR training
          <br/>
          Benefits provided for qualifying employees--Medical, dental, Vision, Life and flex spending
          <br/>
          Paid drive time plus mileage
          <br/>
          Opportunity for career advancement, continuing education and professional growth
          <br/>
          Dynamic and caring cultureTraining provided compliant with the requirements of the Behavior Analyst Certification Boards Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) credential.
         </p>
         <p>
          Please apply, if you have a strong desire to make a difference in the lives of children, give back to your community in a meaningful and long lasting way, know that you would work well in a team based approach, have a great work ethic and great attitude.
         </p>
         <p>
          Please feel free to reply to this posting by attaching your resume.
          <br/>
          Please visit www.acesaba.com for more information.
         </p>
         <p>
          No Phone Calls Please. Due to the volume of resumes, we will contact only those candidates whose experience, education, availability and location, match the current needs of ACES. Thank you for your interest and understanding.

         <p>
          Seeking a motivated, reliable and service-oriented professional to join our team. We are currently looking for a part-time optical assistant interested in a potentially full time position. The ideal candidate is a fast learner, a self-starter and is eager to master new skills and procedures. Experience with electronic health records and paperless office management software is helpful.
         </p>
         <p>
          General duties will include:  * Answer multi-line telephone system, take accurate messages, return all patient calls within 24-hours, complete appointment confirmation calls, and screen or direct telephone calls for management in a friendly and professional manner.  * Cheerfully greet each patient and perform the following functions: check-in, pre-test, coordinate with other staff assistants to ensure all aspects of patient care are delivered seamlessly from start to finish. * Prepare patient charts, manage correspondence, help maintain doctor daily schedules, and perform computer data entry. Maintain confidentiality as required. * Assist patients with frame selection based upon their individual prescriptions and lifestyle requirements. Familiarity with various vision insurances (VSP, etc.) will be needed to assist individual patients with insurance authorizations and to properly review and explain benefits. * Apply simple mathematical formulas for prescription conversion. Select materials, styles and shapes appropriate for various prescription types. Fit, adjust, repair and dispense eyewear. Complete patient monetary transactions and transcribe prescriptions quickly and accurately. * Train patients on proper handling, insertion, removal and care of contact lenses. * Manage multiple tasks while keeping an upbeat and cheerful attitude.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are willing to train the right candidate. We prefer someone who lives in the East Bay area and who is able to start promptly at 8:30am on workdays.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary BOE.
         </p>
         <p>
          Hours to include Saturdays and occasional evenings and Sundays. Competitive and comprehensive benefits package including paid vacation/PTO, 401K matching, medical insurance &amp; vision benefits
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>

          </li>
         </ul>

          Summary: Family owned Real Estate investment firm, started in 1998 based out of Queens, NY expanded to New Jersey in 2000. Work in a friendly and professional environment on a variety of interesting administrative activities or related tasks including but not limited to flow of correspondence, data entry and verification, proofing and evaluation of data, and other duties as needed.           *track and maintain database of all invoices and refunds.
          <br/>
          *Schedule meetings for professionals (lawyers, brokers, contractors as requested by owner)
          <br/>
          *Order and maintain database of all supplies for office, apartments and the building.
          <br/>
          *Provide detailed summary report on a weekly basis of past due rent, evictions in process, maintenance issues with apartments, etc. to the owner.
          <br/>
          *Perform other related duties as assigned.
         </p>
         <p>
          Position Requirements Education
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA or BS degree required or equivalent work experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Formal study in Business Administration, Library Science, or similar discipline highly desirable.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Work Experience
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum of 2 years of experience as an administrator in property management or commercial real estate.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated ability to handle high levels of task completion and demands.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven ability to work independently on assigned tasks as well as to accept direction on given assignments.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Competencies
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Computer proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational and time management skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent communicator in writing and verbally in formal and informal business settings.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong attention to accuracy and detail.
          </li>
          <li>
           High ethical standards.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          *Responsibilities and requirements are subject to change based on business needs.
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>

Our revenues are growing at over 30% per year and we need great people. We offer a great culture and competitive benefits. The Assistant Controller will be mentored by the current Controller with the expectation that they will become the Controller within 2 years, and will then eventually move from there into the CFO role. This is a highly visibly role and that needs someone who is ready for that "next step" in their career. The Assistant Controller will be responsible for directing and assisting in the day to day accounting tasks, and must be able to multi-task effectively and prioritize duties and projects. He / She must have a Bachelor's degree in Accounting and have a CPA, with 4-5 years of experience. Public accounting experience is a plus, as is experience with inventory. Prior exposure to implementing a new accounting and/or new ERP system is also a plus. This would be an ideal position for someone looking to leave public accounting and join a growing and progressive company - with lots of professional upside.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Assistant Controller responsibilities include
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Continually reviews and oversees the process and data flow between accounting systems and sub-systems and evaluates the effectiveness and efficiency of accounting process flow.
          </li>

           <i>
            .
           </i>
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists with the preparation and evaluation of budgets and financial forecasts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Supervise and participate in all aspects of the day to day accounting function.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates month-end and year-end reporting, preparing accruals and schedules, and submitting monthly and ad hoc financial reporting packages.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists with analysis and review of the company's financial performance by collecting, analyzing and reporting financial and statistical data.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develops innovative and effective solutions to problems in financial analysis, reporting and forecasting through individual effort or as part of a team.
          </li>
          <li>
           Evaluates the company's and industry's practices on how capital assets are depreciated
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists the Controller as required, and represents the Finance team as needed at month-end and other Management meetings and review
          </li>

          </b>

          </li>

      </span>

      <span class="location">

      </span>

      <nobr>
       $15 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Electronic Test Technician - 2nd Shift M-F 3:15pm - 11:45pm
         </p>
         <p>
          SigmaTron, International Inc., an electronics manufacturer located in Elk Grove Village, IL currently has an opening for an Electronics Technician.
          <br/>
          Job Description:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The Electronics Technician is responsible for analyzing and trouble-shooting SMT and thru-hole printed circuit boards in a production environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able test complex electronic assembled printed circuit boards and assemblies using test processes and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able to demonstrate the ability to trouble-shoot complex electronic assemblies to component level using various test equipment including but not limited to oscilloscopes, multi-meters, power supplies, function generators, frequency counters, audio analyzers and computer controlled test equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able to read and interpret electronic schematics and assembly drawings.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able to work closely with both internal and or customer Engineers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Candidate must be able to train test operators
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A minimum of an Associates Degree in electronics or military equivalent in electronic technology.
          </li>
          <li>
           3-5 years of direct experience analyzing &amp; trouble-shooting electronics based products
          </li>
          <li>
           Familiarity with digital circuitry: micro  processors, digital logic gates, Multiplexors, and decoders, and analog circuitry: op  amp circuits and filters, discrete mosfets, and power regulation circuitry.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to perform light mechanical assembly and disassembly
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to read/write and communicate in English
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to read electronics based schematics
          </li>
          <li>
           Applicants must pass electronics basic skills test as well as basic English and math test.
          </li>
          <li>
           Applicant must be available to work overtime when needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have good verbal and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have experience in Windows Operating Systems, Excel, Word,
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           $15.00/hr 2nd shift
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $15.00 /hour
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Component Level Testing: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Billing Specialist
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       PlayNetwork
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Redmond, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Summary
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Billing Specialist is responsible for accurate and timely customer invoicing, regular maintenance of recurring billing accounts, and for the general integrity of customer data in our systems. This position also supports the Collection Departments activities through special billing requirements and billing reconciliation issues as well as supplying customer documentation as needed.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Duties and Responsibilities
          </b>
          <br/>
          <i>
           The following is a list of general job responsibilities for the Billing Specialist position. This list is not all-inclusive and may be broadened or changed to meet changing business needs.
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Review daily shipments ready to invoice to bill all Sales Orders in a timely fashion. This includes ensuring all data flowing to the invoice is accurate for the customer and/or invoice, all necessary supporting documentation is included, and submitting the invoice to the customer in the appropriate manner, including through 3rd party billing systems
          </li>
          <li>
           Invoice projects completed by other departments
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that purchase order and approval process standards are being met per customer requirements
          </li>
          <li>
           Confirm that all equipment, labor, and freight pricing is entered per customer contract
          </li>
          <li>
           Confirm correct account and recurring billing setup for all new subscribers
          </li>
          <li>
           Reject any orders not meeting standards and communicate to Client Services team and other users what changes are needed to correctly process the order
          </li>
          <li>
           Enter clear and concise billing notes for the customers final invoice
          </li>
          <li>
           Print and mail invoices for orders that are closed/finalized and submit all special invoices in a timely manner via 3rd party billing systems and Excel templates where required
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor Outlook and Salesforce billing queue for all Billing Department requests
          </li>
          <li>
           Audit accounts as requested to ensure accounts are ready to bill for monthly recurring billing
          </li>
          <li>
           Process internal requests for address changes, billing account changes, rate changes, account termination, account reactivation, recurring billing additions, etc
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all Sales Orders and Projects submitted before monthly cutoff are invoiced prior to month-end closing; manage own workflow
          </li>
          <li>
           Contribute to the teams mission to improve data flows, including getting required data input from upstream partners, optimizing our processes, and ensuring Accounting output is accurate
          </li>
          <li>
           Create general/one-time invoices or Credit Memos as needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Learn and keep knowledge current for 3rd party systems such as FM Pilot, Service Channel, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop positive and productive working relationships with both internal and external customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Document, communicate, and update all billing department processes and procedures in real-time
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with other Billing or Accounting projects as assigned
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Experience/Education
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school education or general equivalency completed
          </li>
          <li>
           Associate Accounting Degree or classes towards degree a plus
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum 2-3 years recent billing or administrative experience in a high-volume AR invoicing position
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Required Skills and Abilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Proficiency with MS Windows Office Suite (advanced user of Excel and Outlook preferred)
          </li>
          <li>
           Superb attention to detail and strong analytical abilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to learn quickly and keep up in an ever-changing environment
          </li>
          <li>
           High level of confidentiality, discretion, and professionalism
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to produce well-written, professional documents (spreadsheets, email, etc)
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to follow directions, meet strict deadlines, and work independently
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability and genuine desire to develop positive and productive working relationships with both internal and external customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Epicor and/or Sales Force experience a plus
          </li>
          <li>
           3rd party billing/tracking system experience a plus
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Behaviors
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Results-driven, solution-oriented team player
          </li>
          <li>
           Capable of sound judgment and decision-making
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to effectively provide, receive, and respond positively to constructive feedback
          </li>
          <li>
           Seeks out information, training, and other resources needed to facilitate continual professional development necessary to be successful in this position
          </li>
          <li>
           Leads by example and exemplifies the PlayNetwork Guiding Principles in actions and behaviors
          </li>
          <li>
           Regular and predictable attendance is an essential function of this position
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Physical Demands and Work Environment
          </b>
          <br/>
          The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
         </p>
         <p>
          While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for long periods of time. In this position you must be able to regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
         </p>
         <p>
          Due to the nature of our business, you may be exposed to potentially offensive lyrics and/or video content. In order to prevent this type of material from going to our customers it is a necessary function of our business to listen for, edit or remove this content from our database.
         </p>
         <p>
          This job description should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the only duties, responsibilities, and qualification for this job. Incumbents may be required to follow any additional related instructions, acquire related job skills and perform other related work as required.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Billing or Administrative Experience: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>

         <p>

          <br/>

          </b>
         </p>

          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Are you ready to launch a career and not settle for just another job?            Grow their business supported by the financial strength and integrity of New York Life.
          </li>
          <li>
           Make a difference in their community by helping others achieve peace of mind.
          </li>
          <li>
           Customize their career path to match their personal goals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience a lifetime of learning and professional development.
          </li>
          <li>
           Enjoy recognition and rewards for their achievements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Define their career path as an agent and have the opportunity for management.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Organized, detail-oriented and excellent time management skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong sales, leadership and communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work in a team based environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Previous sales experience preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Previous Insurance industry experience not required
          </li>
          <li>
           Highly self-motivated and self-disciplined.
          </li>
          <li>
           Relationship building and networking abilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Life &amp; Health Insurance Licensed not required (company will pay for sponsorship)
          </li>
          <li>
           FINRA Series 6, Series 7, Series 63 a plus (paid sponsorship available after employment)
          </li>
          <li>
           Personal Transportation will be required for this position.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Heres what youll do as a Financial Advisor:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Build relationships with clients beyond a transactional basis.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop your professional skills and knowledge.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop and implement business and marketing plans.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prospect for potential clients.
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedule appointments and meet with clients.
          </li>
          <li>
           Discuss financial concerns and needs of individuals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Present potential solutions using our wide array of products and services.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide ongoing customer service and support to existing clients.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Training:
          <br/>
          NYLIC University: One of the most comprehensive and well-respected training programs in the financial services industry
         </p>
         <p>
          Benefits:
          <br/>
          Health/Dental/Life/Disability Insurance
          <br/>
          401(k) plan and Pension Plan3
          <br/>
          Reimbursement for courses taken on industry designations
         </p>
         <p>
          Training - NYLIC University: One of the most comprehensive and well-respected raining programs in the industry
         </p>
         <p>
          Career Advancement - After two years as a successful agent, additional opportunities that may be available include: sales development manager, product consultant, and Home Office opportunities in recruiting, marketing or training
         </p>
         <p>
          Constant Support - During and after the initial formal training, you will receive continuous assistance from your managers and peers in your office and personnel from the company to help you succeed
         </p>
         <p>
          On-site trainers and product consultants are available to you and this is coupled with an entire division within the company located in the Home Office dedicated to providing agents with prospecting and sales ideas, product knowledge and application
         </p>
         <p>
          New York Life Recognitions: Ranks #88 on the Fortune 500 list for 20144New York Life ranked 82 out of 150 companies on Forbes Americas Most Reputable Companies list for 2014.5New York Life was named to Training magazines Training Top 125 ranking for 2014, a ranking of a companys excellence in employer sponsored training and development programs.6New York Life has been named a Best Company for Multicultural Women for 2014.by Working Mother magazine. 7New York Life was named to Professional Womens Magazines Best of the Best list for 2014.81 Based on revenue as reported by "Fortune 500, ranked within Industries, Insurance: Life, Health (Mutual)," Fortune magazine, June 16, 2014.        <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Position Summary: To maintain equipment and grounds facility to provide an efficient and safe work environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          Role qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High School diploma. Mechanical/Electrical Training Certification or equivalent work experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of 5 years working as a Maintenance Mechanic in a manufacturing environment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Position Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Perform all necessary repairs for the facility including mechanical, electrical, support equipment repairs, building and grounds maintenance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Examine machines and mechanical equipment to diagnose source of trouble.
          </li>
          <li>
           Dismantle or partly dismantle machines and perform repairs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Replace broken or defective parts with items obtained from stock.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with the inventory of replacement parts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Preform preventative maintenance on machining.
          </li>
          <li>
           Report any faulty or inefficient equipment and schedule for repair.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide support to production personnel by answering breakdown assistance calls.
          </li>
          <li>
           Troubles shoot machine breakdowns and provide solutions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow proper lockout/tagout procedures when working on equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow department and company policies and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow safety rules and regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reports all food safety and quality problems to the Quality Team.
          </li>
          <li>
           May be required to perform other duties as requested, directed or assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Essential skills and experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in working with low voltage machinery and equipment such as Sheeters (Good Strong), Print Presses (Man Roland), Die Cutters (Bobst) and Gluing equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read schematics and working with PLCs
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of working with several various hand &amp; power tools.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to operate a forklift truck.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          We are looking for a dynamic person with a great work ethic and excellent attention to detail to fulfill our Purchasing Project Manager role using Shop-Tech E2 ERP. The purchasing project associate will be responsible for purchasing our daily inventory needs as part of a purchasing team, and managing the parts needs of a multitude of different projects to their completion. Part of the responsibility of the project manager will be ongoing data entry, building bill of materials is the main part of the job, learning our inventory,and working with shoptech E2 system. The purchasing project associate must be proficient with computers, Microsoft Office Suit, etc. The candidate will be responsible for quickly learning our processes and procedures. The candidate for this position will be responsible for quickly learning inventory parts and their function. Experience using an ERP system to make bill of materials is a must. Must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Please note: This position is a non supervisory position and we are looking for team members with experience making Bill Of Materials in the SHOPTECH E2 system, we may consider experience in other ERP systems.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Purchasing and Data Entry Required : 2 years
          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u12fiaib9ro94r" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
