  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Recycling Specialist - Long Beach Zone 11
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       rePlanet, LLC.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Long Beach, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $10 - $13 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Since 1999 rePlanet has partnered with our customers and communities to encourage recycling while keeping a neighborhoods quality of life high and its property values stable.
         </p>
         <p>
          At our more than 700 centers statewide customers can recycle CRV (California Redemption Value) aluminum, glass and plastic containers. They can return empty containers to our highly trained recycling specialists or utilize automated recycling machines. All centers are state certified and meet requirements for supermarkets and other beverage retailers to comply with the state of Californias Beverage Container Recycling Law (AB2020).
         </p>
         <p>
          BENEFITS:
          <br/>
          rePlanet offers fully paid Medical insurance for Employee Only coverage with the option to enroll for Dental, and Vision insurance at a minimal cost. 401K plans are available additionally, all employees receive paid holidays. and employees who work 30+ hours per week accrue vacation time.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you're dependable and looking for work, and would like to work in a growing industry with the opportunity for advancement apply now!
         </p>
         <p>
          Hourly Wage: $10.00 - $13.00 (depending on experience)
          <br/>
          Hours per week: 30-39 hours
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           PLEASE APPLY AT: http://replanet.com/jobs
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          JOB SUMMARY
          <br/>
          Assists customers with their recycling beverage containers, sorts recycling beverage containers, and in some locations operates reverse vending machines.
         </p>
         <p>
          SSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
          <br/>
          Responsible for opening and closing rePlanet or traditional recycling centers as scheduled and mandated by the State and the Company
          <br/>
          Purchases aluminum cans, plastic bottles, and glass bottles from the public, ensuring proper customer service
          <br/>
          Inspects, sorts, correctly identifies and accurately weighs materials, calling out each weight and verbalizes transaction to the customer
          <br/>
          Demonstrates reverse vending machine for customers at rePlanet recycling centers
          <br/>
          Issues a voucher for the recycled material or pays out cash
          <br/>
          Stores aluminum cans, plastic bottles, and glass bottles in proper storage container
          <br/>
          Responsible for sorting and crushing glass bottles
          <br/>
          Keeps work area clean, organized, and safe
          <br/>
          Performs daily cleaning and maintenance of equipment and reports any problems
          <br/>
          Performs general maintenance and cleaning daily of reverse vending machines at rePlanet recycling centers
          <br/>
          Tests scale with certified weight and ensures accuracy each day before opening
          <br/>
          Correctly completes required daily and/or weekly paperwork
          <br/>
          Reports site volume information to central office via voicemail or modem or computer
          <br/>
          Understands and reports market conditions and competition affecting site.
         </p>
         <p>
          REQUIREMENTS:
          <br/>
          Must be able to work outdoors.
          <br/>
          Must be able to bend, kneel and stand for long periods of time --intense work.
          <br/>
          Must adhere to safety standards and wear appropriate equipment to include safety shoes, uniforms, gloves, and other personal protective equipment as required.
          <br/>
          Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds if necessary.
          <br/>
          Work in a fast paced environment, working with customers and traffic and be able to move safely and provide a high degree of customer service.
          <br/>
          rePlanet is an equal opportunity employer.
          <br/>
          Candidates must successfully pass a pre-employment criminal background check, physical and drug screen.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Customer Service: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_8ee8559085242a52">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

           Poongsan Corp SED, a division of Poongsan Corp
          </b>
          ., is a manufacturer of semiconductor capital equipment to the semiconductor industry. We are looking for a Sales &amp; Marketing Director with Semiconductor Equipment and Front End Process experience.
          <br/>
          Contributor to corporate growth and profitability; Successful in creating, developing and executing sales and marketing plans to bring products to the market; Determining current and future needs of diverse customers on global basis to maintain and gain market share; Comprehensive knowledge of semiconductor process, equipment selling cycle, new product development cycle, and product life cycle. As Marketing Director provide analysis and collaboration to the President/COO in setting the strategic marketing direction of the division, in determining and delivering a highly focused tactical plan of action.
          <br/>
          Come join our successful team and help us advance our current product and roll out a new product offerings!
         </p>
         <p>

           Areas of Expertise
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Experience of driving product(s) from early engineering stage to manufacturing proven product at major IDMs and IC Foundries; diffusion furnace and/or FEOL process equipment background is preferred but not mandatory.
          </li>
          <li>
           Managed existing install bases at Tier-1 IC customers and drive product competitive edge to successfully penetrate other IC device customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage all sales activities to directing product positioning and pricing (ASP, COGS, GM, Profit, etc.), reviewing customers contract / purchase spec., selling tactics and negotiation skill to closing deals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Execute strategic marketing plan to identify business opportunities and customers needs and to define product roadmap to meet advance IC device process requirements at 28nm and below, provide sales forecast, and conduct product cost (COO) and competitive analysis.
          </li>
          <li>
           Well established business channels with key customers at various levels of the organization in major IC makers
          </li>
          <li>
           Co-work with GPS team to manage global accounts and service representatives in Europe and Asia for pre-sale and post-sales support and customer satisfaction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience of managing Asian customers on complicated technical, cultural, and business challenges.
          </li>
          <li>
           Co-work with site GM to review operational budgets / P&amp;L to reduce operation cost to maximize the profit margin.
           <b>
            Qualifications:
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          *
         </p>

          <li>
           Bachelors Degree in Sales, Marketing or Business preferred with a minimum of five years related experience with progressive managerial responsibilities. Masters in marketing/business preferred. MBA highly desirable.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong business-to-business marketing and selling experience, as well as an in-depth knowledge of semiconductor industry particularly in the front end processes and equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           A strong track record and demonstrated success within a marketing, sales, relationship management role, either within the semiconductor industry or marketing / selling / consulting into the semiconductor industry. Preferably with early stage and specialty organizations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated in-depth sales and marketing techniques and financial principles. Effective ability to communicate orally or in written form effectively with co-management, internal and external customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Outstanding analytical, process development, organizational and planning skills; ability to handle both strategic thought and tactical execution. Demonstrate the ability to anticipate and solve practical problems or resolve issues.
          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

          </b>
          <br/>

          </b>

          </b>

          <b>

          </b>
         </p>

          <li>
           Drivers will be dispatched from our Mountain View, CA location.
          </li>
          <li>
           Shifts average between 7-9 hours per day.
          </li>
          <li>
           That is 34 to 44 Hours per Week.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           We provide the following:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Company cargo vans, box trucks
          </li>
          <li>
           Gas cards
          </li>
          <li>
           Uniforms
          </li>
          <li>
           Scanner equipment.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

           YOU MUST COME PREPARED &amp; MUST PROVIDE A
          </b>
          <b>
           COPY
          </b>
          <b>
           OF THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Copy of a valid (CURRENT) driver license.
          <br/>
          Proof to work in the U.S; Social Security Card, Current Passport.
          <br/>
          DMV driving report: You may pick up your DMV report from the DMV office or go online at: https://www.dmv.ca.gov/portal/dmv/detail/online/dr/welcome
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           DMV REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
          Ages 21 to 25 yrs.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <b>
            Clean driving report, nothing on DMV report
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No moving violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No seat belt violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No at-fault accidents
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No suspensions
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No cell phone violations
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

         </p>

          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No seat belt violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No at-fault accidents
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No suspensions
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No cell phone violations
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </b>
         </p>

          <br/>

         </p>

          </b>
          <br/>

          <br/>
          You will work 5 days, weekends days are a MUST!!
         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

           Mountain View, CA
          </li>

         </p>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Retail Merchandiser
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       The Hillman Group
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Summary:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Assists Traditional Sales staff with new store sets, merchandising projects, covering open territories, New Product Van sales, and any other projects as directed by the Traditional Sales Business Manager.
         </p>
         <p>
          Key Result Areas (KRAs):
          <br/>
          <b>
           Sales Support
          </b>
           Open territories and the New Products Van.
          <br/>
           Provide sales support for the Traditional FSMs covering open territories.
          <br/>
           Provide FSMs with support for the New Product Van sales and driving as requested.
          <br/>
           Maintain professional business relationships.
          <br/>
           Knowledge of Hillman products, programs, and sales/field operating procedures.
          <br/>
           Travel as required.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Merchandising
          </b>
           Achieve Hillman merchandising standards.
          <br/>
           Basic understanding of plan-o-grams, marketing concepts, and merchandising aids.
          <br/>
           Maintains consistent presentation standards.
          <br/>
           Identifies opportunities for the best use of retail space and merchandising opportunities.
          <br/>
           Adapts to existing conditions and is flexible with changes.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Communications
          </b>
           Communicate effectively with Traditional Sales management team &amp; sales representatives.
          <br/>
           Communicates weekly with Business Manager and to assigned management staff.
          <br/>
           Informs management staff of current activities and of any changes.  Responds promptly to all customer and management staff issues and concerns.
          <br/>
           Maintains schedule as directed by the Business Manager, FSM or project manager.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Administration
          </b>
           Completes all administrative job requirements.
          <br/>
           Maintains a monthly planner.
          <br/>
           Completes all business reporting requirements.
          <br/>
           Completes all expense reporting requirements.
          <br/>
           Assists with any additional duties or projects as directed.
          <br/>
           Meets all DOT driving requirements.
          <br/>
          <b>
           Safety
          </b>
           Incorporate safety into every aspect of how business is conducted.
          <br/>
           Supports all safety polices/procedures as required by law and Company policy.
          <br/>
           Conducts safety observations relating to job requirements and provides feedback to management.
          <br/>
           Reports all safety incidents in a timely manner.
          <br/>
           Knows and follows the corporate safety policies and procedures.
          <br/>
           Provides and maintains a clean and safe work environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Education
          </b>
          : Bachelors degree in business or the equivalent in education and experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
          <br/>
           Three years related experience.
          <br/>
           Working knowledge of merchandising systems and plan-o-grams.
          <br/>
           Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Word) and Windows.
          <br/>
           Strong presentation and sales negotiation skills.
          <br/>
           Excellent interpersonal and communication skills - able to establish and maintain effective working relationships with customers and Hillman sales reps and management.
          <br/>
           Able to travel overnight frequently, up to 90% of the time.  Maintains a valid driver license.
         </p>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Hospital Department Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Somnia Anesthesia
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Everett, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Description:
          </b>
          The Anesthesia Department Manger is responsible for functions related to clerical and administrative support for hospital based anesthesia department. Liaison for the Practice Administrator in his/her absence. The ideal candidate will have
          <b>
           advanced Excel experience, strong written and verbal communication skills, be
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           detail-oriented and have outstanding organizational skills.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities/Tasks
          </b>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Compile anesthesia case records
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure all anesthesia records are accounted for (OR, Endo, OB, Post-Op Pain, etc) by reconciling charts against OR schedule, OB log, Endo log, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow up on any missing charts to ensure timely capture of information and accurate case count information.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure timely scanning of completed anesthesia records to Somnia headquarters. Anesthesia record includes
          </li>
          <li>
           Charge slip
          </li>
          <li>
           All required signatures
          </li>
          <li>
           Anesthesia Record
          </li>
          <li>
           Acute Pain Management Record (If Applicable)
          </li>
          <li>
           Demographics Sheet
          </li>
          <li>
           Operative Note
          </li>
          <li>
           Respond to requests for additional information to support billing (Lyra)
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with coordinate post-op and pre-op rounds based on OR schedule, add-on cases, acute pain procedures, etc
          </li>
          <li>
           Compile and track quality assurance information in Somnia database
          </li>
          <li>
           Enter incident reports
          </li>
          <li>
           Gather charts for Chief to complete FPPE/OPPE process
          </li>
          <li>
           Put up daily assignments as created by Chief or Administrator
          </li>
          <li>
           Answer department phones and route calls appropriately. If calls are related to the need for anesthesia services outside of the OR notify appropriate providers of PAT and other needs
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          *
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Call Anesthesiologist On-Call for any clinical requests, patient concerns
          </li>
          <li>
           Check Labor for Labor Epidurals from previous day- pass information to anesthesia MD or CRNA to do post op check
          </li>
          <li>
           Report clinical events (Incident Reports) to Chief and enter final reviews of incident reports to QM database (data entry).
          </li>
          <li>
           Special Projects (i.e. data entry for quality audits) as delegated by Somnia Management, Anesthesia Director or Administrator
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Knowledge:
          </b>
          <br/>
          General medical knowledge including terminology helpful
          <br/>
          General business knowledge helpful
          <br/>
          Computer knowledge necessary including use of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Skills:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Organization
          <br/>
          Time Management
          <br/>
          Writing Skills
          <br/>
          Operate office equipment such as voice mail system, fax machine, printer, computers etc.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Healtcare Administration: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_c31373766feb108f">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0u1m3eb0elasi" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Case Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Weston United Community Renewal, Inc
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       New York, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Company Overview:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Weston United Community Renewal, Inc. is a not for profit organization located in Harlem, New York. For over 29 years, Weston United has provided housing and supportive services to participants with histories of chronic homelessness, mental illness, and substance abuse. Weston United employs over 100 employees who contribute to a rich and diverse work environment.
          <br/>
          Weston United is currently seeking a Case Manager that will be responsible for delivering rehabilitative and restorative services to participants currently housed in Supportive Residential Services in Harlem.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements / Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Qualifying candidates must have an Associate's degree
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelor's degree preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           A suitable candidate will also have at least 2 years of Mental Health experience, particularly in the area of case management
          </li>
          <li>
           BSW and CASAC also desirable
          </li>
          <li>
           Good interpersonal and writing skills
          </li>
          <li>
           This position will require extensive walking when visiting consumers in various apartments throughout the city
          </li>
          <li>
           Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Duties and Responsibilities Include the Following:
          </b>
          <br/>
          <i>
           Other duties may be assigned
          </i>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Reports to the Program Coordinator
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide at least 2 face-to-face contacts with consumers in their apartments each week.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that consumers are living in safe, clean and decent environments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Document minimum of 2 progress notes per week.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures consumers have adequate ADL skills by demonstrating, training and coaching.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist consumer with assessing needs and strengths to set goals and objectives.
          </li>
          <li>
           Writes the admission notes in the uniform case record.
          </li>
          <li>
           Documentation of progress notes as they pertain to consumers individualized service plans, and ensures restorative services are clearly illustrated in progress notes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures that consumers are linked to all necessary ancillary services including psychiatric, medical and dental treatment, vocational and educational resources, and legal and financial entitlements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide crisis intervention in acute episodes of emotional and physical distress in order to contain consumers regression and to ensure safety of consumers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Completes follow-ups 30, 60 and 90 days documentation of discharged consumers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Represents the agency at conferences and meetings of referral sources, treatment providers and professional and community groups.
          </li>
          <li>
           Writes the individual service plans, service plan reviews in a timely manner for all consumers of the assigned caseload.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures that consumers have appropriate seasonal clothing.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor and evaluate whether or not consumers needs have been met by the ancillary services and make recommendations to supervisor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist consumers with entitlements, budgeting and managing utilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that furnishings, livings and household items meet agency standards.
          </li>
          <li>
           Escorts consumers to housing, benefits, and psychiatric/medical appointments when required.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>
            Weston United is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer.
           </i>
          </b>
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_5b2012dad5331102">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Spa Attendant
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Massage Envy Woodinville
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Woodinville, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Massage Envy in Woodinville is seeking FT and PT Spa Attendants to help with customer service and maintaining a meticulously clean and organized facility.
         </p>
         <p>
          The best candidates are customer service oriented &amp; professional, with good organizational skills and positive attitude. Able to work in a fast paced environment, be flexible and dependable.
         </p>
         <p>
          These positions are full time &amp; part-time. Evenings are required for the FT position, typical hours are: Mon-Fri 2pm to 10:30pm or 4pm to 10:30pm. The PT is Sat &amp; Sun 7:30am to 2pm.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Primary Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          -Welcome guests
          <br/>
          - Maintain cleanliness of treatment rooms and keep them stocked in supplies. Empty garbage.
          <br/>
          - Run washer dryer throughout the shift.
          <br/>
          - Fold linens, organize &amp; clean supplies.
          <br/>
          - Stock closets and break room, maintain beverage stations.
          <br/>
          - Maintain cleanliness of all common areas including lobby, tranquility room and rest rooms.
          <br/>
          - Assist in room turnovers with massage, facial or hot stone treatments, when appropriate.
          <br/>
          -Assist front desk with filing &amp; provide relief for lunches and breaks.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications and Experience:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Strong work ethic, attendance and punctuality
          <br/>
          Ability to complete job duties under little supervision
          <br/>
          Attention to detail &amp; ability to follow a checklist.
          <br/>

          <br/>
          Flexibility and teamwork skills are required
         </p>

         </p>
         <p>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Regional System Administrator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       BluePearl Veterinary Partners
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       New York, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           SUMMARY
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Regional Systems Administrator is a multi-role position. In addition to the standard systems administration tasks such as Active Directory tasks, VMware usage, server maintenance, and monitoring of backups and antivirus, this position will be responsible for providing support and technical assistance as needed, related to computer systems (desktop and server), hardware, software, and networks for our local regional locations. The candidate will respond to support queries, perform troubleshooting to isolate problems, then determine and implement a solution.
          <b>
           NOTE:
          </b>
          This position will be based at our Midtown Manhattan location (410 W. 55th Street) and require travel to all of our BluePearl NY/NJ locations on a regular basis. Additionally, there will be some project work in other states as needed. Personal vehicle/transportation is required.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Regional System Administrator Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Manage servers (physical and virtual), systems, and peripheral devices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Interacts with a VMware Virtual Infrastructure Environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage LANs and WANs, including site-to-site VPNs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage and maintain storage systems (NAS, NFS, and iSCSI).
          </li>
          <li>
           Install, manage, modify, and repair computer/server hardware and software.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform routine maintenance and configuration on server systems.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare and maintain documentation, to include Network and System configurations, training manuals, and how-to documents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage and maintain backups and antivirus.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to explain technical information to clients, management and peers with effective verbal and written communication.
          </li>
          <li>
           Run diagnostic programs to resolve problems.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Active Directory proficiency
          </li>
          <li>
           VMware proficiency (ability to manage)
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft Windows server and desktop experience: 2003, 2008, 2008R2, 2012, XP, Windows 7 and Windows 8.1
          </li>
          <li>
           Microsoft Office 2007-2013 deployment
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency in troubleshooting various issues (a demonstrated methodology)
          </li>
          <li>
           Printer and print server support
          </li>
          <li>
           Network device configuration and troubleshooting (routers and switches  VLANs, port forwarding, route tables, etc)
          </li>
          <li>
           Client-Server Application Experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Digital Radiography Experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Email and Calendar Systems Experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to multitask, prioritize, work independently, and ask for help when needed
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Educational/Experience Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Telecommunications Experience
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>

          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Highly developed sense of integrity and commitment to customer satisfaction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated passion for excellence with respect to treating and caring for customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing.
          </li>
          <li>
           Has a pleasant, patient and friendly attitude.
          </li>

          </li>

           Interested Individuals must meet and understand the following criterias prior to applying:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           All candidates must be able to receive a Satisfactory result from a NYS Department of Criminal Justice Services fingerprint check.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           All candidates must at time of interview present ALL Disposition letter(s) from the courts for all misdemeanor/felony convictions. (Conviction of a crime is not an automatic bar to employment.)
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           All candidates must be able to pass a pre-employment Federal Drug Test and a DOT Physical.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           All candidates must be able to complete a full 2 weeks (10 day) paid training in order to qualify.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           ALL Drivers must have Current NY State CDL License
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           All CDL Drivers must be at least twenty one years old.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Premier Para Transit is a full service transportation business, looking to hire drivers immediately!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

          </b>

         <p>
          <b>
           We are looking for driven and hard-working mechanics who are ready to shake up the automotive industry!
          </b>
          <br/>
          YourMechanic is a mobile mechanic company. We offer car repair services at our customers' homes and offices. Our website and mobile app provide instant car repair quotes and 24/7 appointment booking. With no shop overhead, we pass the savings on to our customers and provide our mechanics better pay. Customers love us because of the savings and convenience; mechanics love us because they get more control of their schedules.
          <br/>
          We handle all the marketing, appointment scheduling, parts ordering, invoicing and customer support for our mechanics, leaving the mechanics to do what they love-- fix cars.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           About this role:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Seeking a Master Mechanic/Service Advisor to work in the YourMechanic office to manage warranty claims, support our team of mobile mechanics, and assess skills/abilities of technicians applying for work. This is a unique opportunity for a seasoned mechanic who is looking for work outside of a shop while still utilizing his/her automotive knowledge and background. In this position you will work on a team aimed at supplying and supporting our mechanics to service our growing base of customers across the country.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Primary responsibilities would include:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Handle escalated calls and process customer warranty claims - you will have to make judgement calls that best serve both the customer and the business
          </li>
          <li>
           Evaluate candidates applying to work with YourMechanic as mobile technicians
          </li>
          <li>
           Assess ongoing performance of the current mechanic team
          </li>
          <li>
           Act as the lead tech to support our team of mobile mechanics - you will aid in troubleshooting complex diagnostics, give advice on handling customer service issues and overall support the day-to-day needs of the mechanic team
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Master Level Automotive Technician specializing in European makes and models
          </li>
          <li>
           10-15 years experience working as a Master Mechanic in a dealership or independent shop
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience working as a Service Advisor providing customer support and handling warranty claims
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience leading interviews with technicians to assess skill level, experience, qualifications and overall fit
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to take ownership of work and multitask in a fast-past environment
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills is a must - both for tricky drivability diagnostic issues and for supporting a team of mobile mechanics out in the field facing unforeseen issues
          </li>
          <li>
           Sound judgment and the ability to make concise decisions
          </li>
          <li>
           Positive can-do attitude
          </li>
          <li>
           Is a team player and understands that there is no room for egos
          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0egf1lb9jqdns" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Forensics Evidence Clerk
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Discovia
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Job Description:
         </p>
         <p>
          Discovia is seeking an evidence clerk to join its forensics and data collection team. Discovia is a rapidly-growing provider of computer forensics, electronic discovery, and litigation support consulting services located in downtown San Francisco. This is a full-time, hourly position with benefits. Please email your CV and a cover letter that specifically describes why you believe you are a good fit for this position. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Duties:
         </p>
         <p>
          Assume responsibility for evidence / media management, as well as administrative and logistical functions
         </p>
         <p>
          Be a proactive, self-starter and assist with the continued refinement and evolution of these same functions
         </p>
         <p>
          Work as part of a close-knit and high-functioning team to provide outstanding service to our clients
         </p>
         <p>
          Perform occasional IT type tasks, such as deploying new systems, setting up test environments, and troubleshooting custom technical problems
         </p>
         <p>
          Experience and Skills:
         </p>
         <p>
          Familiarity with computer hardware components and functionality - think "can you remove a hard drive?"
         </p>
         <p>
          Keen eye for detail, accuracy, and organization - this is an absolute "must have"
         </p>
         <p>
          Excellent oral and written communication skills
         </p>
         <p>
          Ability to effectively balance multiple projects and responsibilities, often under tight timeframes
         </p>
         <p>
          Clear understanding and recognition that our work schedule is ultimately determined by our clients needs, and sometimes may involve after-hours and/or weekends
         </p>
         <p>
          Positive, "can do" attitude and an ability to adapt to change
         </p>
         <p>
          Self motivation, self direction and the ability to take initiative and solve problems
         </p>
         <p>
          Previous experience preferred, but not required, in computer forensics, eDiscovery, information technology, or law firm litigation support
         </p>
         <p>
          Discovia is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Discovia complies with all laws and regulations applicable under federal, state, and local law. Any offer of employment at Discovia is contingent upon successful completion of a background check and security awareness training.
         </p>
         <p>
          Discovia is a leading global provider of electronic discovery services to corporations and law firms handling litigation, internal and ITC investigations, and HSR Second Requests. Services include onsite and remote data collections, data minimization, data processing and hosting, expert application of leading technology-assisted review tools, document review management, and document productions. It is one of very few companies in the industry to achieve both ISO 27001 certification and Relativity Orange Level Best-in-Service status. Through its proprietary processes, highly-automated operation and outstanding talent, Discovia delivers a 99.6 percent accuracy rate, data culling rates of over 95 percent for repeat clients, and a net promoter score of over 60 percent. Discovia is the first eDiscovery services firm to deliver a fixed-price managed service, enabling Fortune 500 corporate legal departments and law firms to gain a world-class eDiscovery function without building it internally. More information is available at 415-392-2900 or www.discovia.com.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           0 to 5 years: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

         <p>
          Haney Truck Line is the premier customized Heavy Haul truckload transportation provider in the Pacific Northwest. We dedicate ourselves to providing exceptional service and value, founded on a partnership-based approach to business. Our team of committed professionals, leading-edge technology, efficient high-capacity equipment, and high-density regional focus combine to deliver an innovative and cost-effective solution targeted at helping our customers succeed. We are currently expanding our company fleet and are in immediate need of drivers seeking long term employment with a company that puts an emphasis on Safety, Teamwork, Accountability and Respect.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Type of Truck Driving Job: *OTR Truck Driver
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           License Type: *Class A CDL
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Full Time: *40-70 hours per week
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Operating Area: *WA, OR, ID
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Trucking Experience Level: *Heavy haul
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>

          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           1 year CDL Class A
          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Sr. Project Controls Specialist
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Westland Management Solutions, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Menlo Park, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Senior Cost and Schedule Control Specialist
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Westland Management Solutions, Inc. is in need of a project controls specialist to work as part of an enterprise implementation team. Duties include working directly with client to create specific aspects of integrated program controls systems, including EPS, WBS, cost-loaded project schedules, cost reconciliation, accrual, data integration, work flow and procedures. These systems utilize data integration between Oracle Primavera products, Deltek Cobra, Deltek wInsight Analytics, and client legacy systems. The Senior Project Controls Specialist is responsible for leading and managing project planning, monitoring, and scheduling tasks, applying a broad range of Project Management and Project Controls practices. This position is also responsible for providing leadership and guidance to a team of project management/project controls professionals and other support staff. This position expected to have a strong background in the implementation of project management principles and concepts as well as an in-depth understanding of Project Controls processes/procedures and systems and lead projects over $20 million.
         </p>
         <p>
          Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
          <br/>
          Projects Control:  * Develop and maintain resource-loaded schedules. Prepare monthly status reports and advise project managers on critical areas and progress toward milestones.  * Perform cost, schedule and earned value (EV) analyses to identify and report variances from the baseline plan.  * Work with control account managers to develop relevant variance explanations with corrective action plans.  * Review basis of estimate files and other supporting documentation for completeness.  * Knowledge and Understanding of Accounting/Finance GAP/CAS general requirements. Project Management:  * Perform the full range of project management cycle: initiating, planning, executing, monitoring and controlling, and closing. Independently lead and direct projects requiring high levels of functional integration and involving multiple disciplines to be managed.  * Direct development of an action plan, and estimate requirements for resources, including management, labor, materials, and time required to complete project.  * Work with clients to anticipate future demand and secure the necessary resources to address project management and project controls requirements. General  * Interface with project managers, control account managers, engineers, procurement contract administrators, financial analysts, and governing bodies and regulators on project planning and controls issues and requests.  * Implement standards, system descriptions, software applications, protocols and practices in Project Management/Project Control.  * Facilitate discussions and negotiations to drive recommendation consensus.  * Ensure work completion within schedule, budgetary and design constraints; make decisions about analysis, design and testing; solve complex technical problems; and provide alternative methods for achieving goals when necessary.  * Lead and/or oversee a function unit of project management/project controls professionals and other support staff on a project  * Train and delegate staff on assigned project(s); responsible for the planning, scheduling and project management/project controls functions of large and complex projects.  * May recruit, mentor, evaluate, develop and lead project controls staff; assign work to staff and resolve workload distribution issues to address current and future demand of project(s).
         </p>
         <p>
          Minimum Education and Experience Required:  * Bachelors Degree with 10+ years of Project Management/Project Controls including planning and controls experience, or a combination of education and relevant experience.  * Demonstrated project management/project controls leadership experience on projects over $20 million.  * Demonstrated in-depth knowledge and experience with projects requiring the DOE Order 413.3B.  * An in-depth knowledge and experience with capitalization standards, earned-value scheduling and cost management systems and reporting.  * Extensive financial analysis and reporting experience with demonstrated ability to advise customers and develop effective solutions.  * Demonstrate experience leading a unit of project controls professionals and other support staff.  * Demonstrate expertise in all foundational aspects of project management planning and controls, including planning, budgeting and scheduling.  * Demonstrate ability to understand the project and its operational needs and the ability to employ integration, scope time management, cost, quality, human resources, communication, risk and procurement components.  * Demonstrated ability to organize work and manage multiple projects.  * Demonstrate ability to use professional concepts and project objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.  * An in-depth understanding of standard Project Management software such as Primavera and Cobra (or equivalent scheduling and cost processor tools), Microsoft Project and Microsoft Office applications, and applicable processes and procedures.  * Must possess excellent organizational skills with attention to detail and have the ability to manage several projects simultaneously.  * Ability to productively assemble, engage and lead cross-functional teams.  * Demonstrated resilience, diplomacy, influence, relationship building, and problem solving skills in a variety of situations. Keen grasp of interpersonal impact awareness.  * Knowledge of technical discipline/domain needed to deliver projects.  * Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work effectively within a cross-functional team with diverse technical backgrounds.
         </p>
         <p>
          For more information about our company, please visit our web site at www.westlandsolutions.com.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Deltek Cobra: 4 years
          </li>
         </ul>

From home accessories and kitchenware to one-of-a-kind sundries and outdoor tools, our wide range of products grows every day.

         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          o Can internalize and interpret direction
          <br/>
          o Can do the above without rolling your eyes (mostly)
          <br/>
          o Don't find the notion of a generally fast pace to be disagreeable or concerning
         </p>

          INTERESTED?
         </p>
         <p>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Outside Sales Representative
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       AFCO Distribution
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          AFCO Distribution, a wholesale distribution company based in Spokane Valley, WA serves over 800 retail customers in Washington, Oregon, Idaho, Montana Nevada, Utah, Wyoming, and Alaska. The company distributes over 7,000 products including animal feed, garden and nursery supplies, wildlife products, pet food and supplies, fencing and livestock equipment. Customers receive weekly orders within our routed territories. Delivery is provided by a fleet of company trucks from the companys distribution center warehouse. The employees of AFCO Distribution take great pride in offering excellent products at competitive prices with our benchmark customer service.
          <br/>
          AFCO Distribution is in search of a dynamic Outside Sales Representatives to coordinate all aspects of selling the companys products and services on a business to business scale. Sales area includes Western Washington (Seattle and surrounding areas).
         </p>
         <p>
          The position will focus on coordinating the efforts of all staff to developing a highly effective supply chain focused on customer satisfaction and brand image. The Outside Sales Representative will possess a high level of initiative, discretion and independent judgment, with a can-do attitude and the ability to multi-task. The ideal candidate will also be one who can see things that need to be done and figure out a way to do them effectively and efficiently.
         </p>
         <p>
          RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Identify, target and generate business to business (B2B) sales leads to meet specified sales goals
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct sales presentations and accurately measure and price products
          </li>
          <li>
           Cold call and prospect new sales opportunities
          </li>
          <li>
           Understand and communicate information regarding company products, services and policies and procedures to new and existing clients in a timely manner
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend and participate in strategic sales meetings and training sessions
          </li>
          <li>
           Continually gather information on local competition and prevalent industry and business climate with the region; communicate information to management and others as needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Identify market trends and competitive rate actions, and communicate those trends to management
          </li>
          <li>
           Exercise discretion and independent judgment by developing, engaging and maintaining a short and long-term forecast and sales plan
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all required client paperwork is complete, accurate and submitted on time
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide timely and accurate reports as required
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide a high level of relationship-based customer service to new and existing customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Safely deliver merchandise to customer locations
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for other duties including, but not limited to: sales presentations, writing sales proposing, implementation, creating and adding to existing marketing materials, and other assignments as directed by management
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          JOB REQUIREMENTS
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school diploma (or equivalent), or any combination of education, training, or experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities with an emphasis on correctly calculating figures and amounts
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Familiar with business reports and retail math.
          </li>
          <li>
           Solid forecasting, organizational and planning skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to understand and create reports from sales data, showing financial and mathematical analysis that will enhance business making decisions
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess a valid drivers license and have a clear driving record
          </li>
          <li>
           Must pass background check and pre-employment drug screen as a condition of employment
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to travel. Must have own reliable transportation and proof of insurance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing with co-workers and customers
          </li>
          <li>
           Commitment to excellence and high standards especially in regard to customer service
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift, carry and load 60 pound (minimum) weight requirements
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency with Windows operating system and Microsoft Office
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven track record of being dependable and reliable.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           One to three years of related professional experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, retail merchandising or equivalent combination of experience and training that provides the required knowledge and skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Exhibit a high level of product knowledge in one or more of the following areas: feed, seed, pet food &amp; supplies, hardware, fencing, animal health, tack, clothing &amp; footwear, lawn &amp; garden or wild bird supplies
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of Epicor retail software (formerly Activant/Eagle) and Compass Analytics software
          </li>
          <li>
           Helpful and cheerful attitude important
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate a willingness to work long hours and/or weekends
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          HOURS / DAYS / SCHEDULE
          <br/>
          This is a full time, 40+ hours per week position (typically Monday  Friday). Qualified applicants must be available to work evenings and/or weekends as needed.
         </p>
         <p>
          SALARY / WAGE / BENEFITS
          <br/>
          A salary will be discussed during the interview process. The company offers medical, dental and life &amp; long term disability benefits to full time employees. Employees may also participate in the companys 401(k) plan after meeting eligibility requirements
         </p>
         <p>
          TO APPLY
          <br/>
          Applications for Employment can be obtained from www.afcodistribution.com and submitted by mail, email or fax. Resumes are appreciated as an accompaniment to official applications for employment. Visit the careers section at www.afcodistribution.com for a full job description and details on how to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           B2B Sales: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

         </p>

          </li>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0r95k9bqilc3j" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

    </td>

  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Shipyard Tech/Electrician Helper
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       United States Seafoods
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           *******APPLICATIONS AT www.UnitedStatesSeafoods.com ONLY********
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           POSITION SUMMARY
          </b>
          <b>
           :
          </b>
          The Shipyard Tech/Electrician Helper will report the Shipyard IT Supervisor and/or Shipyard Electrician. Employee will be responsible for helping with the installation and repair of cable and wire, the installation and connection of lighting and electrical equipment. Employee will utilize hand and power tools along with blue prints, drawings and schematics. Work will be performed at a shipyard and/or aboard various vessels.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
          </b>
          <b>
           :
          </b>
          This list is not intended to detail all aspects of the assigned work but is representative of the jobs overall responsibilities.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Complies with all craft and shipyard safety and environmental measures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proper care and safe use of hand and power tools.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicates effectively, work independently or in a group.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to do basic math, i.e. add, subtract, divide and multiply.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read, write, speak, and comprehend English
          </li>
          <li>
           Fabrication and installation of packing tubes, multiple cable transits, collars, conduit, and raceways
          </li>
          <li>
           Trace out short circuits in wiring, using test meter.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strip insulation from wire ends, using wire stripping pliers, and attach wires to terminals for subsequent soldering
          </li>
          <li>
           Examine electrical units for loose connections and broken insulation and tighten connections, using hand tools.
          </li>
          <li>
           Bolt component parts together to form tower assemblies, using hand tools.
          </li>
          <li>
           Raise, lower, or position equipment, tools, and materials, using hoist, hand line, or block and tackle.
          </li>
          <li>
           Paint a variety of objects related to electrical functions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform semi-skilled and unskilled laboring duties related to the installation, maintenance and repair of a wide variety of electrical systems and equipment
          </li>
          <li>
           Disassemble defective electrical equipment, replace defective or worn parts, and reassemble equipment, using hand tools
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES
          </b>
          <b>
           :
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Should be available to work 10-hour days and weekends when necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to exercise sound judgment, work well independently, prioritize duties and follow through tasks to completion
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to handle competing priorities and deadlines effectively and respond well to last minute, high priority, and time sensitive projects
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to handle the pressure of constant interruptions and distractions
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
          </b>
          <b>
           :
          </b>
          High School Diploma or GED certificate is required.
          <br/>
          Minimum two (2) years of increasingly responsible experience in a tech role. Industrial or manufacturing background is preferred. Experience in the marine or shipyard industry is a HUGE plus.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           PHYSICAL DEMANDS
          </b>
          <b>
           :
          </b>
          Work is conducted outdoors frequently exposed to prevailing weather conditions. Work indoor or aboard vessel which may have fumes, chemicals and heat as well as noise and dust present depending upon the location of work. Other exposures may be exposed to vibrations, smoke, acids, degreasing cleaners, fumes dust, solvents, oil, grease and confined spaces. Safety equipment required. Must wear welding helmet and hard hat, clothing with no holes, eye protection, and respirator and hearing protection. He/she must be able to walk to and from job sites. The individual must be able to frequently climb inclined stairways and vertical ladders and lift up to 40 pounds. The individual may be required to work more than 10-hour shifts and weekend work. Must be able to work at heights exceeding 20 ft and have the ability to work overhead for prolonged periods of time. Must possess the ability to work in confined spaces for prolonged periods.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           WORK ENVIRONMENT
          </b>
          <b>
           :
          </b>
          While in work areas the person will be exposed to all weather conditions, noise, dusts and odors. Work aboard the vessels can be strenuous and sometimes hazardous. Dynamic, fast-paced outdoor setting with moderate to loud noise levels from production activity in the shipyard.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           EEO Policy
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Company's equal employment opportunity policy prohibits unlawful discrimination with respect to race, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, age, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, veteran or other status protected by applicable law.
          <br/>
          <b>
           EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability
          </b>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Tech or Electrical work experience: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school or equivalent
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_9fccc22a6290d03d">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">

     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Pay commensurate with experience. Will pay top dollar for the right candidates.
         </p>
         <p>
          Responsibilities include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Analysis and repair of tools to address quality and production concerns, as assigned
          </li>
          <li>
           Manufacture spare components and perform die maintenance of tool to standards set out in electronically-maintained tool timing records and tool designs
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete electronic record of tool maintenance performed by part and job number
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop preventive and predictive tool maintenance schedules based upon analysis of tool performance to achieve improved production volumes
          </li>
          <li>
           Review last piece inspection records and make necessary improvements
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure documentation and records are maintained.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Completion of 2 years of apprenticeship in Tool &amp; Die Making or equivalent work experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Will have knowledge of tool and die manufacturing methods, techniques, and related machining equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of English and Metric Systems of measurement.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to read and interpret drawings and specifications.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to manage multiple tasks and priorities and easily adapt to changing situations.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          At Precision Resource, your ideas are encouraged and your contributions valued, recognized and rewarded. We understand that our employees work hard, so you will receive a competitive, annual performance bonus and a generous benefits package. When you join our family, you align yourself with one of the largest and most innovative leaders in fineblanking technology.
         </p>
         <p>
          Additional benefits include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Medical, dental and vision insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           401(k) retirement plan with corporate match and annual profit-sharing contribution
          </li>
          <li>
           Life insurance and Supplemental Life/Dependent Life Insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Short and Long-term disability insurance
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid time-off
          </li>
          <li>
           Section 125 flexible spending accounts
          </li>
          <li>
           Applicants will be required to provide/own basic tools.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Precision Resource is a leading global supplier of precision metal components and assemblies using fineblank technology. Our eight North American divisions serve a global customer base with a commitment to continuous improvement. For over 50 years we have provided solutions to quality, cost and production challenges for market-leading customers in the automotive, heavy duty and off-highway vehicles, tools and hardware, electronics and cutlery.
         </p>
         <p>
          Precision Resource, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer. Women, minorities, veterans, and disabled persons are encouraged to apply.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Work Authorization:
          </b>
          We will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future are not eligible for hire.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Tool and Die: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_a89a10ba7efe1cc4">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">

       <font size="+1">
        Assistant Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       White House Black Market
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Rosemont, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Assistant Store Manager is primarily responsible for supporting the Store Manager in managing the sales, operations, asset protection, and human resources functions of the store to ensure a great customer experience and maximum profitability.
          <br/>
          FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Supervises associates engaged in sales, inventory receipt, reconciling cash receipts, or in performing services for customers. Prepares weekly schedules to ensure proper floor coverage within fiscal guidelines; reviews time sheets and other payroll documentation for accuracy and submits as appropriate. 2. Promotes customer service by ensuring associates are greeting and assisting customers; responds to customer inquiries and complaints in a professional and timely manner. 3. Models sales expectations by utilizing various techniques and communicating product knowledge to the customer; recommends merchandise selections or helps to locate or obtain merchandise based on customer needs and desires.4. Maintains a visually appealing store, ensuring proper housekeeping, visual merchandising, and organization are kept to the highest standard. Trains associates on visual merchandising techniques to ensure store is maintained at all times.5. Monitors associate sales activities and productivity; acknowledges and communicates performance to associates; motivates and trains associates to achieve full potential. 6. Performs all financial activities effectively and in accordance with policy including cash handling and reporting, price changes, and merchandise handling; ensures all register transactions are completed accurately and in accordance with policy. 7. Administers all operational processes including inventory receipt/dispatch, daily replenishment of floor merchandise levels, and execution and preparation of physical inventories.8. Facilitates and/or manages the general operations of the store ensuring that the store is in working order and adequately maintained to ensure safe and efficient operations. 9. Supports compliance with all applicable laws, loss prevention policies, operating procedures and controls; conducts associate training as needed to reinforce proper controls. 10. Assists in the recruiting, hiring, and development of store associates; interprets Key Performance Indicator reports and delivers coaching as needed; provides feedback to Store Manager for associate performance appraisals and evaluations.11. Other duties as assigned/required.
          <br/>
          QUALIFICATIONS: 1. High School diploma or equivalent2. Prior retail or sales management experience preferred3. Excellent communication, verbal, and written skills4. Proven excellent customer service skills with statistical track record in all areas of sales5. Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment6. Strong leadership qualities, training and team building skills 7. Knowledge of administrative aspects of store operations8. Communicate with customers, standing and maneuvering around sales floor and stockroom, operate register, lift and carry 30 pounds, hang/fold merchandise, climbing, reaching, pushing / pulling9. Regular attendance is essential to this position in order to ensure adequate coverage to meet company objectives. Ability to work a flexible work schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays is required.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Sales Managment: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
