       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Salvation Army Adult Rehabilitation Center (ARC)
          <br/>
          (For Alcohol and Chemical Dependency)
          <br/>
          Seattle, WA
         </p>
         <p>
          POSITION AVAILABLE: Production Manager
          <br/>
          STATUS: Exempt, Full Time
          <br/>
          REPORTS TO: Administrator
         </p>
         <p>
          THE SALVATION ARMY MISSION STATEMENT:
          <br/>
          The Salvation Army, an international movement, is an evangelical part of the universal Christian Church. Its message is based on the Bible. Its ministry is motivated by the love of God. Its mission is to preach the Gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Production Manager position is directly responsible for the overall production department functions to include oversight of donations recruitment, transporting of all donation materials, processing of donated materials, shipment of donated materials to stores, property and equipment management. Specific supervision of the Transportation Supervisor, all warehouse supervisors and all maintenance personnel.
         </p>
         <p>
          POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA/BS in Business or equivalent in business and/or
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum of five years basic light industrial processing, transportation, and operations experience or
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum five years supervisory experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent people skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to multi-task and handle deadlines
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be self-motivated, able to work with a minimum of supervision, adaptable and able to handle confidential matters
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Programs (Word, Excel, Power Point)
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read, understand and analyze financial reports
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to travel as necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid Drivers License
          </li>
          <li>
           Must pass a criminal background check
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          DUTIES:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Recruit and train adequate staff for each production operation
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare annual staffing and payroll budgets
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage all warehouse supervisors
          </li>
          <li>
           Coaching, discipline, goal-setting and performance review of employees
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure that each shop and department operates per Salvation Army standards and in a manner to be as financially successful as possible
          </li>
          <li>
           Regularly inspect the physical plant and its related equipment. Follow up to make sure all deficiencies are brought up to standard in a timely fashion
          </li>
          <li>
           Regularly test all equipment in warehouse to insure proper operation and safety measures. This includes conveyer systems, compressors, balers, pricing equipment, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform regular inspections of each processing operation and follow up with any irregularities. This includes quotas and pricing of all items to go to stores, auction and recycling
          </li>
          <li>
           Test processing operations by opening totes, observing and checking pricing
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure each truck, tractor, trailer operations are per standards
          </li>
          <li>
           Supervise donation operations including donor receipts, donation sites and donor relations
          </li>
          <li>
           Analyze receipt counts and donor routes to insure greatest efficiency
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure loading and unloading equipment is safe and operable
          </li>
          <li>
           Weekly production/retail meetings
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure timely completion of paperwork including store reports, daily deposits, safety reports, timekeeping
          </li>
          <li>
           Preparation and maintenance of various reports and records required by ARC policy and administration
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage beneficiaries work therapy and ensure appropriate behavior and monitor productivity
          </li>
          <li>
           Review monthly actual reports vs. budget and provide analysis for Administrator
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend ARC as-is auctions and stores regularly to insure appropriate disposition of product
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties and responsibilities as may be assigned, from time to time, as related to the position
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to sit, walk, stand, bend , squat, climb, kneel and twist on an intermittent or continuous basis
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to grasp, push, pull objects such as files, file cabinet drawers, clothing and merchandise carts, rolling racks, fixtures, furniture dollies, platform trucks and carts, hand trucks and other miscellaneous equipment
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to operate a wireless phone or radio
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to operate a motor vehicle
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to perform various repetitive motion tasks
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          EOE
          <br/>
          Benefits available
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Warehouse Production: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_b0451e4f4d07c813">

         </div>
        </div>
       </td>

Through our investment banking, ESOP advisory and valuation services, we maintain a nationally recognized level of expertise through deep transaction experience, proactive thought leadership and ongoing market research.            Job Description
          </b>
          <br/>
          Due to our continued growth, we are currently seeking a Business Development &amp; Research Coordinator to assist our business development efforts with targeting industries and developing leads. The research will also produce marketing opportunities such as industry conferences, associations or similar business development activities. To help business development professionals improve their productivity and spend more time selling, the Business Development &amp; Research Coordinator will provide a variety of support services including contacting prospects to gauge interest, arrange appointments and document activities in our CRM database.

          </b>
         </p>

          <br/>
          *Follow-up on warm leads to set-up meetings.
          <br/>
          *Work with marketing manager to develop business development tools as a result of the research findings.
          <br/>
          *Document all follow-up activities in the firms CRM database, Salesforce.
          <br/>
          *Attend conferences and tradeshows, when necessary.
         </p>

          </b>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          *Strong verbal and written communication skills
          <br/>
          *Work with professionals at all levels of the organization
          <br/>
          *Due to the volume of communication that will be required with the clients, potential clients and referral sources of the firm, the Business Development &amp; Research Coordinator must possess excellent customer service skills
          <br/>
          *Detail oriented and well organized
          <br/>
          *Ability to travel to firm tradeshows, conference and events, when needed
          <br/>
          *The ability to work both as part of a team and independently
          <br/>
          *The ability to handle multiple projects and to adjust to schedule changes
          <br/>
          *Ability to thrive in a small company environment
          <br/>
          *Strong work ethic and personal integrity
          <br/>
          *All applicants must be U.S. citizens or authorized green card holders

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Apex Fun Run
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Apex Fun Run is a leadership and fitness program for elementary schools. It is taught by athletes who love investing in students and making a difference in their lives. We serve as a fundraiser for our schools by also facilitating a funrun.
          <br/>
          www.apexfunrun.com
          <br/>
          TEAM MEMBER- OverviewAs an Apex Team Member you will lead and support a team, going into elementary schools for a 2-week period to inspire kids through key leadership lessons and facilitate a Fun Run. The program is a leadership-driven and fitness promoting fundraiser which includes: teacher huddles, pep rallies, class lessons, prize delivery, Fun Run day, recap and collections.
          <br/>
          RESPONSIBILITIES:  * Support and inspire the Apex Team by guiding and training them to be excellent * Set up and manage all aspects of the program in the schools you are assigned * Trouble shoot daily challenges at the school with School Staff and Parents * Teach Leadership Lessons and interact with students during lunch, recess and PE * Manage inventory and items needed for successful program * Manage the pledge process and collections process * Report weekly progress to owner
          <br/>
          MUST-HAVES:  * Ability and desire to LEAD others * Attention to Detail * Amazing relationship skills * Strong Character and Integrity * Ability to connect with kids
          <br/>
          QUALIFICATIONS: You were born to leadYou have always been a take charge type of person. You like to make things happen! You recognize the importance of delegation, yet you never ask anyone to do something you wouldn't be willing to do yourself. You can assess a situation and quickly determine what is needed to make it better or more effective. You act swiftly. You put others first. You love to see others achieve success.
          <br/>
          You get things doneYou are half human, half machine. You follow through on every task, no matter how big or small. You don't like to let people down and you understand the importance of staying on schedule. You juggle tasks better than a circus clown juggles balls. People easily follow your lead because they admire how hard you work.
          <br/>
          You communicateYou keep everyone in the know so that the job gets done efficiently and effectively. You recognize people gifts and praise them for them. You don't avoid difficult conversations. You say yes when you can and no when it's necessary. You mean what you say, say what you mean, but never say it mean. You're known for your fun professionalism.
          <br/>
          You are the most reliable person you knowWhen you say you are going to do something, you mean it. When you say you are going to be somewhere, you're there.
          <br/>
          You have a passion for lifeYou have a genuine enthusiasm that is contagious. You are a breath of fresh air to everyone you meet. People see something different in you than the average person. . . and they love it!
          <br/>
          You are resourcefulProblem solving is like a hobby for you. You are strategic. You don't just think outside of the box, you live outside of the box. When faced with a problem, you think about it from all angles and understand the importance of perspective. You like more having more than one solution. You don't look for problems but you are always looking for new ways to streamline processes and increase efficiency. Proactive is your middle name.
         </p>
         <p>
          DETAILS:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           This opportunity is located in varying areas between Seattle/Tacoma/Snohomish
          </li>
          <li>
           The timeframe of this job is September 2015 -- June 2016
          </li>
          <li>
           The job offers time off in the summers and holidays off
          </li>
          <li>
           Requires some travel
          </li>
          <li>
           Compensation -- DOE -- Discussed upon interview
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

Minimum Job Requirement:  * Experience in one or more of the following fields: remodeling design, remodeling sales or remodeling project management, or sales. The Sales/Design position plays the primary, customer-facing role in developing, closing and managing kitchen/bath and home improvement/remodeling project sales. The Sales/Design person will work independently to guide customers through a process of selecting material -- in stone and porcelain tiles and natural stone slabs-- and in most cases oversee the entire project through installation. The purpose of this position is to improve the clients experience through their home improvement journey and to make it an easy procedure. The Sales/Design will be engaged with customers during the entire project cycle (from lead generation to post project follow-up) and drive project decisions to ensure customer expectations are met. The Sales/Design will positively impact kitchen and bath project sales volume, project completion, and customer satisfaction by doing the following:  * Building relationships with customers and proactively communicating throughout the project  * Interviewing customers and performing detailed site inspections to collect project specifications and develop comprehensive Kitchen and Bath plans &amp; quotes  * Actively managing the sales cycle to close leads

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0e20qpbqmk83l" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Direct Care Worker
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Omelagah, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Daly City, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $13 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Title:
          </b>
          Direct Care Worker
          <br/>
          <b>
           Department:
          </b>
          Supported Living Services (SLS)
          <br/>
          <b>
           Reports to:
          </b>
          Program Supervisor
          <br/>
          <b>
           Work Location(s):
          </b>
          Daly City, CA
          <br/>
          <b>
           Shift:
          </b>
          Weekday and weekend positions available
          <br/>
          <b>
           Compensation:
          </b>
          $13.00 per hour
          <br/>
          <b>
           Employment Status:
          </b>
          Full-Time Positions available
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Summary
          </b>
          <br/>
          Under direction from the Program Supervisor, the Direct Care Worker provides support services to individuals with developmental disabilities in a supported living setting. The Direct Care Worker provides training, assistance and support services to clients in a manner that ensures their health, safety and successful achievement of service objectives outlined in their Individual Service Plan (ISP). This role requires a high level of cleanliness and strong domestic skills (such as being able to cook healthy meals, and helping purchase healthy food). Other key responsibilities include all of the following: help with medical appointments, help implementing an exercise program, hygiene assistance, recreation, and medication monitoring.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for people who enjoy working with people with disabilities, are interested in teaching and encouraging healthy eating and a positive lifestyle. Candidates availability and flexibility to work when needed is a plus. We are also looking for someone interested in working with people with challenging maladaptive behaviors.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provide adaptive skills training to clients in areas of daily living, including, but not limited to following activities: shopping, budgeting, safety awareness, community access, positive relationship building, physical fitness, positive recreation, conflict resolution, anger management, coping skills, resisting peer pressure and maintaining a clean and healthy living environment;
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide supervision and redirection to prevent the manifestation of maladaptive behaviors that may lead to recidivism;
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsibility for the health and safety of assigned client;
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain client confidentiality. Follow reporting procedures regarding denial of rights and special incident reports;
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate with other staff regarding any changes in regulations, policies and procedures and general information pertaining to the program;
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist client with coordination of medical services, nutrition, personal hygienic and meal preparations. Coordination of clients personal hygiene needs may require exposure to bodily fluids (feces, urine, blood etc.);
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist client with household management needs including but not limited to the following: regular upkeep and maintenance, paying bills, developing schedules and routines, record keeping, and documentation;
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor client progress towards Individual Service Plan (ISP) objectives by maintaining and submitting weekly progress notes;
          </li>
          <li>
           Facilitate the full inclusion of individuals with disabilities in the recreation, volunteer, and employments sites of their choosing;
          </li>
          <li>
           Create and use natural supports and support client in a person centered manner;
          </li>
          <li>
           Teach community awareness to clients while they access their community via public transportation and travel training;
          </li>
          <li>
           Promote full engagement of each client in each activity;
          </li>
          <li>
           Recognize unusual or threatening conditions related to persons with disabilities and resolve issues if necessary;
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend required training and staff meetings;
          </li>
          <li>
           Adhere to and all Omelagah, Inc. policies, procedures and program rules;
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned;
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Minimum Job Qualification
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must pass fingerprint background check (Child Abuse Index, Criminal Record Clearance);
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be 18 years of age;
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess a valid California state drivers license;
          </li>
          <li>
           Recent, clean TB test and health screening (within one year);
          </li>
          <li>
           First Aid/CPR certification required (within 2 weeks);
          </li>
          <li>
           Clean DMV printout and proof of auto insurance;
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently and display good independent judgment;
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong time management skills, patient and detailed oriented;
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to utilize critical thinking skills in decision-making situations;
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent oral communication skills;
          </li>
          <li>
           Fluent report writing skills;
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with clients, parents, social workers, fellow workers, and others in a positive and constructive manner;
          </li>
          <li>
           Willingness to work flexible hours including nights and weekends to meet client needs;
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits Available to Employees:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Paid time off
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid company holidays
          </li>
          <li>
           Health insurance for medical and vision coverage and dental coverage
          </li>
          <li>
           Recognition and incentive programs
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           About the Company:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Omelagah, Inc. is a family-owned community-based organization that provides support services to individuals with developmental disabilities. Our mission is to support individuals with developmental disabilities with a history of forensic involvement or individuals who may be at risk of involvement with the criminal justice system, live productive law abiding lives in the least restrictive community setting. We are passionate in our belief that people with developmental disabilities deserve the right to live and thrive in the least restrictive community setting. We strive to improve the lives of the people we support and the communities they live in, through the implementation of structured community-based programs. We achieve our mission through the following services: Supported Living Services (SLS), Residential Services and Adaptive Skills Training. For more information, please visit us at www.omelagah.com
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $13.00 /hour
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_003a29351e7f0494">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0t4g11bqekatl" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Canvasser - Field Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       The Fund for the Public Interest
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Manhattan, NY
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $13 - $15 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          JOB DESCRIPTION:
          <br/>
          Were looking for people who work hard, communicate well and are committed to positive social change. Depending on where you work the hours of the job are from 1:45pm to 10pm Monday thru Friday, or 9am to 5pm Tuesday thru Saturday. Many of our staff also participate in campaign projects and attend workshops and trainings.
         </p>
         <p>
          The heart of the job is canvassing neighborhoods. That means were either going door-to-door or out to busy public places to talk with as many people as possible about the campaign. We identify people who support the issue and get them involved. Every day, each one of our staff talk to about forty people, sign up five new members and raise between $150-$250 for the campaign. Additionally, we do petitioning, media work, and coalition building, which also helps us win the campaign.
         </p>
         <p>
          PAY: Therefore, the average hourly wage is $9-$15/hr and the typical weekly pay is about $400-$600. can also earn more if you are in a leadership position.
         </p>
         <p>
          TRAINING:
          <br/>
          Canvassing is pretty basic, and you get better and better at it as you improve your skills and learn more about the issues. Training starts the first day, and it continues throughout your time on staff. Before you start on staff, there will be an observation day where you shadow one of our trainers to learn the basic skills. After that youll be able to attend workshops on canvassing, campaign and leadership skills, go to regional events and trainings, and have weekly meetings with the directors.
         </p>
         <p>
          LEADERSHIP:
          <br/>
          We offer the best candidates the opportunity to be a Field Manager in Training. Field Managers are some of the most important people for the campaign. In addition to canvassing each day, the Field Manager is responsible for motivating staff to hit goals in a particular town or site. They train most of the staff and take part in weekly staff meetings. They are the leadership team and play an even larger role in having an impact on these issues. These positions involve more hours and more responsibility. Field Managers can earn more in their pay or anywhere from $13-$15/hr.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you are graduating this year, or have already graduated, we also have career opportunities all across the country running these types of campaigns. Youll run one of our canvass offices, recruiting and hiring your staff, training and managing them to win our campaigns, and handling the day-to-day operation of a campaign. Please let me know if you are interested in doing this type of work long-term
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_2265ad2bdb030d68">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>

 </body>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Country Doctor Community Health Centers
          </b>
          <br/>
          Country Doctor Community Health Centers (CDCHC) is a non-profit organization, whose primary goal is to provide high quality, caring, culturally appropriate primary health care that addresses the needs of people regardless of their ability to pay. CDCHC providers, support staff and administrative employees are committed to providing a caring environment that respects our patients dignity, while acting both as the patients individual health advocate and as their advocate with the community at large to ensure that they receive the health care services they need. CDCHCs employees enjoy a collegial environment where they are encouraged to learn and grow. As an employee of Country Doctor, you will work with other dedicated, dynamic individuals who share your commitment to the health of our communities.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT
          </b>
          WWW.COUNTRYDOCTOR.ORG
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           TO APPLY: SUBMIT COVER LETTER WITH POSITION TITLE AND RESUME
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Description
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Hours: Thursdays &amp; Fridays 5:30 pm to 10:00 pm
          </b>
          <br/>
          *
          <b>
           Saturdays 11:30 am to 10:00 pm
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           *
          </b>
         </p>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Hand out patient registration form to new patients and making sure that patients have a current signed registration form every year
          </li>
          <li>
           Setting up alerts when current registration form is received and or financial agreement
          </li>
          <li>
           Verifying insurance information and set up new insurance as necessary
          </li>
          <li>
           Collection of co-payments, minimum fee and outstanding balances
          </li>
          <li>
           Remove alert codes when they become invalid
          </li>
          <li>
           Sliding Fee Scale verification and update when needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Post all in-person patient payments in NextGen
          </li>
          <li>
           Daily reconcile payments to the NextGen generated report
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedule appointments as needed for our established patients
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in staff evaluation process and staff meetings as requested
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform special projects as assigned
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

         <p>
          <b>
           Company Overview:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Cortland Capital Markets Services is a full-service investment servicing company that offers loan servicing, asset-servicing, fund administration and analytics. Headquartered in Chicago with offices in Indianapolis, London, Los Angeles, and New York, Cortland provides analytical, accounting, and administrative services to alternative investment managers and commercial lenders. Financial Markets covered include business loans, real estate, syndicated bank loans, structured product, derivatives, futures, commodities and global equities.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Description:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Credit and Special Asset Services team offers credit and collateral documentation audits and reviews, financial analysis, statement spreading, ratio and trend analysis, compliance testing and credit due diligence in support of client underwriting to banks and credit unions.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Financial statement spreading, analysis and interpretation using industry standard software programs and Excel spreadsheets including personal, corporate, Sub S, and partnership tax returns, as well as internally prepared financial statements, audited statements and financial reports (A/R Agings, borrowing base certificates, etc.). Understands the concept of and is able to prepare cash flow and debt service spreadsheet.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare and write complete, succinct, and insightful Credit Reviews as required by our clients. Written Credit Reviews (similar to a Loan Presentation Package at a commercial lending institution) are performed on behalf of our clients on commercial credits including C&amp;I, Commercial Real Estate, and Government Guaranteed Loans (SBA 7A/ 504, USDA).
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform Loan Documentation and Collateral reviews and understand various commercial loan documents; maintain understanding of the following: perfection of security interests in real and personal property; reviewing and filing UCC statements; ordering and analyzing public record and asset searches, appraisals, credit reports and environmental reports.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Desired Experience, Education &amp; Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors degree in finance, accounting, or economics. Must understanding financial statements and ratios.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work experience in underwriting, commercial lending or formal credit training a plus.
          </li>
          <li>
           Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; ability to collaborate with internal and external parties.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and outstanding attention-to-detail and data accuracy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Commitment to a client-focused, professional, proactive, solutions-oriented approach in all manners.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to work independently and display organization and project management skills to meet weekly credit review workload deadlines in a quality manner; yet be adaptable to changing priorities.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           financial statements, underwriting, commercial lending: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's
          </li>
         </ul>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u10k24cb97ncn0" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          NNE Group is a conference company that seeks a Marketing Manager, who is responsible for the planning, preparation and execution of targeted marketing initiatives. Position requires working with senior management and other marketing staff to identify sales strategy and goals, working with multiple internal groups to ensure that all deliverables are produced on a timely basis, and take steps to measure, enhance and enrich the position of the company within the target audience. The Marketing Manager is also responsible for reporting on results as requested and required by senior management. Teamwork, schedule management and timely and effective communication with development, creative and production staff, as well as attention to detail and deadlines are critical aspects of this positions responsibilities.
         </p>
         <p>
          RESPONSIBILITIES
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Work closely with management and peer teams to initiate all branding and marketing programs and strategies
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare yearly marketing plan alongside other company executives and staff and present to senior management
          </li>
          <li>
           Execute marketing campaigns, including direct marketing, email marketing and promotional marketing
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively communicate content and strategy to internal and external clients, including telesales staff and management
          </li>
          <li>
           Evaluate and analyze market trends and recommend changes to marketing and business development strategies based on analysis and feedback
          </li>
          <li>
           Research additional marketing offerings and present to senior management
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate with various media organizations to initiate and enter into advertising barter agreements and/or commit advertising budget dollars
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in budgeting process, and adhere to budgets in marketing execution
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend appropriate meetings to understand business needs and execute on those needs
          </li>
          <li>
           Update and maintain marketing reporting accurately on a periodic basis and assist in analyzing and communicating to team
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist in analyzing database results and reporting back to various internal parties to further enhance, evolve and improve database marketing efforts
          </li>
          <li>
           Create and execute weekly email segmentation
          </li>
          <li>
           Research and execute new database marketing initiatives in conjunction with marketing team
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain archive of regular database marketing activities
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain CRM calendar and regularly communicate the schedule out to telesales team
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Effective time management and project management skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to prioritize responsibilities in line with business objectives
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong organization skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to assist in creation of and maintain timelines
          </li>
          <li>
           Work and execute within said timelines
          </li>
          <li>
           Self-starter and great communicator
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to understand marketing data, interprets reports and develops, implement or revise the goals in line with report results
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent attention to detail and quality assurance capabilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Team player with excellent relationshipbuilding skills
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors Degree from a four year college or equivalent
          </li>
          <li>
           Four to six years marketing experience (direct or database marketing experience preferred), a significant portion of which includes conference or event marketing experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in direct mail, web marketing and email marketing and strong knowledge of database programs is preferred
          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          </b>
          <br/>

Our team will help you develop new skills and channel your energy into amazing results, exciting experiences and great rewards and success.           </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           401K retirement planning (after 6 months)
          </li>
          <li>
           Total rewards package including high quality training, Verizon Wireless phone service discount, limitless advancement and transfer between multiple locations
          </li>
          <li>
           4G Wireless is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce M/F/D/V
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Looking for a career which provides professional and personal growth? Are you ready to work with the latest technology on the market? Are you an outgoing person with high energy loves to help people? Can you increase sales and profitability while working within a dynamic and highly motivated sales team? If so, your new Career is calling you!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Summary:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          The Sales Store Manager role is responsible for meeting or exceeding the monthly sales generation goals assigned to his/her store by actively managing his/her stores sales staff and personally driving sales. The Store Manager role also ensures that all operational and procedural objectives of the store are met, coordinates the safety and security of its employees and products, participates in the the hiring training and development of his/her team, and ensures location sales objectives are attained.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Recruits, trains, coaches and develops sales staff on all aspects of sales for 4G Wireless, including, but not limited to, sales techniques, products, promotions, and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Actively manages and motivates sales team on a daily basis to ensure 4G sales quotas are being met or exceeded.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides effective performance feedback to all staff and sets timeframe for achievement.
          </li>
          <li>
           Consistently finds ways to increase employee and location productivity, DRIVES sales.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains appropriate level of staffing at location by recruiting, selecting, orienting and training employees.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures availability of merchandise by maintaining inventory levels.
          </li>
          <li>
           Markets merchandise by adhering to advertising, sales promotion, and display plans.
          </li>
          <li>
           Secures merchandise and protects employees by adhering to security standards.
          </li>
          <li>
           Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Handles scheduling of staff at location to ensure appropriate shift coverage.
          </li>
          <li>
           Handles all escalated customer service issues with professionalism.
          </li>
          <li>
           Executes daily operational procedures with efficiency, diligence, and integrity.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicates, executes, and enforces 4G policies and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           This is not an exhaustive list of duties or functions and may not necessarily comprise all of the "essential functions" for purposes of the ADA.
          </b>
         </p>

          <b>

          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to create sales momentum.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proven ability to work well in a team environment and ability to lead by example.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent interpersonal skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates commitment to excellent customer service.
          </li>
          <li>
           Basic interview skills and enhanced staffing knowledge.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Looking for a fulfilling position in early childhood education? Our Fremont campuses are seeking a full time Assistant Teachers for our Toddler and Preschool Programs. The Assistant Teacher is responsible for aiding in the supervision of an assigned group of children, following the philosophy and standards of the school in conjunction with the Montessori Philosophies and Early Childhood Programs. Responsibilities include assisting with planning activities, supervising children, ensuring children's safety and managing classroom environments. The position of the Assistant Teacher requires the person to be flexible and cooperative since the Assistant teacher will not be assigned to a permanent classroom or job duty. The Assistant teacher will also have to be flexible and be willing to work in other classrooms, kitchen, and front desk.
         </p>
         <p>
          Educational and Training Requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must be 18 years or older.
          </li>
          <li>
           1-2 years of Center experience required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must work towards completing 12 semester units of Early Childhood Education.
          </li>
          <li>
           Live Scan fingerprints and a valid driver's license.
          </li>
          <li>
           Current TB test.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be currently authorized to work in the United States.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide previous Employer References.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Our schools offer Exceptional Benefits including; Paid Time Off, Paid Sick Leave, Paid Holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401K, Childcare Discount, Comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, College Tuition Benefits Rewards Program, International Dental Travel Program, Orthodontics Program.
         </p>
         <p>
          Interested candidates please email resume and salary requirements to the email address listed on this posting.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are a proud EOE and committed to maintaining a work and learning environment free from discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, pregnancy, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital/civil union status, ancestry, place of birth, age, citizenship status, veteran status, political affiliation, genetic information or disability, as defined and required by state and federal laws. Additionally, we prohibit retaliation against individuals who oppose such discrimination and harassment or who participate in an equal opportunity investigation.
         </p>
         <p>
          For More Information Visit Us At: http://www.LearnAndPlayMontessori.com
         </p>

           Job Duties:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Ascertains automotive problems and services by listening to customer's description of symptoms; clarifying description of problems; conducting inspections; taking test drives; checking vehicle maintenance records; examining service schedules.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Verifies warranty and service contract coverage by examining records and papers; explaining provisions and exclusions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develops estimates by costing materials, supplies, and labor; calculating customer's payment, including deductibles.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepares repair orders (RO) by describing symptoms, problems, and causes discovered, as well as repairs and services required; obtaining approval signatures; entering RO into service database system.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains customer rapport by explaining estimates and expected return of vehicle; obtaining customer's approval of estimates; obtaining and providing contact telephone numbers; answering questions and concerns; arranging towing and temporary transportation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains automotive records by recording problems and corrective actions planned.
          </li>
          <li>
           Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading manufacturers' publications.
          </li>
          <li>
           Enhances organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
          </li>

Job duties are performed in our team-oriented 6 bed residential care homes in Fremont, at a 1:3 staff-to-client ratio. Duties include support with cooking, cleaning, bathing, personal hygiene, community integration, socialization, dispensing medication, assistance with transferring to/from wheelchair. Monthly mandatory in-service trainings meet on-going educational requirements for CNA's and LVN's.

          <br/>

Our customers include leading Northwest and Fortune 500 companies such as Boeing, United Rentals, Genie/Terex, Sunbelt Rentals, John Deere Remarketing, Pape Machinery, City of Seattle, and many others. As featured in Entrepreneur Magazines Hot Business category, bidadoo is rapidly expanding to meet the tremendous growth in our online equipment sales and global customer base.
          <br/>
          bidadoo has a new full-time opening for an accounting professional. In this role you will work with the accounting and finance department on a variety of accounting, bookkeeping, reconciliation, customer/vendor support, auction/sale management, office management and financial systems functions. Responsibilities include QuickBooks Enterprise systems support, accounts payable/payment processing, accounts receivable, filing, customer checkout and pick-up process, customer support  phone and email, reconciliation activities, contract administration, and other general office management projects. We are looking for a team-oriented individual with solid accounting and customer communication abilities to help grow a customer-focused company.

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

         </p>
         <p>
          Our evolving Distribution Center needs a broadminded, motivated leader with an eye for detail and dedicated initiative towards quick product turn-around. Our warehouse is growing from a manual, paper-based management style to fast-paced, electronic management systems using RF guns and advanced warehousing software.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           What you will do in the role:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare and monitor daily/weekly work plans and pace, discussing and implementing modifications as necessary to meet goals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Direct and oversee productivity and processing strategies and employee training and development.
          </li>
          <li>
           Oversee the accurate and efficient movement of product.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work with internal and external departmental leaders to support labor and data needs with exceptional customer service being the primary motivator.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           What Title Nine needs from you:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Be open to rapidly adjusting priorities and motivated to accommodate versatile strategies to respond to such changes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate plans, goals and expectations to team members with the goal of driving engagement and enthusiasm, providing corrective guidance when necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Delegate as well as participate with all levels of departmental tasks when/where necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate effectively through multiple avenues (e-mail, phone, personal interaction) with DC managers and inter-departmentally to update and coordinate efforts towards goals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Team leadership experience (ex., athletic team captaincy and/or work-related project lead)
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer savvy, both with internet and Excel. Powerhouse experience a plus.
          </li>
          <li>
           General warehousing experience is required, familiarity with Shipping and/or Receiving will be useful.
          </li>
          <li>
           Goal completion-driven, but able to maintain sense of humor under pressure.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Basic requirements include:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Be able to lift 40lbs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be able to move around in high and low areas using step ladders and stools.
          </li>
          <li>
           Sit at a desk for extended amounts of time.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be able to push and pull utility carts and pallet jacks.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          As this is a supervisory position, please be prepared to describe previous leadership experiences -- successes AND failures -- and how those experiences will support performance in this position.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Benefits include:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Free access to in-house gym and fitness classes
          </li>
          <li>
           Subsidized gym membership
          </li>
          <li>
           Medical/Dental
          </li>
          <li>
           Long-Term Disability
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid Time off
          </li>
          <li>
           401K with match
          </li>
          <li>
           Screaming employee discounts and pro-deals
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Resumes with cover letters get bonus points! We REALLY do want to know a bit about who you are. So please share something about yourself above and beyond the standard resume fare... a little known fact or a transformative sports/fitness experience or a personal hobby/passion.
         </p>
         <p>
          You can find out more about us at www.titlenine.com.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
        </span>

         </p>

         </p>

          The Customer Service Specialist answers customer inquiries by phone, email, and social media channels. You solve the customers problem quickly and professionally and escalate as necessary.
         </p>

         </p>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated commitment to high quality customer service
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated problem solving skills coupled with the ability to remain solution oriented at all times
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong organizational and time management skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong computer skills
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

   <tr>

    </td>

  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Development Coordinator
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Castilleja School
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Palo Alto, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Castilleja School, a 6-12 independent girls school located in Palo Alto, CA, is embarking on a multi-year capital campaign to enhance facilities and programs. The school is seeking a full-time Development Coordinator to assist in laying the foundation for successfully executing the schools next campaign by providing support to the schools overall fundraising efforts including annual giving and major giving efforts.
         </p>
         <p>
          In collaboration with the Chief Advancement Officer and the Director of Development, the Development Coordinator will help to support every aspect of the schools ambitious fundraising goals including a likely $100M capital campaign. As a part of the multi member development team and 9 member Advancement department, the Development Coordinator will be responsible for several tasks associated with the successful accomplishment and recording of the schools fundraising goals. This would include supporting the strategic planning for the campaign, providing reporting, campaign communications and support with the execution, solicitation and stewardship activities to support the Schools fundraising goals and priorities.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Development Coordinator reports directly to the Director of Development and works closely with the Chief Advancement Officer, Advancement staff, trustees and volunteers to help to identify and record donor and prospect activities and engagement. S/he will track campaign progress and work with the Director of Development to provide timely reports to the Chief Advancement Officer, Head of School, Board of Trustees, and other key leaders and volunteers.
         </p>
         <p>
          The ideal candidate will excel at providing support to the fundraising team and developing relationships with all members of the school community, as well as the greater Silicon Valley community.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Working collaboratively with the Director of Development and Chief Advancement Officer to execute the Schools overall fundraising strategy
          </li>
          <li>
           Serving as a key staff member of the schools upcoming campaign including support for the fundraising team and campaign co-chairs and volunteers
          </li>
          <li>
           Accurate data entry and gift processing in collaboration with the Database Manager
          </li>
          <li>
           Drafting and preparing correspondence and coordinate mailings
          </li>
          <li>
           Preparing development materials for meetings and events
          </li>
          <li>
           Scheduling meetings and provide coordination as needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Prospect research
          </li>
          <li>
           Solicitation of corporate support for fundraising goals
          </li>
          <li>
           Supporting stewardship efforts of annual giving and restricted gifts
          </li>
          <li>
           Helping to support the schools relationship with fundraising counsel including providing information, feedback and research as needed throughout various phases of the campaign
          </li>
          <li>
           Helping to bring the campaign to a successful close by targeted project end date
          </li>
          <li>
           Conducting prospect research and reports to identify prospective donors as well as support to nurture relationships, and secure contributions to the campaign
          </li>
          <li>
           Conceiving and executing Campaign events with the support of Advancement staff
          </li>
          <li>
           Building systems for identifying, tracking, and soliciting funding prospects
          </li>
          <li>
           Working in partnership with the Director of Development to determine strategies for annual giving and other fundraising initiatives so that they reinforce the Campaigns success.
          </li>
          <li>
           Keeping record systems up to date and producing regular reports on the capital campaign, as well as statements for donors
          </li>
          <li>
           Helping to recruit, manage and guide a large group of fundraising volunteers
          </li>
          <li>
           Working as a member of a 9-person Advancement team and supporting the overall success of the schools Advancement efforts
          </li>
          <li>
           Overseeing the Schools planned giving initiatives
          </li>
          <li>
           Assuming special projects at the direction of the Chief Advancement Officer
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Key Qualifications
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Possess a minimum of a bachelors degree.
          </li>
          <li>
           A minimum of 3 years of experience in development
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong track record of success in supporting the management of large fundraising campaigns
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent written and oral communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with Raisers Edge or similar tool
          </li>
          <li>
           Commitment to excellence and best practices
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency with Microsoft Office, social media tools and comfort with technology
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently and as part of a team
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to problem-solve and think creatively
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrates initiative and flexibility with long and short term responsibilities
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to connect with others using various forms of communication tools
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with, or understanding of, the culture of independent schools
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to pass state and federal fingerprinting and background check and provide a recent negative TB test or screening
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          The position is 12 months and exempt. It requires occasional weekend and evening work as well as limited local and national travel.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           For Consideration
          </b>
          <br/>
          If interested, please visit our careers website at castilleja.org to download the application, and then email/attach completed application, resume and cover letter as directed. Please indicate
          <b>
           DEVCOORD
          </b>
          in the subject field. Compensation is commensurate with experience. No recruiters please.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Development / support: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Executive Assistant
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       King County Bar Association
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $18,000 - $20,000 a year
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Detailed Job Description:
          <br/>
          The Executive Assistant provides high-level administrative support to the Executive Director and the Development Manager. This is a part-time position.
          <br/>
          Reporting Relationship: Reports to the Executive Director
          <br/>
          Supervisory Responsibilities: None
          <br/>
          Principal Duties:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provides administrative support to Executive Director and the Development Manager;
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains Executive Director and official KCBA correspondence, KCBA board meeting records, policy decisions, Executive Director perpetual files;
          </li>
          <li>
           Drafts routine correspondence and email communications on behalf of Executive Director;
          </li>
          <li>
           May create complex documents, surveys, and reports;
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains Executive Director calendar; schedules travel, arranges meetings and conference calls with staff, board members, government officials and members of the community;
          </li>
          <li>
           Codes and reconciles Executive Director receipts, invoices, expenses and monthly credit card charges;
          </li>
          <li>
           Annually updates Board rosters, letterhead, listservs, and iMIS committees;
          </li>
          <li>
           Generates pledge and invoice reminders and acknowledgement letters;
          </li>
          <li>
           Performs other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Desired Qualifications:
         </p>
         <p>
          Education: Bachelors degree preferred.
         </p>
         <p>
          Experience: Minimum of three years of previous complex administrative experience required.
         </p>
         <p>
          Abilities/Skills:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to handle details of a highly confidential and critical nature;
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent written, proofreading and verbal communication skills;
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent organizational skills with a high attention to detail;
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite programs including Outlook, Word, Excel;
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of graphic design software is a plus;
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to manage multiple projects from beginning to end, ensuring all deadlines are met;
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently with minimal direction.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          The successful candidate will:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Possess a strong work ethic;
          </li>
          <li>
           Be adaptable, flexible and able to professionally manage last minute scheduling changes;
          </li>
          <li>
           Be able to work with KCBA colleagues in a professional, amicable and team-oriented manner;
          </li>
          <li>
           Have a demonstrated passion for the elements of the KCBA mission.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Schedule &amp; Salary:
          <br/>
          This is a non-exempt, 20 hour/week position, 4 Hours per day, Monday  Friday.
          <br/>
          Salary range: $18,000 - $20,000 plus employer paid healthcare, retirement and transit benefits.
          <br/>
          About the King County Bar Association:
         </p>
         <p>
          To Apply:
          <br/>
          Submit a cover letter and resume to:
          <br/>
          Applications received by May 26, 2015, will be given preference.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our Mission:
          <br/>
          The King County Bar Association provides support to its diverse membership; promotes a just, collegial and accessible legal system and profession; works with the judiciary to achieve excellence in the administration of justice; strives to benefit the community through its own efforts and those of its Foundation; and offers opportunities for public service and input into matters of public policy.
          <br/>
          Founded in 1886 the King County Bar Association is the largest voluntary bar association in the state of Washington, with over 5,500 members, 35 staff members and an annual budget of $3,200,000. For further information, please visit the KCBA website at www.kcba.org.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum of three years of previous complex administrative experience required.: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

         </p>

         </p>

           *MUST BE OVER 21 YEARS OLD TO APPLY*
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Drivers will be dispatched from our Mountain View, CA location.
          </li>
          <li>
           Shifts average between 7-9 hours per day.
          </li>
          <li>
           That is 34 to 44 Hours per Week.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

          </b>

          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </b>

          </b>

          <br/>

While we appreciate charm and charisma (and fun!) (and happy hours!) we know that doing our homework by thoroughly interviewing our talent and researching our clients industries makes us the best in the business. Build your career in a fast-paced, high-energy environment right in the heart of SF. Got hustle? Got smarts? Got a flair for tech and fast-growth companies? Do your career a favor and join a dynamic company where you'll learn from some of the best sales and business development minds in the Bay Area.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Coit Group is looking for a Recruiter to join our growing team! The ideal candidate has strong research skills and ability to attract passive talent. Our clients are the hottest Venture Funded, private companies in the bay area. Our client's are leaders in their industry and growing rapidly.
         </p>
         <p>
          You will work directly with the founders and other leaders of our company in the critical delivery of the Bay Area's best and brightest talent and help our clients scale-FAST.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are growing quickly, and you'll need to bring the hustle associated with a fast paced environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          Responsibilities:
          <br/>
          *Identify and attract applicable talent for each specific jobs
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Finding creative and effective places to post job descriptions (blogs, user-groups and beyond)
          </li>
          <li>
           Setup phone screens and onsite interviews
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend industry networking events and ABR - Always Be Recruiting
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Self directed
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to prioritize and manage your day
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain strong relationships with your team and our clients
          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

         </p>

          What Coit Group offers you:
         </p>
         <p>
          At Coit, we are team players who thrive on healthy competition and a good challengeseasoned professionals with deep industry knowledge and a nimble start-up mentality. Rather than running a reactive business like many recruiting agencies, we've built a proactive model that helps us foster long-term relationships, both with our talent and our corporate clients. While anyone can say that theyre one of the top recruitment companies, we prefer to let our track record speak for itself. Since starting in a San Francisco apartment (where else?) in 2000, we've only had two clients--out of thousands of placements--ask for a refund. Two. In 15 years. Why? Our People.
         </p>
         <p>
          Located in the heart of the financial district of San Francisco, Coit Group offers a very professional and career growth orientated environment. "Teamwork Makes the Dream Work" is our company motto; we all pitch in to get the job done. We offer the support and guidance to veteran recruiters and comprehensive training to our industry newcomers. We are the proverbial Work Hard Play Hard Team. We enjoy company sponsored trips and happy hours with the typical onsite keg and bar which opens at 4:00pm every day, except Friday when it opens at 2:00pm.

  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        The Maintenance Tech III  Electrician
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Stoneridge Creek
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Pleasanton, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $22 - $24 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Maintenance Tech III  Electrician
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary:
          <br/>
          $22.00 to $24.00 Hourly
         </p>
         <p>
          Status:
          <br/>
          Full Time
         </p>
         <p>
          Hours:
          <br/>
          Hours varied
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Preview:
         </p>
         <p>
          The Maintenance Tech III  Electrician maintains, repairs, and installs electrical equipment and systems throughout the community.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The Maintenance Tech III  Electrician maintains, repairs, and installs electrical equipment and systems at the community utilizing technical, interpersonal and critical thinking skills under the guidance and support of a supervisor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Working as a team with the entire Plant department, the Maintenance Tech III performs general maintenance duties, preventive maintenance, service calls, and emergency maintenance as needed and assigned.
          </li>
          <li>
           Continues to perform minor repairs and similar duties that may be assigned to Maintenance Techs I &amp; II, but is considerably faster and more proficient compared to Tech levels I &amp; II, and requires no oversight or direction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Uses complex electrical schematics and blueprints to troubleshoot and correct problems.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides direction to co-workers through hands-on assistance, direction, support, and development; and serves as a positive role model by way of example.
          </li>
          <li>
           Displays and practices a work style that reflects the mission, philosophy and goals of the organization.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides excellent customer service to residents as demonstrated by doing the following:  Preview work order, and arrive at unit prepared with all tools/parts needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Greet resident by name, introduce yourself, and tell him/her what you will be working on.
          </li>
          <li>
           Wear protective booties over shoes when entering residents unit, if requested.
          </li>
          <li>
           If resident is not home, leave a note
          </li>
          <li>
           Thoroughly clean up after yourself when finished with the job
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain personal cleanliness
          </li>
          <li>
           When a resident asks you to do something not on the work order, if it will take less than 15 minutes, do it! If it will take over 15 minutes or doing it will make you late for an appointment, ask if you can use their phone to call in the work order on their behalf.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           May complete apartment turnovers and scheduled pool/pond/lake maintenance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assigned one week of on-call duty approximately once each quarter.
          </li>
          <li>
           Conduct technical training sessions for staff related to electrical, as well as safety training as scheduled by the assistant director.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Requirements:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum five years of increasing responsibilities and experience in troubleshooting and repair of electrical systems and plant operations equipment in a complex commercial, industrial, and/or healthcare setting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be knowledgeable in troubleshooting, repairing, replacing, and testing of various electrical controllers, boilers, HVAC, kitchen and laundry equipment, lighting and low voltage systems.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read and understand complex electrical schematics and blueprints.
          </li>
          <li>
           Basic understanding of state and national electric codes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficient with automatic lighting schedules and systems.
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer proficient using Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to understand and follow instructions in English, communicate effectively, and perform simple arithmetic.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have a passion for providing excellent customer service.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Testing Requirements:
         </p>
         <p>
          Applicants for the Maintenance Tech III - Electrician position are required to complete two computer-based tests. One is Customer Service Aptitude test and the other is Workplace Productivity Profile. After you complete the application and apply for the position, an email confirmation will be sent to you. On the email is a link to the Criteria Test Center. Please complete the test at a time that is convenient for you. Be aware, once you begin the tests, you will not be able to 'come and go' on the testing site. You must complete the tests in one sitting. The tests are multiple choice, and will take about 30 minutes. You will not be considered for this position until the tests have been completed.
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_8daa4bef3037a5ca">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>

Then you go to work and you make sure that everyone there is doing what they need to do, even your boss. You just do that because you've always done it. Well maybe it's time you moved up.          </p>
