          ADVANCEMENT
          <br/>
          Many of our team members began their careers as delivery drivers and today are successful Domino's franchise owners. From assistant manager to general manager, general manager to franchisee or Manager Corporate Operations, our stores offer a world of opportunity.
         </p>
         <p>
          DIVERSITY
          <br/>
          Our mission is to recognize, appreciate, value and utilize the unique talents and contributions of all individuals. To create an environment where all team members, because of their differences, can reach their highest potential.
         </p>
         <p>
          SUMMARY STATEMENT
          <br/>
          We take pride in our team members and our team members take pride in Domino's Pizza! Being the best pizza delivery company in the world requires exceptional team members working together. At Domino's Pizza, our people come first!
         </p>
         <p>
          If you can't wait to be a part of this apply by sending an email with your resume attached or visit us at 2331 W Madison in Chicago. Domino's is the biggest pizza delivery company on the planet. . .who doesn't want to be a part of that?

          </b>
         </p>

We have helped over 30 million people find a trusted home services professional and have been featured in publications such as Fast Company, Wired, The Today Show, the Wall Street Journal and the Huffington Post. We are a subsidiary of IAC (NASDAQ: IACI).
          <br/>
          We combine a fast paced, high energy culture with committed professional training and development programs. HomeAdvisor is located at the foot of the Rockies in Golden, CO, and is one of the Top Places to Work in Denver. We are growing our sales floor, and are looking for the best talent to take our company to the next level.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Sales Associate
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Our Sales Associate position provides a unique opportunity for anyone interested in gaining or furthering their experience in the world of sales and internet media. Our powerhouse sales floor is the engine of HomeAdvisor, and we have built out a team of smart and passionate innovators. You will be fully immersed in growing our company, and will gain invaluable, life-long communication skills. Every single sales professional is vital to the companys success, and we are expanding our family!

          </b>
         </p>

          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </b>
         </p>

          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

           Learn sales techniques and help to develop new, creative sales strategies
          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </b>

          <br/>

          <br/>

         </p>

          ** All benefits listed are subject to change.HomeAdvisor is an equal opportunity employer.
         </p>

          Sales, media, marketing, advertising, sales associate, sales representative, online, internet, direct, inside sales, communications, tech, startup, IAC

The machine creates meaningful cost savings for customers while diverting food waste from landfills and reducing methane gas production. For more information, please visit www.totallygreen.com

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u10r3hkb9rpbm3" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Assistant Teacher
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       VOCEL
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Assistant Teachers Job Description
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Role
          </i>
          : VOCELs preschool classroom Assistant Teacher (AT) works with the Lead Teacher and Cooperating Teacher to ensure the safety, well-being, growth, development and learning of all children in the preschool classroom. Primarily, the AT will be responsible for 3 main work streams: interactions with children; observation and documentation of childrens growth and development; and organization, paperwork and cleaning responsibilities. These work streams will require the Assistant Teacher to work collaboratively with other members of the classroom teaching team and also to take initiative and work independently, on occasion taking a lead role in the classroom.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for passionate, self-motivated educators who believe in the potential of all children and ascribe to VOCELs educational philosophy  that children learn best through play, discovery and conversation. The ideal candidate for this role will be able to remain calm in the face of challenge, support children through conflicts and emotional stress and be a loving caregiver for all children.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Team
          </i>
          : VOCELs AT will work closely with the entire VOCEL staff. The AT will be managed by the Director of Program &amp; Evaluation and will meet weekly with the full classroom teaching team. VOCEL is committed to continuous development of all team members, so this is a great position for someone looking to learn and grow as an early childhood educator.
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Qualifications
          </i>
          :
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           High school diploma or GED required; currently taking coursework towards Associates degree in Early Childhood Education from an accredited college or university
          </li>
          <li>
           Associates degree in Early Childhood Education preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           At least 19 years of age
          </li>
          <li>
           At least 2 years of experience in early childhood setting preferred
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated ability to respond expeditiously in the classroom to child conflicts, challenges and emergencies
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrated ability to work with diverse individuals and groups
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           Primary Responsibilities
          </i>
          :
          <br/>
          Education
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ensure the care, safety and well-being of the children in the assigned classroom and when appropriate, all children in the center
          </li>
          <li>
           Collaborate with Lead Teacher and Cooperating Teacher to create plans for classroom instruction and facilitating childrens play
          </li>
          <li>
           Implement a developmentally-appropriate curriculum as guided by Teaching Strategies GOLD with modifications to meet the needs of all children
          </li>
          <li>
           Support the Lead Teacher in maintaining growth and development portfolios for all children; collect materials and write observation notes and maintain organization
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Program Compliance
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ensure the assigned classroom is always in compliance with DCFS health and safety standards including but not limited to ensuring the classroom remains clean, organized and free of unnecessary clutter
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure any physical facility issues are reported to the Executive Director immediately
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain organization of educational files for the children in the assigned classroom including filing necessary paperwork, tracking completion dates and soliciting additional information from childrens families when needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete daily attendance record and meal counts
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete daily and weekly classroom and material sanitation checklists
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Collaboration with Others
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Participate in weekly teaching team meetings to discuss teaching team collaboration, childrens learning and additional supports needed by individual children
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain positive, healthy relationships with colleagues, children and families
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in bi-weekly observation and coaching cycle with Director of Program &amp; Evaluation
          </li>
          <li>
           Other responsibilities as determined collaboratively by classroom teaching team
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           Desired Skills &amp; Approach to Work:
          </i>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Positive demeanor with children, parents, and staff
          </li>
          <li>
           High-level of energy and enthusiasm
          </li>
          <li>
           Desire to increase knowledge about early childhood education and improve own skills as an early childhood educator
          </li>
          <li>
           Flexible and adaptable to meet the needs of assigned group of young children
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to remain calm in face of challenging situations with children, families or colleagues and keep best interest of children at forefront of all decisions made
          </li>
          <li>
           Analytical and problem solving skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Effective verbal and written communication skills
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong computer skills (Microsoft Office, Internet, etc.)
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work closely with team members, including getting along with individuals with diverse backgrounds and personalities
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           Role-specific physical demands:
          </i>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Lifting, moving and holding children up to 40 pounds
          </li>
          <li>
           Frequent sitting, standing, bending and stooping for prolonged periods of time
          </li>
          <li>
           Physical agility to participate fully in all indoor and outdoor activities with children
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Schedule &amp; Salary
          </b>
          This is a full time position (35-40 hours per week) and is paid hourly. Wage is competitive with similar roles at similar organizations.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Anti-Discrimination Policy and Commitment to Diversity
          </b>
          VOCEL seeks individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds to apply for this position. VOCEL is committed to a non-discriminatory hiring policy and will hire the most qualified applicant regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation or age.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           childcare or teaching: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Associate
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_46e7100cfb15f213">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>

      <b class="jobtitle">

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">

      <span class="location">

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          We are currently looking for Journeymen throughout Western Washington for the following positions: Service,Installation and Inspectors.
          <br/>
          Washington Alarm, a Seattle based full service alarm company with our own central station, is seeking 06 technicians with a service background.
          <br/>
          We are experiencing rapid growth in sales and service and need licensed technicians with the following skills:
         </p>
         <p>
          Hardwired and Wireless Security installations
          <br/>
          Experience in Installing Fire Alarm systems
          <br/>
          Knowledge of multiple alarm panels
          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          Must be able to work independently
          <br/>

          <br/>
          Able to read blueprints
          <br/>
          Must have a good driving record, able to pass both a background and credit check and pass a drug screen
         </p>
         <p>
          $500.00 Signing bonus for qualified applicants payable after 3 month on the job and an additional $500.00 signing bonus after 9 months on the job.
         </p>
         <p>
          Washington alarm provides a company vehicle, cell phone and a competitive wage.
          <br/>

         <p>
          Retail Store Sales Manager / Sales Representatives -- HIRING TODAY!
         </p>
         <p>
          Have you been searching for a career in retail sales. . . not just a job?
         </p>
         <p>
          Are you looking for a company that is actually growing and will provide you the ability to advance your career in sales?
         </p>
         <p>
          Tired of being utilized incorrectly by management and not getting paid what you're really worth?
         </p>
         <p>
          If you answer "yes" to any of the above, read on. . .
         </p>
         <p>
          What's in it For YOU to Bring Your Talent to MetroPCS:
          <br/>
          - We're rapidly expanding in the Seattle area and have positions with the potential for growth for motivated, productive salespeople.
          <br/>
          - MetroPCS is one of the nation's leading providers of unlimited 4G wireless service through T-Mobile's network with no annual contract.
          <br/>
          - We make wireless simple by offering unlimited talk, text and data plans with all applicable taxes and fees included under 3 affordable rate plans.
          <br/>
          - Our busy stores have a fast-paced, team atmosphere with a goal to help sales stars continually increase their commissions and earning potential.
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary &amp; Compensation:
          <br/>
          Sales Reps: Minimum wage plus commissions on accessories &amp; phone activations
          <br/>
          Sales Managers: Competitive salary (based on experience &amp; store's performance)
         </p>
         <p>
          NOTE: If all of this sounds good so far, finish reading this entire ad. . . then follow the 3-step directions at the end to apply today!
         </p>
         <p>
          Goals &amp; Objectives of the Sales Rep &amp; Sales Manager Positions:
         </p>
         <p>
          1. Communicate Effectively -- by approaching every customer that walks through the door with a goal of understanding their needs by asking good questions and listening.
         </p>
         <p>
          2. Continually Increase Store Sales -- only once you understand the customer's need, clearly explain and demonstrate our products, services, features and confidently ask for the sale.
         </p>
         <p>
          3. Team Player -- be able to work in a group environment, be open-minded to learning new things and always treat customers / co-workers the way you'd like to be treated.
         </p>
         <p>
          4. Professionalism - be confident of what you're selling by utilizing all the tools that management provides to continually improve your knowledge of the products we offer and our phone's features.
         </p>
         <p>
          5. Integrity -- be dependable and show up on-time everyday, don't bring personal problems to work and help to maintain a clean, organized store.
         </p>
         <p>
          Sales Rep Employment Requirements:
          <br/>
          Prior work experience: 1+ years sales experience (preferred), ideally in the wireless telecommunication industry
          <br/>
          Educational requirements: High school diploma or GED
          <br/>
          Skill requirements: Fluency in English (required) and Spanish (preferred)
          <br/>
          Misc. requirements: Reliable transportation, a valid Driver's License, drug-free and be willing to submit a Background Check
         </p>

          Sales Manager Employment Requirements:
          <br/>

          <br/>

         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>

         </p>
         <p>

         </p>
         <p>
          Step 3: Write a short paragraph on which position you'd like to be considered for (Sales Manager, Sales Rep -- or both) and what makes you better than the other 200+ candidates that apply for our jobs each month.

       </font>
      </b>

      <span class="company">

      </span>

      <span class="location">

      </span>

     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          One of the worlds premier product manufacturers is seeking a versatile and driven leader to manage distributor sales growth for our General Industry, Bearing Division segment. The ideal candidate will reside in the Seattle area. This position will require approximately 50-60% overnight travel within Washington, Idaho, Oregon, Wyoming and Utah. Responsibilities will include maintaining existing distribution accounts, building relationships and increasing market share by working closely with our distribution partners. Strong sales and technical background, as well as a positive team attitude, are a must. Knowledge of industrial distribution, bearings and power transmission is preferred.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Overview / Role
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           The Area Manager is responsible for sales territory growth. An existing base of distributor accounts will be assigned. Sales activities (sales calls, joint sales calls to end users, target prospecting, training promotions, etc.) will need to be coordinated by the Area Manager to effectively attain forecasts, sales goals and territory growth plans. Interface with all customer department levels (management, purchasing, engineering, production, etc.) is expected, and the ability to coordinate sales and project activities between divisions (customer service, engineering and management) is a must.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Job Functions
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Implement policies and strategies to reach targets set by management.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate and monitor the sales functions within assigned district.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strive to attain forecast and sales plan.
          </li>
          <li>
           Efficiently plan territory activities to minimize travel and maximize account exposure.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor the gross quantity of sales made in the district.
          </li>
          <li>
           Document all the sales details and report accordingly to the Regional Manager.
          </li>
          <li>
           Initiate stock orders from the company inventory.
          </li>
          <li>
           Utilize company resources to assist in sales generation and growth.
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the products sold.
          </li>
          <li>
           Have solid understanding of divisional goals and company mission statement.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Required Tasks
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Excellent communication, relationship building, organizational and negotiation skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           A thorough knowledge about the policies and sales strategies of the company.
          </li>
          <li>
           Distribution and OEM knowledge.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong computer background required in order to complete daily, weekly and monthly report assignments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must monitor expenses and submit proper expense reporting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to travel frequently, 50% - 60%.
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelors Degree in Business Management.
          </li>
          <li>
           At least 2 years of experience in sales and marketing.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We provide a comprehensive benefit package that includes medical, prescription drug coverage, dental, vision, and life insurance. Automatic enrollment in our 401(k) program, company credit card, cell phone, laptop computer, and company car allowance provided.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           <i>
            Prior to starting with us, you must have: Proof of education from an accredited educational facility, complete a negative, hair follicle drug screen and successfully complete a criminal background check.
           </i>
          </b>

        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Apply by visiting www.aarcareer.com with hiring code 101.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Purpose:
         </p>
         <p>
          Serves patrons by providing information to help food and beverage selections; presenting ordered choices; maintaining dining ambiance.
         </p>
         <p>
          Duties:
         </p>
         <p>
          Protects establishment and patrons by adhering to sanitation, safety, and alcohol beverage control policies.
         </p>
         <p>
          Helps patrons select food and beverages by presenting menu; offering cocktails and aperitifs; suggesting courses; explaining the chef's specialties; identifying appropriate wines; answering food preparation questions.
         </p>
         <p>
          Transmits orders to bar and kitchen by recording patrons' choices; identifying patrons' special dietary needs and special requests.
         </p>
         <p>
          Serves orders by picking up and delivering patrons' choices from bar and kitchen; delivering accompaniments and condiments from service bars.
         </p>
         <p>
          Responds to additional patron requirements by inquiring of needs; observing dining process.
         </p>
         <p>
          Maintains table setting by removing courses as completed; replenishing utensils; refilling water glasses; being alert to patron spills or other special needs.
         </p>
         <p>
          Concludes dining experience by acknowledging choice of restaurant; inviting patrons to return.
         </p>
         <p>
          Obtains revenues by totaling charges; issuing bill; accepting payment; returning change or credit card and signature slip to patrons.
         </p>
         <p>
          Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
         </p>
         <p>
          Skills/Qualifications:
          <br/>
          General Math Skills, Verbal Communication, Customer Service, Resolving Conflict, Teamwork, Persistence, Energy Level, Selling to Customer Needs, Thoroughness, Professionalism.
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0udbqqb02jb2o" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Technical Security Consultant
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Beecher Reagan Advisors
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       New York, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          COMPANY OVERVIEW
          <br/>
          Beecher Reagan Advisors LLC is the executive search firm of choice among top consulting firms, corporations, and alternative investment firms seeking guidance and counsel on talent acquisition. Our Partners bring over 40 years of proven experience and a personal commitment to deliver impactful results to our management consulting, business advisory, and IT Services clients. We also advise Fortune 500 and alternative investment firms (Hedge Funds and Private Equity) around attracting top leadership talent in-house. By acting as a trusted advisor to both clients and candidates, we leverage our unparalleled access, experience and sector expertise to build long-standing relationships and facilitate executive level hires that have immediate impact and that persist over time.
         </p>
         <p>
          Beecher Reagan has been retained by a blue-chip client that is the worlds leader in their industry. They consistently strive to recruit talent that can be the leaders of the company  starting on their very first day.
         </p>
         <p>
          Throughout our clients history, they have been recognized as an industry innovator. They are one of the few firms to have positive performance during the 2008 credit crisis. In both 2010 and 2011, our client ranked as the largest and best-performing firm in the world for their respective industry, and in both 2012 and 2013 our client was recognized for having earned its clients more than any other firm in the history of the industry.
         </p>
         <p>
          In addition, our clients innovations have changed their industry in several ways. As a reflection of the magnitude of its beneficial impact on their industry, our client has received over 40 "best of" industry awards and its founder has received five life time achievement awards. As a reflection of the founders influence on economic thinking, in 2012 Time magazine judged the founder to be one of the 100 most influential people in the world.
         </p>
         <p>
          SECURITY DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW
          <br/>
          Our client holds the security of their intellectual property as mission critical. Given the ever-changing threat landscape, protecting their competitive edge requires a groundbreaking approach. Under the direction of a newly hired CSO and with the funding and governance support from their Executive Committee, our clients Security team is pioneering a transformational, industry-leading three-pronged strategy, which includes:
         </p>
         <p>
          1.) A fully integrated cyber, physical and staff security operation
          <br/>
          2.) A complete overhaul of their technical and security environment, which will include migration to the cloud and major investments in next generation analytics
          <br/>
          3.) An innovative dynamic defense operating model that is proactive, predictive, automated and intelligent
         </p>
         <p>
          The Security department is looking to hire a number of talented, entrepreneurial security professionals to bring this vision to life. Individuals who join the department's transformative efforts will be on the forefront of the next generation of security and technology with vast opportunities for future growth within the department, as well as firm-wide.
         </p>
         <p>
          JOB DESCRIPTION
          <br/>
          In keeping with the entrepreneurial ethos of our client, each of their departments operates in many ways like an independent business. For example, each of the three most secure and mission-critical business areas has an advanced, innovative technology sub-department that develops and operates numerous platforms and applications for the department. Due to these unique technical environments and the mission-criticality of their assets, each of these departments requires an embedded, dedicated security function that leverages and builds on the work done centrally by the Security Department.
         </p>
         <p>
          Protecting the digital assets in these departments is a top priority and enjoys visibility and support at the highest levels of our client. The Technical Security Consultant in each of these departments is a key part of that  he or she is the person ultimately responsible for securing the department's technical environment and digital assets. This is truly both a security strategy/risk management role and a "hands on" technical security oversight role. It involves both engaging deeply with the departments to safeguard its critical assets, as well as helping shape the company-wide effort to transform how we do technology and security holistically. This position reports to the Head of Security for the department who is holistically responsible for securing the department.
         </p>
         <p>
          Responsibilities would include:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Maintain the constantly changing picture of the threats, vulnerabilities, security controls and residual risk to which the departments assets are exposed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Define and maintain the information security policies and standards for the department
          </li>
          <li>
           Partner with IT organizations to ensure new technology development and deployment projects in the department are delivered securely (from initiate, plan, design/architect, test/assess, control, execute and close phases)
          </li>
          <li>
           Design and execute a security improvement program to address key risks and maintain a cutting edge security profile
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop the strategic vision for the future of information security in the department that delivers excellent security while supporting the dynamic, agile technology development activities which drive our client.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure operational components of the information security program (e.g. helpdesk, vulnerability management, incident response) are delivered excellently
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Position Requirements
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           5+ Years of security experience including exposure to both infrastructure and application security and depth in one of these domains
          </li>
          <li>
           A very sharp, quick thinker who is self-motivated continuous learner
          </li>
          <li>
           Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, is tolerant of ambiguity and drives activities to their completion
          </li>
          <li>
           Accomplished hands on technologist (professionally, academically, or vocationally).
          </li>
          <li>
           Extensive knowledge of industry standard security practices, the cyber threat landscape, and risk management methodologies
          </li>
          <li>
           Prefer a candidate with experience operating in a high-assurance or other highly classified environment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Information Technology: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_cc221a53480f40d0">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>

          <br/>
          2. Prepares meals in accordance with planned menus, standardized recipes, therapeutic diets and authorized substitutions. Reviews menus prior to preparation of food.
          <br/>
          3. Prepares and serves meals that are palatable and appetizing in appearance.
          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>
          6. Inspects special diet trays to assure that correct diet is served to resident.
          <br/>

          <br/>
          8. Ensures that appropriate equipment and utensils are provided with resident's meal tray.
          <br/>
          9. Processes diet changes and new diets as received from Nursing Services.
          <br/>
          10. Prepares and delivers nourishments.
          <br/>
          11. Ensures food is stored in accordance with sanitary regulations as well as our established policies and procedures.
          <br/>
          12. Works with the Dietitian as necessary and implements recommended changes as required.
          <br/>
          13. Directs and participates in daily or scheduled cleaning duties in accordance with established policies and procedures and ensures that food storage areas are clean and properly arranged at all times.
          <br/>
          14. Ensures that menus are maintained and filed appropriately.

These attributes define Crescent Heights properties.           </b>

          Serves as the guests liaison for both hotel and non-hotel services. Functions are an extension of front desk agent duties. Assists the guest-regardless of whether inquiries concern in-hotel or off-premises attractions, facilities, services, or activities. Knows how to provide concise and accurate directions. Makes reservations and obtains tickets for flights, the theater, or special events. Organizes special functions such as VIP cocktail receptions. Arranges for secretarial services.
         </p>

          <b>
           ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
          </b>
         </p>

          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Provides guests with information about attractions, facilities, services, and activities in or outside the property.
          </li>
          <li>
           Makes guest reservations for air or other forms of transportation when requested. Obtains necessary itinerary and tickets.
          </li>
          <li>
           Makes guest reservations for the theater and other forms of entertainment when requested. Obtains necessary tickets and provides directions to facilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Organizes special functions as directed by management.
          </li>
          <li>
           Arranges secretarial and other office services.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinates guest requests for special services or equipment with the appropriate department.
          </li>
          <li>
           Contacts roomed guests periodically to ascertain any special needs.
          </li>
          <li>
           Handles guest complaints and solves problems to the degree possible.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          <br/>

          </b>

         </p>

          We are looking for drivers with great knowledge of the San Francisco bay area along with the use of GPS technology.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           **Replies to your applying are made through email correspondence**
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           **Please check your spam filter as well**
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           *SERIOUS APPLICANTS ONLY THAT CAN COMMIT TO A SCHEDULE*
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           *MUST BE OVER 21 YEARS OLD TO APPLY*
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Drivers will be dispatched from our Mountain View, CA location.
          </li>
          <li>
           Shifts average between 7-9 hours per day.
          </li>
          <li>
           That is 34 to 44 Hours per Week.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           We provide the following:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Company cargo vans, box trucks
          </li>
          <li>
           Gas cards
          </li>
          <li>
           Uniforms
          </li>
          <li>
           Scanner equipment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          You MUST pass a background check &amp; drug screen in order to join our team.
          <br/>
          <b>
           TO BE CONSIDERED TO APPLY/ INTERVIEW
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           YOU MUST COME PREPARED &amp; MUST PROVIDE A
          </b>
          <b>
           COPY
          </b>
          <b>
           OF THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Copy of a valid (CURRENT) driver license.
          <br/>
          Proof to work in the U.S; Social Security Card, Current Passport.
          <br/>
          DMV driving report: You may pick up your DMV report from the DMV office or go online at: https://www.dmv.ca.gov/portal/dmv/detail/online/dr/welcome
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           DMV REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
          Ages 21 to 25 yrs.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <b>
            Clean driving report, nothing on DMV report
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No moving violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No seat belt violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No at-fault accidents
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No suspensions
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No cell phone violations
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           DMV REQUIREMENTS:
          </b>
          25 yrs. +
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           One point within the last 3 years
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No seat belt violations
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No at-fault accidents
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No suspensions
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            No cell phone violations
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          *
          <br/>

           Full Time positions are available with Progistics and after a probationary period
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           We offer Medical, &amp; PTO. 90 DAYS PTO, 60 DAYS Medical coverage
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Hourly Wage: $13.50 per hour ($20.25 per hour overtime rate)
          <br/>
          Pay: $30,000 to $42,000 per year based off Hourly wage, potential overtime, &amp; benefits.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Work Schedule:
          </b>
          <br/>

          <br/>

           Mountain View, CA
          </li>

         </p>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </li>

       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          We are looking for a dynamic person with a great work ethic and excellent attention to detail to fulfill our Purchasing Project Manager role using Shop-Tech E2 ERP. The purchasing project associate will be responsible for purchasing our daily inventory needs as part of a purchasing team, and managing the parts needs of a multitude of different projects to their completion. Part of the responsibility of the project manager will be ongoing data entry, building bill of materials is the main part of the job, learning our inventory,and working with shoptech E2 system. The purchasing project associate must be proficient with computers, Microsoft Office Suit, etc. The candidate will be responsible for quickly learning our processes and procedures. The candidate for this position will be responsible for quickly learning inventory parts and their function. Experience using an ERP system to make bill of materials is a must. Must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Please note: This position is a non supervisory position and we are looking for team members with experience making Bill Of Materials in the SHOPTECH E2 system, we may consider experience in other ERP systems.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Purchasing and Data Entry Required : 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>

  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>

    </td>

  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Administrative Assistant
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Masonic Homes of California
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Union City, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Description
          </b>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Administrative Assistant
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Title: Administrative Assistant Work Status: Full Time
         </p>
         <p>
          Company Name: Masonic Homes of California Payroll Type: Exempt
         </p>
         <p>
          Division: Administration Supervisory: No
         </p>
         <p>
          Reports To: Vice President, Community Based Services
          <br/>
          Director, Quality Management
         </p>
         <p>
          Location of Job: Union City Revised/Updated: 5/13/2015
         </p>
         <p>
          Current Position
          <br/>
          Assigned To: New Actual Title: Administrative Assistant
         </p>
         <p>
          Regular Hours: 40 hours per week (full time)
          <br/>
          Schedule: Monday through Friday
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Summary:
          </b>
          To assist the Vice President, Community Based Services and Director Quality Management in all types of administrative matters.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Essential Functions:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Perform administrative functions as required by these individuals. The ability to coordinate and prioritize competing needs of the two individuals supported by this position is critical.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage the business calendars for these individuals; schedule and confirm meetings, conference calls and Web and video conferences, as requested.
          </li>
          <li>
           Code, file and reconcile business and travel expenses, credit card statements and other expense reimbursements for payment as well as consultant, contractor and other project-related invoices. Maintain electronic records of all approved, pending and paid invoices in such a way as to assure access for tracking and reporting. Responsible for tracking status of approved invoices and reimbursement requests to assure timely payment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Facilitate effective collaboration on critical projects; maintain professional and effective communication between MHC departments and offices, as well as with consultants and contractors and other external parties to foster positive, collegial rapport.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate standing meetings and special meetings on behalf of organizers; send invitations and confirm with attendees; assure meeting room reservations and other meeting logistics; prepare agendas and take and distribute minutes and follow up on action items, as requested.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate, as requested, to track time-critical projects, assist in the coordination, compilation and or completion of departmental and project reports including and not limited to monthly Dashboard Reports to the EVP, quarterly Board Reports, Quality Management Reports, Compliance Committee Reports, Admissions Committee Status Reports and other bi-monthly, monthly and quarterly reports. Prepare revisions or updates to policy &amp; procedures manuals and other business records as required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage general correspondence, including written and electronic mail, using good judgment about the tone and content of communications. Maintain complete files for correspondence, electronic mail, and other documents properly in paper and digital files.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare PowerPoint presentations for meetings; organize materials such as presentations and photocopies, for meetings and special events.
          </li>
          <li>
           Organize and maintain departmental and project files, records and other critical documents, assuring ready access for responsible staff. Including some limited data entry and export using Access, as well as data analysis and Pivot Charts in Excel.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain inventory of office supplies; coordinate office supply and equipment needs among these individuals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide exceptional travel support to these individuals as required and to other employees as requested.
          </li>
          <li>
           On a limited basis and by arrangement, may be asked to provide phone support to the Executive Vice President and Lead Executive Assistant.
          </li>
          <li>
           Regular attendance and punctuality is an essential function of the job.
          </li>
          <li>
           Occasional travel to San Francisco or to the Covina campus may be required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform all other administrative duties as assigned.
          </li>
          <li>
           Comply with all security, safety and health standards in the workplace.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Five or more years of experience supporting multiple senior-level executives.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA strongly preferred or AA/AS degree with strong executive support experience.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Excellent telephone skills. Strong business writing skills including ability to accurately summarize meeting transactions and telephone messages.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Excellent proficiency in English grammar. Excellent proofreading skills and error-free communication.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to effectively use Microsoft Office products including MS Outlook, MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Access, MS Visio, MS Project on a computer and ability to learn new programs and software as required.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to learn and understand pertinent parts of the California Masonic Code.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Uncompromising sense of confidentiality and discretion required.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to successfully collaborate with management and administrative staff at Union City and Covina campuses and Grand Lodge, and liaison as necessary with Director of Administration and Board Governance.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Strong organization and filing skills.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to tale initiative, work independently.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to take a proactive, solutions-based approach to complex problems and situations.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ability to remain calm and responsive under pressure of fast-paced, priority- changing, deadline driven environment.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Unwavering commitment to fostering gracious, respectful tone in all interactions with residents, members, and staff.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Maintain a professional image and be well-groomed.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Administrative Assistant Experience: 5 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_2894c621cdcdb4a1">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Repair Transducer Technician
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Summit Imaging Inc
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Woodinville, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Who We Are:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Summit is a highly responsive service company, in the medical imaging industry. We offer the best customer support, and innovation in the business. We are committed to making our customers heroes; minimizing downtime, helping control costs, and providing the highest quality solutions for our clients. Each of us at Summit is committed not only to our clients but to each other.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Summary:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The transducer repair technician is responsible for assessing the condition of incoming repair requests, repairing both the electronic and mechanical functions of ultrasound transducers in an ESD safe atmosphere, and performance of final quality acceptance testing of the product. This person needs to be a self-starter, team player and creative. Self-directed persons who are meticulous about small details and are committed to quality excel here.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Specific Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Evaluate incoming work requests to identify and document required repairs for the formulation of an accurate repair quote. Interface with customer service team as needed
          </li>
          <li>
           Troubleshoot and repair ultrasound transducers and complete documentation requirements
          </li>
          <li>
           Under limited supervision, performs adjusting, fitting and aligning to very close tolerances
          </li>
          <li>
           Assembles or installs various components by soldering, winding, adjusting, gluing, masking and centering under special magnification equipment to exacting tolerances
          </li>
          <li>
           Inspect and test completed repairs using established quality criteria
          </li>
          <li>
           Expected to attain mastery of all steps in the repair and assembly process
          </li>
          <li>
           Works at a bench and walks or stands some of the time
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete projects received from oral communication
          </li>
          <li>
           Works in a team atmosphere
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Education &amp; Experience:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           AA Degree or equivalent
          </li>
          <li>
           Two to four years of electronics troubleshooting and repair experience
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Required Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Experience or ability to learn fine pitch soldering under microscope
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience using electronic testing equipment
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to perform and thrive in a continuous learning environment
          </li>
          <li>
           High degree of eye-hand coordination and finger dexterity
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience using small tools and small item manipulation
          </li>
          <li>
           Good written and oral communication
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work in a deadline-driven atmosphere and handle multiple projects/tasks with attention to detail
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_452c036c20b7227c">

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Meritage Medical Network
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Novato, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Meritage Medical Network
          </b>
          is a healthcare network representing our local physician members. We provide health care and administer benefits for HMO members in Marin, Napa, and Sonoma Counties. Our expert medical and administrative staff are dedicated to ensuring that you receive the highest quality health care available.
         </p>
         <p>
          The
          <b>
           Utilization Review Coordinator
          </b>
          serves as a liaison between Meritage Medical Network, our contracted health plans, Network physicians and Members. The incumbent is responsible for intake of all requests for medical services. Must have the ability to understand and use set criteria, and approve specific services within the related UM system.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Principle Duties and Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Ensure prompt, accurate data entry of Authorization requests into the Quick Cap system
          </li>
          <li>
           Utilize knowledge and experience to analyze contractual or administrative issues related to the requests.
          </li>
          <li>
           Identify additional information needed and ability to research and understand Policy benefits and criteria
          </li>
          <li>
           Accurately identify when and how to refer cases to appropriate clinical personnel or take other actions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Follow strict guidelines to ensure all work meets ICE standards for accuracy, timeliness, quality and compliance with federal, state and accreditation regulations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate with other insurance coordinators and the medical review staff.
          </li>
          <li>
           Consistently meet department productivity and performance metrics.
          </li>
          <li>
           Contribute to the efficiency of the department by being flexible and cross-trained on other functions.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           1  2 years of related experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Familiarity with insurance billing and/or terminology
          </li>
          <li>
           Managed Care experience, preferred.
          </li>
          <li>
           Knowledge of CPT and ICD codes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong data entry skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent interpersonal skills, including phone, verbal, and written communication.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong computer skills with demonstrated proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, database, presentation and email applications.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
         </p>

         </p>
         <p>
          Health IQ was founded on the premise that people who take responsibility for their health are overpaying for a number of products because they are assumed to be less healthy. We are building products (iOS, Android, and web) to help find, connect, and celebrate those who are Health Conscious. If you are passionate about improving your health and believe in rewarding the Health Conscious, we would love to talk to you.
         </p>
         <p>
          As a customer advocate, you will be acting as our customers trusted advisor. It is your job to ensure that our health conscious customers get the health and wellness information they are seeking, including money saving tips on health products and services.           </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Direct Care Worker - Supported Living Services
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Omelagah, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Mateo, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>
       $13 an hour
      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Job Title: Direct Care Worker
          <br/>
          Program: Supported Living Services (SLS)
          <br/>
          Work Location(s): San Mato, CA
          <br/>
          Shift(s): Weekday and Weekend Shifts Available
          <br/>
          Starting Compensation: $13.00 an hour
          <br/>
          Employment Status: Full-Time and Part-Time Positions Available
         </p>
         <p>
          Position Summary
          <br/>
          Under direction from the Program Supervisor, the Direct Care Worker provides support services to individuals with developmental disabilities in their own homes. The Direct Care Worker provides training, assistance and support services to clients in a manner that ensures their health, safety and successful achievement of service objectives outlined in their Individual Service Plan (ISP). This role requires a high level of cleanliness and strong domestic skills (such as being able to cook healthy meals, and helping purchase healthy food). Other key responsibilities include all of the following: help with medical appointments, help implementing an exercise program, hygiene assistance, recreation, and medication monitoring.
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for creative high energy individual who would welcome the opportunity to work with people developmental disabilities who have complete histories and behavioral challeges.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Duties and Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provide adaptive skills training to clients in areas of daily living, including, but not limited to following activities: shopping, budgeting, safety awareness, community access, positive relationship building, physical fitness, positive recreation, conflict resolution, anger management, coping skills, resisting peer pressure and maintaining a clean and healthy living environment;
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide supervision and redirection to prevent the manifestation of maladaptive behaviors that may lead to recidivism;
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsibility for the health and safety of assigned client;
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain client confidentiality. Follow reporting procedures regarding denial of rights and special incident reports;
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate with other staff regarding any changes in regulations, policies and procedures and general information pertaining to the program;
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist client with coordination of medical services, nutrition, personal hygienic and meal preparations. Coordination of clients personal hygiene needs may require exposure to bodily fluids (feces, urine, blood etc.);
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist client with household management needs including but not limited to the following: regular upkeep and maintenance, paying bills, developing schedules and routines, record keeping, and documentation;
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor client progress towards Individual Service Plan (ISP) objectives by maintaining and submitting weekly progress notes;
          </li>
          <li>
           Facilitate the full inclusion of individuals with disabilities in the recreation, volunteer, and employments sites of their choosing;
          </li>
          <li>
           Create and use natural supports and support client in a person centered manner;
          </li>
          <li>
           Teach community awareness to clients while they access their community via public transportation and travel training;
          </li>
          <li>
           Promote full engagement of each client in each activity;
          </li>
          <li>
           Recognize unusual or threatening conditions related to persons with disabilities and resolve issues if necessary;
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend required training and staff meetings;
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned;
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Minimum Job Qualification
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must pass fingerprint background check (Child Abuse Index, Criminal Record Clearance);
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be 18 years of age;
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess a valid California state drivers license;
          </li>
          <li>
           Recent, clean TB test and health screening (within one year);
          </li>
          <li>
           First Aid/CPR certification required (within 2 weeks);
          </li>
          <li>
           Clean DMV printout and proof of auto insurance;
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work independently and display good independent judgment;
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong time management skills, patient and detailed oriented;
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to utilize critical thinking skills in decision-making situations;
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent oral communication skills;
          </li>
          <li>
           Fluent report writing skills;
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with clients, parents, social workers, fellow workers, and others in a positive and constructive manner;
          </li>
          <li>
           Willingness to work flexible hours including nights and weekends to meet client needs;
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Benefits Available to Employees:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Paid time off
          </li>
          <li>
           Paid company holidays
          </li>
          <li>
           Health insurance for medical and vision coverage and dental coverage
          </li>
          <li>
           Recognition and incentive programs
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          About the Company:
          <br/>
          Omelagah, Inc. is a family-owned community-based organization that provides support services to individuals with developmental disabilities. Our mission is to support individuals with developmental disabilities with a history of forensic involvement or individuals who may be at risk of involvement with the criminal justice system, live productive law abiding lives in the least restrictive community setting. We are passionate in our belief that people with developmental disabilities deserve the right to live and thrive in the least restrictive community setting. We strive to improve the lives of the people we support and the communities they live in, through the implementation of structured community-based programs. We achieve our mission through the following services: Supported Living Services (SLS), Residential Services and Adaptive Skills Training. For more information, please visit us at www.omelagah.com
         </p>
         <p>
          Salary: $13.00 /hour
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_addd96eeb6c75e9e">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">

      -

       San Mateo County, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           We are looking for someone with a history of success.
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <b>
            Were looking for someone with integrity.
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Were looking for someone with a passion for Benefits Administration.
           </b>
          </li>
          <li>
           <b>
            Were Primark Benefits, and were looking for YOU!
           </b>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           Primark Benefits has a solid reputation for providing complete administration, compliance and consulting services for all types of employee benefit and retirement plans. Founded in 1971, our focus is on quality customer service, innovative plan designs, and maximizing benefits for the highly compensated. We are a vibrant, growing company that partners with some of the largest wholesalers in the industry, and were seeking an energetic contributor to our team.
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          Based near the San Francisco Airport, we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, a progressive environment, and the opportunity to be a part of an exciting team. You are invited to visit our website at
          <b>
           www.PrimarkBenefits.com
          </b>
          to obtain additional information about our company!
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Primary responsibilities include:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Performs flexible benefits plan administration for programs such as FSA, HRA, Section 125, DCAP, and Transportation Benefits;
          </li>
          <li>
           Reviews claims and process them using web-based system. Issues manual checks and ACH payments;
          </li>
          <li>
           Performs payroll reconciliations and audits of enrollment;
          </li>
          <li>
           Performs client support  communicate and answer client and broker questions;
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensures plan compliance with plan document and IRS regulations;
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides participant support regarding eligible expenses, account balances and claims deadlines. Answer questions, educate participants;
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists in resolving complaints, concerns regarding eligibility, payroll discrepancies and denied claims;
          </li>
          <li>
           Attends and presents at enrollment meetings or benefit fairs of local clients;
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains client and employee confidential records and adhere to HIPPA requirements;
          </li>
          <li>
           Performs debit card administration using on-line system, including collection of funds via ACH transmission;
          </li>
          <li>
           Creates and maintains processing schedule to ensure daily and weekly tasks are completed;
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitors and performs client billing;
          </li>
          <li>
           Performs bank reconciliation for client funded accounts and monitor plan funding;
          </li>
          <li>
           Processes COBRA notifications to participants and provide COBRA assistance to employers;
          </li>
          <li>
           Collects, reconciles, and forwards COBRA payments as needed; and
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists, trains, mentors and supports customer service and plan document departments.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualified candidates will have/be:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A minimum of 5 years of extensive Benefits administration experience;
          </li>
          <li>
           Superior written and verbal communication skills;
          </li>
          <li>
           Computer literate, including fluency with Word and Excel;
          </li>
          <li>
           A self-driven, positive, results-oriented performer who possesses a passion for results, and a clear focus on high quality;
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong time management, problem solving and organizational skills in a deadline driven environment;
          </li>
          <li>
           A commitment to doing things right the first time;
          </li>
          <li>
           The ability to learn quickly, with attention to detail; and
          </li>
          <li>
           Confidence to ask relevant questions and contribute with constructive suggestions.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Got the right stuff? If this sounds like what you're looking for, send us a cover letter
          <b>
           (including your salary expectations)
          </b>
          and your resume via the resume submission tool, right away. No calls please; direct applicants only, no search or placement firms. We look forward to hearing from you!
         </p>
         <p>
          <i>
           Primark Benefits is an Equal Opportunity Employer
          </i>
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           extensive Flex Benefits administration : 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>

         <p>
          The Upper West Side's Premier Pet Care Company is seeking a Lodging &amp; Daycare Supervisor for immediate hire. We are looking for dedicated, enthusiastic and experienced candidates who are passionate about providing premium pet care.
         </p>
         <p>
          This position reports directly to the General Manager. The primary focus is to supervise staff and ensure that they are appropriately trained to handle the dogs in our care, facility cleaning and maintaining the health and happiness of our canine guests. The duties of this job revolve around the advanced care of the dogs in our facility and the overall organization of the staff and their duties.
         </p>
         <p>

         </p>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>
           You are comfortable handling dogs of all sizes, ages, and temperaments.
          </li>
          <li>
           You have weekends and holiday availability (we are open 365 days a year!)
          </li>
          <li>
           You pride yourself in being reliable and punctual!
          </li>
          <li>
           You pride yourself in a job well done and enjoy the outcome of being part of a team dedicated to maintaining a healthy environment for the pets in our care.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We are a fast growing company with many opportunities for the right candidates. We offer competitive industry compensation. In addition we provide a clean, safe, fun yet professional work environment. If you are an energetic, outgoing person and can provide exceptional customer service in a fabulous pet care environment, this is the job for you!
         </p>
         <p>
          We look forward to hearing from you!
         </p>
         <p>
          This is a popular position with many applicants making it difficult to respond to everyone. To be considered please send us a resume and a brief summary of your prior work experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Supervision in a pet care environment: 2 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Electronics Technician II
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Laser Techniques Co LLC
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Redmond, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Company:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Laser Techniques Company is involved in cutting-edge design, development and manufacture of precision laser-based measurement and inspection systems for a worldwide client base, including commercial, power, defense, and space applications. Contact us for an opportunity to join our dynamic and fast-paced work environment. Please visit our website at www.laser-ndt.com for more information about our business, technology and client base. Laser Techniques is an equal opportunity employer and offers a competitive pay and benefits package.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Position Description:
          </b>
          <br/>
          We are looking for an intermediate-level Electronics Technician who is motivated, innovative, and able to work with minimum supervision.
         </p>
         <p>
          The position is expected to include:
          <br/>
           Wiring, mechanical assembly, and testing of electronic instrumentation, sensors and cables
          <br/>
           Trouble-shooting computer instrument hardware and software issues
          <br/>
           Loading software and drivers onto computer instruments
          <br/>
           Testing of PCBs, with minor PCB rework.
          <br/>
           Documentation of electronic assembly and test procedures
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
          <br/>
           A fast learner with solid understanding of electronics and mechanical components.
          <br/>
           Excellent organizational skills, attention-to-detail, and multitasking capability.
          <br/>
           Excellent soldering skills of wires for cables, small wires, and surface mount components.
          <br/>
           Experience with assembly of miniature mechanical components.
          <br/>
           Experience with computer assembly and hardware/software troubleshooting.
          <br/>
           Familiarity with requirements for rugged instrument assembly.
          <br/>
           Ability to read electronic schematics, wiring diagrams and mechanical drawings.
          <br/>
           AA or BS in Electronics.
          <br/>
           Minimum 3 years experience in electronics assembly
          <br/>
           Proficient in MS Word, Excel. OrCAD and Visio experience a plus.
          <br/>
           IPC-A-610 Level II, J-STD-001 training and certification preferred.
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_e588fa08c3fedc34">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
