    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Caregiver
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Silver Point Plaza dba Canyon House
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Menlo Park, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          We are a 43-bed assisted living community in Menlo Park with immediate openings for caregivers. If you care about the elderly and persons with dementia, this job is for you! We are an energetic and highly compassionate team that works hard to ensure our residents can thrive and enjoy life every day.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Caregivers assist residents with Activities of Daily Living, such as:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Getting dressed
          </li>
          <li>
           Eating
          </li>
          <li>
           Bathing
          </li>
          <li>
           Personal grooming (e.g., shaving, brushing teeth)
          </li>
          <li>
           Toileting and/or incontinence care (e.g., changing undergarments)
          </li>
          <li>
           Transferring (e.g., from bed to wheelchair)
          </li>
          <li>
           Walking safely
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Caregivers are also expected to
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Contribute to a positive living environment, making our community as much like HOME as possible.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform other reasonable duties as assigned, including helping co-workers with other residents and job tasks as needed.
          </li>
          <li>
           Observe residents and report any significant changes in their condition, needs, or physical environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete required trainings upon hire and every year thereafter.
          </li>
          <li>
           Attend mandatory monthly staff meetings.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate regularly with their supervisor and other caregivers, especially where resident care or safety is concerned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Shifts available
          </b>
          <br/>
          We are open 24 hours per day, so there is potential for caregivers to work a variety of shifts, either full or part time.
          <i>
           We especially need caregivers for Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays.
          </i>
          <b>
           Must be able to work weekends.
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Minimum Requirements
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Criminal record clearance to work in a Residential Care Facility for the Elderly as required by the California Community Care Licensing Division.
          </li>
          <li>
           Authorized to work in the U.S.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be reliable, professional, compassionate, honest, able to work well in a team, and interested in caring for elderly persons with dementia.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift, push or pull 25 pounds; bend, twist, stoop, kneel, and reach; communicate effectively in English (includes reading, writing, and speaking); communicate with residents and visitors in a friendly and congenial manner; treat and care for residents and their property with dignity and respect.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Compensation &amp; Benefits
          </b>
          <br/>
          Rate of pay depends in part on experience. Full time employees are eligible for medical insurance and paid time off after 90 days of employment.
         </p>
         <p>
          Silver Point Plaza is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug-free work environment.
         </p>
         <p>
          Note: This document describes the general nature and level of work for the position. It is not a comprehensive list of its responsibilities, duties, skills, efforts and conditions. The responsibilities for this position are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
        </span>

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Bladium Sports &amp; Fitness Club
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Alameda, CA
      </span>
      <br/>
      <nobr>

      </nobr>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Lil Kickers Soccer Coach
          </b>
          (Part-time)
          <br/>
          at Bladium Sports &amp; Fitness Club
         </p>
         <p>
          Are you energetic and enthusiastic? Are you a self motivated individual that loves working with young children? Are you ready to be part of a team of coaches that is dedicated to making a positive difference in the lives of young people? If so, tell us why you would make a great coach for kids, why kids like you, and tell us about your work experience. Show us your personality in your cover letter! While a background in sports is not necessary, please include your sports background and relevant childcare experience.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Description:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          The Lil' Kickers program is in search of highly energetic, animated, out-going, fun, hard-working individuals who want to become the best coach they can be. Lil' Kickers is a child development program based around the game of soccer. The Lil' Kickers Instructor will lead small groups of children (from age 18 months to 9 years old) through a series of games and activities that help promote a child's physical and social growth.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Work hours are depend on your availability, class offerings and your performance as a coach. Schedules can range from 5 hours to 35 hours per week.
          </li>
          <li>
           Classes are available mornings and afternoons from Tuesday to Friday, and mornings on Saturdays and Sundays.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coaching rates begin at $10/hour. Coaches can earn up $15/hour depending on their experience and performance.
          </li>
          <li>
           There is room for advancement as a Lead Coach, Assistant Coordinator, and Management.
          </li>
          <li>
           More hours are available for greeters, telemarketers and admin helpers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Training in teaching and child development is provided and ongoing---the best training that any childrens' sports program can offer.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Required:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The qualified individual will be energetic, creative, patient, honest and punctual.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to pass background check with no issues
          </li>
          <li>
           Enjoy working with children
          </li>
          <li>
           MUST be able to work Saturdays from 7:30am to 12:30pm, and/or Sundays from 8:30am to 12pm
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Able to attend Full season on day of classes (for example, if you coach classes on Saturdays for the Fall Season---then you must work every Saturday for 11 of 12 weeks)
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Preferred Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

         <p>
          Bladium Sports &amp; Fitness Club is a 170,000-sf indoor sports and fitness club located on the water in Alameda, CA. The club has been in existence since 2001 and includes complete fitness center, group exercise programs, personal training, three indoor and two outdoor soccer fields, rock climbing gym, basketball and volleyball courts, boxing and mixed martial arts gym, sports bar and grille and kids activity center and programs. The club is locally owned and operated and has over 20,000 members. We are rapidly expanding and are looking for dynamic individuals with a passion for health and fitness and a desire to help others. We have immediate openings in our Lil Sluggers and Lil' Kicker's program.

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

         <p>
          Seattle, Washington
          <br/>
          South Lake Union
         </p>
         <p>
          Description: Garage Booth Cashier / Full time and PT available
         </p>
         <p>
          Basic Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <p>
          Utilizes a quality customer service orientation, receives payment from customers for parking services and facilitates the flow of traffic through the gate by performing the following duties:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Responsible for being at work every scheduled day, on time and in uniform.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Counts "bank" of revenue at beginning of shift to ensure starting total is correct.
          </li>
          <li>
           Collects cash and/or validations and maintains security of cash.
          </li>
          <li>
           Makes change and issues receipts or tickets to customer for each transaction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Computes or re-computes bill from ticket showing amount due per customer.
          </li>
          <li>
           Operates cash register after time calculation (manually or by machine), calculates cost or transaction and displays cost of customer transaction on cash register.
          </li>
          <li>
           Quotes prices for parking services for which money is received upon customer receipt.
          </li>
          <li>
           Gives directions to customers to various locations in the city.
          </li>
          <li>
           Completes lost ticket forms when original tickets cannot be located.
          </li>
          <li>
           Resolves customer complaints independently or with the aid of a supervisor.
          </li>
          <li>
           Answers telephone in a prompt and courteous manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains cleanliness of booth and picks up trash in the surrounding area.
          </li>
          <li>
           Conducts timely checks to see if a proper inventory of necessary work aids and supplies are located in booth.
          </li>
          <li>
           Verifies log of shift transactions against bank of "revenue" on hand.
          </li>
          <li>
           Compiles "bank" of collected revenue during the day once a predetermined amount of money has been collected.
          </li>
          <li>
           Record amounts received, cars in/out of facility, cars left in a facility (if applicable) while preparing shift report of transactions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Any other duties that may be assigned by the supervisor.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
          <br/>
          Qualification Requirements: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
         </p>

         </p>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">

       <font size="+1">

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">

      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">

      </span>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">

         <p>
          Job Description: We are looking for
          <b>
           Outside Sales Representative
          </b>
          for the area of NY, CT, NJ, RI, DW, MA, NH, and PA to develop sales leads and prospect new customers.
         </p>
         <p>
          Attitude, charisma, character and good presence is crucial for this job. This is a
          <b>
           JUNIOR position
          </b>
          . Training will be provided. Fine Jewelry Experience is preferred but NOT ESSENTIAL.
         </p>
         <p>
          In short: Job will consist in visiting customers (jewelry stores) in the mentioned states and report back to HQ.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Car
          </b>
          &amp;
          <b>
           customer lists will be provided.
          </b>
          Travel expenses will be paid by the company.
         </p>
         <p>
          Overview: Responsible for increasing sales and brand awareness with each retail partner and initiating and developing sales from new customers within their assigned territory by performing the following duties:
         </p>
         <p>
          Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Visits lists of prospective customers for use as sales leads, based on information from the Company, newspapers, business directories, industry ads, trade shows, Internet Web sites, and other sources.
          </li>
          <li>
           Daily travels throughout assigned territory to call on regular and prospective customers to introduce the company.
          </li>
          <li>
           Customer lists will be provided by the Company.
          </li>
          <li>
           Sustains a high level of customer service by performing tasks according to the clients agenda, responding quickly to customer inquiry and other communications, troubleshooting any business related problems, and following-up with clients to ensure they are satisfied.
          </li>
          <li>
           Displays or demonstrates product, using an iPad and color samples, and emphasizes salable features.
          </li>
          <li>
           Merchandise showcases &amp; train retail staff on products and promotional advertising.
          </li>
          <li>
           Quotes prices and credit terms and prepares sales contracts for orders obtained.
          </li>
          <li>
           Estimates date of delivery to customer, based on knowledge of own firms production and delivery schedules.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepares reports of travel itinerary and business transactions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintains expense report accounting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Works with Sales Director to keep account activities and literature up to date.
          </li>
          <li>
           Enters new customer data and updates sales data for current customers into computer database.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develops and maintains relationships with purchasing contacts.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          This is a wonderful opportunity for a driven
          <b>
           outside
          </b>
          sales person. Salary or draw against commission, expenses and car allowance!!!! If you are an energetic sales representative who is driven, we would like to speak to you!
         </p>
        </span>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Loan Agency Associate
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Cortland Capital Market Services
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          The Agency Services Team administers middle market and broadly syndicated bank loans where Cortland has been engaged as the Administrative Agent to keep accurate records and execute all loan activities. This role will act as the primary contact for clients, lenders and business partners for complex syndicated credit transactions and be exposed to many facets of the leveraged and distressed bank loan market. Loan structures include large U.S. and European syndications, leveraged middle-market, and special opportunity situations.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Act as liaison between borrowers and lenders and collaborate with other parties within the industry, including legal counsel, trustees and other third party service providers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain a working knowledge of all relevant portfolios and deal related documentation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Reference, understand and extract Credit Agreement and governing document information to ensure compliance and update the Agency system accordingly.
          </li>
          <li>
           Use judgment, interpretation and problem-solving to understand loan related information
          </li>
          <li>
           Calculate, invoice and disburse all deal related fees; collect and disburse interest, principal, fee payments and new borrowing funds.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate funds movement for initial funding and closing.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain facility commitments and process loan and facility-related activity including rollovers, rate settings, conversions, prepayments, assignments, amendments, etc.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform heavy data entry in agency systems and Microsoft Excel.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Desired Experience, Education &amp; Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors degree in finance, accounting, economics or operations; or commensurate work experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           2+ years of experience in bank loan agency, syndication or investment management operations experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsive, friendly, professional and proactive communication approach.
          </li>
          <li>
           Deadline-driven and highly organized with exceptional attention to detail.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to independently research, analyze and resolve complex problems and quickly learn new concepts.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate and collaborate with internal groups and external clients by phone and email.
          </li>
          <li>
           Working knowledge of fundamental financial, accounting and operations concepts.
          </li>
          <li>
           High proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience with Bloomberg and other loan research tools a plus.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           bank loan agency, syndication, investment management: 1 year
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>

However, the realm of responsibilities will extend beyond that of a typical front desk agent. Primary responsibilities include: registering guests, making and modifying reservations, hotel operation, and concierge duties. Guest Service Agents must possess a positive and upbeat personality with a desire to deliver outstanding customer service to our guests. Handle additional duties as needed by the guests.

Since 1973, a specialization in design and construction of post and wood frame, steel-covered buildings has brought Town &amp; Country to a level of quality and workmanship few can surpass. The company is seeking a motivated and qualified Production Manager to join the team. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and overseeing all functions related to production and workflow scheduling within the company. This position requires a high level of competence, strong leadership, and commitment to quality. The position will report to the President.

          </b>
         </p>

You will also be responsible for ensuring production is cost effective, all jobs are brought within budget, and performance measures, planned efficiencies, and LEAN initiatives are met or exceeded through change management processes and best practices.
         </p>

          <b>
           The Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          The position requires a deep knowledge and experience in manufacturing or construction related logistics and production processes. The applicant must have demonstrated leadership, implementation, and consumer relation skills. He/She should be a motivated, dependable individual with ability to manage several projects and exhibit strong attention to detail and problem-solving. A 4 year degree in construction management or related field is preferred.
         </p>

          </b>
         </p>

         </p>
         <p>

           Apply Now:
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Along with a complete resume, please attach a cover letter which addresses your specific competencies and how they apply to the position.
         </p>
         <p>
          Town &amp; Country Post Frame Buildings, division of Permabilt Industries, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.
         </p>

         </p>

   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Residence Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Eden II Programs
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Staten Island, NY
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Residence Manager
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BA/BS degree (Masters degree preferred)
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities. (autism preferred)
          </li>
          <li>
           Valid drivers license from state of residence
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent communication skills---verbal and written
          </li>
          <li>
           Good computer skills---Microsoft Word and Excel
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong supervisory experience
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Reports To:
          </b>
          Director, Residential Services
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Job Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Provide on-going supervision and necessary training and feedback to direct care staff to promote effective job performance and skilled care and treatment of residents.
          </li>
          <li>
           Serve as an expert and model in the understanding of each residents needs and special alerts, and the implementation of their behavior and goal plans.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that staff is continually engaging consumers in structured learning activities and active treatment, in accordance with their individual program plan and interdisciplinary team recommendations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Document on-going supervision and feedback given to direct care staff, using supervisors observation records and other methods of documentation.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that house is clean and well maintained, and that all vehicles and property are in safe and working order.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete monthly, weekly and daily staffing schedules. Ensure that there is an adequate number of trained staff available on each shift. Submit look-ahead schedules prior to the beginning of the month for administrative review, and follow-up staffing records at the close of the month for quality assurance and oversight purposes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate, schedule and participate in in-services and staff meetings on a regular basis and other meetings upon request.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain and submit accurate employee records of attendance, accrued personal time, benefits, hours and wage information for payroll purposes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all employees and volunteers have necessary information on file, including evidence of annual tuberculosis testing; current First Aid/CPR, AMAP and SCIP-R certification, and other paperwork as required by agency policy, state regulations and federal law.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that fire safety and emergency procedures are carried out in compliance with policy and procedures.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all direct support staff receive required training in areas specified and required by regulation and agency policy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide direct consumer care and treatment as necessary, including the administration of medication in accordance with AMAP guidelines and agency policy.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that direct care staff receives the necessary training, guidance and feedback to complete necessary household tasks in a satisfactory manner (including meal preparation, cleaning, laundry, clothing repair, shopping and home repairs).
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that all residents have adequate clothing and personal supplies at all times.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure that necessary supplies for the safe and effective operation of the house are present (including food in accordance with diet plans, cleaning supplies and equipment, office supplies, etc.)
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure proper implementation and documentation of individual treatment plans and group recreational programming.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain case disbursement receipts and forward to main office for accounting.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide resident banking system in the house.
          </li>
          <li>
           Schedule staff/supervisor in order to provide necessary coverage at all times.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain communication with shift supervisors, team leaders, active treatment coordinator and designated staff of daily events.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain on-going contact with consumer day programs and other providers of care and treatment to the consumers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Serve as an interdisciplinary team member and advocate for all consumers served.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete occurrence and incident follow up as necessary and in accordance with agency policies and IRC recommendations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate relevant information regarding needs of consumers and house to agency administration as requested.
          </li>
          <li>
           Respond to emergencies, crises, and unforeseen circumstances in a responsible and conscientious manner, consulting with agency administration as necessary and appropriate.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be available on an on-call basis as needed for consultation and relief.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned by supervisor.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          We offer excellent benefits including a family medical and dental plan, employee life insurance, LTD insurance, FSA plan, HRA plan, tuition reimbursement, employer matching pension plan, EAP benefits, generous paid time off policy, home and auto discounts and many others.
         </p>
         <p>
          Please visit our website for more information at:
          <br/>
          www.eden2.org
         </p>
         <p>
          *Resumes without salary requirements will not be considered.
         </p>
         <p>
          Job Type: Full-time
         </p>
         <p>
          Local candidates only:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Staten Island, NY
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Developmental Disabilities: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required license or certification:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Driver's License
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required education:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelor's
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_31d46cbb481afe25">

          </b>

          </li>

          </li>

           Assist the Bookkeeper with placing orders. This includes giving proper payment (Deposits, full payments), requesting a lead time, submitting any approved CFAs or requesting them before an item can ship out. Also, if applicable, completing any additional paperwork which may include but is not limited to, resale tax CRT-61s, and final destination forms.            </i>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Work with the Bookkeeper to analyze and resolve office administrative and procedural problems. For example make our procedures work for a specific client or projects needs without compromising our policies or guidelines.
          </li>
          <li>
           General office, office technology and kitchen Supply ordering.
          </li>
          <li>
           Coordinate projects for office with IT person such as technology installation, repair or replacements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assists JRW with personal assistant tasks.
          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>
          *
          <b>

          </b>

Maintain good time management skills and the ability to multitask. Knowledge of standard office equipment and computer applications related to the work including but not limited to Internet research, WordPress, MS Office, Adobe, Photoshop, etc. Excellent Customer Service skills.

<html>
 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0du3bqbr1g8q1" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Valet Attendant
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Crescent Heights
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Crescent Heights is a company with a storied history in the San Francisco real estate market.
         </p>
         <p>
          Jasper is a convergence. Of structure and imagination. Of the classic and the eclectic. Of art and life. This 400-foot high-rise, designed by Stanley Saitowitz, crowns San Franciscos fabled Rincon Hill and stands as an iconic addition to the city skyline. Residences from studios to three-bedrooms open to sweeping views of Downtown, SoMa, and San Francisco Bay. Its a statement about elegance in a place where elegance means something. Everything about the building, form its faade and lobby interior to its art collection and brand voice reflects an appreciation for 21st-century San Francisco style.
         </p>
         <p>
          Our properties have dramatically reshaped the traditional concepts of living in America. The finest amenities. Innovative architecture. Signature interiors. Quality construction. These attributes define Crescent Heights properties. As one of the nations largest developers and marketers of high-rise, multifamily housing and hotels, the companys premier properties stretch from New York to Los Angeles, from Miami to Chicago, and points in between with corporate headquarters in Miami, Florida.
         </p>
         <p>
          We provide a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package to all full time regular employees.
          <br/>
          <b>
           SUMMARY:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Ensure maximum resident and customer satisfaction through providing exceptional customer services while parking their vehicles. Oversee operations with the assistance of Valet Manager.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Greet residents with a smile and by their name.
          </li>
          <li>
           Remains on the floor, actively manages throughout shift.
          </li>
          <li>
           Directly responsible for overseeing the training of Valet Attendants providing each with the knowledge and appropriate direction to perform his/her responsibilities.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain employee work schedules including assignments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensuring that personnel clearly understand and are held accountable for their respective performance expectations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proactively seeks coverage for shifts and or special circumstances under the direction and guidelines set by management. Proactively informs management or future and or immediate staffing shortages for any given shift or circumstance.
          </li>
          <li>
           Efficiently handling customer disputes (making every effort to achieve customer satisfaction). Exercising skills to identify situations that require attention and resolution as well as appropriate discretion that require the attention of management.
          </li>
          <li>
           Meet and exceed resident expectations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure wait time for cars averages under 3 minutes and never exceed 7 minutes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Provides full coverage of the valet stand and assists residents and guests in a timely manner.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure security measures are met.
          </li>
          <li>
           Keeps a detailed log of cars coming in and checking out. Follows check in procedures to ensure the garage is always moving smoothly.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain fast and efficient response times.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure garage and workspaces are always clean and organized.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure the cleanliness of the interior of the car and that the exterior is not damaged while in our possession.
          </li>
          <li>
           All other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
          </b>
          <br/>
          Overseeing all valet(s) when manager is not present.
          <br/>
          <b>
           QUALIFICATIONS:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Must have a valid Drivers License and be able to provide a current DMV driving record.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to drive both automatic and standard shift cars.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must be able to work in fast paced, ever changing, demanding work environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to communicate effectively and positively with associates, guests and management.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

          </b>

          </li>

       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">

      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">

      </span>

      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          About DWA:
         </p>
         <p>
          DWA is a global media and marketing agency for technology companies. With its feet in media and its head in data and analytics, DWA has a fascination with the art and science of engaging people. Thats why youll find us at the intersection where media, technology and strategic marketing meet. Operating from eight offices around the globe covering North America, EMEA and Asia Pacific, DWA offers a range of programs such as programmatic media, marketing automation, account-based marketing and content marketing consulting - all for over 150 of the worlds best technology companies, including Cisco, Citrix, Box and more.
         </p>
         <p>
          About the Role:
         </p>
         <p>
          DWA is looking for a SEM (Search Engine Marketing) Program Manager who is comfortable under pressure and in fast-paced working conditions and thrives in an environment where performance is paramount. The ideal candidate will bring to the table a high level of campaign creation and management experience, as well as team building and training. You will manage and optimize paid media campaigns, including SEM/PPC, display/GDN, and remarketing, with the goals to increase conversions, optimize for target CPA goals, and efficiently increase leads for our key clients. You will also have opportunities to provide strategic insight on campaigns, as well as improve internal processes and structure.
         </p>
         <p>
          What Were Looking For in a Teammate:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Inspirational and passionate
          </li>
          <li>
           Has a multidisciplinary skillset
          </li>
          <li>
           Is curious, iterative, and collaborative
          </li>
          <li>
           Balances factual information with intuition and creativity
          </li>
          <li>
           Cares about winning as one team
          </li>
          <li>
           Is looking to do things that havent been done before
          </li>
          <li>
           Can tell stories with data
          </li>
          <li>
           Builds strong internal and external relationships
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Responsibilities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Develop and manage key client relationships, which requires calls and meetings
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for effectively managing various client accounts and budgeting requirements
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for the planning and strategic development of campaigns and account structure
          </li>
          <li>
           Capable of delegating and leading a team of SEM Analysts, who act as a support team for SEM Program Managers
          </li>
          <li>
           Provide weekly reports on assigned clients to SEM Team Manager and VP, Intent Marketing, communicating overall progress, initiatives, and other high level topic matters that management should be aware of
          </li>
          <li>
           Report and communicate results/ideas with clients and also share with the SEM team, promoting team growth
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop strategies and oversee and execute initiatives to increase paid media traffic
          </li>
          <li>
           Ownership of structure, tactical direction, optimization, budget pacing, and efficient lead production
          </li>
          <li>
           Research and communicate competitive landscape of specific products in the paid media market using 3rd party tools such as SEMrush, Google Keyword Tool, and Google Trends
          </li>
          <li>
           Run A/B test experiments on landing pages and text ads to produce the best conversion rates for clients
          </li>
          <li>
           Stay up-to-date with new search trends and test flagship and/or beta products for strategic accounts
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Qualifications:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           3 - 5 years of paid media experience, including search marketing (SEM REQUIRED; Display and Remarketing are pluses)
          </li>
          <li>
           Certifications: Google AdWords Fundamentals, Search Advanced, Display, and Marin. Certifications are not required, but must obtain while employed with DWA.
          </li>
          <li>
           Verbal and written client-facing experience
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess strong analytical skills and industry presence, as well as innate curiosity and aptitude
          </li>
          <li>
           Familiar with enterprise management platforms for SEM and Display, such as Marin Tools
          </li>
          <li>
           Advanced proficiency with Excel
          </li>
          <li>
           Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Economics, Psychology, or similar field preferred (MBA is a plus)
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Paid media experience, including search marketing: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u0djv6fb02jdh2" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Tire Technician (Full-Time Position)
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       ROLLING STOCK INC
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       San Francisco, CA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Hello!
         </p>
         <p>
          Rolling Stock is seeking to fill one of the most important roles at our shop--Tire Tech!
         </p>
         <p>
          The Tire Techs primary job is to be responsible for all tire servicing jobs. Including mounting/ dismounting, balancing, inspecting and repairing tires safely and expediently.
         </p>
         <p>
          Primary job Functions:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Responsible for all tire servicing jobs
          </li>
          <li>
           Mount/dismount, balance, repair and inspect all tires
          </li>
          <li>
           Fill tires to proper air pressure and torque on vehicle correctly
          </li>
          <li>
           Examine damaged, defective and flat tires to determine extent of damage and whether or not tire may be repaired
          </li>
          <li>
           Repair/patch tires
          </li>
          <li>
           Balance tires using balancing machine
          </li>
          <li>
           Operate tire changing machine
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform visual safety inspections on all vehicles as time permits
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain a neat, organized and safe work area
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Rolling Stock Inc offers paid vacations, and Holidays. We offer 401(k) with employer match. We are always closed Sundays. Room for growth and a great career opportunity, plus a fast-paced, fun (never dull!) environment.
          <br/>
          We are conveniently located near BART, MUNI food and shopping in the heart of the Mission District!
         </p>
         <p>
          Check us out on our website, FB, Instagram and Twitter
          <br/>
          www.RollingStockSF.com
          <br/>
          @RollingStockSF
         </p>
         <p>
          Physical Requirements: The job requires the ability to use various hand tools, driving vehicles, standing for long periods of time, walking outdoors, frequently changing positions including getting in and out of cars, carrying/lifting (up to 50 lbs), pushing/pulling, bending, reaching/handling, and twisting; and use of computer keyboard.
         </p>
         <p>
          Keywords: Tire Technician, Tire Tech, Auto Tech, backup tech, Automotive, Tires, Wheels, opportunity, growth, fun
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>

     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Accounting Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Acucela
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Seattle, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          Acucela is an entrepreneurial, clinical-stage biotechnology company that specializes in the treatment of sight-threatening diseases. Our lead drug candidate is in advanced clinical trials.
         </p>
         <p>
          We have an immediate opening for an experienced Accounting Manager to join our team located in Seattle, WA. Were looking for someone who embraces ambiguity and is looking for an opportunity to grow as the company grows. This individual will pay an integral role within the Finance/Accounting group. Primary responsibilities will include the general ledger and financial close process.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           POSITION SUMMARY
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          This position will own various general accounting duties including preparing journal entries, maintaining and reconciling GL Accounts and month end reporting. The Accounting Manager acts as the main point of contact with the Companys auditors, coordinating fieldwork and the organization of audit requests. Assist with the research of technical accounting issues and formulates analyses and conclusions as to the proper treatment. Assist in the development, implementation and maintenance of accounting and control processes. Supervises and reviews the work of the accounting staff and clerks.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Lead the monthly closing process including: managing the closing calendar, generating and reviewing journal entries, establishing accruals and performing and reviewing account reconciliations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Prepare schedules, and various deliverables for the internal monthly reporting package including reviewing/preparing variance analysis, analytical reviews, and consolidating monthly management commentaries.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with the research, interpretation and report on new and existing issues related to US and regulatory requirements related to financial reporting and practices.
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform timely follow up on outstanding issues, requests for information, and other research between departments and external parties.
          </li>
          <li>
           Review department processes, ensuring timely completion of control procedures; recommend and implement process improvements.
          </li>
          <li>
           Recruit, develop and motivate accounting staff.
          </li>
          <li>
           Manage accounts payable, payroll and accounting staff to ensure payables, payroll, and general ledger activities are accurate, timely, in compliance with accounting policy and business processes.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist with equity-related administration and transactions.
          </li>
          <li>
           Effectively work across the organization as an accounting interface with other functional groups.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other special projects including involvement in systems, SEC/TSE/FSA reporting and other accounting functions/duties as assigned.
          </li>
          <li>
           Other duties as assigned.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           ESSENTIAL JOB REQUIREMENTS (Education, Experience &amp; Required Skills)
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Bachelors Degree in Accounting or Finance and passage of CPA exam.
          </li>
          <li>
           Minimum 8 years of relevant accounting and reporting experience, ideally with a combination of public and private accounting experience.
          </li>
          <li>
           Solid understanding of accounting and reporting principles (including SOX), strong analytical skills and business acumen.
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience in a fast paced environment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Able to communicate clearly, efficiently and accurately with internal and external customers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Detailed, organized, able to meet deadlines.
          </li>
          <li>
           Desire for professional growth working on a team with increasing opportunities to perform research, develop analytical skills, define business processes, and support decision making.
          </li>
          <li>
           Must have current legal work authorization to work for any company in the United States
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Office environment, long periods of standing, sitting
          </li>
          <li>
           Visual, verbal and auditory capabilities used for constant assessment of operations
          </li>
          <li>
           Verbal functionality to be able to voice communicates in person, via phone and over other technologies
          </li>
          <li>
           Mobility to move about the Companys offices and to travel between sites
          </li>
          <li>
           Manual dexterity for typing of documents and emails
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <i>
           Please be aware that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Direct applicants only  no recruiters, please. Acucela Inc is an EOE.
          </i>
         </p>

         </p>

           Seattle, WA
          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

          </li>

         </p>

          </li>
         </ul>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u120nmib9rocr0" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">

   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        PPC Specialist
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       VacayStay Connect, LLC
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          <b>
           Paid Search Marketing Specialist
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Company Background
          </b>
          <br/>
          VacayStay Connect, formerly Vacation Storebuilder, is a distribution and digital marketing platform provider transforming the vacation industry through innovative solutions. The company offers a mosaic of interconnected products and services designed to grow online vacation rental businesses for global hospitality brands, resorts, property management companies, innkeepers, and vacation homeowners. The VacayStay Connect team is dedicated to bridging the gap between consumers and vacation rental accommodations.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Reports To:
          </b>
          Digital Marketing and Account Manager
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Principal Objective:
          </b>
          <br/>
          The Pay per Click Specialist is responsible for the day-to-day management of paid search campaigns and delivering strong business results. This person is responsible for tracking, analyzing and executing paid search strategies, ensuring that all deliverables are executed on time and produce a high standard of quality for all client and company deliverables.
          <br/>
          This position is based in the Chicago office. It is not a remote position.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Responsibilities:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Tactical campaign development including keyword, ad copy and account creation and development
          </li>
          <li>
           Track and analyze results from PPC campaigns to identify potential opportunities for improvements
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor, analyze and report the performance results for client accounts
          </li>
          <li>
           Campaign auditing, data QA, and daily tracking
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate with team members on campaign developments, timelines, and results
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist in the execution and evaluation of account maintenance/optimization activities, including but not limited to: keyword development and expansion, ad copy creation, landing page identification, bid strategy execution, and budget management (under supervision/training of a PPC Specialist or Leader)
          </li>
          <li>
           Assume ownership and accountability of search program successes and failures for assigned client accounts as well as company initiatives.
          </li>
          <li>
           Research and stay abreast of current industry best practices and trends, develop and maintain digital search best practices, and promote digital search optimization techniques.
          </li>
          <li>
           Create and maintain positive client relationships and communicate program results.
          </li>
          <li>
           Interface with other department leads to share ideas, communicate service offerings and to identify and deliver optimal search results for clients.
          </li>
          <li>
           Support the marketing team with placement of other digital marketing campaigns, such as display, social media, retargeting or behavioral campaigns.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Qualifications:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Deep knowledge of SEM (Search Engine Marketing) and Pay per Click advertising.
          </li>
          <li>
           2-3 years of proven marketing experience associated with ecommerce, online marketing solutions preferably for the travel, hospitality or other service industry
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with keyword research tools and knowledge on how to use these tools to setup/expand PPC campaigns
          </li>
          <li>
           Experience with web analytics tools and ability to use analytics data to improve PPC campaigns.
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>

          </li>

          </li>
         </ul>

         </p>

         <p>

         </p>

          <br/>
          Remote Sound monitoring
          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

         </p>

         </p>
         <p>
          Because of our unique business structure, no project is too large or too small for VCS. Ingenuity and an eye for recognizing potential possible issues before they arise makes VCS the obvious choice for any project. See our website at: www.vanguardnewyork.com
         </p>
         <p>
          We are looking for an exceptional FIELD TECHNICAL SUPPORT
         </p>
         <p>
          FIELD TASKS: Conduct field inspections such as crack gauge monitoring, seismic unit installation and seismic unit maintenance on as as needed basis. The position will be maintaning the modem and system connection at all times. This is mostly an outdoor position, so the right candidate would not have a problem with the cold or warm weather.
         </p>
         <p>
          OFFICE WORK: Candidate will go into the field then if needed we will require reports to be done at your residence.
         </p>

         </p>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

          <br/>

 <body data-tn-application="jasx" data-tn-olth="ffffea7078c5e62ac35ebeef761a3e30" data-tn-originlogid="19u1203qtb9jqdh0" data-tn-originlogtype="viewjob" onload="onLoad();">
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr>
    <td width="1125">
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class="separator_top">
  </div>
  <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
   <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Project Manager
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       TRS Group, Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Chicago, IL
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          TRS Group, Inc. (TRS) is hiring a Project Manager in the New Jersey/New York Area and Chicago, IL.
         </p>
         <p>
          TRS Group, Inc. is an environmental remediation company with projects throughout the U.S. We apply a new, but proven, technique for cleaning soil and groundwater called Electrical Resistance Heating (ERH). ERH is in its infancy and our employees have the chance to provide unlimited input into its expansion and growth.
         </p>
         <p>
          TRS has built a reputation on solid business relationships based on mutual trust and satisfaction and provides superior customer service, routinely provide guaranteed fixed price cleanups and complete our projects in a timely manner without costly change orders. TRS is seeking highly motivated, self-starting individuals to fill positions of responsibility that will strengthen the company and help TRS grow to the next level.
         </p>
         <p>
          Are you the type who functions independently &amp; would prefer the freedom of working from a home office? Would you find the challenges of helping a small company grow into the market leader rewarding? If you are passionate about designing and implementing truly innovative approaches to environmental cleanup TRS wants to hear from you. For your skills and talents, TRS offers you in return a great deal of latitude, responsibility and decision-making authority, as well as a number of potential career growth pathways.
         </p>
         <p>
          TRS offers an above average compensation and benefits package effective day one of employment and the opportunity to be an integral part of a highly respected, fast growing, entrepreneurial, and innovative company. TRS is an equal opportunity employer.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Project Manager position is within our Operations Group and will report directly to a regionally based Senior Project Manager. This position will direct the successful application of TRS technologies to company standards. Job requirements include, but are not limited to:
         </p>
         <p>
          Responsible for all project planning and project preparation required to implement TRS technology designs on assigned projects as follows:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Supervise all aspects of project completion, including project planning and scheduling, design, procurement, installation, operation, decommission, business analysis, and contract and vendor management.
          </li>
          <li>
           Using experience and expertise to determine the theoretical principles involved and the methodology to be followed to ensure that complex engineering assignments are accomplished on projects.
          </li>
          <li>
           Supervise other personnel assigned to his/her projects and ensure personnel are properly trained to complete tasking safely.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor system operations and identify data gaps or changes in remedial progress requiring system optimization. Direct field staff as necessary to safely meet internal and external project goals.
          </li>
          <li>
           Supervise Subcontractors and Vendors assigned to his/her projects.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for overall professional management of issues involving clients, site owners, regulatory agencies, and the public.
          </li>
          <li>
           Performing project accounting duties including tracking costs and accurate client invoicing.
          </li>
          <li>
           Participation in project design process, using contract documents and design drawings provided by the Engineering team to supervise a TRS team in the construction of the ERH system on project sites. This task requires practical and field expertise to determine the proper methodology for efficient construction, including coordination of construction activities, oversight of subcontractors, and in-field decision making.
          </li>
          <li>
           Develop documents required to meet project needs, including permit applications, work plans, health and safety plans, progress reports and final reports.
          </li>
          <li>
           Responsible for preparing technical papers and make technical presentations at regional and national conferences.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assisting TRS Marketing personnel in preparing proposals and in making presentations to potential client and regulatory agencies.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Requirements:
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           BS or equivalent with 3-5 years of related environmental experience of a direct or broad technical nature.
          </li>
          <li>
           Requires a working level knowledge in position-related technical areas, this includes the ability to understand the relationship between energy, heat, and physical and material properties.
          </li>
          <li>
           Completion of required training to ensure safety, quality assurance, and customer satisfaction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to read, analyze and interpret common scientific and technical writing and standard construction and engineering drawings.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to handle a wide variety of technical issues over a broad range of work assignments.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to work with the mathematical concepts of geometry, trigonometry, and algebra. The ability to make rough calculations 'in the head' and to recognize proper orders of magnitude.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to apply advanced subject matter and expertise to resolve diverse problems that cannot be solved at lower management levels.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to understand and work within highly sophisticated and complex integrated systems.
          </li>
          <li>
           Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and standard internet and email software.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Work will be performed both in office and field settings.
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Work in field settings will involve exposure to weather during all
          </li>
          <li>
           The noise level in the field settings will be moderate-to-loud, and the use of hearing protections may be required.
          </li>
          <li>
           Field settings will include sites impacted with hazardous materials and waste and the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) may be required
          </li>
          <li>
           Frequently be required to use diagnostic meters to evaluate electrical
          </li>
          <li>
           Frequently be required to use common construction tools, including hand-held power
          </li>
          <li>
           Frequently be required to operate an automobile or pick-up truck and occasionally by required to operate a forklift.
          </li>
          <li>
           Frequently be required to lift up to 50 pounds and occasionally be required to lift up to 100 pounds.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          For more information about TRS Group, Inc. please visit our website at www.thermalrs.com. Please respond by email, with a cover letter and resume.
         </p>
         <p>
          Required experience:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Environmental: 3 years
          </li>
         </ul>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_31ec899dbc3eed03">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">

       </td>

          <br/>

         <p>
          <b>
           Office Equipment Delivery /Network Connectivity Technician (Everett, WA)
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Looking to join a local company where you can make a difference? Come join a proven winner where you will be appreciated and compensated for your efforts. We are Electronic Business Machines, a well-established Office Products dealer representing Canon &amp; Kyocera office equipment products in the Greater North Puget Sound area.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           JOB SUMMARY
          </b>
          <br/>
          EBM is currently accepting applications for the position of Office Equipment Delivery/ Network Connectivity technician for our South Everett location. Qualified applicants should have a valid WA State Drivers license, a clean driving record, demonstrate and/or have experience providing excellent customer service and possess good communication skills. This position includes the responsibilities of performing network connectivity for the customer on their new equipment so networking experience is preferred. Employment will be contingent on the applicant passing a drug screening test and having an acceptable background check.
         </p>
         <p>
          Some of the duties are, but not limited to;
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Driving a 24-foot delivery truck, parking in tight areas such as loading docks and alley ways.
          </li>
          <li>
           Load/unload the truck with office equipment using a hand truck, lift gate, strapping as well as operating a stair climber when necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Communicate with the customer regarding delivery, set-up of the equipment, operation as well as set up network functions of equipment.
          </li>
          <li>
           Insure all proper delivery and pick-up paperwork is complete and accurate.
          </li>
          <li>
           Assist Warehouse manager with moving equipment around warehouse and set up equipment when necessary.
          </li>
          <li>
           Maintain company truck to include washing and wiping down interior when necessary.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>

          </b>
          <br/>

          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Possess and maintain reliable transportation
          </li>
          <li>

          </li>
          <li>
           Provide certificate of insurance with adequate liability coverage and include statement from insurance company of their knowledge that you use your vehicle for work
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to lift 50 lbs. and drive the truck throughout the entire work day.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ability to stand, crouch, walk, kneel, crawl, lay, bend, and perform simple and firm grasping functions with both left and right hands through an entire 8 hour work day.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be prompt and on time to work and scheduled appointments
          </li>
          <li>
           Possess strong interpersonal and customer service skills, able to maintain professional demeanor under stress
          </li>
          <li>
           Demonstrate the ability to supervisor to seek assistance if you are unable to perform the task in a timely fashion or if you encounter any reasons that are preventing the timely resolution of delivery/installation.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          This is a full-time position, Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. We offer a very competitive compensation package with benefits including medical, dental, retirement/401(k) program and paid vacations, to name a few. This is a driving /technical position and requires someone with exceptional organizational skills, ability to handle detailed paperwork as well as work without constant supervision.

          Electronic Business Systems is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free workplace with an outstanding reputation within the community.    <tr valign="top">
    <td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">
     <div data-tn-component="jobHeader" id="job_header">
      <b class="jobtitle">
       <font size="+1">
        Inside Sales
       </font>
      </b>
      <br/>
      <span class="company">
       Gravitec Systems Inc.
      </span>
      -
      <span class="location">
       Poulsbo, WA
      </span>
     </div>
     <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
      <tr>
       <td class="snip">
        <span class="summary" id="job_summary">
         <p>
          This is an Inside Sales position within a specialized sector of the safety industry. We are happy to train candidates with an outgoing personality, a sense of urgency to complete tasks and a high level of ownership for their work. The Equipment Advisor's role is to proactively manage and develop customer relationships. This role is also responsible for defining opportunities and managing them to completion of the sales cycle. Closing professionally in a manner that maximizes Gravitecs profitability, number of sales and brand value is a must. Special consideration will be given to those with safety, climbing, or fall protection experience. Veterans are encouraged to apply, as the Federal Government and Armed Forces are a substantial customer base.
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Primary Responsibilities
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Managing pre-established client base.
          </li>
          <li>
           Cold-calling, building a network and maintaining professional relationships with a heavy emphasis on telephone interaction.
          </li>
          <li>
           Monitor trends in customers business activities and communicate issues to management in a timely fashion.
          </li>
          <li>
           Work ross-functionally with all departments to maintain efficiencies and our position in the marketplace.
          </li>
          <li>
           Analyze and interpret basic sales reports.
          </li>
          <li>
           Report to Director of Sales &amp; Marketing
          </li>
          <li>
           FSLA Status: Non-Exempt / Full Time
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Other Duties
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Assist with the preparation and execution of customer events, including occasional travel to trade shows.
          </li>
          <li>
           Contribute marketing and campaign ideas to advance our brand.
          </li>
          <li>
           Participate in our classes to learn the industry of fall protection.
          </li>
          <li>
           Be engaged; contribute and enjoy your co-workers.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Attributes
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Minimum of 2 years sales experience, with proven ability and success in following a defined sales process.
          </li>
          <li>
           Excellent customer relationship skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
          </li>
          <li>
           Technically minded, able to visualize moving pieces and scenarios.
          </li>
          <li>
           Strong computer skills, experience with Office, ACT, Sage50, SAP and professional Social Media a plus.
          </li>
          <li>
           Integrity
          </li>
          <li>
           Resident of Kitsap/Pierce County, or willing to become one. State your ability / plans to relocate in your cover letter if applicable.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          It is Gravitec's mission to protect the lives and livelihoods of those who work at heights by providing a full range of high-quality fall protection services worldwide including training, engineering, consulting, testing and technical equipment sales. In 25+ years, we have become the largest fall protection training company in North America. Our intention is to drive a company culture that is as innovative as our brand, that is collaborative, and that strives to move the Gravitec mission forward.
         </p>
         <p>
          Are you one of us?
         </p>
         <p>
          Join the ranks by submitting a cover letter and resume at: https://www.gravitec.com/career-opportunities/
         </p>
        </span>
        <br/>
        <div id="p_7b7c8291f1a814b0">
         <div style="margin-top: 30px;">
         </div>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
    </td>
    <td class="auxColPad">
    </td>
   </tr>

          </li>
